reviewText: The fruit thins are hard to define.  They are extremely thin, even thin for a cracker.  I was expecting something more like a cookie.  They are very crisp and crunchy.  (No sign of the delicious newton cookie / cake here.)  There is a mild blueberry flavor, and not much sweetness. I think the flavor would have fared well in a thicker, soft cookie.  As is, the fruit thins just don't work for me.

I have been a fan of Cheez-It crackers for a long time. We almost always have the cheddar in our pantry and most recently the white cheddar which is very good as well. I was excited to try the mozzarella and I was not dissapointed! They have the same great crunch as the orginal but with a yummy mozzarella taste. I can't wait to see what they come out with next!

Surprisingly, these satisfy my craving for a salty snack, even though they're not at all salty. I find that eating a handful of these is more satisfying and enjoyable than a small bag of potato chips and there's no comparison with respect to the healthiness of the two. That these are available through Subscribe an Save is just an added bonus.

Taste is subjective, obviously, other reviews have detailed the product. I'll just add my subjective evaluation. It tasted good to me and I was not bothered by the texture. I prefer a darker chocolate and, at 54%, this bar was sweeter than one that I would buy for myself.

My hubby and I tried these tonight after dinner.  I gave them 2 stars and he gave them 4 stars.  So, I averaged a 3 for these.  It tastes more like a sweet cracker than a cookie.  Hubby said the berries were a little too chewy. I didn't think that was a problem. It's not something I plan to go out and buy.  Hubby will probably finish this bag of them. I might like them better if they were in strawberry, apricot or cherry.  There just wasn't enough good flavor to make me want more than one.
My kids love these, and I love the fact that there organic and they taste great. Even my older nephews eats them and there teenagers.

Our family really enjoyed these crackers, and I loved that they were high fiber. It seems difficult for me to find a healthier cracker that my children really find tasty and these fit the bill. Better tasting than some of the other whole grain options out there.

The popularity of liquid concentrates, to add to water or seltzer, has been a god-send. It allows you to decide how intense a flavor to enjoy and puts that control in the consumer -- a wonderful thing when most beverages are cloyingly sweet or artificial tasting. It also has zero calories, which can make it a great asset for dieting or cutting down.The Vitamin Squeeze Energy Drink comes in an easy flip-top container; meant to be refrigerated after opening. It tastes fairly good, and has a good vitamin matrix: Vitamin C, B Complex, some caffeine, and a few other goodies.Now, the container itself instructs consumers to not use it in mixed drinks or in conjunction with alcohol but -- lettuce be cereal -- the stuff is made to be added to club soda and vodka. The kick of caffeine, though minor, is a great enhancer to a regular cocktail, and the flavor lends itself (though with zero calories!) to imbibement.
summary: Tastes good, zero calories, nice kick of energy.

reviewText: The pops contain 100% daily allowance of vitamin C, which is great to get from candy! The baggie actually contains more lollipops than you would think, and they are all individually wrapped. We got hooked on these after trying the vitamin C pops at our local health food store-they are still my favorites, although this company makes a nice variety of organic candies, there is even a pack of 12 different kinds for sale here on amazon. The candies are colored and flavored with organic fruits and vegetables, and the citric acid in the suckers is from non-gmo beet root sugar, not corn (which is where a lot of citric acid comes from, in case you wondered). Pretty much any candy you buy in a regular supermarket these days is just packed with toxic junk, pesticides and metallic dyes that are really no good for your body, so this has been a wonderful find.
summary: Yumearth organics are TRULY organic and taste phenomenal!

reviewText: Salt is salt...but this is a nice course grain, so you need a grinder to use in foods, otherwise for bulk in baths or large pots of soups.  You can taste the minerals, but its not bad, it is expected really.  I give it a thumbs up as I have used in steam baths for detox and in a pot of soup.

Back in the `50's my gramps would open a can of sardines and eat them on crackers while he smoked a cigar on the back steps.  The taste and smell of these pungent fish gave me a life long distaste for the little critters.  I've noticed that recently many of the high end restaurants and trendy TV chefs are touting the virtues and health benefits of sardines.  I must admit that I've always enjoyed a good Greek Salad with added tuna or sardines.With great trepidation I decided to try the King Oscar Sardines Extra Virgin Olive Oil.  All I can say is these aren't  grandpa's sardines.  The flavor is light, the consistency is firm and the odor is pleasant; not fishy at all.These are wild caught fish from the icy fjords of Norway.  To me northern caught, cold water fish, are always the best.  These are not the cheapest canned sardines you'll find in the market and neither are they the most expensive but they may be the best buy you'll find around.
summary: wild caught fish from the icy fjords of Norway

reviewText: I made a pesto to eat with this pasta and it was very tasty. I like the size of this penne for eating this way - the larger is nicer for casseroles rather than a salad or with pesto, I think. Would definitely get this again.

...and call it macaroni.I love this Mezze Penne. It has the shape and texture of a regular penne pasta (straight shape, angled cut, and slotted texture), but it has the smaller size of a macaroni.There's something fun and frivolous about this miniature penne, almost like the giggles you get when you eat baby corn.I trust and enjoy the quality of Barilla pasta and I appreciate the price and packaging from Amazon. You're not going to find a product like this on the shelf at your large chain grocery store, so Amazon is a great source.My family loves this pasta. We all give it two thumbs up.
summary: Stick a feather in your cap...

reviewText: I bought this so I could start making my own pizza dough, but quickly found out that it isn't that easy.  So I used this flour to dust the counter to roll out my instant pizza dough I bought from Walmart.  Good stuff!
I am a dark chocolate person and found that this particular chocolate was a little on the bitter side. Probably good for baking; however, I am not sure if I would buy it for regular consumption.

If coffee were a tea it would be Irish Breakfast Tea. This is a strong and robust tea that is an excellent substitute for coffee. As a matter of fact, I would call it the tea lovers coffee. It's strong and robust and it is best taken in the morning. It will wake you right up! I drank this tea straight for awhile--no sugar, no milk, just tea--but then I discovered that adding a dash of milk or creamer makes it really quite delectable. I especially like adding the creamer/milk with the tea bag and then I pour the boiling water over. That way it mixes itself very nicely. This is a great tea and I will most definitely be purchasing more!

There are so many dark chocolate bars out these days from all over the world.  Many claim to be delicious as well as healthy.  Newman's Own Organics Dark Chocolate Bar seems worthy of praise even though the percent of dark chocolate is somewhat low compared to others. However, it has a creaminess and flavor that are above some dark bars.The waxiness of some chocolate bars is overly apparent, but Newman's is soft without the waxy feel.  It melts nicely in your mouth and because it's organic, it makes you feel like you're eating something that may be good for you.  People worry about additives, pesticides, etc. and this product, being organic, seems to avoid all the bad stuff.  Of course, it is a bit higher in fat than most dark chocolate bars, but if you don't mind that, the taste is good.The size of the bar is a bit small, 2.25 ounce, the price is about the same for other similar products.  On the other hand, a smaller bar is probably better than buying a large size one and devouring all of it.  I think it's a delicious tasting dark chocolate and I would probably buy it again.
summary: Scores well for what it is

reviewText: Wheat thins and me go back a long ways; try 40 years.  The fiber select, 5 grain crackers are tasty, to be sure, but they are not wheat thins.  These crackers are noticeably less salty, and they are not as crunchy as wheat thins either.  Thirteen crackers are a total of 120 calories, which, for me, makes a good snack, plus they are satisfying.  I think these are an acceptable alternative to wheat thins for a change of pace.

No additives. All natural. I use it as a to go snack. I also use it in my fruit smoothies and it blends great into my smoothies. Or I will also snack on it using alomond butter or chocolate spread as a dip to go with it.
Everything is fine--crispy crackers, low sodium, organic brown rice.  Great for people allergic to wheat.

I love Fig Newtons and I love crisp cookies.  I really wanted to love these new cookies.Kudos to Nabisco for trying to make a healthier type cookie that uses real fruit, flax, natural flavoring and sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup.We are slowly eating these as they aren't bad, but they also aren't the cookie or snack we want or crave.As many others have noted they are a bit on the dry side.  They are visually appealing cookies and I actually like how thin they are.Overall, they are just a bit to bland and dry for me.  Hopefully Nabisco will look at all the feedback on this and make some tweaks to the "recipe" and re-release these.

When the local grocers stopped carrying these, I was relieved that Melitta still shows them available on their website – and very happy that Amazon sells them in bulk (12 boxes of 40 each).  I still keep an eye out when I pass the coffee aisle in grocery stores, and no one stocks them anymore.  Not sure why, as they seem to be a hit with folks who use single-serve coffee makers.
summary: Great product – impossible to find locally

reviewText: My wife loves this coffee!  I enjoy it too, but the caffiene gives me a buzz, so I drink decaf.  Fair price, great free delivery (over $25.00).

Good things:1 The thickness is a plus, it is nice to bite a thicker piece of chocolate.2 It is all organic.Not so good things:1 The initial aroma is a bit off putting somewhat like a cross between coffee and ashtray.2 Takes a while to actually taste this product, it's overall weak on cocoa flavor but at least it doesn't taste like it smells!3 Has a waxiness to it, even though there is no paraffin in it, not sure why.4 My initial reaction to this supposedly dark chocolate was that it was way too sweet and not at all complex in flavor.5 Anticlimactic chocolate lacking any particularly distinguishing notes.I am a big fan of Lindt chocolate, especially the very dark high cocoa percentage bars with their rich, wonderful, full spectrum of complex flavors and fruity notes. This product was just plain bland and nothing special. Three stars instead of two because I didn't hate it but I wouldn't buy it.

Oh how I do love sardines. I love sardines in all the different ways they're packed, but these King Oscar Sardines in olive oil with jalapenos is right at the top of my list for tastebud awesomeness. These things are just so flavorful and have just the right amount of "oomph" to really get your attention. These babies are excellent on crackers of just about any variety, go great with chocolate, and are even fantastic just enjoying them straight out of the can.

Barilla Mezze PenneI don't know about You, but, I've always loved to create dishes with Penne type pastas. I've found Penne pasta is especially a favorite with guys. :)Barilla Mezze Penne held its shape while cooking (for the recommended time), didn't clump together with other noodles, fall apart, turn to glue or stick to the bottom of the pot.Barilla Mezze Penne (when cooked) had turned a light buttery color, was firm and tender -- not mushy.  And, made a wonderful presentation beneath my world famous (slow cooked in crock pot) spaghetti sauce, sprinkled with grated Pepper Jack cheese, chopped green onion and sliced black olives. :)Absolutely Delicious!Does Barilla Mezze Penne sound like what you may be looking for? :)  Highly Recommended!  --Katharena Eiermann, 2013note:  Other Barilla Pastas I've reviewed:Barilla Whole Grain Thin SpaghettiBarilla Penne PlusBarilla Linguine FiniBarilla Ditalini Soup CutsBarilla Mezze PenneBarilla Spaghetti Plus MultigrainBarilla SpaghettiBarilla Whole Grain Spaghetti

How can you go wrong with Ghirardelli chocolate? These make the best brownies ever and I've had so many compliments when I make them for anyone. I get them at a better-than-grocery-store price with subscribe and save and they just can't be beat.

I prefer fresh pasta or even frozen pasta to dry pasta, but I have to say that Barilla is quite good. You're not going to be fooled into thinking it's fresh or frozen, but it is better than other dry pastas out there.I also liked this particular shape. It's easy to eat and holds sauce well.Dry pasta is a staple in my pantry, and Barilla is the best.

Amazon was out of my regular green tea so I picked up a box of this Celestial Green Tea with White Tea at the store to hold me over.  I LOVE IT!!! It's very smooth without that very slight "tang" (or bitter) note at the end.  I'm very careful about making my tea.  I use very hot water but NOT boiling.  It's important to NOT "burn" the tender tea which can effect taste and destroy some of the antioxidents.  I have a whistle tea pot so put water on the stove and do my thing until I hear the whistle blow, take the tea pot off the burner, set my oven timer for 10 mins and let the water cool down before pouring it over the tea pouch.  Many brands just say pour boiling water over tea bag...uggg.  You have to remember that green tea is just black tea in the very early stages of leafing out....just as the name implies....green leaf stage.  In any event, for my taste, Clestial Green Tea with White Tea is excellent. This is an amazing value compared to buying tea in a supermarket AND free shipping and an ADDITIONAL SAVINGS over the listed price if you buy through Subscribe And Save.  For those who might be a little hesitant to try letting Amazon automatically deduct money from your debit or credit card on a regular basis, it's a great option.  I've used Subscribe And Save for a few years now and love it.  They send you an e-mail well before each transaction to let you know a debit to your account is coming. You can decide how often you want a delivery..once a month or every 2,3 or 4 months.  You can change delivery dates anytime you want to which also changes when your payment option is charged, you can order extra shipments whenever you want to with no shipping charge even though the order is under $25, and you can cancel any time you choose so try it for your first shipment and if you don't like the tea cancel.  It's a great savings and you never run out because you forgot to order.  In my opinion it's great tea at a fantastic price.
summary: I Love The Smooth Well Rounded Taste...Great Value Too

reviewText: These chicharrones are delicious, and the packaging is very convenient.  Just like microwave popcorn, the pork rinds come in a bag with cellophane around it.  You shake the bag to distribute the pork rinds, pop it in the microwave, and set the cooking time.The optimal time for my microwave is one minute 45 seconds, but the time will likely differ from one microwave to another.The only reason I'm not giving this product five starts is due to the MSG listed as an ingredient.  While I don't react badly to MSG it still makes me a little nervous.If you're on a low-carb diet this is a great choice for snacking or even meal replacement.
summary: Practical and delicious. However, has preservatives!

reviewText: Not a fan.  There's really nothing good about these.  They only taste a little bit like blueberry, but what really gets me is that they are more like crackers.  I saw "newtons" and I assumed they would be soft and cake-like.  But no, they are hard and crunchy like crackers - and they kind of taste like cardboard.  Imagine eating Wheat Thins without any flavor at all (even the plain ones have some sort of spices on them) - that's what these remind me of.  My toddler also hated them, and so did my pregnant wife.  My dogs liked 'em, though!

Made this for our finicky daughters and they both loved it...which was, by our standards, pretty darned amazing! I've eaten falafel before, but never made it. It looks odd, I won't lie. You put it in a bowl and pour water on it. (Use a tad less than it says and you will be ok. We measured precisely and let stand the HOUR IT TAKES TO SOAK UP and it felt a bit fall-apart-y in my hands when I was shaping it.) As stated, it takes an entire hour to sit and form into itself from the mix, so plan ahead a bit. I used the time to slice the cukes and sweet onion and grape tomatoes, warm the pita, and chat. But just so you know. Now, when you fry it (you CAN bake it but spray Pam on the top of it if you do so it will brown a bit, and it will be drier than fried), don't expect it to look like the box. It won't. It will look like dried up meatballs. It is a funny dark greenish brown color that could pass for overcooked hamburger but isn't off-putting and it smells heavenly! Garlic and onion abound in the smell and next time I fix it, I am adding some crushed red pepper flakes to give it some heat. But it is spiced perfectly if you want non-spicy. We dressed it with sour cream and Hidden Valley Ranch inside our pita pockets with the aforementioned veggies. It is really, really delicious and good for you. Just drain it well after you've fried it (it will float and it only takes a couple mins on each side to cook, as it only needs to brown.) It is shelf-stable and meatless and a good buy here on Amazon. I recommend it wholly. Ooh, would it be sacrilege to dress it up with spicy guacamole??? MMMMM

I recently purchased the Senseo machine and have really enjoyed it! The fact that you can use these pods and make one cup at a time is fantastic for me because Im the only one who usually drinks coffee and cappuccino and I hate making the big pots and having it go stale, get cold, or just having to throw it out.This makes a nice fresh brewed cup and the taste I have found to be quite good. I will admit tho that I still use a dash of creamer in with this one even tho it already has the cream in it. I just like mine creamier.

I really like Dr McDougal instant soups so I thought I'd try this. I will not be buying it again. It contains a very small amount of noodles, especially for the calorie count & amount of sodium, and, quite frankly, the flavoring is really gross. And it's very salty, like old soy sauce. You need at least 2 to have it qualify for anything more than a light snack, in my opinion.
Much spicier than I expected, but overall no complaints. They had a nice smooth smokey flavor and tasted great on a whole wheat roll.

If you don't have time to make a dark chocolate ganache for filling or frosting, this is a fully acceptable ready-made option.It tastes great, like premium cocoa was used and does NOT bring to mind the canned frosting you find in the supermarket at all.It is smooth and supple and spreads great at room temp, a fast schmear gets the tasty job done.  Heated until warm, this can be drizzled on bundt cakes and such as a shiny chocolate glaze.Be aware that it is a pop top lid and once you open it, it does not have a lid for refrigerator storage.  No biggie for me since I just pop the leftovers in a lidded tub and store it that way.This is a great item to keep int your pantry, especially around the holidays.  The price here on Amazon is the lowest I have found anywhere.
summary: For time pressed, this is a wonderful time saver

reviewText: These are definitely "grown up" cookies -- not too sweet and a nice, crumbly but not dry texture. These would be delicious with a cup of tea.  Actually, they'd be delicious anytime. As others have mentioned, they do have a strangely addictive quality to them.  I would certainly buy these cookies again, although I'd probably watch for them to go on sale.
summary: Reminds me of a tea biscuit

reviewText: We are very fond of salmon but we don't like farm raised ones that are offered in groceries. They are less nutritious and packed with lots of chemicals put into their medium during the farming process. Wild caught salmon is a good alternative but it is not always affordable and readily available, so we went for these packed ones however most similar products are packed with fillers like soy, corn etc. which are most likely GMO as well. Besides why the hell, would I want to have soy while I am paying for fish? This is a filler free wild caught alternative in an acceptable price. It is quite tasty as well. We buy a box each month through subscribe and save and I make fish balls for kid's snacks so far we are happy and will keep buying...
summary: we like it, especially in fish balls we make

reviewText: Martinson Joe's Mint N Mocha is my new favorite coffee! Not too strong, great mint and chocolate flavor - perfection in a cup! Highly recommend this flavor. I also want to try Martinson Joe's other flavors. The cups work great in my Keurig.

I love stroganoff, but don't always havs time to make it the long way. So I get these, a steak to grill & either sour cream or country fresh veggie dip (adds a unique, fantastic flavor). After the steak is cooked & has rested, I cut it up & add to the side dish  & sour cream or veggie dip. Wala! I have a nice, easy dinner.

No-one should do oatmeal better than Quaker ....right? Well they have been trying to expand from just the basic oatmeal for some time. These soft cookies are tasty and satisfying. In my family you can tell how good they are by how quickly they disappear. Weel - they disappeared in swift order. In fact I barely got to taste more than one. The general consensus is these are 'just like homemade. There is not greater compliment that can be paid. They are packaged conveniently for inclusion in school lunches etc. They certainly make a great accompaniment for tea or coffee for that unwinding moment all of us need at somour day.
i was having trouble finding the Green Mountain Breakfast blend.  The stores that usually carried it were all out.  It arrived quickly and was cheaper than what I was paying at these stores.
summary: Easy way to get your K-Cups

reviewText: This jam was very good. Not overly sweet like other companies.  I did find a few jars broken by FedX though. I would buy again.
This coconut water is not too bad if you get it really cold makes a huge difference. I prefer the Zico and Vita coco water brands over this one.

Vitamin Squeeze Energy Drink, Fruit Punch, 12-Ounce (Pack of 4)is a good product that is a nice alternative to taking multi-vitamin tablets or drinking Vitamin Water and the like.  For those that believe in taking multi-vitamins, one serving a day is about the equivalent of one tablet for the most common vitamins, such as vitamin C and the various B vitamins.  The serving size of  floor ounce per 8 ounces of water is about a teaspoon.  The taste was stronger than I was expecting, and the fruit punch flavor tasted more like a tart pink-lemonade to me.  This is similar to Crystal Light, but I found this product to have less of an artificial sweetener aftertaste.  Your mileage may vary as taste is entirely subjective.PROS++ Large bottle brings down the per serving cost of the product++ One serving equal to one tablet for the most common vitamins, such as vitamin C and the various B vitamins++ Less artificial sweetener aftertaste than Crystal Light or Mio, at least for me++ Added caffeine and Taurine may give some people an energy boost++ More economical than competing drinks like Mio and Vitamin WaterCONS-- Recommended shelf life is only 30 days-- No clear area to see how much is left in the bottle-- Bottle cap made of fragile cheap plastic and could be prone to leaking-- Bottle is too large and requires refrigeration, so it's not ideal for travel-- Still ridiculously expensive when compared to generic multi-vitamin tabletsWARNINGS++ Refrigeration recommended after opening++ Not for children!  It says so right on the bottle++ Some are more sensitive to the taste of artificial sweeteners than others, so try a sample first++ Multivitamins are not for everybody, so consult your physician if necessary++ Too much vitamin intake can be bad, so portion control is necessary++ Contains Taurine which is animal derivedThe product is not vegan friendly, because it contains Taurine which is animal derived.  Will the added caffeine and Taurine provide an energy boost beyond the product's nutritional content?  Your mileage may vary here as well.  I suspect this will not have a noticeable benefit to those who are used to consuming 40 ounces of coffee per day.  But it may replace the caffeine craving that many people satisfy with sugary sodas.The packaging is large, designed to make 24 portions.  It is re-sealable, and they recommend you refrigerate after opening.  But the cap seems like it is very breakable, particularly for a bottle designed to be stored cap-side down.  The signage is on a plastic label that surrounds the bottle, but there is no clear area to see how much product is left in the bottle.  Even with refrigeration, the recommended shelf life is only 30 days.  So this product will work best for those who have at least one serving daily.CONCLUSIONThis is a good product that provides another alternative for those looking for vitamins or a caffeine boost.  The shelf life is not very long.  And the packaging could use some improvement.  But the product itself is better tasting than I expected, and it will definitely appeal to some people.Enjoy.
summary: Vitamin Squeeze Energy Drink - Good Ingredients, Short Shelf Life, Poor Packaging

reviewText: I mostly make my cookies from scratch, but it's nice to have an emergency treat on hand. These cookies are soft (for those that fall into the "I love soft, not crunchy" cookie camp).They have a cocoa taste and a bit of creamy fudge in the center. This improves when you stick it in the microwave for a few seconds.The only thing I think is a negative, is the package is bulky for how many cookies you end up getting. I wish they gave us more for our money.Having said that, they are tasty in a store-bought way.

Good taste and good price at a buck a pack, but you really need to brown some ground beef and onion to punch it up. I've only had Stroganoff with BEEF and/or mushrooms as a 1-dish meal. I think this is great for the base of a 1-dish meal but I don't care for it by itself. I commend Lipton/Knorr's for this "less sodium" version.
This coffee is good but since I prefer something bolder, I rated it a 3 star.  If you like a more mild cup of coffee, this may be for you.

I tried this coffee, and I think the hazelnut flavor tastes a little off. It doesn't taste quite like hazelnut to me. Of the hazelnut flavored coffees in K-cups that I have tried, my favorite is the Eight O'Clock brand. This one just didn't satisfy me.

I do not know what real Kombucha tastes like, but if it tastes anything like this soda, I'll pass.  The Kombucha Wonder drink tastes like diluted sweetened apple cider vinegar with some ginger added to it.  The drink was so sugary that I really couldn't finish the can.  From what I've read, this is not true Kombucha - the first few ingredients include: filtered water, organic brewed oolong tea, then Kombucha...if I'm going to be drinking primarily oolong tea, I would rather stick to the pure stuff.  That said, I personally do not like this stuff - I don't hate it, but it certainly won't be something I would pick up on my own accord.  Not recommended.

The blend is the kind my taste buds prefer. I can drink straight from the Keurig brew black or add cream and the taste stays appealing. I've opted for the Organic blends and recycle friendly Gorilla brand.....but can recommend this coffee without hesitation.
summary: Good taste, aroma and not too strong

reviewText: pure and natural, what else is there to say? VERY GOOD FLAVOR, and only one ingredient, coconut water, I give this to my twin toddlers instead of juice to keep them hydrated throughout the day, very healthy alternative and they love it!

This coffee has a nice smooth flavor with a hint of creamy caramel.  Before brewing I can smell really nice caramel notes in the cup.  Once brewed, the coffee is rich, with a lighter caramel flavor.  I found this to be a slightly darker roast than I've seen in other flavored coffees.  The caramel flavor is smooth and light.  This is not too sweet to be relegated to dessert coffee.  I'm quite happy drinking it in the morning and at night.  Versatile and delicious.
Crunchy peanuts, whole flax seeds, tastey way to get omega-3, 4g Fiber from the delicious diversity of whole grains, yummy!
summary: Erin Baker's Peanut Butter Breakfast Cookie

reviewText: Pasta sauce from an envelope?  Never.  What kind of a plebian do you think I am?For this sauce, I'll make an exception.  Knorr sauce mixes are generally a cut above the rest, but this particular blend is creamy, cheesy (in a good way), and easy.  It's a nice side for grilled chicken with Italian herbed vegetables, and with some shaved grana padano on top, no one will think it's from a packet.  Also, Amazon has a great price, and the larger quantity doesn't take up all that much room in the pantry.Let's see:  creamy, cheesy, easy, and cheap? Hey, I think I went to high school with her.  But this one won't mind waiting in the pantry when mom comes over.  Check it out.

There's just enough honey in this to be noticeable and impart a very sweet flavor.  It's not overpowering, and it's not too faint.  The peanut butter is very smooth and creamy. It spreads easily and fairly melts in your mouth.  I'm not normally a devotee of Peter Pan PB; I'm more of a Jif man.  But they've struck on a winning formula here.

I have this on automatic shipment, as I keep it in the office to eat with my salad. I would have given it 5 stars as it usually comes with no bones or skin but the last shipment I received had some (not much) in each can. Its tasty, handy and since I try to follow Dr. Perricone's diet principles (yes, I am getting younger by the minute), this little can fits the bill.
Has a moderately good flavor for a decaf.  I prefer a little more robust flavor myself.  A good choice for a decaf for a mild flavor.
I love green mountain coffee.  Sometimes on my way to work, I would stop at dunkin dounuts and get a coffee and it's bitter but green mountain is never bitter.  It always has the best taste
An all-natural, pleasant tasting straight coconut product.  Convenient packaging.  From the ingredient list, this would be a good product for an active lifestyle.  4 stars

There is another brand of organic rooibos tea offered on Amazon (Choice brand) that I previously ordered.  I gave that tea 5 stars.  Numi also offers a good rooibos.I decided to give Davidson's a chance since it was so cheap.  Now I understand why it's so cheap.  It is extremely weak tea.  2 bags of Davidson's is still not equal to 1 bag of Choice.  Maybe 3 or 4 bags is more like it.I actually ended up throwing out my most recent cup of Davidson's because I had left 2 old bags in there, along with 2 new bags (so 4 bags in total) thinking that maybe I could suck more tea out of the old bags (something I did quite often with the other brands).  But the joke was on me because what the tea ended up tasting like was the bags themselves with just a hint of tea.I feel that drinking this brand of rooibos tea is more like drinking plain water with just the hint of tea flavor.  I doubt I will drink the remaining 96 bags I have left but will instead use them for my tired eyes when I go to bed at night.
GREAT TASTING ALKALINE WATERWISH I COULD GET LARGER QUANITY CHEAPER BUT ITS STILL A GREAT BARGAINLOVE THESE CAPS

I have purchased this item before on Subscribe and save.  It is great as a Salad dressing, but also as a seasoning straight over sliced fresh tomatoes with a little vinegar and no oil.  I  even added it to my fresh homemade salsa.  Add a little to your favorite meat rub and it embellishes the flavor.  The little bit of sugar in it is a plus.  09/29/2013 UPDATE:  The price is getting just too costly for these little 2/tbsp. envelopes, even with subscribe and save, so I decided to find a similar recipe for it online.  I purchased bulk quantities of the ingredients on subscribe and save and use leftover 1/2 pint canning jars to make Christmas gifts of it and oodles left for me as well.  You can find a great recipe on ALL-RECIPES.COM with serving size increase as well to figure out how much to increase the ingredients for specific amount of serving you want to make.

This is a huge amount of candy. I'll be sharing this with folks for many months. And they're soft which is good, but sour is not the correct term for them. I'd be stretching to call them even tart. I don't need insanely sour candy, but this is truly not in the category if sour candies. They are very very sweet with an insufficient scattering of sour crystals on each. Also very messy as the crystals fall off as soon as you unwrap one.

My mom bought this as the alternative to sugar and loves using it all the time in her coffee. Me, I believe it's just okay, but leaves a horrible after taste. I tried using it many times, hoping I would acquire the taste, but it just didn't come at all. It even makes the coffee I drink have a weird after taste as well. Judging by the reviews, people like this stuff, me I just stick to regular sugar or Equal, because it tastes better than the Splenda.

Sorry to find maltodextrin and caramel color listed as ingredients, because maltodextrin, a chemically derived product, especially is too hurtful to use.Sorry I can't recommend this....I ordered it based on some of the reviews, but missed the "m word" review.  Maybe I just need to stick to tea.  Don't waste your money on this chemical blend.
summary: caramel color and maltodextrin in this, maybe coffee also

reviewText: If you like mild coffee and mint flavor you will enjoy this coffee.  The mint flavoring is clearly artificial but I would not consider this a negative aspect of the product.  It's exactly what I would expect out of flavored coffee.  I did feel like the mocha flavor was drowned out by the mint flavoring.  It has a lovely mint aroma that I could smell across the kitchen as soon as it started brewing.  The serious black coffee drinker will not like this at all.

Plain and simple:  this tastes awful!Vitamin Squeeze is a concentrated energy drink that you squeeze into a glass of water and enjoy.  But there was no enjoyment here.  It has a fake chemical taste which overpowered any fruit punch flavor.  The first sip was bad, but I took another in the interest of writing this review and... even worse the second time around. So bad, in fact, that my tongue and lips started to tingle and I had to rinse my mouth out.I'm beyond perplexed that others would speak so highly of this product.  I'll drink my water straight, and get my vitamins (and caffeine) elsewhere.  I don't recommend this water enhancer.

It tasted very clean and pure, not unlike water. It tasted like I get out of my reverse osmosis water. I didn't feel any different than drinking normal pH balanced water, but I only had one bottle. But I did enjoy the taste!I think it is a tad overpriced at more than $2 per bottle. I would rather get a Dasani or a Smart Water at much less than this.
summary: Tasted pretty good, not worth the price

reviewText: I was surprised that many thought this was different then the "regular" Rockstar. Double strength refers to the size of the can, not the ingredients. Rockstar definitely tastes best when as icy cold as you can get it. I like to compare it to champagne, most of your really expensive champagne's taste exactly like Rockstar, except they have the opposite results. Which is why you should never combine the two, can't believe people are crazy enough to combine an energy drink with alcohol, not smart.Normally I would not order this from Amazon because I can get it for a lot less locally, but Amazon was running an "Amazoning" special that worked out to $1.00 per can, woo hoo, way to go.PS: it is one of the few ways to get your Vitamin B's that isn't nauseating. From one who gets sick at just the smell of Vitamin B's.

The bottle I received was a 1.5 liter size.  Very large (I have a photo at the top).  I usually get more manageable sizes to take with me when I walk/jog - a size that fits in the cup holder of my stroller.  Anyway I thought I'd give this a shot today since I was going for a longer jaunt, a 5 mile combined jog / walk with my stroller and perhaps I'd want more than just one small water bottle.The bottle size actually made it so I drank less because I had to store it in the bottom of the stroller and it wasn't readily available... so I only drank half of it and that was consumed at the end of my outing.  But I sort of felt more energized after drinking it - and I was quite pooped after 5 miles of pushing the stroller.  I don't know if that was psychological because I knew there were electrolytes in it or if there really was more of a boost.I can't comment too much on if the pH is of any benefit or not, I understand you have to drink this for awhile before any benefit kicks in... HOWEVER I did a quick search online to see if I could read anything from an independent source telling me why 9.5 pH or a higher pH in general is good for you and I couldn't find anything EXCEPT websites that were trying to sell me their products.  I couldn't find a website to tell me WHY this was good that WASN'T trying to sell me anything and that had some credibility.  So please keep that in mind.  One of the websites that was trying to sell me their pH stuff sited some "Japanese study" but gave no specifics... so I could not even look that study up to verify anything.  So it sort of leaves me to believe the pH thing may be a fad.  Probably a harmless one though.Bottom line... water tasted good.  I like the electrolyte thing.  Don't care much about the pH, think that may be silly.
summary: It tastes... like nothing.  Refreshing to drink after a 5 mile walk.

reviewText: This is the fourth attempt to post this review, I can only assume I mentioned a country or person or something, so I'll keep it simple.I like curry, any curry (no countries or ethnic groups mentioned)This curry is: -The exact recipe calls for Beef, if you prefer chicken go for it.Cook the meat (whichever you choose) shallow fry, or wok flash fry until cooked through, rare is OK for beef, but obviously not for pork or chicken, cook these thoroughly.Second stage is mix paste and spices with fluid, cook on their own until simmered.Finally add meat, and simmer to taste? That could mean 20 minutes, or 6 hours - I know when I make curry I prefer slow cooked soft meat that has had plenty of time to absorb all he spices, so longer is better. But if you're in a hurry that's fine, it just won't be as fully flavored.So taste?Well that's subjective and personal but I found it hot (spicy) in a white pepper way, and top heavy on the cumin flavor, but this is not uncommon for that part of the World.I guess I was disappointed, I used one mix on three pounds of meat (not the 1-2 pound as suggested) and it was still pretty fiery.

I have been buying these from Amazon forever.  Very tasty and the sweetness lasts a long time.  It's also good after a meal as it helps freshen your breath and get the food out of your teeth.  But be very careful around your dogs as the sweetener in these is poisonous to dogs and perhaps other animals.
summary: Very tasty, long lasting and freshens your breath

reviewText: WHAT THIS IS AND WHO IT'S FOR:GoPicnic Energy Boost Care Package, Gluten-Free, 2.01-Pound Boxis perfect for many occasions: it's great as an emergency kit to keep in your car, it's appropriate to take with you when you are having a picnic with your significant other, but most of all it would serve well as a start-up gluten-free kit. If you or someone you know suffers from a gluten allergy (in the United States 1 in 133 people have gluten allergies), having snack food around the house can be a chore. This package is like a crash course of the types of foods you can purchase on regular basis.WHY It's GLUEN-FREE: All items are made from non-wheat flour. instead they are products from potatoes (PopChips Barbeque Potato Chips), seeds, rice flour, and grains (Crunchmaster Multi-Seed Crackers and Trail Mix), chick peas (hummus), and beef (Jack Link's beef nugget).TASTE: All food in this package is natural. Not all food is made in the United States; some of it is made in Israel. All foods very natural and gluten-free, but not all food were delicious.My least favorite items were the organic Sharkies chewables and the PopChips Barbeque Potato Chips. The Sharkies chewables tasted like a poor-man's version of licorice gummy bears, and although I'm generally a huge fan of the PopChips brand, I found the Barbeque style to be too spicy and lacking in true grit flavor. The chips, like all PopChips varieties, were not made by frying or baking.My favorite item was the Crunchmaster Multi-Seed Crackers. They were great with the Parmesan cheese spread (inside the smaller GoPicnic package), with the hummus (this package includes four little packets of Wild Garden Hummus Dip), as well as being crunchy on their own.In addition to the snacks, the package includes five "single-use" packackets of raspberry-flavored Vitamin C energy booster drink.Except for the parmesian spread cheese and the beef jerky (both inside the smaller GoPicnic package), all foods are also Vegan.PACKAGING: This is a 2-pound box of snacks that comes in Amazon's Certified Frustration-Free packaging. What this means is that all the items were in their own individual box and that box was inside a huge amazon box. This seems rather wasteful to me especially since all items are individually packaged.MARKETING: The Amazon product description says that no refrigeration or heating is required and while that's generally true, the four packets of hummus need to be refrigerated upon opening (assuming you don't eat them all first!). Sidenote: I'm a bit confused why this item is called GoPicnic Package and then contains items that are not GoPicnic items, and a box of GoPicnic items as well. Perhaps it's just the way Amazon packages things? To the consumer, this has no bearing on the flavor though.EXPIRATION DATE: Some of the other reviews mention that the expiration date was very close. I did not find that to be the case for the box I received. The frustration free box indicated the expiration date as June 9, 2011. This date was the least common denominator for all the products. Several of the items in the box, however, had an even further expiration date - the hummus was good till June 2012 and several items were good till August 2011.VALUE: The value of this package is questionable. It seems like a good box to send to someone as a present or maybe even to order once (for that gluten-free friend who is coming over to your party), and it might even be cheaper than buying individually. Still, this would not be an item that I would be buying every day. This is more a one-time purchase to taste all the foods and then to figure out which you like best and then buy those items instead.

GoPicnic Energy Boost Pack is a convenient way to send someone at college or camp a little bundle of snacks ranging from hummus to potato chips.  Additionally, all of the items are gluten free.  The box contains the following items:1) Popchips BBQ Potato Chips: The Popchips are a great chip.  They are fluffy and light with a crisp crunch.  The BBQ flavor is sweet but tangy and the chips leave very little residue on your fingers.2) Crunchmaster Multi-Seed Crackers: These crackers are crunchy and wheaty tasting with a slight salty taste.  They are good alone or with cheese on top.3) Sheffa Zesty Snack Mix: This mix contains chickpea noodles, roasted corn, sunflower and pumpkin seeds.  It's supposed to be zesty, but it tasted bland overall, and had very little kick.  It was very fresh and crunchy though.  It did leave a bit of residue on my fingers however.4) Mareblu Naturals Blueberry Pomegranate Trail Mix: This had an obnoxiously sweet smell when I opened the bag, and I thought I wouldn't like it, but it was quite tasty.  The sweetness was slightly intense initially but quickly gave way to nuttier flavors.  It was very fresh and crunchy.  The mix is peanut free, and certified vegan.5) Wild Garden Traditional Hummus Dip: I've never had hummus before so I was a little leery, and I'm still not sure I like it.  This hummus was very smooth and had a spicy, bean like taste to it.  Not bad, but I'm not a hummus convert.6) Sharkies Watermelon Scream Chews:  These are like very healthy fruit snacks, and I like the idea of organic fruit snacks, but this flavor is way too sweet for me, and they were very gummy.7) Emergen-C Raspberry Fizzy Drink Mix: This is a powered drink mix that you add 4-6 oz of water to and are supposed to have 2-4 times a day.  Personally, I'd rather have it never.  It was way too sweet for me, almost like drinking fizzy pink sugar.8) Steak Nuggets & Cheese: The last item is actually a little box that has all the makings of a meal.  There are beefsteak nuggets (dry, dense, and tasteless), Crunchmaster crackers (see #2 above), Parmesan peppercorn cheese (tangy and tasty cheese spread), fruit and nut mix (very peanut tasting), almond roca (crunchy, sweet, and sticks to your teeth).All in all... with the exception of a few items, a tasty and healthy little box of treats.
summary: Mostly good stuff in this box, a few undesirables leave a bad taste though.

reviewText: If you're a fan of mint and mocha, you'll love this coffee. It's absolutely delicious and very flavorful. It brews quickly in my Keurig brewer. It's very smooth, not harsh at all. I add a peppermint creamer when I want a super-minty taste. This is perfect for serving to guests at holiday parties. I would definitely purchase this product again.

I'm not an athlete.  I've read through the reviews of this from the athletes, and if I were an athlete it would probably be a big deal in my mind.  On the other hand, I'm like everyone and get sick from time to time.  From being ill, I was dehydrated.  My doctor immediately told me to start drinking Gatorade or PediaSure.  I have never liked flavored sports drinks.  I hate the fact that when I am already not feeling well, I have to drink something I can't stand the flavor of.  I had previous tried SmartWater to solve this issue, but it doesn't seem to be infused with enough electrolytes to help.  So, this time I tried Essentia.  After about 2 liters, I did feel better.  You know that sorta dry, swollen tongue thing that happens when you are dehydrated?  That went away.  I felt a little stronger between drinking this and taking my medicine.  I asked the doctor if this was okay to drink instead of Gatorade and he gave me the go ahead.  So, here is what I liked:1.  It pretty much tastes like water.  There is a slight difference in taste from something like Brita water, or most bottled water, but overall it's not a taste that drives me away.2.  It is not sugary!  This is what drives me away from Gatorade.  I hate the sugary taste of every one of their flavors.  Since this basically tastes like water, it is not sugary!  This is the aspect that makes me dance for joy.3.  It made me feel hydrated after a bottle.  Honestly, it was probably less than a bottle.  If I wasn't already extremely dehydrated, it would have been even less than that.  I love it when something makes you just feel better.4.  It is a sporty water bottle that is made from environmentally safe products.  I'm not a total Go Green girl, but it is definitely a plus and something I am becoming more aware of.  I know that several of my high school athletes are very big in the Green shopping, so this is something I would recommend it.  It's also good plastic that is easily recycled again.The biggest con is the price.  It's not unheard of for a 12 pack of water to be expensive, but it is definitely not a drink the average family would be able to purchase several times a week.  A single bottle is just slightly more expensive than Gatorade, but a 12 pack for about $25 is much different than the supermarket brand of water that is a 24 pack for $4.00.  This is water that is for the electrolytes and rehydrating after a sickness or big work out, not an every day drinking water.

I was surprised at how tart this drink was! I love Fuji apples but didn't expect to get such wonderful, tangy flavor in a juice that calls itself apple.Jones soda doesn't hold the same aesthetics for me without the glass bottle and homegrown photos on the label, but the can was of the new taller, skinny variety that certainly made it different.Both of my children, ages 3 and 6 loved it as well.

K-cups are typically touch-and-go. Among various manufacturers across a multitude of flavors, you can never predict strength or flavor. That said, I can honestly say this is one of my favorite k-cup flavors.This coffee has a perfectly mint-chocolately taste, where neither the mint or chocolate is overpowering. I can only describe this as a hot-chocolate flavored coffee, without the richness of hot chocolate. When I ordered this, I thought the "mocha" meant it would be a creamier coffee like a cappuccino, but it is not like that, fortunately. Other than flavoring, this coffee has no additives and does not have any calories.The coffee brews dark, and has an awesome aroma. If I run my brewer and wait a few minutes before returning to the kitchen to retrieve my mug, the kitchen is filled with the mint-chocolately aroma. My only complaint is that I wish it was a more full-bodied, darker roast, as it's not as strong as I normally like my coffee.I recommend this coffee if you want something different, although drinking this daily is quite easy.

I used to drink two or three  cans of this tea a day for many years. Then one day recently I started to worry about the cans' lining--I wondered if it was lined with BPA. After calling the Ito  En offices several times and not getting my calls returned and getting the runaround, I was finally referred to a Japanese beverage can maker. I emailed them and was told that their cans are lined with polyethylene terephthalate. Those of you who know what phthalates are, know that they have been shown to be endocrine disruptors. I had thought I was getting pure green tea and healthy catechins and now I'm sickened to know that for years, I was likely ingesting phthalates that leached out. Ugh. I am switching to iced tea in glass bottles now.

Actually this curry sauce was really good. A lot better than I expected from a box. The kit is full of ingredients to make a sauce - it has a packet of paste (the sauce base) and a packet of coconut "premix" (a powder made from dehydrated coconut milk and bits of coconut). You just add water and you have delicious curry sauce.Instructions said to brown 28 oz of beef for this. But I think you could use any meat and / or veggies and it would taste good.It's not very spicy though. If you like spicy, you'll have to add some. It's also quite high in sugar and fat.One tip: the coconut premix has a texture like sugar. It comes in a packet and has some lumps in it (also like sugar). You don't want the lumps. Mush the packet with your fingers to squash the lumps back into powder. This will make it easier to mix the sauce into a nice smooth texture.It was easy, tasty, and made quite a lot of food. Probably 4 servings at least.I'd buy this again, and I'd try this brand's other sauce kits too.

I bought a few of these for immediate  snacks during a grocery market trip (impulse buy!) and was very pleasantly surprised!  None of my kids require a gluten free diet but that is simply a plus in my mind as they have enough gluten in their daily diet (pizza, pizza, pizza!).  These are healthful and hearty and they enjoy them in their school lunch.  More economical buying in bulk from Amazon than individually at my local health market!
These are excellent little treats for people avoiding white foods. The taste is great. Like a fig bar in texture, except blueberry filling. Kids love them, too.
I LOVE these cookies.  They do not have the aftertaste that some of the gluten free cookies have and they have the consistency of real home made shortbread cookies without the gluten.
summary: These taste just like real wheat shortbread cookies

reviewText: I enjoyed the BBQ chips, the hummus, and the mini-meal with the crackers and the beef nuggets.  Everything else was fairly flavorless.But could I find better tasting BBQ chips, hummus, and beef jerky at the supermarket for less money?  I sure could!  This was an amusing diversion, but I wouldn't get it again.
This quinoa is absolutely delicious. It is wonderful quality, and the price is outrageously good! I will definitely be buying this again.

These nutrients are semi-decent. Just add a squeeze to the water you are drinking and you are done with your daily vitamins. Except if you have allergies to dairy/milk, are a vegan, or don't like highly synthetic vitamins. Then, considerEmergen-C Immune Defence, 30-Countinstead.
summary: squeezeable nutrients that are not for everyone (not vegan friendly)

reviewText: I was hesitant to buy these, expecting a hard, tasteless granola bar.  Boy was I surprised!  These are honestly the best granola bars I have eaten.  They are chewy and the flavor is wonderful!  They are great to carry in my pocketbook in case I am out somewhere & there are no safe foods available.  I highly recommend!
summary: The best granola bar I have ever tasted!I wa

reviewText: Betty Lou's fruit bars are amazing!  The apple cinnamon is very similar to a Nutri-grain bar - which if you are gluten-free and cannot have ... you start to crave.  Thank you Betty Lou's for curing the Fig Newton, Nurti-grain, chewy fruit cookie cravings.

I enjoy that this is a handy product that gives my usual beverage of water a nice change.  It is very tasty.  You can add as much or as little as you want.  It is very thirst quenching.  I kept this in my classroom during the school year but come September, I will need to have two on hand so I can keep one at work and one at home.  This is one of the most thirst-qunching options I have come across.

Amazon.com took care of shipping these grits.  It is just fine to follow the directions on the back of the package. The grits turned out yummy.  You will of course want to season them to your liking but the grits plain have the same taste as the grits you get in restaurants. They end up cooking into a light golden color.Amazon's price of $[...] can't be beat. They were shipped perfectly in a Bob's Red Mill brand box holding the 4 packages and that box was laid inside an Amazon box snugly. For $[...] with 4 packages it is a steal--- when you think about how much money you can spend on Grits in a restaurant.  It's just as good at home and takes little time to make.
It's not much better calorie-wise than a candy bar and taste-wise, honestly, it's just ok. It's a little harder than I expected, as well.

My two year old will eat the entire case if I let her!They are delicious, but too high price, even at $10 per case.Should not be more than $5 a case, compared to Costco price, and less overhead.At $5 per case I'd by 5 cases a WEEK for my extra large family and let them snack on them all day long.Come on, Jayone, either make a bigger case, or cut the price, eh?

I have never been a huge fan of curry.  I think it has more to do with my taste buds being drowned in Italian food most of my life, but I continue to enjoy the cuisines of the world.  I received a package of the Prima Taste of Rendang Curry and found it to be a perfect match for the stew beef that was slow cooked.  One of the things that sold me was that the sauce has a slightly sweet taste, which cut the feeling of the curry being its usual overpowering self for me.  I will definitely purchase more of this in the future.

This water is smooth, but not overly soft. It is very drinkable with a good clean water taste. 1.5 liter bottles are a little awkward for drinking straight out of, but a cup solves that problem easily.
Mist a little olive oil and sprinkle this on your air popped popcorn and you will be in cheesy popcorn heaven. I have not used used it on other food but this powder has a good taste,

reviewerName: James C. Ward "horror and sci-fi fan.."
reviewText: takes about a minute to make in the micro.  The taste of the sauce was better than expected and clean up is very easy.

I bought this coffee at the suggestion of a friend.  The price was right and I was pleasantly surprised!Not overly strong, but strong enough for my first cup of coffee in the morning and not bitter.  My husband was able to drink it too once he doctored it up with his creamer and sugar (he likes his coffee rather weak in my opinion).I would buy this product again.

I drink a lot of bottled water, all day, everyday and the fruit punch flavor was a pleasant change to my usual plain water.  I do like that it has added vitamins, but it still doesn't make this a healthier product.  I'd prefer the coloring be removed and no artificial sweeteners added, and instead use natural or no color with fruit juice < would be a nice change >.If you are just looking for an occasional flavor boost and don't mind the dye, you might enjoy this.  The bottle was easy to use, once I cut the inner seal off.  The boost of vitamins didn't have much impact for me, but the flavor is good.
summary: Good flavor and Not too sweet

reviewText: I received a single box of Prima Taste Rendang Curry Sauce Kit free from the Amazon Vine program, in exchange for writing a review of the product.We lived in Malaysia and India, so we love curry and enjoy it at home on a regular basis.  I usually use lamb or chicken, but this time I used beef as directed on the box.  We enjoyed the flavors of lemongrass and coconut in this sauce, although it wasn't quite spicy enough for us.  I actually added some extra curry powder to it before it was done cooking.  We all thought it was a little too sweet, but overall was very tasty when served over rice.The current price for this product is around $6.50 per box.  That seems a little on the expensive side when I am adding my own meat, vegetables and rice.  The box made six very small servings (we have six in our family).  If you're looking for an authentic tasting and less expensive curry mix, try Kitchens of India Paste for Butter Chicken Curry.This was nice to try just for the experience, but I will continue to make my own curries because I can do it much cheaper without the mix.
summary: Too mild and sweet, but not bad

reviewText: This is a lot of cinnamon.  But that's OK as I've shared it with family.  Everyone is happy with its taste.
If you like cherry flavored licorice, you should buy this. They are very good-- A great treat! They are individually wrapped, so stay fresh. You can take them anywhere!
rich strong bold tasting coffee in the morning is what you like than this one is for you. if not than don't buy it.

These are delicious chocolate covered espresso beans. I like it that the covering is thicker than most. I hoped to get a little jolt from the caffeine and did not. I have in the past, but none of these beans I have tried recently seem to give me a lift.Update:12-16-13I had to come back and give them 5 instead of 4 because these are the best tasting espresso beans I have eaten. None of the several I am currently sampling give me a jolt, but of the 5 different kinds I have tried this year, these are the best tasting. They have more chocolate which I have decided is a good thing. Also, the chocolate is great tasting.

I bought a case of both the Native Forest Orgainc Asian Pears and their Peaches. As others have noted, nearly all the cans were significantly dented. The fruit had a tinny taste (not uncommon in canned vegetables, but less expected in organic produce.)  I do not intend to purchase again.

Basmati rice is a very well kept secret in America. Most Americans seem to think all rice is the same (often boring is mentioned). Basmati rice is an adventure from the moment you read the label on the package. As the rice is cooked, a savory fragrance fills the air not too unlike freshly popped pop corn. Having tried various brands of Basmati rice, none have come close to Tilda. The superior quality of product and packageing has made me a loyal fan.
My husband and I enjoy a variety of "regular" coffee favors. We are not fans of the fru-fru favors. It's nice to try something different.

What the heck is couscous? That's what I wanted to know when one of my kids said he likes it. So, of course, I had to get some and give it a try. I do, indeed, enjoy it. I should have mentioned this to my lovely bride who told me that I could find it at WalMart.NT

Having purchased gourmet popping corn montly I was excited to find this large of quanitiy at such a small asking price. However; this product arrived in a large, mostly unsealed bag with the corn being spread out througout my entire shipping package rendering the corn virtually unuseable. The corn itself smelled stale although that could be from the poor shipping. The package of corn itself was only secrued with a twist tie. Largely disappointed in this company and product.

Donut Shop coffee is my usual coffee.  I do order different blends on Amazon.  This one is the closest to the Donut Shop coffee I usually buy and at a lower price.  One of the better coffees that I had never heard of.

You know for years I used to wonder why so many people dislike chunky peanut butter.  I guess sometimes just the chunkiness feels awkward on the tongue so it's more like a mind over matter thing and not that the taste is actually bad, but recently -after doing some serious thinking on the matter- I think I know why people prefer not to buy chunky peanut butter.  You actually unintentionally waste a LOT more than you would had it just been regular (smooth) peanut butter.What I mean is, if you stick your butter knife in a jar of chunky peanut butter, you'll end up using a lot more for one sandwich due to the nature of chunky peanut butter more likely to cling onto the knife compared to smooth peanut butter.  In other words, chunky peanut butter encourages a huge clump to come out at once which is probably not what you intended to do.  I guess if you really make an effort to take your time, you can assure your knife won't end up using too much chunky (if you have a ton of patience, that is).  For that reason alone, it's better to go with smooth since you won't end up wasting as much for one simple sandwich.  Simply put, chunky peanut butter is wasteful.

This will be the bottle that you grab from the fridge if you are really thirsty!  The bottles are big!  I like that about them because I can grab one and drink from it for a couple of hours and really stay hydrated.  The taste is just cool, clean and refreshing.  No aftertaste at all.  This is good water.
The little portion packs were great for smores at a campout and for putting into lunches without the need to open up the box and reseal it to keep the crackers fresh. I would definitly buy this again

Can't say enough about the organic spices I just love them the scent is so pure I have always said you get what you pay for and when it comes to good spices you should never cut corners , I cook a lot with herbs and spices and I do see the difference in good spices also making sure they are replaced often so they stay fresh.

One of my children has life threatening peanut and tree nut allergies.  Hence, like many other families in the same situation, we had to explore other options.  Until recently, we just worked around it for lunches with other food (protein) items until we tried this product.  The whole family now enjoys creamy SchoolSafe SoyButter with Fluff, Jelly, and whatever else they can think of to put it on!  This product is a homerun!  Reading from the label, this product is manufactured in a peanut and tree nut facility.  The listed Ingredients are:  Canadian toasted soy, soy oil, granulated cane sugar, monoglyceride (from vegetable oil), sea salt.

I used to buy K-Cups at the grocery store and pay almost $0.75 a cup. Now, I only buy K-Cups when they are $0.50 or less. These sure are! I love a light roasted coffee and these GMC Breakfast blends are the perfect match for me. I have one cup every morning before work. The only time of day when I venture away from the breakfast blend is if I'm craving a slightly darker roast after dinner. GMC makes some great K-Cups and this one is a classic and my favorite!

Garbanzo flour is known as "Besan" in Indian cooking and it's simply the ground flour of chickpeas, so it's a bean flour, not a grain. it is slightly yellow in color and has a somewhat nutty and sweet taste. Due to the high protein, a batter of chickpea flour and water can behave rather like an egg batter when you use it to dip foods for frying. In addition, it's used in a number of Indian sweets that are somewhat like fudge or nougat.If you want a really great recipe for zucchini pakoras, or fritters, it's so simple, you'll want to make these frequently. You can also use large white mushroom slices, Vidalia onion rings, even thinly sliced potato or sweet potato. Slices of cauliflower, carrot and whole trimmed green beans work, too. Here's the recipe:1 cup Chickpea Flour1/2 cup water1 tsp Garam Masala (Indian spice mix)2 tsp each, grated gingerroot and mashed garlic1/2 tsp ground chili pepperMix this up until it's nice and smooth. This is your batter.Thinly slice (1/4 inch) zucchini, or mushrooms, onions (make into rings), potatoes or use a mix of these vegetables. Dip each piece into the batter and coat well. Fry in a cast iron skillet with a shallow layer of vegetable oil (you don't need more than a 1/4 to a 1/2 inch of oil.) When the fritters are caramel-brown on one side, flip and cook the other side. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle lightly with coarse sea salt, if you like. I use tongs to flip the vegetables. These are fantastic as appetizers or a quick snack.
summary: Protein-packed, gluten-free, egg replacer--and a recipe for you

reviewText: My family is on the last box.  My oldest daughter ate most of the cookies.  She likes peanut butter more than anything, and these 100-calorie pouches had just the right amount and they taste great.

I have been using another brand for years- and I love it. However, when Amazon could no longer get for some reason I tried the Terrasoul. It is wonderful, and less expensive! Tasty.

Reviewing water... Well, what can I say.  This water has absolutely NO TASTE whatsoever, which I take it from other water reviews is what most people like.  I, however, LOVE and BUY only BOTTLED SPRING WATER which, of course, you can taste the minerals.  I prefer water with taste.  I used this water for bread making and pizza dough making, which as a chef, you want to use this type of water due to PH levels and interacting with yeast cultures.  It worked perfectly for what I wanted to use it for.  I would NEVER lift this kind of water to MY lips but it was put to good use in my kitchen and I had EXCELLENT results...
summary: A Review For H2O... By A Spring Water Drinker

reviewText: taste was bland but metalic. Will not buy again even though $8 a box was cheap.

I often wonder if I am the only person in the world who cannot stand microwave popcorn.  Give me real corn and a little oil and I am pretty happy.  Then I discovered this popcorn at a kitchen store in my local outlet.  Then they went out of business and I lost my awesome popcorn connection... until now.Wabash Valley Farms is the best popcorn you can get outside of your local multi-plex (though I really like target popcorn too).  You don't need the whirly popper as indicated on the package instructions - I always cook it on the stovetop in a large covered pot; my sister cooks it in one of those fancy carnival poppers.Each pack contains 5 pouches of product. Each pouch contains popping oil, popcorn, and a buttery salt topping (which I only use about half of - it is very fine and very salty). For those that like additional butter, you can add it after popping.  While I cannot attest to the exact amount of popcorn yielded, it does do a good job of filling up my 32-cup Tupperware Thatsa bowl.  Thatsalotta popcorn.The unit cost is $1.66 per pouch, which may seem high when comparing it to microwave popping corn, but you just cannot compare the quality and taste (and when compared to theater popcorn, it is a fraction of the cost). Orville Redenbacher has nothing on Wabash!
summary: Hands down best popcorn you can get outside of a theater

These, however, please my hubby, the gingersnap fanatic.Let's say right up front: They don't snap.Who cares. Hubby loves them. I tasted part of one (I'm not the ginger cookie freak, he is). It's very flavorful and gingery. The outside crust is nice, with a chewy inside. These are softer than I'm used to experiencing ginger snaps. These give me a gingerbread vibe.I remember buying the Mi-Del ones and finding them awful. These are nice. Even I'd eat them if a cookie craving hit.I bought our bag at Nutrition S'Mart, but if these delivered ones can make it in proper piece (not pieces), then hooray.Enjoy...

I love them because they are great on the go snacks that I can feel good about giving her.  I am a repeat orderer of this product!

Unless you get non-sweetened, I feel like Rice Dream really adds too much sugar. It's hard to drink straight, sometimes I like to mix it with a non-sweetened variety. There are newer more modern methods of pregnancy detection. These rabbits can be spared. Early pioneers in pregnancy testing came up with the "Friedman test.",  An improvement on the 1927 test developed by Bernhard Zondek and Selmar Aschheim that used mice (You can't sell dead mice on Amazon).  The rabbit test was an advance and consisted of injecting the tested woman's urine into a female rabbit. Examining the rabbit's ovaries a few days later you would find a change in response to a hormone only secreted by pregnant women. The hormone, human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), is produced during pregnancy and indicates the presence of a fertilized egg. The rabbit test became very popular and the supply of dead rabbits increased. The term "rabbit test" was first recorded in 1949 but became a common phrase in the English language. The people who didn't know any better thought the injected rabbit would die only if the woman was pregnant. The phrase "the rabbit died" became as euphemism for a positive pregnancy test. Actually all rabbits used for the test died, because they had to be surgically opened in order to examine the ovaries. While it was possible to do this without killing the rabbit, it was generally deemed not worth the trouble and expense, the cheapskates!  Due to medical advances, use of a live animal is no longer required. Folks the rabbits don't have to die. Don't promote their demise by purchasing this product.A replacement for the rabbit test uses frogs, specifically the African clawed frog, which like all frogs lays eggs instead of getting pregnant, and therefore can yield a positive result on the test without the need to be cut open in order to prove it. So do your pregnancy testing on frogs not rabbits.
summary: The Rabbit Died is Not the Message You want to Hear

reviewText: I make my own vanilla extract, and these beans have given me a nice dark yummy product. I split them with a sharp knife, stuff them into a quart jar, filled the jar with cheap vodka, and put in the pantry for about six weeks, giving the jar a shake whenever I thought of it. Then poured off the headily-fragrant extract into another jar, and filled the first jar with more vodka. It's about three weeks into its process and I think It's going to be only slightly less strong; I'll probably let it sit a bit longer. That makes the whole process a pretty good bargain: these beans, two quarts of cheap vodka, two jars, and time equals two quarts of excellent quality vanilla extract.
summary: Good quality at a decent price

reviewText: I was looking for cashews to crush and put into a food processor to be one ingredient for a non-dairy cream sauce.  This is the perfect solution!  It's already in pieces and the price can't be beat.

I like having a coffee mocha but I hate the sweetness and this cacao powder takes care of that.  It dissolves very quickly and I have put it in hot drinks, smoothies, cookies, etc.  Love the rich taste without all the sugar of hot chocolate and dissolves better than cocoa powder.

This organic coffee (K-cup) bills itself as "extra bold." Amen; it surely is. I do prefer coffee with a bold flavor, and this particular K-cup brand is very satisfying. The package says, in part: "Look for lots of body in this big, bold coffee."Some coffees bill themselves as bold or extra bold and disappoint.I appreciate the brand a bit more, because (if its claim is accurate) it pays growers fair prices, helps with community development, and sustainable environmental practices.I am indeed a satisfied customer--and consumer--of this product.

I used to eat pop corn as it was when I popped it in the micro bags, usually butter flavor, my daugthter told me about this and I tried it and now im completely addicted to the ranch flavor onmy popcorn! and eat popcorn regularly so I ordered a case of it and when its gone ill order another case :) haven't tried some of the other flavors yet but the bacon sounds interesting.

I decided to do a taste test with the product I had on hand and open--Miracle Whip dressing, which is what I usually use unless there's a good sale on regular mayo.  I tasted the Miracle Whip first; it's definitely sweet--not surprising when you look at the ingredients.  Then I tasted Hellmann's mayonnaise dressing with olive oil.  It's not as sweet, and it has a subtle flavor I like.  Another family member said that she preferred the Hellmann's.  I liked them both and couldn't choose one over the other.I see that the first two main ingredients are the same in both products; the third main ingredient in Hellmann's is the olive oil.  I think it has more eggs too.  Miracle Whip says that it has half the fat and calories of regular mayonnaise; I didn't know that, though I've always wondered what the difference is between it and regular mayo.Btw, what is the difference between mayonnaise and mayonnaise dressing?  On checking the pantry, I see that I have a bottle of Hellmann's Real Mayonnaise.
This gentle guarana tea doesn't make you 'up' like coffee...it just removes the tired so you're normal.I love it and will keep some in the house always.  A+
summary: This works very well, and is very reasonable.  AAA+++

reviewText: This is the only brand of guayusa I've tried but it is very good, I'd especially recommend it to anyone who drinks yerba mate but really to anyone who loves tea. Tastes somewhat similar to yerba mate but brighter and sweeter, tastes great pure and unsweetened, however it goes well with sugar or honey or in blends too.
Chocolate Dip is great to drizzle over low carb ice cream or yogurt.  A nice treat without guilt of too many calories or carbs.

I am currently deployed and was looking for something different from the food provided at the chow hall.  This was an excellent choice!  Easy to make (add boiling water, wait 5-8 minutes), healthy and it tastes great!  At home this would be perfect for those days that you can't get away from your desk but, need lunch.
Yes this is organic, but without any lemon or any sweetener,so it's pretty plain, not quite mouth-watering.

This is actually a pretty decent snack. The crackers are multigrain and tasty and the cheese is that powdery yellow cheese that you expect in a ritz cracker snack. It's good stuff, but obviously not the most healthy choice. And that's where I have to take points away. I think that the earthy-colored packaging and the multigrain label make this snack look a little more healthy than it actually is, which might lead people to think they're making a healthy choice when really they're eating the same processed cheese cracker snack they would have otherwise. Still, it's a good size cracker and easy to carry around and share if you're at work or somewhere that you need a quick snack.
summary: tasty but the package is a bit misleading

reviewText: I bought these for just under $15 a few months ago.  They are now over $32.  This is for 8 bowls of macaroni and cheese!  DO NOT BUY AT THIS PRICE.

Before I even opened the box I could smell the cinnamony goodness.  My first taste was milk-less (as an afternoon snack) and it was really good and VERY filling.  The cinnamon taste isn't too heavy or too light but was a good complement for the grains.  It was really very delicious.

This may just be more of a personal preference.  This soup is okay, but it's not great like some of the other Amy varieties I have tried.  It seems a bit watered down, but it is very low in calories (I think 150 or less for the whole can) so it would be great if you're trying to watch your weight and need to fill up more without consuming a lot of calories.

Love Tully's coffee... nearly all of it (those that we have tried anyways). It is on the expensive sideso we normally get other brands like Emeril's, etc but we would buy the Tully's more often if it werearound 50 cents per cup.

The typical ginger tea that we make at home is a milky chai tea made with black tea leaves and crushed fresh ginger. It's wonderful in the winter or to soothe a sore throat. This Numi tea does have a ginger flavor but it's pretty mellow and not too spiced up with cinnamon and cardamom although you can detect hints of those spices. This is a subtler ginger tea for those who just want a hint of ginger that's not too strong.It's pleasant to drink but I think with ginger it's better to have all or none as you don't get the benefits of ginger in such a mild tea. However, it still gets 3 starts as it's different from other teas out there and will definitely appeal to some folks.
summary: Nice flavor of ginger but it's a light tea.

reviewText: My father-in-law is a fisherman and loves fish. He really enjoyed this and we'll probably get him more. What else can you buy for a 87yr old?

It was ok but I am not a hot cocoa lover, I ordered it to see if I would enjoy it but not for me. If you like hot cocoa this is a good price and I was told by my sister that she enjoyed it when she came to visit.

I was pretty excited about these noodles: I'm a fan of brown rice and a fan of vermicelli, so I figured the combination would be pretty good. How wrong I was.
