Don't get me wrong, it was edible, but the noodles simply wouldn't soften enough no matter how long I kept them soaking in water. I made the recipe on the package, which calls for browning some garlic and pepper in oil and then mixing the noodles in for a minute or two. I won't lie - I was pretty disappointed with how it turned out. The consistency is tough and I wouldn't use these in a stir fry again. Perhaps they'd be better in soup, but probably not much better. If you're on a gluten-free diet I guess these are okay, but otherwise I'd stick with regular vermicelli.

The Pastariso Instant Brown Rice, Mac and Cheese Meal Cup is billed as a healthier alternative to, say, a major brand instant mac-n-cheese meal in a cup.The fill line inside the cup was a little hard to see.The cook time of 3 1/2 minutes on high made the meal really hot for at least ten minutes so be careful that you don't scald your tongue, etc.The taste was okay, not bad but not fabulous, about what you'd expect from a cup of instant mac-n-cheese.
summary: Heating instructions made it WAY hot...

reviewText: I love the Fiber One stuff and love Chocolate, so figured I'd also love these.  Well, not really.  They seem more like a dense cake than a brownie--so the texture isn't quite what I expected.  They also aren't as chocolaty as I would expect for something called a "brownie."  All in all, I'm a bit disappointed, but it's still a decent product if you want a quick, filling snack.  Perhaps if the name were something other than brownie I would have had different expectations and would have given it a full 5 stars.  It is NOT a brownie.

Bob's Red Mill Red Lentils, 27-Ounce Units (Pack of 4)I've enjoyed most of Bob Red Mill's products.  His products are guaranteed nutritious, high quality,and very healthy.  I'm a frequent buyer of his products, such as wheat gluten, lentils, whole wheat flour, etc...If you've never tried his products, you should try some and you'll discover that his products are true to his philosophy.Would definitely buy again and again.

Nutiva is a company based out of Sebastopol.... California. Their hemp seed is excellent for stir fries, salads, and their 13 ounce pouches last awhile. I've used their hemp seed as a substitute for sesame seed in stir fries inSimply in Season Expanded Edition (World Community Cookbook), as well as in the Mayan Wonder Bars and Rasta Pasta Primavera inVegan Fusion World Cuisine: Extraordinary Recipes & Timeless Wisdom from the Celebrated Blossoming Lotus Restaurants. It's versatile and has a subtle nutty flavor. They add extra protein. Nutritious and delicious!
This is an easy and tasty product....  it's a fast food however and all should be reminded of that.  I will buy again.

This is the same White Mocha product that Starbucks uses.  I put two or three pumps in a large coffee and then add milk to lighten. It is tasty and much more convenient than driving to Starbucks. The only complaint I have is that the pumps are huge and a bottle goes really fast.  I also wish nutrition information was included on the package.
summary: Make a reasonable facsimile to a Starbucks White Mocha at home

reviewText: I discovered this product years ago at a local asian market.  This is a miracle cure for an upset stomach, car sickness, seasickness, etc...My husband uses it when his IBS acts up.  When I go on a cruise, I bring one dose a day and I do not need to get the behind the ear tabs that I had used before.Before I found this, I would have to go get the ginger root, peel, slice, and steep to get a good tea for my stomachache, but this is tons more convenient.  Besides, who wants to do all that work when you are sick.The flavor is very strong so I found that I like it a little more watered down than it recommends but 1 or 2 "doses" when I am feeling queasy and it is gone.
summary: Best Cure for an Upset Tummy!

reviewText: OK I get it this is not Pad Thai in its expected sense since there isn't even any tamarind paste in it  and the sauce is well, not even a sauce in that it is more like a coating but it has lots of peanuts and other chewy tidbits that pick up on this new invented mimic of what Pad Thai looks and tastes like on another planet perhaps....in outer space it would be just  great.  And so for offices and quick stops this is the perfect fly a a way. I added some dark brown soy (not the healthy kind to pick up the flavor which it did and soon I am going to try some oyster sauce.  I also just bought some Maggi Authentic Indian Tamarina on amazon which is so ssoooo delicious and I will use that all by itself to spruce this up.

I'm not a big fan of super spicy instant soup, so I always lean towards non or less spicy soups. This one falls under the not spicy but tasty category. If you don't like spicy and is tired of the old cup o' noodles, give this a try.I used to order the Beef and Ginger flavored soup, that was very excellent (for instant soup standard), but a Amazon does not carry it anymore.

I love this curry paste - I use it whenever I have a tough white fish or even a flaky white fish I want to eat curry style. So easy to cook with. You literally add it to the pan and a little water and cook it with the fish. It smells incredible (good to me) - BUT - it is curry smell. My neighbors dont like when I cook curry fish - too bad for them. Basmati rice and Naan bread - some veggies - and you have the best dinner ever.
summary: Best Curry Fish Paste! I love it!

reviewText: Arrived quickly.  They were and still are very fresh and as good as ever.  Not cheap but no chocolate candies are.

I've not had these biscuits since I left England some eight years ago, and I'd forgotten how good they were, especially with some cheese!They also make a great base for desserts like cheesecake, in place of graham crackers.

I put them in yogurt but my husband eats them from the bag.  They are not very sweet but I didn't expect them to taste like chocolate.  It's hard to describe what they taste like.  You just need to try them.
And I have to stop!  I ate the whole box the last time and I didn't share at all!  That's pretty scary.  These things are tooooo good!
summary: I ordered these once - and then twice

reviewText: I love cookies and sometimes I want a cookie that is not too sweet. This biscuit or in the USA a cookie is very flavorful, and slightly sweet.  If you are a tea drinker these biscuits are perfect. If you need something a little sweeter with your tea or just a glass of milk, they also come with milk or dark chocolate coating on top.The only problem, if you call it a problem, they are as addictive as popcorn. I've opened a packet of McVitie's biscuits to get out a couple and end up eating half the pack.You will not find anything made in the USA that tastes like these cookies. The closest you can get would be Graham Crackers, but it would only be close.
I think the popcorn tastes great.  I reminds me when we didn't have microwaves and had to pop it on the stove.  A definite plus is that it has fewer hulls than other brands.

These Candy Bars arrived more than a week early which is great for my sweet tooth. They were fresh and exactly as described by the seller. I highly recommend them as some I purchased from other sellers were not as fresh.

I have always enjoyed Planters nuts.Like John, I live in a wooded area,the hills of WV.I also feed animals: squirrels, birds,rabbits, foxes, coons, ground squirrels,stray cats & dogs, deer, occasionally, aneighbors horse gets loose, & only God knowswhat else is lurking in those woods.I teach my children to take care of animals.They have a purpose just as humans do.I also teach them that if a stray cat or dogcomes around, it is our responsibility to takecare of it.We are the only ones on this hill that will.Everyone else runs them off, throws things at them,shoots BB's or bullets at them. Besides, I live at the top.By the time they get here, they are in bad shape, sometimes wounded.I could never sit in my house & eat knowing astarving animal was right outside.I have given the squirrels nuts before.Deer bring their little ones around to showthem where the food is. They of course hidein the woods nearby. One time, a baby deer wasalone at the usual food spot, there wasn't any corn.He kept looking up at the house.I searched for something to give him. I found something.However, I came too close to him & he ran away. Later, Irealized that was stupid since I knew the mother was close.I was surprised she didn't come after me.A fox family was living here when I moved in.The fox was very brave, walking around my yardin daylight. I figured there was a pregnant fox.I was right. They left after the babies were bigenough to walk a distance. However, the babies cameback about a year later. I taught them thathumans could see them in the dark with a flashlight.I knew they were going up higher in the mountains &I knew hunters would be there. I also know that foxare not used for food, but as a trophy. I didn't thinkthey should give their life to hang on a wall.So, if John is crazy, so am I. Maybe even more so.

If you don't like ginger then don't pick up a ginger drink, but if you like ginger then I do suggest Gold Kili All Natural Instant Ginger & Lemon Beverage. It has a very intense ginger taste to it, much stronger ginger flavor then I was expecting and a very very mellow lemon flavor that is so mellow because the ginger just takes everything over.The smell of the drink when you first open the package it ginger overload, to me smelled like a gingerbread cookie with some lemon on top. Getting your drink just right is very easy, just open and pour your contents into a cup and add your choice of water and stir. Easy as 1 2 3 and your done. No need to sweeten your drink as it is already sweet with honey already inside.Can be served two different ways: hot & cold but I have to say I would prefer the hot way as it is very soothing to drink. Ginger is a wonderful way to settle your upset stomach and the fact that this drink mix is caffeine free is another bonus for that means I can drink it at any time and not have to worry about it keeping me up at night.If you like ginger check it out, for as a fan of ginger drinks/teas I have to say this has to be one of the better ones that I have tried.

It could be me. When you hit middle age all sorts of strange things start to happen...lol! But, the taste just isn't as strong / flavorful as the first batch I bought about 2 1/2 years ago. If they changed the type / amount of tea or spices used in the recipe, then it's not my imagination. If they did (and we will likely never know), then I'm not crazy. OK, I am, but the change in flavor is the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars.I used to love it; now I like it a real lot.This tea *is* yummy and usually works better for me than "Smooth Move."The next part of the review may be TMI (Too Much Information) for some. You can stop reading now if you're uncomfortable talking about constipation. :-) I know many people (mostly woman) who have been dealing with this issue for years. Many things affect your digestion system: Diet, exercise, stress, medication, the amount of water you drink, etc.Here are my tips / advice. (I am not a medical doctor, nurse practitioner or even a Phd. If you are experiencing more than occasional constipation, you need to see a doctor.)Don't drink this tea all the time. It's like taking any laxative too often; it will stop being effective. Also, be sure to drink at least a glass of water after you finish the tea. More if you can.. I will sometimes drink half the tea and then let it sit overnight (covered) with the tea bag in it and finish the rest in the morning. If I'm especially "stuffed up" I'll use two tea bags.I use one Splenda packet to sweeten it. It's pretty sweet on its own; you may not need to add anything. Or a bit of honey is nice.The active ingredient is the herb "senna." Just because it's not a prescription medication, doesn't mean it's not powerful. In fact, there are prescription laxative medications that are based on senna.The first time you use the tea, I highly recommend trying it in the morning when you can spend the day relaxing and near a bathroom. Nothing worse  than finding out in the middle of a date that this tea really works for you! (I'm lucky; my man of 16 years is so used to me and my "issues" I don't have to be embarrassed.)Eveyone's system is different. There are many factors that impact its effectiveness as a laxative. Don't be discouraged if it doesn't work the first time or right away. It's a trial and error process. For me, drinking half of it before bed and the other half upon waking (with the tea bag(s) still in it) often works by mid-morning.I microwave a 16 or 20 ounce mug of water for 3 1/2 minutes. Then, dump the bag(s) and the sweetener, if using, in the boiled water. Cover it with a plate and let it sit until it's cool enough to drink (about 10 minutes).Even if it works, it's a good idea to clean yourself out completely every 1-3 months. Use "Medline 1 EA/EA ENEMA BAG, W/SLIDE CLAMP, POLYBAG"  (B0016LG9KMCheap and sanitary. I've stopped buying the red rubber kits. If you use them, fill with very hot water and a teaspoon of bleach. Slosh it around, let it sit until cool, then rinse with hot water, allowing it to run through the tubing. Hang to dry before storing.Here is a great article on how to give yourself an enema (I've been doing this for years and I learned something new from it): [...]I get that this stuff is kind of embarrassing and no one wants to talk about it. Please try to get past it because it's important to your health. Hope this information was helpful.Would love to know what works / doesn't work for others. You can leave a comment here. Thanks!
summary: Not as flavorful as the last batch I bought...but still yummy!

reviewText: Peanuts are a great snack, wonderful in soups, salads, stir-fry, main dishes, with meat or just about anything one can imagine.  This is a great value and it isn't sweetened up with toffee, honey or any other product.  They're a great price and no meat products were used in their processing (including gelatin).  They are salted, but that's how I like them anyway.
This is very high quality olive oil for the price.  Nice flavor and color.
This product was well packaged and arrived undamaged and in a timely manner. The item was freash. Makes good pasta dishes and just the right size to use for soups.

This Barilla Ditalini pasta will make just about any regular bowl of soup better. The pasta is small and firm with excellent flavor. It cooks up in nine minutes and stands up to a bowl of soup for a long time.
This had a good taste and was smooth to drink, I will purchase this again in the future arrived on time

I found this product by accident, but I'm glad I did! I used to drink Switch or Izzy when I had craving for soda, but this tastes better, less sweet, and cheaper than Switch or Izzy! Very refreshing taste doesn't thirst you after drinking it. Totally recommend for who are not used to drink to high fructose corn syrup, which provides intense sweetness that many people addicted to so they won't think this is sweet enough. Thanks Amazon, for offering real "Italian soda"!
summary: Tastes better and cheaper than Izzy or Switch!

reviewText: These are great in many ways. I love the size, texture, chewiness, lack of heavy oil, etc. They are VERY smokey. Which is not bad....just means you can take maybe one bite in a very long time.I would be thrilled if there was a version of the exact same size, etc that was "smokey" and not "Extra smokey". I have yet to find such a thing. Tried some other kids by the maker, but they were less dense, less chewy, smaller, etc.Considering a re-order.
summary: Ultra Smokey...not in a bad way

reviewText: I have been working to eliminate sugar from my diet.  It is next to impossible to find a BBQ sauce without sugar.  I tried the Walden Farms version, but wasn't very impressed with the flavor.  I wasn't sure about the Paula Deen brand, since I am from Texas and our sauce flavors can be different from other states.  I really like this sauce.  I will quit trying to find one and stick with this.  It is a sweet sauce, so if you like a tangier one, you may be disappointed.  There are 10 calories per serving, which is 2 tablespoons.  I browned 2 chicken thighs and put 2 T of sauce on the cooked thighs and heated through.  It was the perfect amount.
summary: Hard to believe there is no sugar in it.

reviewText: A delicious tea that has lost it's appeal : 4 tea-bags are crammed  in one  little foil envelope. They are stained by whatever aromatic oils the manifacturer used and look unattractive. If you are the only one in the family that likes this tea ,you use one tea-bag per cup.The rest are left in a little bag to become stale and to loose it's flavor.I got 6 boxes.40 tea-bags in each ...I will never again buy this from Amazon or from this merchant. I would rather buy it in the store.The price is the same.

I have been gluten-free for years, and I love to try new items. However, I refuse to purchase products that do not meet my high expectations... more than once! And since my first box of Glutino, I refuse to purchase other brands.
summary: Glutino crackers are always my favorite

reviewText: With the polar vortex and below zero temperatures this year, a cup of this chocolate tea with some milk and a little sugar is the perfect accompaniment to a couple of cookies.  Usually, the hubs and I would make a hot chocolate or a coffee, but this tea's mild chocolate flavor pairs wonderfully with cookies, without overpowering the sweetness of the cookies.  Bonus - less calorie guilt than a hot chocolate.
summary: perfect for chasing the chills away

reviewText: This is probably my favorite decaf Kcup. I like to switch flavors sometimes but always find myself ordering this one the most

I happen to like this particular assortment of coffee flavors. Different people like different flavors, though. This is a nice assortment with good, strong flavor from each one. I use these pods in my Keureg k-cup machine because they are so much cheaper than the k-cups coffee.

First off, let me say bravo for a vanilla coffee that isn't French vanilla.  For a while I thought that was the only vanilla that could be used in coffee.  Second, I prefer Starbucks over most brands simply because it has a bold, strong coffee taste.  Essentially, it tastes like coffee.  It never tastes watered down or over flavored.  The same can be said about their new Natural Fusions ground Coffee.  Now don't get me wrong, it's great coffee, but "natural fusion" doesn't seem to make the coffee taste any different or better.  I never understood how a label such as that, or organic, or all natural, is supposed to give the impression that the coffee is better than the, I guess, regular version of the product.  This is good coffee, I could care about it's marketing label.
summary: Throw a fancy name on coffee and it's still just coffee

reviewText: This is okay, but probably not the best curry powder ever. But it gets the job done if you don't demand authentic stuff.
summary: it's ok. gets the job done if you're not serious about authentic curry powder dishes.

reviewText: This coffee is good. It was my favorite flavor. This coffee smells are really good. I recommanded for it.

I really enjoyed this coffee! There was a flavor in there to please everyone. Some of them (although this may vary by box) were hazelnut, vanilla, caramel, fudge, dark roast, and light roast. The coffee when brewed at the 8oz. amount for the flavored coffees was the perfect strength for me. The dark roast could be brewed at 10 oz. as well and retain its smoothness. I would definitely buy this box of coffee again!

You really can't go wrong with all of the Barilla products - they always cook right and you don't end up with mush.I used the Ditalini for a slow cook chicken noodle soup (in lieu of rice or flat noodles) and loved it.  They retained a nice texture throughout the cooking process and even the next day as leftovers.  It really is worth paying a bit more over the bargain brands for Barilla.

These crisps are light and crisp with a slight corn taste, not as much as corn chips, but recognizable.  They make a great addition to any gluten-free pantry since they will be good served with many spreads, etc.  I will keep a supply.

Read the packaging for these sardines and you can't help but feel you're saving Mother Earth as you chomp on your sandwich. But digging down beneath the surface, there's not so much to be excited about. Unless of course BPA free packaging is your primary purchase criterion. If so, buy em now and don't read any further.If not there are some issues to be aware of...I understand that Wild Planet is the brand. But what about the "wild" sardines? I'm not aware that the sardine has been domesticated, and the lowly pilchards that swarm the seas in massive schools sometimes visible from outer space are not amenable to aquaculture.On the other hand, qualifying these sardines as wild, notwithstanding the fact that there's no other kind, does confer a seemingly significant though clearly misplaced credibility. No doubt this will boost sales to a gullible buying public.Then there's the matter of what happens to these fish after they're "sustainably caught along the California coast". The small print provides a clue in that these bad boys are "processed in Viet Nam". So what's really going on is that our diminutive sardines take on a heavy carbon footprint, travelling as they do from the west coast to the far east and back again, presumably to harvest the otherwise mutually exclusive benefits of buy-local chic and low labor costs. Nonetheless, we read that, "These sardines are considered a `Best Choice for Sustainability' by a consensus of environmental organizations".There are other issues as well.The health benefits of chowing down on this product are highly touted. For instance, "Ounce for ounce, Wild Planet sardines provide 3 times more calcium and phosphorus than milk...". OK, fair enough. But is this, as implied, unique to the Wild Planet variety only, or is it once again a characteristic of all sardines? Unfortunately, it's the latter.We also learn that these "delicious meaty portions" are "cleaned and scaled". Buyer beware: this is quite different from "skinless and boneless". "Cleaned" in this context must mean something other that what is commonly expected by the use of this word in conjunction with fish. Be prepared to either eat the vertebral column and various entrails, or to remove (clean) them yourself.How do they taste?Not bad, if you're into schmaltz herring. The lemon juice in which they're packed adds a bit of zip, but these babies are smoked and have a characteristic smoky, salty taste.But don't worry. It's not just any smoke, but "aqueous natural smoke" that they're treated with...
summary: Eat a Sandwich; Save the Planet

reviewText: I find these sardines better tasting than most, including those from some health foods stores (Whole Foods included).  I thought I had reviewed these sardines before, and there, I was concerned about the travel time from harvest to processing, and why they are called "wild caught," when all sardines are generally caught in the wild.  I've found nowhere where sardines are farm-raised.

I am a complete novice about ginger tea and ginger beer (didn't even know there were such things until I read a review of this product).  I was most surprised when first drinking this beverage mix, added to hot water, at the strength of the flavor and the bite it leaves on the tongue.  There is nothing tepid about it.  However, if the drink is too strong for your taste, it can be weakened, but still taste good, by putting it on ice.The flavor of the honey and lemon is easily distinguishable.  So you have to be a lover of ginger in liquid form to really appreciate this instant drink.  I like the fact there are no bags, it's easy to prepare.  You just pour.It's really up to one's individual taste as to whether or not this drink will be appealing.  As for myself, I think I might drink it as a remedy for indigestion (rather than over-the-counter pharmacy remedies); however, for pleasure, I would choose something else.

I do enjoy the strong, earthy flavor of this product. The spice adds a nice subtle touch, and this tea seems to give me a little stronger kick than most teas, but less than coffee, just like other teas that I have tried from this company. (It is supposedly higher in caffeine than most teas.)So...if you tend to like teas with a strong flavor...I say give this product a try.
summary: If you like strong teas...this is a product for you.

reviewText: The back of the bag tells you to use two tablespoons or coffee for every 6 ounces of water when brewing this coffee. I did that, and the vanilla taste was very weak. This is strange, because my ground floor smelled strongly of vanilla after brewing, but you would not have known that from tasting the coffee itself.Since I had a week to use it after opening, I made it again and again each morning. With each passing day, the coffee would taste worse. Just the other day, I made some for a road-trip to the in-laws. My wife took a sip and said "oh, that's bad," and never touched it again. Yep, there was something about this coffee that just did not jive. At all. I'm sorry Starbucks, I have nothing against you, this coffee was just a big disappointment.

I really liked most of these K-cups.  I am a dark roast fan, so those were by far my favorites.  There was a good selection of different types of coffee.  The flavored cups aren't really my thing, but my son loved them.  You can't go wrong here if you have people with different preferences.Pleasantly surprised at the rich deep flavor of these.  They definitely rival the more expensive coffees.
They are a great snack .  Come in handy when traveling and need a  little something to munch on.  Nice and crisp not to salty and GLUTEN FREE .

With two kids, I am a fan of the slow cooker - being able to easily provide a meal made of whole ingredients without spending a ton of time in the kitchen. However, I was never a fan of leaving something hot running all day. Not to mention I usually over cooked the food. With the Wonderbag, I did my usual prep, brought it to a boil on my stove top and popped into the Wonderbag to cook for the day. The result - perfectly cooked meals!

Very good tasting slightly infused coffee with real vanilla. This is very good for those who drink black coffee or even those who take regular non-sweetened creamer. Also, try the caramel one too, as that is tasty as well.
summary: Especially good for those who like their coffee black

reviewText: only drawback to this is the flavor could be stronger.  it tastes delicious and is good to combine with other flavors.

I like samplers because they give you a chance to try different flavors without committing to a whole box. This one includes the following six flavors:  carrot curry, beet cabbage, spinach chive, fennel spice, tomato mint, and broccoli cilantro.  I can't say I was crazy about any of them as a tea or broth. They weren't bad, somewhat subtle with herbal and vegetal notes. As I am fond of curry, the carrot was my favorite. They are best served as a broth, preceding lunch or dinner. The savory taste was not especially pleasant after dinner.  However, they do work well as poaching or cooking liquid. They impart a depth of flavor, especially to fish, that is enjoyable. 3.5 stars

Recipe: soak 5-6 dates overnight.  use dates, 1/4 cup of Caca and some small pieces of frozen banana with AVOCADO ... yes, you heard it right.  Avocado is usually used when making chocolate mouse in the Raw World of Food.  I mix it all up in a food processor and then place it in ice cube trays.When I crave a chocolate treat ... I take some frozen bananas and a couple of chocolate cubes and pop in my blender with a little seed milk [you can find recipe on you tube]. YUM!!
summary: It fills the bill when craving chocolate

reviewText: Love this tea.  I start off each morning with a hot cup of Pu-Erh and then have another cup with breakfast.  All it needs is a packet of Spenda, but I also brew it with a sprig of fresh mint.  Delicious!!

I love the stevia dark chocolate in my smoothies and now they have this new water flavoring in 3 yummy flavors (Raspberry is my favorite) that really rock! I buy these water enhancers to add to bottled water because the fruity flavors helps me drink more. Other water flavorings I tried were just to weak for me and so expensive for the amount it made. I only use about 10 drops to a 12 oz. water bottle. I like it pretty strong. Sugar free. No artificial colors or sweeteners....just stevia. I won't buy anything else because this tastes great and is really concentrated as described. Good stuff!
This product is wholesome so i do not feel so quilty in making my husband and i waffles. It is also easy to mix up. Very convenient.
summary: makes me not feel so quilty

reviewText: Okay, so the idea of this is fantastic. The flavour is pretty good (the ingredients list is pretty short).But it's impossible to spread the stuff. It came to me as if it had frozen stiff lying sideways and it's never changed position even with being inside the house. I've tried toasting my bread to see if heat would help with spreading and it didn't help a bit.Basically what it seems to boil down to is I might have to end up eating this off a spoon straight out of the jar, because it clearly has no intention of ever being spreadable.

i bought this mix, not due to gluten intolerance, but because i was extremely curious when i kept seeing Pamela's in the bestselling list for Amazon groceries.  I thought, what flour could be such a best seller at such a (relatively) high price?  I now understand better that this flour contains some expensive ingredients (almond flour), and items that would be somewhat inconvenient to assemble and mix at home.  anyway, i bought a 3 pack to try it out, when i recently went on a waffle-making spree. well, i have to say, just trying the recipe on the Pamela's bag had me quite impressed.  I added cornmeal, and it was even better (i like crunchy cornmeal waffles). because i don't have celiacs, i ended up with a recipe combination using wheat flour as well, and the result has been tremendous.  Pamela's is a fantastic product, and the taste is marvelous- sweet, nutty, textured.  i have not tried it for anything else but 50 or so different waffle recipe experiements, but i am so pleased with the results, that i will always order Pamela's to use as a component in my waffles.  like i said earlier, though, the Pamela's waffle recipe right on their bag is quite delicious by itself!  thank you Pamela's.  if i were gluten-intolerant, i think this product would save me.
summary: great for those without celiac disease as well

reviewText: These flavors are definitely interesting.  Beets and Cabbage, Tomato Mint, Fennel, Carrot Curry...all of them very interesting.  Some are better than others.  The Carrot Curry was my favorite while my daughter enjoyed the mint with tomato.  Obviously, this is one you'll have to try for yourself.  This sample package is a great way to figure out which you'll enjoy and those notsomuch.I tried these in the summer in Florida.  While I enjoyed most of the flavors, all I could imagine was that these would be excellent on a cool or cold winter's night.  Or maybe as a soothing hot drink for someone suffering from a cold or flu.  The flavors are surprising and "savory" is a good description.Try this sampler and pick your favorites.
Once you learn how to cook it, you crave it.  It is so fortifying and satisfying that it can be eaten by itself and you are good to go!!!

This Aloe Juice is a very nice refreshing treat. I've had horrible acid reflux through my pregnancy and was hoping this would help naturally. I also read up online that this may help with my 2 year olds tummy issues.  While the taste is nice and refreshing, be advised that the batch I recieved does have VISIBLE pulp in it, and many of the pieces are large (they are soft but you are going to feel the urge to chew them while drinking if that makes sense).  Part of me thinks this adds to the "from nature" aspect of the beverage. I personally dont mind it at all, my husband found it strange but liked the taste anyway.Overall 5 stars since the beverage is quite tastey.  Waiting to see if it has any noticible impact on the acid reflux.  Would recommend and would buy again. (also agree with other reviews that you can probably find this CHEAPER if its local- i am on the north east coast and dont see the aloe drinks often unless in a health food store.  Also you cant beat prime shipping...
summary: Love the taste- be advised of PULP

reviewText: I thought I'd like this- but blech!It seemed harder to spread and tasted like fake sugarPlus it was overly rich.and I found the raspberry and peanutbutter to be a weird combo.No thanks!

I was expecting more a berry flavor but got very little of the berry flavor.  The chocolate was very good though and I could slightly make out the berry flavor so overall it was okay but I won't spend this much on this product again.

Tea has never thrilled me , and I often tire of coffee and soft drinks. So I am always eager to sample "alternative" liquid refreshment. The ginger ingredient was clearly evident , but not overbearing. An excellent balance of lemon and other flavors. Looking forward to my next cup.
These are good. They are a bit chewy and sticky but nice replacement meal bar if on the go. Contain high quality ingredients in them.

I was looking for something to help with severely dry skin and came across a website that talks about the medicinal uses of coconut oil.  I ordered this product because its organic virgin cold pressed.  This is supposedly the best to get.  It smells and tastes like coconut milk.  The coconut oil is so like, that when it melts in your mouth it feels like water and has no oily feel. I read that taking a few tablespoons of this oil will help with many conditions like digestion, chrons disease, eczema, joint pain, etc.  It truly is a miracle food. I've been very pleased with this brand.  The quality is very high.

Barley Malt powder is super healthy, since the sugars are largely Maltose, which do not produce a sharp sugar spike for diabetics.  I have tried just about every one available, and Barry Farms makes the best one of all.  The Barry Farms barley malt powder is sweeter tasting than most others and quick dissolving in milk.  I use it with straight cocoa powder and milk in a blender to make a tasty chocolate malted breakfast drink.  Two tablespoons of this only has 3 grams of sugar.  This is one great tasting health food.
My son loves them!  Moist with good flavor as well. This variety allowed my son to have a choice of what flavor he was in the mood for that day.

These are dreadfully expensive at the store, but bearable here on Amazon. Dice them in salads, they are divine sliced on a turkey sandwich or topped with cous cous.  I haven't done it yet, but I'm going to top them with crab salad and I bet they will be great cold or browned under the broiler. Release your inner creative chef with these!

This is a classic example of a food not equaling the sum of its parts. While not "terrible" by any stretch of the imagination, invariably I found the Razzle Dazzle to be a letdown.The raspberry in the peanut butter is swirled in, similar to when you see the peanut butter/jelly combo in the same jar. For as much as there seems to be mixed in, the taste is very light and is drowned out by the peanut butter and the cocoa butter drops. The chocolate and honey also do not come on very strong as you chew. I was not a big fan of the aftertaste, in which the honey was more noticeable but also made me want to gulp down a drink.Spreading the Razzle Dazzle is a chore. With all the lumps it's nigh-impossible to smooth out, and frequently it tore the potato bread slices I was putting it on. I think pumpernickel or rye bread would be able to stand up to it, by breads with the consistency of white bread won't.

This mix from Bob's Red Mill makes pancakes that are just almost cornmeal muffins in a different shape.  I'm tempted to eat them with red beans and ham....But they are good.  My next try with them will include kernel corn and diced peppers, and some shredded cheese.

I'm a fan of a different, popular chocolate but decided to try this one... So glad I did..When I tried Lindt Chocolate Lindor Truffles (white chocolate) my eyes went wide... Lindor Truffles Stracciatella Chocolate is sweet and creamy. I love the way the taste stays on my tongue; it makes me want another one...This is the perfect gift for someone who adores chocolate.

Excellent true vanilla coffee. Pretty much has D&D beat as well as other brands. Nice smooth consistant flavor. Had to add a tad more to the coffee pot to achieve the flavor but overall a great product.

There is no question about the fact that I absolutely love a rich and full-body flavored cup of coffee. The aroma can always get to me through a single whiff for me to enjoy. But when it does come to the best, you really expect to the best company to have the best flavor. That does come mostly well with Starbucks, and their brand of Natural Fusions Vanilla flavored coffee. The taste does fell delightful, but honestly I was hoping from the smell that there could've been a lot more vanilla flavored into the coffee, making more savory cup deliver the best vanilla you could ask for. While it isn't a bad cup from Starbucks at all, I have definitely tasted better from brands like Melitta and Folgers. Still, I wish I could've gotten more Starbucks than my money had shown for it.Price: C+Taste: B-Overall: C+

Smells great... too bad it didn't taste good too. I tasted no vanilla, and the coffee itself was very bitter for a medium roast. I wouldn't buy this product myself as I like to have FLAVOR in my flavored coffee and I don't think this had any. Overall, it was a disappointment.
This kind of product I have gotten in the store before. Its OK, it just doesnt have the same taste as good old fashioned uncooked bacon

Coconut oil is magical.  I keep one tub in the kitchen and use it for cooking pretty much everything.  And I keep another tub in the shower to rub on my skin during the winter.  This brand is the best I have found, and I find this size of tub to be the easiest to use.
i ordered this for my husband who is a truck driver.he loves the taste and quality of this,easy,quick,for lunch,or whenever.will buy again.
What can I say - this is the best dark French Roast to be had...  The whole beans stay fresh longer - I drink it every day...

reviewerName: Vanessa Gilfoy "Uncover darker realms of roma...
reviewText: It's finely ground.  Mixed with other gluten free flours and with a teaspoon of unflavored gelatin and a teaspoon of xanthan gum, this makes a great bread flour.  Muffins made with this brown rice flour and millet and sorghum flours are to die for.  My waffle batter also rises better when I use this brown rice flour in the flour mixture.The price here is great.  I always keep a box of this in freezer and take out a bag a day before I bake bread.
summary: Makes for fluffy breads and tender muffins

reviewText: I hate running out of pasta when I want to make a salad. I do it all the time. I figured this would help a bit. It did and does. It says "short cuts" but I don't see any yet. It's good, full elbows of macaroni. Cooks up great and although 12 pounds may sound like a lot, it saves me from running to the store.Great stuff. Thanks Amazon.DaVinci Pasta Short Cuts, Elbow Macaroni, 16 Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)

The idea of vanilla-flavored coffee sounded intriguing, and since Starbucks is relatively new at this I figured I'd give this blend a whirl.Bottom line:  If you like vanilla in your coffee, this blend is a treat.  It's typical Starbucks coffee with a very mild (not overpowering) vanilla flavor infused.  It seems to be not as artificial tasting as some varieties I've purchased at the grocery store.  The brewing aroma is lovely and the grind worked great with our flat-bottomed metal filter.  Add a little milk and a little sugar and you've got yourself a cup of coffee candy.This makes for a fantastic dessert coffee, but it's a very pleasant day-brightener as well!

This is a most unusual set of teas. They are... vegetable flavored. I tried the broccoli cilantro and while it smelled delicious - I couldn't finish it. On the other hand, my daughter tried and loved the tomato mint. So, just goes to show people have different tastes.

reviewerName: N. Ferguson "Two, Daisy, Hannah, and Kitten"
reviewText: I add this to pea soup-- two teaspoons richly flavors a whole small pot of soup.  Just don't overdo it-- if you go crazy with this stuff you will end up with an overly salty soup (it is a country ham-type flavor, so salty).  It moderate amounts it is perfect!

Perhaps Gold Kili Ginger & Lemon beverage mix is better suited to a true, traditional Asian palate, as ginger is a very popular spice in many Asian dishes. I, myself, happen to be a BIG fan of ginger. I enjoy eating pieces of candied and crystallized ginger on a regular basis both for its breath-freshening properties, as well as to make my mouth sweeter (and more kissable!), and to soothe my stomach. My favorite granola is one from Trader Joe's that contains slivers of candied ginger. Ginger is just something that I miss when I go for too long without it. On that note, this drink DOES have an initial potent kick of ginger, at first sip, but the flavor after that first sip seems to be pretty weak and ambiguous. Is this supposed to be kinda like the ginger beer that I grew up seeing my mom enjoy on a regular basis? Is it supposed to be similar to a ginger ale, but with a little (well-nigh undetectable, and synthetic-tasting) lemon to punch it up? I really wasn't quite sure.The drink isn't sweet enough to really count as a soft drink, and overall, aside from a drink with a bit of punch and somewhat waning - or at least perhaps slightly old-tasting - ginger kick, I couldn't quite figure out what Gold Kili was trying to present here.I had my pouch cold, as I'm most likely to drink most of my beverages that way. Not sure if it would've been better hot, but I just wasn't a fan of this. Potent ginger flavor, odd, almost absent lemon flavor, not sweet enough, and I feel that I should be able to enjoy a product straight out of the package, as it's sold. If I have to do a bunch of gussying up of it in order to make it palatable, it needs some tweaking before going out on the store shelves, at least as far as I'm concerned...
summary: I am a BIG fan of ginger, but I'm not quite sure what, exactly, to make of this drink mix!

reviewText: Like most other posters ahead of me, I was struck by just how much ginger there was to taste in this product. After making the drink, the smell was overwhelming but not horrible. The taste wasn't all that pleasant, with the ginger masking the lemon taste. I could detect the lemon when I was making it in the aroma, but none in the taste.I can imagine using this when I am sick, to open my sinuses or help clear my nose and head. But as an everyday drink, no way.

This is a great combo pack, providing enough variety for a fun time in the kitchen twice or thrice a month. I modify each one depending on a whim or inspiration... or what's in the fridge. The biryani are often a bit too much for guests, but that's easily tamed with a good yogurt served on the side or mixed in. I almost never use as much butter or oil as recommended. Not having to worry about clashing with tradition, I *always* add an assortment of *usual suspects* such as potatoes, rice, roasted peppers, onion, garlic, lemon, green beans, squash... endless possibilities. With a bit of experience, K of I pastes are a great resource to add some adventure and fun to any culinary arsenal.

I tend to like chai teas, and knowing that this was cardamom was enough to twist my arm and convince me to buy it.When brewed, this tea has a beautiful color. In an age of so many green teas, it's great to have a truly red-brown cup of tea. This tea is dark when steeped for about 3-4 minutes. It's also very rich and full of flavor. It has a strong bouquet -- slightly bitter -- and I think this lends itself to a bit of bitterness I taste on my palette. I use a bit of natural sweetener to cut through this bitterness.Being a pu-erh tea, this tea has a higher caffeine content than other teas, but it doesn't make me jittery.This is also a very "green" product -- the tea is organic, the cardamom is organic, the outer packaging is made from 72% recycled content, and the tea bag is biodegradable.  Even the box is printed with soy ink. All of this scores very highly with me.This tea has become one of my favorite mid-afternoon pick-me-ups.
summary: Really good tea, just a bit bitter

reviewText: So to give up a soda addiction, I've recently switched to teas. I'm not really a big tea fan, but having tried a few Tazo teas with just a bit of honey or sugar added I was growing to somewhat like it. When I saw this Lipton tea had a coupon, I decided to go for it, since I like Green Tea anyways.Well, this is just disappointing. First, the packets contain a very very small amount of leaves, as in around 1/8 of the bag was filled with leaves. Second, they don't really have any smell, and even just making a small (around 7oz) cup with two bags still barely had any flavor. And worse, the flavor that was there was kinda disgusting. I tasted like a hint of minty-like flavor with some bitter...I don't know, trash-water flavor? I mean seriously, it was just gross. I've tried it on multiple occassions, and my wife who likes tea a lot more than me commented on how flavorless it was.Will not be buying Lipton again if this is what they've become; Tazo may be overpriced but I've never had an experience with them like I have with this tea.This is one of the very few one-stars I've ever given, but I really feel this deserves it. It's cheap, but even for cheap it's still not worth it.***Update 8/27/13***So we decided to tryYogi Green Tea Rejuvenation, Herbal Tea Supplement, 16-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6), and while it is a little more expensive, each individual bag had more than double the filling of tea leaves, in fact closer to triple the amount, meaning only one bag is actually needed for a normal sized cup. Plus, it tastes much much better. We contacted Lipton about this flavor, and never received a response, I guess they're OK with trash-flavored tea with their name on it. We won't be trying Lipton products after this fiasco, this stuff just gives me nightmares thinking about, it really was that bad.
It is a classic and Campbells delivers on this wonderfully for the price. It's creamy with plenty of calms and nice balance of potatoes.  Be sure to split it because it is a HUGE can of clam chowder.
Was a great item to have for a quick lunch. Put in microwave and eat. Good value and taste. Have it on subscribe and save for reorder.

This is by far the best tasting and best smelling coconut oil I've ever purchased. In fact, this will be the bar from which I will now judge all other coconut oils. After using it for cooking several times, I decided to try a tablespoon in a chocolate protein powder smoothy. With just the protein power, coconut oil, milk and ice and no other ingredients it ended up tasting like an Almond Joy / Mounds bar. Yummm.The size of the tub is perfect - very easy to scoop from. I like that it comes in a two-pack rather than one large container. When I start on the second jar, I will place another order. I never want to be without this brand of coconut oil!
I love this but I found the same kind and size in the local store at half the price. It's great stuff!

I love Lindt Truffles!  Actually, I don't know anyone who doesn't like them.  They are such a nice treat.  Quite addictive!  I especially like the dark chocolate, but they also come in milk chocolate, if you prefer them.  There are 60 in this bag.  I often buy a bag to split up into little favors or stocking stuffers.  Delicious!
This oil smell so good and melt very fast.  The price was great.  I love popcorn and using this oil makes it taste even better.
summary: Popcorn taste so much better with this

reviewText: I like it a lot, it's a nice alternative to rice. The only issue I can see with it is that it takes ~60 minutes to cook it.
Excellent!  This is such a healthy alternative to butter. Love it.  I love it for a body cream as well.  I don't like to eat chemicals and preservatives or put them on my body so this is GREAT!

Good stuff, not much to complain about. Though I could say that it could use a little more salt and seasoning. However, it's understandable why it isn't seasoned well, since they probably figure that's something you would want to do your own liking. One can can easily satisfy most people for a meal. Get a bottle of Sriracha and this stuff and your golden.
summary: Tasty corn, chicken and potatoes. Chowder Down.

reviewerName: A. Tran "happiness makes up in height, for wh...
reviewText: What I like about this product:- made with better ingredients- frosted but not too sweetAdmit it, we all love pop tarts but those things have way too many unnecessary ingredients and sugar. I was so happy Nature's Path provided an alternative. I love the acai flavor; it is not too sweet but still satisfying the need for a sweet tooth.
summary: Not too sweet, better pop tart

reviewText: OK folks: I have to tell you I'm one of these people that tries every kind of black cherry soda I can find. Once upon a time, in the days before colas and Dr. Pepper were totally dominant in the market, and before the days of Mountain Dew, Black Cherry sodas were plentiful. It's harder to find them now. And if you were fan of black cherry, some sodas were super artificial in taste, and others tasted more natural. The Switch beverages are among the best on the market and the good news is: The Switch Black Cherry is one of their best flavors. The only bad news is that The Switch cans are small and you'll want to have more and more. It's natural tasting, has good, natural ingredients and it gives you a natural energy boost. And if you haven't tried black cherry...the BEST WAY is to try it drinking The Switch Black Cherry. You'll become hooked. Take THAT colas and Dr. Pepper!

The latte is good but I've had better. I chose this one because from the ingredients this appeared to be the healthier of the two with almost the same taste.Certainly not to be used more than a treat if your watching ingredient and calorie intake

reviewerName: Meryl K. Evans "Content Maven behind meryl.net"
reviewText: I heard about these and had been looking all over for them because I wanted to try them as a fan of baked snacks. In the meantime, I had the opportunity to try a competitor's product of popped tortilla chips. The competitor wins hands down. The flavor is fuller and deeper than Popchip's. Popchips Tortilla Chips taste like lightweight, airy corn tortilla chips. The corn is lighter, not rich like yellow corn but more like white corn. As for the salsa, it's mild and tastes more like chili peppers with tomatoes.These won't quench your cravings for regular tortilla chips nor do they make a good substitute for chips in nachos. They also don't have quite the crunch of a chip. I've seen lighter chips have a good solid crunch. These are softer. They're average compared to all the baked chips I've tried. When shopping for baked chips, the original Popchips and competitor's popped tortilla chips will end up in my basket rather than these.
summary: Tasty yet not quite as good as Popchips potato chips or competitor

reviewText: the box stuff is ok but they always come out super dense no matter what cycle i use or how i modify it.  I did a fifty fifty on the box. it split the box in half and replaced what i took out with white and made a white wheat which turn out delicious and hadded two packets of honey it was super good after i did the modification

Delicious!  And the black remains very black, even after cooking.  (Don't know if this makes a difference:  we pressure cook it.)  Beautiful in salads.  And being forbidden, it's all the more enticing.
everything you want in soy milk, except organic so no five star.  the straw comes with it too. they're a good buy

I enthusiastically recommend this product, primarily for its vastly superior taste and texture. Although nothhing tastes like a blueberry as much as a blueberry, once you adjust (about 4 initial mouthfuls) the KIND version of blueberry, you'll not only love the taste, but it will seem close enough to the real thing that you'll have a Blueberry Experience!  NOt too crunchy, yet not too soft or crumbly, these have a great blueberry/flax/cinnamon flavor which I loved. (Non-cinnamon fans should stay away).The product is slightly pricey, but this is offset by how filling it is--especially when consumed with water.  I'd recommend this as a pick-me-up/snack almost anytime,; for example, while at the office, on a hike, taking a break from a bike ride, etc. The ingredients tasted fresh (one unlucky reviewer reported a "rancid" ingredient). Overall a very tasty and satisfying snack food.  Highly recommended!

This makes the best homemade popcorn!  Melt 1 or 2 tbsps of butter in a 2.5 qt glass bowl.  Add 1 tsp of salt and 1/3 cups of this popcorn.  Cover with a microwave cover and microwave for 5 minutes.  Voila!!

Having made our  large order last for two years, we are ordering large again, knowing that the cookies did not go stale! I know you think they were fresh because we gobbled them- not true! We delight in having two w/tea, or coffee, or water, or... THANK YOU, CARR'S!

I love using my bread machine but often don't have the time or ingredients on hand.  Hodgson Mill uses high quality ingredients that work terrifically in my bread machine.  I can depend on serving great loaves and the dough is easy to work with if I choose to stop the machine and make rolls instead.

I started buying this popcorn awhile back when I became concerned when my normal brand was not always available.  I just love this.  It pops up quite large for white and it is still tender and nearly hull-less.  We go through a lot of popcorn and make it nearly every day with our popcorn machine.  I don't like the larger yellow as much, but this white is just super.  I have never had a bad batch of it.  It seems to keep fresh just a bit longer, too.  It does cost a bit more, but for the convenience of the smaller bags, it is worth it to me.

First off, you have to understand that I drink a LOT of coffee, and have been drinking a lot of coffee for 35-plus years. I started out with brands like Folgers and Maxwell House, brands that my parents would typically buy on sale at the supermarket. As I eased into adulthood, I found myself drawn to pricier and better blends. These days I find myself buying a lot of local coffees, and living in central Texas I am blessed with several that roast and distribute in my area.That said, I always seem to find myself gravitating to an old “off the shelf” friend in Eight ‘O Clock Coffee. The rich color, good smell, and dependable flavor provide for one of the best coffee bargains around. Is there a nostalgia factor at work? It’s possible. I’ll freely admit that the smell of a pot brewing brings back fond memories of drinking this at my parent’s table when I was younger, but the simple fact is that this is just a darn good cup of coffee. It’s hard not to appreciate this venerable brand, especially at the cheaper price points that it can usually be bought at.There’s nothing special about it, it’s not a designer coffee in any sense. It just brews up perfect every time and produces a simple and satisfying cup of java.This and Community Coffee are the two mass-produced commercial blends that I keep coming back to. Eight ‘O Clock coffee is a consistent and welcome visitor to my cupboard, and I’ll keep on throwing a few bags into the basket at the supermarket every year.
summary: Easily one of the best coffee bargains around......

reviewText: These are the Lindt chocolates that I think we're all familiar with. They're really sweet and creamy.The ones I got were in good condition - not melted, tasted fresh.But I think it would be more convenient to just buy them in a regular drugstore.

This one my favorite item the reason as follows, so great I eat 1/1/4 for BKF,SNACK and over salad. I shared this item with family, friends, Church Members and everyone just can't get enough. Hello, just don't take my word, try this item and all the other EMERALD BRANDS and you will like the prices too.

reviewerName: M. Jobbagy "Follow Your Bliss - Joseph Cambell"
reviewText: This is a great concept, we all need more natural things in our diet. The Black Cherry flavor of this product was trying to catch up to the other juices that are in it, which basically came down to it was a bit tart, like a cherry, and not totally sweet like apple or grape juice, of which this contains more of than the cherry juice.It was lightly carbonated, not overly so. Hard to tell if this is by design, or being shipped through the postal service, with all the shakes, rattles and rolls that consists of.The small size leaves a bit to be desired, as it kinda leaves you wanting more. It has a pleasant flavor, so I would drink it again, although I actually prefer naturally carbonated water with a hint of some natural flavor, such as lemon, cherry, orange, etc.

This coffee is now our favorite.  Taste is both smooth and robust with no bitterness.  Fresh ground just before brewing is the only way we've tried it, but any other way would seem wrong.  Incredible value on subscribe and save at the 15% discount level.
summary: wonderful smooth tasting coffee, great value

reviewText: I eat A LOT of popcorn, and for the most part, prefer the white.  THis popcorn is EXCELLENT.  I've purchased several different brands from Amazon, and some from the supermarket, and so far, this is in my top 2 for freshest and tastiest.  It's also very tender.  The price, delivery and quality all get high marks. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.  Enjoy!

This flavor of the rice seasoning mix I did like a bit better than the other variation of it.  It had a bit more flavor and I only used it on long grain rice this time.  I did however mix in some mushrooms, broccoli and squash with it as I tend to like my rice with veggies in it.  I would expect Knorr to have given this just a bit more flavoring as they do with their other products but guess you can't have everything.  This one is a bit more salty that the other version but not overly so.  I absolutely love Knorr products and so when eating this and finding it a bit on the mild side I was a little surprised.  Great concept but they just need to make it a bit more flavorful.
Love that I have a healthier option for flavored tortilla chips that actually tastes good!  Can't wait to try them in a taco salad!  Will be buying again!

The sampler pack contains a bunch of different products with diverse uses.  The oils are nice and pack some flavor.  The syrups and other desert flavors were less successful for me.  Perhaps I just don't know how to utilize them well.  I don't really find it a good value for the money.  Each bottle really is a sampler size and not enough for more than a few uses.  It seems like a 'savory' sampler or 'sweet' sampler might make more sense.
summary: Not sure how useful this is

reviewText: Can't beat fresh.  large and fresh is how i would describe these whole nutmegs.  i hate that they make you write so many words for a review.

I don't know why I have always resisted buying this for so many years, I don't know if the term flake put me off or what but it is SO good. You crush it between your fingers and sprinkle over food. I think this goes great whole on top of sweets like chocolates or cupcakes for the salted caramel flavor - you get a flaky salty crunch that is awesome. I think its great for cooking with as long as you break it down with your fingers, we keep it in a salt box on the counter and it is all we use now.
summary: This is a great salt for all applications, tastes very good

reviewText: I love the sesame ryvita crackers. They are great with everything and little ingredients. You will love the flavor. I signed up for the automatic shipment since I want to have them on hand all the time. They make great PB&J sandwiches.

I love chocolate. And am happy with almost any chocolate. But, by far, hands down my favorite is the Lindt milk chocolate truffle. The perfectly sized round shape. The smooth and silky shell. The soft, creamy chocolate filling. Delicious. I used to think that the expensive chocolates were the best, you know the ones from the exclusive stores. But these are consistently better. Bonus for being easier to find, and at a much better price.So much happy deliciousness in a small wrapper. Yum!!
summary: Hands down the best. The. BEST.

reviewText: I love this breakfast cookie! I usually have this with fruit and tea or juice for a quick breakfast, or sometimes I have it with vanilla ice cream for dessert.

Doctor Kracker Parmesan Culinary Crisps somehow manage to taste stale even when fresh out of a new bag.  They have the consistency of a nice piece of toast that you forgot to take out of the toaster oven for a few days.  Plus the flavor is mild but inoffensive.  They look a lot better on the package and having some seeds on top might have made these more enjoyable.  Despite the 12g of multigrain, these just taste like baked flour with a bit of Parmesan and a hint of garlic.

Indeed, I had no clusters in my shipment, just a few clumps in a sea of grains.  Not deterred, I really liked the flavor of the product.  It echoes the quality and general flavor of other Kind offerings.  Its texture is a little more brittle-like than I prefer in granola, which seems to contribute to it being very sweet and candy-like.  This is the one factor that would keep me from enjoying it regularly.  The flavor of the grains is very nice, though the blueberry could come through a bit more.The inclusion of whole flax seeds is a bit distressing, however.  Whole flax seeds are hard to chew, which when factored into being indigestible would seem that their health benefit is somewhat lost.  Generally speaking, this granola is a tasty treat, though not something I could keep as a staple in the pantry.
Can you have too much of this stuff?  Haha!  I love it on my popcorn, in tofu scramble, the vegan "cheeses" I make, etc.
This bar was pretty good.  I enjoyed it, but I prefer the other flavor - Odwalla Super Protein bar.  I preferred it.
summary: Odwalla Banana Nut 2.0 ouncs Bars (Pack of 15)

reviewText: I love peaches but I found these to be too tart, I don't want my peaches to make me pucker.

These are a great balance between the sweetness of the juice, to the tartness of the montmorency cherries, they taste just like the cherries in a cherry pie.Also, before people go and start to bad mouth these because they are 'transitional to organic'....maybe they should know just what that term means instead of jumping off the gun and starting with the cherries are not organic crap.
Quite wonderful on their own (can be a little addictive!) I think they are truly best in a large scoop of soft serve vanilla ice cream! Oh, yes! Yum. Says it all....

We don't drink a lot of hot cocoa but we have a cup once in a while and when our grandson comes over and we have coffee from the Keurig he wants some cocoa.  As far as products go this is not bad for a quick cup.  I rate it a four star.  We fix a medium cup on the Keurig and it is just a bit watery.  When you are paying about a dollar a cup I would at least like to get a large cup and have it a bit stronger.  They make K-Cup coffees bolder by putting in more coffee into the K-cup so they should put in more Cocoa in these.
summary: Not a bad cup of cocoa but it could be a bit stronger and make more than a medium cup!

reviewText: The whole family loves Peanut Butter Panda Puffs and we're glad they are available on Subscribe & Save. The cereal holds up well in milk and it's great to have an organic alternative that's every bit as good as the famous name brand cereal.

I got this bag in the mail and the first thing I noticed is that these clusters were more like tiny cereal bits, which I assume is being bounced around in the mail.  Second, my bag came with a hole in it, which I guess didn't affect the overall quality of the clusters. I feel these are two things a consumer needs to know about buying this item via the mail.  Other than that, the taste of the blend is pretty good.  I had it by itself, with milk and as a topping on my oatmeal and it tasted very good.  The fruit flavor is natural and sweet with the vanilla taste warm and inviting underneath.  All the ingredients are pretty wholesome for the most part, except for cane sugar, but at least that is a natural, non-processed sugar.  I feel the packs are overpriced for what they are.  My boyfriend and I ate the pack I got very fast, to account for how good the product is.  But we do make similar clusters as a snack in our home for a lot cheaper.  The Kind comes out to about 50 cents an ounce and I can make a great deal more of a honey/almond/fruit clusters for that much.  Even if I added flax seed and quinoa.  But needless to say, I really like the product a lot and if I had the money to spend $5.38 for a pack, I would.  It just is a bit high in price for my meager budget!
summary: If you get it in the mail, the clusters will be broken down...

reviewText: I loved it. Perfect combination of refreshing taste (not that usual bitter zing)with a consistant energy boost. I'll be trying it in all the favors.

Tastes very good but a little weak on raspberry flavor.  It's more like a sweeter raspberry pie filling than preserves. I doubt I will buy it again.  It might be good for cake or torte filling, however.  I may try it for Vienna Finger cookie filling but I'm not sure it is sweet enough for that.  Still I have to find a way to use up 4 pounds.

I know not everybody is a fan of white chocolate…seems like you either love it or you hate it.  Very little grey area for this product, no matter what form it takes.For those that love white chocolate, you need to give this product a try.  As a white chocolate connoisseur, myself, I do not recall every having a finer tasting piece of heaven.  If it were whiskey it would be described as “perfectly smooth”, “rich” and “bold” etc.  The same can be said for this chocolate.  The outside is the perfect texture for sliding around your taste buds and fighting that desperate urge to chomp down with your teeth.  The inside darn near melts in your mouth…it is that smooth.  And the taste…well, it’s simply out of this world.  White chocolate sweetness is intoxicating.  The only downside is that each piece doesn’t last long enough.Even if you are not normally a fan of white chocolate I recommend giving this a try.
summary: Gotta have my daily slice of heaven

reviewText: He said it tasted ok, but had an odd after flavor and wouldn't want us to buy it.  He said CapriSun is better.

I have enjoyed these sweet white chocolate truffles many times in Lindt assortment packs. I don't like them as well in this single variety pack. These are mild and sweet with the usual melt in your mouth eating experience and consistency but not something I want in this large a quantity. I still think they are very nice as part of an assortment pack though.
summary: Sweet and Melt in your mouth

reviewText: They satisfy my sweet tooth without refined sugar. Also so easy to carry with for those times I can't find a good gluten-free meal while shopping.

I purchase these after reading so many good reviews. I was surprised to find out that they are so SWEET don't get me wrong they are not bad tasting at all is just I don't really like sweet drinks I prefer them to have a watered down taste or a light refreshing taste. These are all very sweet like syrup my daughter only liked the orange, my mother liked the lemon but the rest we gave them away.

We like this very well cooked as a hot cereal.  Sometimes we add dried fruit to it.  One should probably check the list of grains to rule out problems with food allergies and might try just one bag to see if you like it before buying in quantity.

howdy y'all,this bread is pretty good. the potato flavor is there, recognizable as potato bread [if you've had it before] and not overwhelming. makes a good sandwich bread with meats or an enjoyably different pseudo-bruschetta base.made it with vegetable oil and olive oil. as usual, the good olive oil makes for a somewhat better flavor.rated a THREE cuz it's just exactly as expected - average with no surprises.take care,lee

This stuff is delicious.  It imparts a wonderful umami flavor to anything you use it in.  It's much better than the Thai Kitchen brand which also has some junk in it.  This stuff is the real deal.  I use it in anything asian from stir fryes, marinades, meatballs, thai dishes, all sorts of foods.  IMO it's worth the price.  Every penny of it!

I'm a big fan of Lindt Lindor Chocolate Truffles.  These white chocolate ones are good, no question.  But they're a tad sweet for my tastes.Very creamy and smooth, the usual Lindt quality shows.  They're a nice change from the usual milk or dark chocolate truffles -- I like them, but I didn't *love* them.  Taste is a very individual thing, though, so if you like really creamy sweet truffles, these might work really well for you.

These Lindt White Chocolate truffles were simply delicious.  Eat bite was full of creamy, almost sinful goodness.The package contains a generous amount of candies - too many to eat in one sitting!  Instead, you'll want to savor them one delicious morsel at a time.We aren't huge chocolate eaters in our house, so we've been snacking on these little by little, but they've kept well and seem to be the perfect end to a hectic day at work or school.

This popcorn was much too sweet.  It tasted like caramel corn with a strange cheesy coating.  The ingredients do include sugar, which I think is a weird thing to put on cheddar popcorn.  The cheddar flavor itself was fairly mild, and the cheese coating itself was powdery and very messy.  This also contained artificial dyes, which I'm not a fan of.I've had much better cheese flavored popcorn than this.
I bought this for our home during the holidays but we're eating it now. It's very good and I might buy more soon.

I love this sauce so I dip plenty of foods in it. I dip fries, baked chicken, and more in it. I use it on Thai, Japanese, Korean, Asian and more foods. It is perfect for foods that is lacking seasoning. It is a slight sweet taste. I can not taste the spice in it.
summary: I love this sauce so I put it on almost everything

reviewText: We regularly buy this flavor as well as the Blueberry, Strawberry, and Maple flavors. We like the fact that they're not frosted. For some reason Costco only carries the frosted variety. My only complaint is that all of us (my family) wish there was more of the fruit filling.
summary: Our Favorite brand or toaster pastry

reviewText: A great breakfast cereal for the whole family. Healthy and delicious. Our preschool-age kids love it too. It tastes fresh and flavorful.

St. Dalfour's "French Bistro (Gourmet On The Go), Ready to Eat Wild Pink Salmon" is a convenient lunch, low-calorie, but high in protein, and wonderfully fresh-tasting. Even the organic sea-salt that accompanies each container (along with pepper & a nifty plastic spork) is above average. There are nice chunks of wild salmon, along with an assortment of tasty vegetables & spices, including: potatoes, carrots, Flageolet beans, red & green peppers, celery, mustard, salt, dill, garlic, white pepper, and paprika. The folks at St. Dalfour aren't kidding when they say that using a special vacuum-process seals in freshness (without preservatives), providing a remarkably flavorful meal. Enjoy!

This product is not a soda but a carbonated juice. This soda has a nice taste- its not as sweet and as pure orange-tasting as typical orange soda-like drinks. It's not pure orange juice- but made up of a mixture of several different juices including apple, orange, grape and tangerine.  That juice blend gives it a slightly tangy taste that is actually at first slightly surprising and mostly refreshing.  The carbonation also seems lighter to me than soda but it is definitely there.The things I like about this product are the smaller can size (8.3oz)which makes it a more appropriate serving that a regular soda.  I also like the bright packaging and the pleasant taste.  After reading the ingredients of SWITCH carefully- I see that it is all juice just as it claims- so its probably a better choice than a regular soda.This product has no added sugars just as advertised on the can- but buyer beware- its still kind of high in sugar because fruit juices are naturally high in sugar. As always be sure to read the label if you are concerned about sugar levels.Overall I think this product is a good size and has a pleasant taste- especially if you are looking for something that tastes like an orange juice blend.  Traditional orange soda fans might be slightly disappointed in the taste.
tastes great!! i cant say anymore than that! it's actually their best flavor in my opnion. worth looking at if you want a tasty on the go snack.
I haven't tasted Gingerbread this good since I was very young.  It is good served plain or with whipped cream.
summary: Just like my mother and grandmother use to make

reviewText: Bob's R M Oats "Rolled Thick" are the BEST! These are two pound bags, so each bag makes 18 (yes eighteen) servings and each serving has all the "whole grain" (28 grams) you need for the DAY! But the cooking directions on the bag turn these fine oats into globs of sticky goo that hardly look like they should. You can get the picture if I tell you they look like a bowl of gummy instant oats! Yucky! So I used HALF the amount of water, dash of salt (optional) and brought the water to boiling, added the oats, bringing it back to boil, stirred, then covered and cooked TWO minutes, Turn off heat, keep pot covered, and let sit a few minutes (to swell) before you serve. This method produces thoroughly cooked oats that retain their natural shape, texture, and chew. DELICIOUS! See if you like!
summary: EXCELLENT Oats for someone who really likes oats!

reviewText: I quit sodas over a year ago due to the unhealthiness of them.  I do, however, like bubbly drinks, but I don't need the sugar or sodium.  That's why this product is perfect.  It is 100% fruit juice, carbonated for the bubbliness.Orange is one of my favorite flavors.  This drink is the perfect drink.I think this product is even better than orange soda; orange soda is sticky, but this product is not.  It has the perfect amount of sharpness - which I love.  Because it is 100% fruit juice, it also has the perfect amount of natural sweetness.So this product is all the good things rolled into one:100% fruit juiceNo added sugarBubblyAwesome orange flavorIt's so good, it's hard to believe you're drinking something healthy.
summary: Tastes Good and Healthy and Bubbly

reviewText: Are they the freshest pine nuts you can get?  No.  But they make a killer pesto!  :)The parrots are happy, too, although they like Nuts.com pine nuts better.
summary: Pine nuts - need I say more?

reviewText: My family has been using V8 fusion for years to make smoothies. The V8 fusion provides a nutritious serving of fruits and veggies in every serving, and it tastes great. Now, it comes in a single serve can, and is an energy drink to boot. This carbonated energy drink tastes great and provides and awesome early morning pep. I like the price too. It easily beats Red Bull and 5-hour energy. I recieved this for review on Amazon Vine.

My Mom is the gingerbread queen. She enjoys it all year round. She'd never tried this brand and really loved it on her visit. It is so easy to make even in my Zojirushi bread oven. A plus is it's high in iron and a healthier treat than many others.

These corn flakes are truly the best I've ever eaten.  They are crispy, stay that way for quite some time when served in milk, and are deeply satisfying insofar as flavor is concerned.  To boot, and very important to me, they are gluten free.  With some products, looking at the price-tag is a waste of time, I'd buy these anywhere, at any price.
It is a healthy albeit expensive additive to many of the food i eat; rice, stir fry, omelets to name a few.  I grew up with roasted pine nuts on rice.

It is hard to find hulled hempseed at a decent price. Buying the 5 pound tub was the cheapest route, and it encourages me to eat more! I started eating hemp hearts for quick energy, and learning to make hempmylk has gotten me away from consuming so much cow milk.  My vet recommended an omega 6 supplement to me to help with my poodle's skin condition, but I balked at the outrageous price of this supplement. Knowing the omega 6 profile of hemp hearts, I started feeding him a teaspoon per day of these hearts...like magic, within a few weeks his skin condition improved. The quality of these hearts is comparable to the Nutiva I have ordered in the past, but with a much lower price tag.
This cinnamon spiced black tea has become a real favorite with me.  I drink more than a few cups per week.
Perfect for those following a Paleo diet. Much better tasting than EPIC bars, which were my go-to before discovering Tanka. Not too dry like EPIC. Will continue to order these!

Recently, I picked up a 30-ounce plastic jar of "Ann's House Soy Energy Blend" which I discovered in the snack isles of my local Costco warehouse store. It's a mixture of soy nuts, almonds, pumpkin seeds and dried cranberries. I'm a sucker for things like this. I can use them as a healthy snack. I can pack them in little sandwich bags and include them in my lunch package. I can bag them up for snacks in hiking walks. My wife likes them too. We snack now and then but we try to avoid salty and sweet snacks and stick to things that are nutritionally sound. These things fit the bill. They're a little bland tasting and you might wish that they were salted at least a little bit, but the protein and fiber content will make up for any taste deficits, at least in my book. It's a good snack. I love discovering things like this!Gary Peterson

These are very tasty, and a nice, crunchy snack that is much better for you than chips. They are definitely reminiscent of pizza, but not in a gross artificial way. The nutrition is great, good amount of protein/fiber, no sugar, but I feel like $4/bag is a bit much for what you get. I did Subscribe & Save so I'm down to about $3/bag, which isn't terrible for 3 servings.
summary: Super yummy, a bit pricy for the size of the bag

reviewText: I have been using Hodgson's MIll bread mixes in my breadmaker for years.
