I like to add various seeds and grains as well.I just figured out how to make thin buns (great for portion control) using these mixes:I use the dough only setting on the breadmaker, which does everything but bake it.Then I punch down the dough, form into kind of a round, then cut into 16 pieces (first in half, then half those pieces, and so on.)Then roll each piece into a flat disc about 4 inches wide, and let them rise again for 30 minutes under a clean dishcloth on the baking sheet.Bake for 10-15 minutes at 350' and you got 'em.I don't grease the sheet because I use a silicone pan liner.  I also roll the dough on the same liner so there is no need for flour.

I drank a single can of the Switch Orange Tangerine flavor today.  Upon first impression, the physical size of the can is a tiny -- 8oz or 250ml.  This in contrast to a regular can of soda size which is 12 ounces or 355 ml.  Therefore, only about 2/3 the content of a normal can of soda.  To say the least, this isn't enough liquid for me in one sitting.  I need more to drink than that to quench a tiny bit of thirst so I was quite disappointed without even opening the thing up.The taste of the drink itself was satisfying.  Since there is no added sugar (which is usually corn syrup in the US) the flavor was not too sweet nor was it too bland.  However, it wasn't anything like drinking a fresh bottle of 100% natural juice.  More on the side of mixed syrup with water.What kills this product is the high price.  Product right now comes out to about a buck a can.  I would be angry paying that out of a vending machine for its small size but for purchasing in bulk, it is an insult to say the least.  Not worth the money.
summary: Decent tasting, but too small and overpriced

reviewText: Not what I was expecting.  The salt is good but I think I'll look for salt flakes instead of using this as a finishing salt.  I do use this a lot in my cooking lately to use it up.  To me it seems more of a sandy texture than a finishing salt that one would expect.

This tea is delicious and easy on the palate.  I am not sure what else to say as everyone has different standards when it comes to food and beverages.  The teas is smooth and refreshing.  I find that this needs to steep in hot water longer than a black tea needs to steep.  Product is well worth the money.

Don't kid yourself, these aren't a healthy snack.  However, they are very tasty and quite addictive.  As an occasional treat or something to take with you to the drive-in movie as a snack for the kids, these are great.I give it 5 stars for flavor...not everything we eat needs to be kale and spirolina.

Orville Redenbacher's brown sugar cinnamon popcorn has the same sweetness strength as regular caramel corn, but has a nice addition of cinnamon to the overall flavor.  The result is a totally satisfying crunchy popcorn.  If you don't measure out your portion, you may find yourself eating the entire bag.Details:Serving size - 1/2 cupServings/bag - 6Calories - 140Calories from fat - 45%First few ingredients - corn syrup, sugar, whole grain popcorn, corn flour, brown sugar, canola oil, margarine....(note: my bag showed an expiration date 2 months prior & my popcorn was still crunchy.  The bag was not flat when I opened it.
I love that these are conveniently packaged and it's also a healthy snack for the kids.  The chocolate and cheddar bunnies always go the fastest!
On my first try, it made excellent pasta.  Great tasting and easy to work.  I mixed it 50/50 with regular flour.
summary: it made excellent pasta. Great tasting and easy to work

reviewText: I love Steel Cut Oats and Bob's are just as good as any other out there. It works well to cook up several servings and freeze in individual servings. It serves as a quick breakfast that I can take with me.
I prefer the Ekobrew cup because they are easier to clean.  But this one works the same and allows me to use my own coffee beans.

I certainly hope that Switch will be selling this product in larger packages - I was very disappointed when my Tangerine soda was gone - it was very good!  Actually tasted like tangerines, which was a surprise as most of the sodas on the market don't have much distinctive flavor at all.  Switch sodas are pleasantly carbonated, sweet without being overwhelming so, and very satisfying, particularly when drunk very cold!

Makes popcorn taste just like theater grade as long as you have the proper salt. Love this. It's one of the few products that's better than advertised. I use it with a Whirly Pop & it throws out one perfect batch after another.
We get a variety of flavors in one variety pack.  Best part is that there is no more running to the grocery store, standing in long lines, and wasting of fuel!

After trying Barilla's Whole Grain Fusilli with Vegetable Marinara, one may say that not any one microwaveable meal is the same.  From the ability to open the package with ease to warming the meal in only 60 seconds, Barilla provides a satisfying experience for the hungry consumer.  And in addition, the pasta meal is delicious, the tomato sauce is perfectly placed and not messy to prepare, and nutritious, especially with the variety of choices that Barilla offers.  The meal is convenient for anyone that has to eat on the go or simply want a simple lunch or small meal anytime of the day.
I loved this mix passed it out at the office evertone thought it was really good and tasty enough said!

This coffee has a good flavor. It's not especially strong. I suggest using the medium cup setting on your Keurig. On the full cup, the flavor is diluted too much.The drawback is the cups cannot be stored in the K-cup carousel, because they are not solid plastic. Instead they are a mesh netting, open somewhat, and need to remain in the stay-fresh pouch inside the box.

This is fine to use for a child who is eating more food and nearing the one year mark.  As far as formula goes, my baby did not seem to notice a big change (it does contain corn syrup though as opposed to their regular infant premium formula that does not).  However, to promote it as a product to use past one year of age seems a big much and just a way to make more money.  Also, disappointing that they did not use the great snap lid canister like their premium infant formula.

We first tried this cake when we were on Grand Caymans and there was no turning back after that first taster.  The cake is moist, sweet and laced with a generous portion of rum. The cake is sealed in a vacuum sealed bag that helps maintain its moisture.  Dont worry once you open the bag because I doubt it that it will last for more than a couple of days!Just so pleased that this item is on Prime delivery and that Amazon is supporting this product.  It is great as a gidt idea, but only if you are ready to part with it!
summary: Delicious, yummy moist and laced with rum CAKE

reviewText: I'm really happy with the Organic Coconut Oil that I used! It says for use in cooking, but there's so much more that you can use coconut oil for. I tried it with some cleaning and cooking to try it out. It was great on both accounts. I would recommend it!
have a good taste and the raspberry comes through pretty good, but I don't love the soft cake...would love a crisp one instead...

For years, the only Lu's I could find at my local market were the USA Lu's, which aren't as good as the Belgium biscuits.  So, I was happy to find them at Amazon this past July, 2012 and bought the case of six boxes.  Unfortunately, they didn't taste fresh and had an expiration date of Dec. 2012; that explained the stale taste, but I chose not to return them.  Instead, I nuke two in the microwave for 5 or 6 seconds and it sort of revives the flavor.Well, last week, Sept. 14, 2012, I found the Belgium Lu at my local supermarket and bought a single box.  That box expires Dec. 2013, over a year from now, and the cookies definitely taste better.  Moral of the story: Buy them where you can read the Expiration date.  I surmise that having a year or two shelf life should be about right.

These crackers weren't burnt but they sure tasted like it. They are so hard to chew they hurt my teeth. The flavor is very strong in an unpleasant way- tasted a bit like rye. My gluten free daughter said "ewwww yuck!" When she tasted these. I agree.
Twinings is a name you can rely on for terrific tea.  Starting the day with English Breakfast makes the rest of the day go better!
summary: Economical way to get best tea!

reviewText: This is my second order of the pack of 3 sunflower oils.  I use this every morning for my oil pulling.  It's a great organic oil at a reasonable price.  Pretty packaging, love everything about this oil.
This one really is "better than milk" - with enough sweetness to make it really special. Low-cal and low-fat, it's a great product.

Poor packaging, they were essentially crumbs by the time they got to my home.  Used them for a shake n' bake substitute with a few other ingredients, but had to buy more at the grocery store for my kids' lunch.
Like the bigger bags better, either you like them or you don't. They just don't have that snap as they use to as I remember.
For some reason, with a name like "Kicking Horse", I expect more of a full-bodied flavor.  My all-time favorite continues to be  Ola's Organic Fair-trade Sidamo (also sold through Amazon.com).

The EBOOST will fizz. For those who love soda pop, the flavor should grow on you as a slightly healthy version of that.Get a 12 ounce bottle of water. Drink off a few ounces. You need the water anyway right?Pour in the packet and let fizz. Put on lid and give it a few shakes.The taste is bad. It's about like the crystal light energy drink in similar packet. That one tastes like straight citric acid.If you're needing caffeine and would like some vitamins to enhance your energy level, then this is a good alternative to soda with all that sugar or fake sugar. Cane sugar is unrefined and slightly less glycemic as regular sugar (meaning raise blood sugar levels) and isn't stripped from its natural nutrients. It's more pricey than the stuff we usually get.So, if you're wanting to try a new energy drink, then you can try this. If you already drink coffee regularly, it might be a nice non-teeth-staining alternative. It's not going to WOW you with energy, but can help if you get drained in the afternoon and need a pick-me-up.
summary: How EBOOST is different from others...

reviewText: good stuff
Tried the light roast. It was not bad but nothing special to make you want seek it out. An average light roast with a very light flavor.
Have buying this for last 4 years. It is consistent. A good, dark, full flavored coffee. We put it on extra brew. Will keep buying this coffee.

Let me say first that I am not a coffee "snob". I don't have to drink expensive, fancy coffees. The most important thing to me in terms of coffee is that it not be too bitter.  I like a smoother coffee, nothing too dark or too strong. I usually look for medium roasted coffees.  I don't ever drink my coffee black; I drink it with milk and sugar (preferably not too much of either). This coffee isn't too bitter but it's a little bland and a little bit "off". It has a bit of a funky aftertaste. It's not horrible and if it was the only coffee available I'd drink it occasionally. However, given the many choices available, I wouldn't choose this one.  The one good thing about it is the design- it has the open filter bottom. I do like that idea for a k-cup better than the traditional plastic cup. If only the coffee itself was better.
This flour is fresh and well packaged and yummy and fine. You will enjoy it very much in your recipe.

I first ordered the Chipotle flavor.  I didn't enjoy the flavor very much, but the texture was crispy and the amount of flavor was perfect.  There was plenty of flavor there but it wasn't overwhelming like some brands are.  It was because of this that I decided to give Blair's a second chance.  I ordered the Habanero flavor next.  I was extremely disappointed.  Gone was the perfect amount of flavoring the chipotle chips had.  Instead the chips had so much seasoning it was darn near falling off the chips.  I've had a few brands of habanero before, but this one tasted nothing like any of them.  It has almost a sweet flavor to it.  I personally didn't care for it at all.  On top of it all, the chips aren't even very hot.  I was very disappointed in how hot both chips were considering the brand is called Death Rain.  If you can find them, try Poore Brothers Habanero chips.  THOSE are some hot chips, with a fantastic flavor.
We live in a rural area and special ingredients for our Paleo recipes aren't always available.  I use this product in a lot of recipes and it's so handy to order off of Amazon Grocery.
For the price I think the cocoa cups are very good. I will order them again. They are nice to have in the house for the grand children and the holidays

I completely agree with everyone else that steel cut oatmeal is the ultimate low calorie healthy breakfast.But McCann's oats are overpriced.Steel cut oats are not unique to McCann (though their oats are grown in Ireland); many other food companies sell them. Despite the location of where the oats are grown, the taste is identical and the nutrition facts are virtually the same.McCann's oats are by far the most expensive. Even after Amazon's subscriber discount, Whole Foods store brand steel cut oats, for example, are several dollars cheaper (grown in America and organic). The only difference in nutrition data is that the Whole Foods brand is insignificantly higher in calories from fat as well as fiber, protein and iron. No doubt some of the price differential has merely to do with the tin can and transporting the oats across the Atlantic.So if you want to save several dollars, look at other brands of of steel cut oatmeal.
Housemate specifically wanted this flavor and thought it was a good deal.I like it too... good chew, good flavor, nice size, lasts long enough. Lots of it!
Sadly, I was supposed to receive this product, but never did.  I imagine it's good given the others I've tried, but alas, that won't happen.  Still, I have to write a review, so there you go.

My grandsons, who don't usually drink reconstituted milk, had no complaints drinking this.  I suggest mixing it with an electric mixer if you are in a hurry because it is rich and does not dissolve quickly.
summary: Organic Valley Organic Nonfat Dry Milk Powder -- tastes good enough to mix and drink even without chilling

reviewText: Finally a 100% Stevia sweetener.  The packets are great for keeping a watch on the intake of a natural sweetener and the portions are perfect for a cup of coffee; also as a sweetener for home made lemonade - 1 packet per lemon.  Sweetens without the glucose spikes!

I don't know about it giving me energy but after trying it with water as the instructions read, it made me feel sick to my stomach. Also overpriced! Others may swear by it and if you had better results than I, feel free to press the no button!

I am a Type I diabetic, and I had high hopes for Just Like Sugar. I was aware that Dr. Bernstein was not fond of such sugar substitutes, but I decided to give it a try.As a sugar substitute, it is very good. However, it caused my blood sugar level to spike.I made a lemon chess pie using Just Like Sugar (2 cups for the pie). After fasting for at least two hours, and testing my blood sugar, it was 102. I then had a piece of pie (the crust was by LC, known for being low carb). After an hour, my blood sugar level was 164. After 90 minutes, it had reached 212, at which time I injected insulin.I had been using Just Like Sugar for several months. I believed the company's claim that this chicory root product was diabetic friendly. Anytime I noted high reading I guess I kept attributing it to something else I might have eaten. However, I became suspicious after eating a piece of this pie one day, and found blood sugars of 190 two hours later. That is when I decided to 'test' Just Like Sugar, being careful to not eat anything but the pie after my blood sugar level was stable (again, several hours after eating my low-carb lunch).If you are not diabetic, I recommend this product, and give it 5 stars. No bitter aftertaste, bakes well, etc. My wife simply loves the lemon chess pie.If you are diabetic, I do not recommend and I give it 0 stars. Hence, the '3' as cutting the difference.Dr. Bernstein had warned that such sugar substitutes would spike blood sugar levels (except for pure, liquid Stevia). I wish I had heeded his advice.

WithGreen Mountain Hot Cocoabeing perpetually out of stock in the winter, I thought I'd give the cheaper Grove Square brand a shot.Since the K-Cup patents are starting to sunset, Grove Square is one of the first "unofficial" producers of "we can't legally call these K-Cups but they work in your Keurig(R)(TM) coffee maker" pods, and I thought that I'd be getting the same overall quality, without the licensing fees tacked on to the price.Well... I was right about Grove Square being cheaper. But I think that's the nicest I can be.As others have pointed out, there's a definite "diet" or "Splenda" aftertaste. This hadn't been reviewed yet when I bought it, so I didn't see the warnings from others, and re-checked the ingredients several times to make sure."Well... it's got 60 calories, which seems a bit lower than Green Mountain, but a bit high for something that diet-conscious people would want." and the ingredient list didn't seem to point to obvious "diet" sweeteners.The overall taste is kind of like someone dropped a sugar-free Tootsie Roll in your hot water, using the normal cup setting. Going one size down didn't seem to improve much, beyond making a weak chocolate flavor sweeter - but that just meant a heavier shot of low-calorie sweetener to the taste buds.The way I see it, I saved about $5 by going with this brand. On the other hand, now I've got 20 of these cups left that are probably going in the trash if I can't sucker someone... er... please my discerning guests... with a few cups.If you drink diet soft drinks by choice, you're probably going to like this.

Other formats of coffee machines have pretty much taken over the market, and Senseo pods are difficult and expensive to purchase locally.  We use our Senseo machine on a daily basis, and still enjoy the coffee it makes.

Has lots of cherry and grape packages.  I just think the variety isn't really a match for me. My faves are lemon-lime (green) KA, orange, and punch.  This package has lemonade, orange, and tropical punch.  I seem to get a headache with the cherry, but that is probably a red food dye thing. Let's face it this isn't health food.  I only use 2/3 sugar in the mix.  It's just not my favorite variety.
summary: It is probably better for Cherry and grape KA lovers

reviewText: I was buying different kinds of breads for my bread machine and was never really satisfied with any of them.  My dad bought me the Bob's Red Mill flour and I don't think I will ever go back to the other flours, as I am 100% happy with this one.  The bread is really fluffy and tastes very good, and isn't heavy as a cannon ball, as it was at times with the other flours.  I am happy with this flour and I think I have found the flour that I will use from now on for my bread machine.

Last time I got Madagascar Vanilla Beans they were Big, Long, Plump and Fresh looking, I have been buying them for a long time to make Vanilla Extract and Desserts. I noticed the New Madagascar Vanilla Beans are Shorter, Thinner, Dryer and not as Plump as the ones I purchased before. Even with the Big Drop in Quality, Madagascar Vanilla Beans are a Bargain over the Supermarket Prices and that is the reason of my 4 Stars! ...Thank You D.D.

I love the resealable packing and convince I have being able to just pour some in a bowl and put it back on the shelf quickly. The taste is sweet and delicious, I love these cranberries and this brand :)

.....and Completely Organic. The texture is like that of a dried fruit pie (actually, this is a compliment) that you can get at some bakeries -- it was moist enough to enjoy without having to drink water at the same time. Although I could not actually taste the wild blueberries (the first ingredient was Dates -- the blueberries were the fifth ingrdient, and organic blueberry flavor was the last ingredient) the bar was enjoyable and sweet without the use of refined sugar.The list of ingredients includes dates, nuts, rice protein, lemon juice. Because I am hypoglygemic, after eating the bar I waited and waited and...there was no sugar high! And since I am also Gluten sensitive, it was very nice to know that there is no gluten here either. This would be a good source of energy to me when camping or hiking.There is Zero sodium in this bar, as well.

I tried vitacoco in the past and was a bit turned off by the taste in a packaged product, but this came on sale so I gave it a go, boy was I surprised, just like the real thing!  I drink one a day now, no sugary aftertaste like gatorate or vitamin water which I used to drink, just clean and refreshing.

The opening on this container is perfect for keeping the container clean and free from drips and spills. There is a plastic spout that pops up when the tin is opened and this allows the oil to flow free away from a neck.The amount that comes out at once is slower compared to most oil bottles and tins and this is another feature I enjoy about this tin. The size is compact and easy to handle.
Love having the convenience of hot chocolate in a K-Cup!  This is a rich chocolate taste that is really yummy.  My husband is the hot chocolate drinker in the family and he absolutely loves it.

This is the best vanilla flavored coffee ever! Very smooth and, unlike some brands, the vanilla does not overwhelm the coffee taste. It's just the right balance and the coffee is high quality. Try a cup and you may get hooked too.
Swiss-Miss is delious and would recommend this, which I have.  Have reordered this several timesAnd will continue to order Swiss-Miss.
I really enjoy these. Great, intense flavor.. and nutritious.. just the right amounts of everything to give me a boost midday. I highly recommend.

This premium milk based formula is great for most babies but not all. Bright Beginnings formulas contains DHA and ARA levels that may support brain and eye development; all the nutrients, vitamins, and minerals your baby needs for growth and development during his or her first year. This product does have milk and soy ingredients though- and some babies are fussy with milk allergies, intolerance, or soy issues. So just keep that in mind if your baby is having any issues on this. My daughter has a milk allergy so this did not last long for us at all. But for those that don't have an allergy I think its a very good formula.Ingredients: nonfat milk, lactose, vegetable oils (palm olein, soy, coconut, and high oleic (safflower or sunflower) oil), whey protein concentrate, galacto-oligosaccharides; and less than 1%: mortierella alpina oil, crypthecodinium cohnii oil, soy lecithin, vitamin a palmitate, vitamin D3, vitamin E acetate, vitamin K1, thiamine hydrochloride, riboflavin, vitamin B6 hydrochloride, vitamin B12, niacinamide, folic acid, calcium pantothenate, biotin, ascorbic acid, choline chloride, inositol, calcium carbonate, calcium chloride, calcium hydroxide, magnesium chloride, ferrous sulfate, zinc sulfate, manganese sulfate, cupric sulfate, potassium bicarbonate, potassium iodide, potassium hydroxide, potassium phosphate, sodium selenite, sodium citrate, taurine, l-carnitine, beta-carotene, mixed tocopherol concentrate, ascorbyl palmitate, monoglycerides, nucleotides (adenosine-5'-monophosphate, cytidine-5'-monophosphate, disodium guanosine-5'-monophosphate, disodium uridine-5'-monophosphate).
summary: Great for infants - Does have milk and soy

reviewText: I use coconut oil everyday to sauteé foods and as a substitute for butter on brown rice, potatoes, etc.  It's not only healthier, it tastes delicious too. I have used this oil all my life, because I'm Dominican and this oil is a staple in my island. I used to help my mother make this oil from scratch in our kitchen since I was a little girl. It was a long, tedious process! But it smelled so good, and I got to eat lots of little pieces is yummy coconut pulp. We use this oil to cook delicious foods, as well as a natural medicine to prevent and treat constipation. My mother used to give me half a teaspoon of melted oil with a pinch of sea salt on an empty stomach everyday, first thing in the morning to keep me regular. But the most popular use would be as a hair growth stimulant and conditioner (mostly infused with rosemary leaves) which leaves the hair shiny, soft and silky. It also treats psoriasis, dandruff, chapped skin and lips, and weak brittle nails. It also does wonders for dry skin!This oil is very good It is pure and has nothing else added. Trust me, I know what real coconut oil is supposed to look, smell, and taste, and this is the real deal. I use it on my hair and on my skin too and it works just like the one Mom used to make.
summary: Healthy, delicious and has a million uses!

reviewText: we love pinto bean's and these are very good

For the most part I generally like Snackwell's products, though it's been quite some time since I tried any.While I liked the taste (nice combination of popcorn, caramel and chocolate)and the serving size to be quite adequate for a quick snack, I don't think I would add these to my regular shopping list. I prefer 100 calorie snacks. I didn't find that the taste justified the extra 30 calories. They also seem rather expensive.I'd rather stick with regular popcorn - much more for your calorie count/money.
summary: Tasty But Not Necessarily Worth the Calories/Price

reviewText: I like to have a bar to carry in my briefcase during the work day in case I have to eat a late lunch, need an afternoon snack, etc.  Most taste like one is eating a bunch of chemicals (which they usually are).  This one actually tasted like I could have made it at home.  It was chalk full of nuts with a strong blueberry taste coming through.  I knew what all the ingredients were and didn't need a chemistry degree to read them.  Best of all for me, as I have high blood pressure, was no sodium.  I will definitely be buying these again!
summary: Finally!  A bar that is not only healthy, but tastes good!

reviewText: This is the best vegan "chicken" flavored bouillon cube I have found for use in soups and for flavoring other dishes, like rice and homemade bean-based veggie burgers. I have tried other brands of similar products but this one has the best flavor and, unlike some, doesn't contain soy. It is salty so if you are using it in a recipe calling for salt I would definitely recommend reducing or omitting the salt. My favorite way to use this is in my split pea soup (posted on The Vegan Kitchen blog). In combination with the other ingredients it really gives the soup that perfect "split pea" flavor! I've also used this in homemade veggie burgers with kidney beans and rice. For that use, I recommend adding the cube to the rice while it cooks. These don't dissolve as readily as I would have expected so I would advise taking a bit of the water your recipe calls for and heating it in a small container where you can stir the cube(s) until completely dissolved, then add it to the recipe. You won't find it for cheaper than Amazon subscribe-and-save but pay attention to your shipment dates because one case of this goes a long way!
summary: Vegan Flavoring for Soup and Other Dishes

reviewText: We saved money on our wedding by buying plain undecorated cakes from Costco. To make it look special, we made a Doctor Who themed cake topper and sprinkled these stars all over to make it have a space theme. They looked really cute and not at all tacky. They don't taste like anything and held their shape despite being in a refrigerator overnight. I will probably buy more for other special occasions!

I soak beans overnight since it allows heat in faster without killing more nutrients and never cracks beans while cooking. I love the taste of Black turtle beans and the red kidney beans but more importantly except high fiber, iron and lots of nutrients offered by beans, I consume this beauties since all beans are high in FOLATE something like 64% for one cup which is very important to me as well as magnesium, the highest in magnesium in all beans and are priced lower than all other beans amazingly and taste delicious. I hate Pinto beans. This is one top superfood and happily produced in US. One cup or 8 oz of Spinach 41/39.1%, Swiss Chard 353/7.6%, Soybeans 298/36.9%, Black Beans 227/30.1% and Navy Beans 255/24.11 offer CALORIES/DAILY VALUE %... This is Non-GMO in conventional form not USDA Certified organic form.

I love this mix. It contains most of the ingredients. I like it because everything is measured. I add extra dried cranberries and nuts and use the same size baking pan. I line the pan with foil so that I have less cleaning, jst thrown the foil away
I got these for a fall/winter quick meal but have been eating this summer! No adding water, just open can + heat!  Alot of potato and light on leek flavor.

It tastes like carbonated apple juice, not unlike Sparkling Apple Juice made for non-alcoholic champagnes . I waited until the afternoon when I normally need a quick pick-me-up and noticed that even though I woke up I didn't end up with any sort of jitters or hyperness.This is the only energy drink which tastes good to me and there isn't any strange (and potentially dangerous) ingredients other energy drinks can harbor. The ingredient list starts out with Apple and Lemon Juice and the energy is from caffeine.It tells you on the can that it contains 90 calories and 80 mg of caffeine which is less caffeine then 1 cup of coffee.

I like hot cocoa in the winter time. I have purchased this and am going to keep on as long as amazon has this. I found this at a local grocery store and the price is higher than here. I can save 2 dollars and am happy. The taste is great and I use the middle setting on the machine. This is handy to get in the 24 pack so I do not need to keep ordering and bother the mailman with so many packages. I think If you like hot cocoa and try this you will be satisfied with the taste and the cost as well.

If you like popcorn, chocolate and caramel, you're gonna like this stuff!  A lot!  And if you like those little pre-measured packages with 100 calories or 150 calories, or in this case, 130 calories, you'll really like it.  Each 130 calorie package has 1.06 oz of popcorn with caramel and chocolate drizzled on it.  And it's not the kind of drizzling where you taste a whole lot of popcorn and very little chocolate or caramel.  There's a nice balance and you can really taste it.  The little bags are just the right size to tuck in your purse or briefcase for a quick mid-morning or mid-afternoon pick-me-up snack when you're on the go.  They'd also fit well in lunch boxes, backpacks or tote bags.  Yum!!
summary: Excellent!  Run, don't walk, to get some!

reviewText: These portion controlled treats are like an adult version ofCracker Jack - 24/1.25 oz. bags, replacing peanuts with a chocolate drizzle. I like a combination of salty and sweet, so they hit the spot for me, but other members of the household felt the salt flavor was too strong. We all agreed that the popcorn tasted fresh and the serving size was not too small. As a snack, I'd give it a 4 or 5 star rating depending on the household member rating it. As a 'healthier' option (which Snack Well's promotes) I think it is no better than other candied popcorns on the market. With 5 % total fat (vs 3%) and 13 % saturated (vs 0) I would not always choose it over our preferred candy popcorn brand, despite it tasting much fresher. That said, I would certainly get it for a change of pace, it's a very tasty treat.Ingredients: Brown Sugar, Popcorn, Sugar, Corn Syrup, Palm and/or Palm Kernel Oil, Skim Milk, Cocoa, Whey Powder, Salt, Soybean Oil, Soy Lecithin, Vanilla Extract.Calories 130Calories From Fat 25

We loved Barilla pastas before we were gluten free and were thrilled to see them come out with THIS! It cooks up, and tastes like, regular semolina pasta. It's our favorite and we always have some on hand! Hope they come out with other varieties of pasta in the future!

I am a huge fan of Indian cuisine, and in a bid to reduce my expanding waistline, moved to a more sensible diet plan that focused my lunches around Indian food. I found these in my local grocery and gave them a shot and was quite pleased. Nutritionally much better for you than lots of stuff out there and incredibly better in both nutrition AND taste than anything the fast food palces want to shove down your throat. This particular entree takes only 90 seconds to heat, has a great armoa and flavor, and goes great with the Tasty Bites Rice sides ( I like the Tandoori Rice ), or the Jasmine Rice I make at home. For something quick, delicious, healthy, and not overly expensive, I would recommend this all day. Make sure to watch the pricing on a lot of these meals, they are often much less off the shelf locally, but ocassionally there are some good deals.
summary: Great Entrees, Just Watch Your Pricetags

reviewText: ok so 1.5 LT = 50 oz..@ my sams club i get $3.99 for a 30 pack of spring water.$.13 per 16oz bottle, and its something like $.40625 for spring deer park water compared to $2.00+ for a bottle of this.is it good? yea. does it have a light airyness to it that makes it a little different ? yea. if i made $180k a year and had the $ would i get it? yea..i dont make that much and have a kid.. its similar to my reverse osmosis water (which is better than the spring water i get for running out the door)all in all- this is a good product. better than my RO water, spring water. etc..its "value" is all based on what your financial "values" are..some people buy only organic. some buy half/half. some dont... it just all depends on what u feel your money should be spent.

Delicious!  If you like the vendor type, this is way better and more fresh tasting (without the chance of a dirty vending machine). And the price...what are you waiting for?!  I bought a box for work, huge hit!

Like the title says, I have tried (nearly) all the brands, spent a lot of money, and in the end these are the best Gluten Free Pancakes I've had.I am not happy about the lack of fiber, and the the starchy flours used. But a handful of ground flax seed makes up for that.I am also happy about a brand that helps you to make biscuits and other things from the same mix. Other companies sell biscuits and pizza dough as a separate item, duping the customer to spend even more money.Compared to the many other brands, these do not have a "funny" taste or smell from odd flours. These are made mostly from Rice and Potato flours. You just feel NORMAL.I hope they will come out with a "whole grain" version from Brown Rice and Bean flour.TIP: To get the fluffiest texture use BUTTER instead of oil. Room temperature butter.
summary: I've tried them all--this is the best!

reviewText: I love the Cafe Escapes Vanilla Cafe coffee.  Every morning I make it with caramel syrup and I have my very own Caramel Macchiato!
I like using liquid stevia in drinks because it is easier to regulate than the powdered form. This brand is priced low, but I find I need to use almost twice as much as the SweetLeaf brand.

I've tried Bob's Red mill and...one other.  This is by far the best gluten-free pancake mix I've tried.  I really see no need to try anything else.  Makes me want to go make some just writing about it.

"Snackwell fudge Drizzle Caramel Popcorn" is a good treat for calorie-counting sweet fiends, with each box containing five individually-wrapped portions at 130 calories each. However, I can't distinguish between the fudge and caramel taste...all I get from each bite is an overpowering taste of generic, artificial-tasting sweetness.Still, if you have a strong sweet-tooth and are watching your weight, you'll probably dig this, as the packaging is certainly convenient and the price is fair for what you get.

Very crisp and refreshing.  if you want real juice but no caffeine and not quite the ridiculous sugar-zap of soda, this is the way to go.  It's spendy which detracts from the overall value, but if it every comes down a little, it really is delicious.
I am doing paleo and to get any yummies you need to use coconut or almond flour. This stuff rocks!
Nice refreshing beverage but with 120 cal a bit too sweet.  Good amount of carbonation, though, so very cold it would be great for a summer picnick.
summary: Refreshing, but a tad too sweet

reviewText: Ok, this stuff has lots of sugar as others have said.  I can taste the brown sugar in the flakes and the berries, which there are quite a bit of them, are sour.  To me it balances out.  However, I was surprised how crunchy this cereal is.  I couldn't hear my television and had to turn the volume up several notches while eating this.  Yes, it will soften some while sitting in milk, but that would make the berries disintegrate.  I think I'm going to stick with my Kellogg's Vanilla Almond Nut.
summary: Back to Nature Summer Berry Blend

reviewerName: Dianne E. Socci-Tetro "Never Judge a Book by ...
reviewText: Although this does have an after-taste due to the fact that it is not made with real sugar, it is flavorful enough with peach and tea flavors to over-come the after taste.  Actually I am getting used to the faint non-sugar taste.This is perfect for  adding to a  bottle of water or even to plain  seltzer.  It takes about 3/4 of a TSP. to flavor 8 ounces (about two squirts), but  like a little stronger flavor so I use a bit more.  This  is perfect for me to keep in my handbag and using when I am out and I am unable to get an iced tea.It is also great for those times that you have real iced tea but would prefer a peach twist to it and can't find peach tea or peach juice at the store.

Barilla is making several different microwave meatless pasta dishes. The sauce and the pasta come out very tasty when following the directions on the box. They are handy to take to work for lunch as they do not have to be refridgerated. I don't care for just meatless pasta so I add an italian sausage or a couple of meatballs and this makes a good lunch or snack.
If you buy this because it is gluten free then you know why someone would buy this product. What is surprising is the pancakes are really good. Recommend this good pancake mix.

I used to order 2lb and 5lb bags of coconut flour, but have since come to favor the smaller sizes that these units come in, making the using of the flour before it begins to go stale a lot easier than when I ordered in larger single bulk packages.  The flour is finely milled, with a very smooth texture and pleasant smell and going into my 9th month after the ordering of this the 3rd bag I opened is as fresh and user friendly as the first was.  Come time to restock my coconut flour, I will be using Bob's again, the price is reasonable and the product simply excellent.
This is the cereal I was looking for.  It is just great! I love the crunchy taste and it helps fill me up without being heavy.

The benefit of this drink is that it is "no sugar added, 100% juice," which tastes basically like fruit soda.  I can see it as a good alternative to traditional soda, especially for kids and teens.  However, for adults I think the drink still tastes really sugary, despite the fact that sugar has not been added.  I ran for my toothbrush as soon as I was finished.  However, the taste is good and the kiwi berry was a nice flavor.  For young people with a sweet tooth I would recommend it, but I think grown ups will have a more difficult time jumping on board.

This Breakfast Blend is an extremely smooth, medium roast coffee, plain and simple.  I'm not one for dark-roasted or flavored coffees routinely, and if you're like me, you'll like this coffee.This coffee is so smooth that if you usually use sweetener or milk in  your coffee, you might try it plain or with less sweetener or milk.I actually prefer this brand over the brand I had been using and will look for more in the store.

This Barilla brand meal comes in a microwavable dish and needs no refrigeration or freezing. I have tried other brands and they do not compare too this in taste. Plus the other brands I have tried all required the addition of water too the noodles before microwaving and this does not. Easy too store and cook!The Penne with Marinara Sauce is microwaved in its container for only sixty seconds and the pasta came out just fine. The marinara sauce was flavorful and when mixed made for a fast and delicious meal. I found it enjoyable and as I can no longer lift boiling water this is an excellent alternative. Not as good as home made but much better than canned pasta and other brands of microwavable meals I have tried. I would get this again.
Oh so good. Great when I want a salty crunchy snack.

Convenience is the major perk of Nescafe's Taster's Choice Decaffeinated Gourmet Instant Coffee packets. The taste is good but can't be compared to that of brewed coffee.  Other flavors in the packet line are: original, Vanilla, Colombian, and Hazelnut.My favorite of the bunch is Hazelnut.The small, individual packets are supposed to be mixed with 6 ounces of water. I prefer a larger cup of brew so I use two packages in a large cup or a packet and a half which is harder to judge.At work I fill a large mug with hot water, add one packet of Nescafe instant and one package of powdered hot chocolate mix. That way I get my coffee flavor with the addition of chocolate, sweetener , and milk. It's my Saturday morning regimen and a nice pick me up.Using these small instant coffee packets daily would be more expensive than spooning out instant from a jar. For occasional use and to add a little variety in one's coffee routine, the Taster's Choice packets are a good option.  Though the box and packets are  green, I wouldn't label this an environmentally green product because of the extra packaging.On the side of the package is a graphic  illustrating the roast intensity of the decaffeinated instant. The graphic indicates that this coffee is judged between light and medium.A cup of decaf only has 2 to 5 mg of caffeine.

Chaomomille tea is always my drink of choice at the end of the day because of its calming effects that last well into the night and next day.  While at the grocery store, I saw the tension tamer and thought I would give it a try.I use 3 tea bags in the pot, so after one cup of the tea I am pretty much super relaxed and through for the night.  The tea tastes alright, but the combination with the peppermint makes it taste funny.  Fortunately, I don't drink calming teas for the taste so it doesn't bother me.  Also, I use Splenda in the tea after it is through boiling so it tastes bearable.
summary: Would be better without the peppermint

reviewText: The manufacturer of this Dark French Roast Coffee advertises that it is gourmet coffee with less than half of the acid found in regular coffee. This minimizes, they say, heartburn, acid reflux, and mild stomach irritation. They add that their coffee lacks "the bitterness" found in regular coffee. My wife and I tried the coffee and found no difference in taste between it and the regular store brand coffees.
summary: We found no difference from the taste of store brand coffee

reviewText: *cough**thumbs up*Wow, not too spicy if you nibble, but don't chomp.  Or actually do chomp.  great jerky!  I just hope things go well for me afterwards....

I would consider this on the lighter side of a medium blend.  It has a pleasing aroma and a slightly nutty taste, although I find it somewhat bitter.We're using this in our office with a one-cup-at-a-time coffee maker.  I know that 2 others find the coffee to be somewhat weak and double up on the amount used.Nothing really special, but not bad.

...I found quite versatile and a very good condiment for Marinades, rice dishes and so much more.So far I have made Rotisserie Chicken and Pork Loin, using this as a marinade and reserving some for a dipping sauce.I also used it in a saute of Onions, garlic and Red Cabbage, as a compliment to a pork dish.I really like the contents, but I do wish that the company would use a dispenser style cap, as this plastic bottle has an Open WIDE Mouth, so pouring it straight from the container is awkward and you tend to go overboard.I will be transferring it to more practical dispensers.If you like soy and a sweet tang to your foods, this is worth a try.
summary: Basically a Sweeter, less salty Soy Sauce that...

reviewText: Can't find these in individual size packages locally so this has answered my family's needs.  Have tried most of the varieties, but we prefer the original flavor.

I really enjoy trying new things, so I found the idea of this soda pleasing. It is essentially carbonated fruit juice, so it is naturally high in calories and thus comes in a small container that looks a lot like an energy drink. This might confuse some, leading to negative reviews based on the wrong preconceptions of what it is meant to be. However, I think a very valid complaint comes from some that feel this "natural" drink tastes a bit artificial. This is likely due to the use of fruit juices from concentrate, which always have a more muddled flavor.  Having tried many of the Switch flavors, I find this one, like the watermelon, a bit plain and unexciting for a drink which purports to "switch" my world around.  The flavor really reminds me of strawberry-kiwi Snapple, which isn't a bad thing other than the lack of originality, and the carbonation is very pleasant.  It is an expensive treat, but would make a fun addition to breakfast in lieu of a similarly high calorie cup of orange juice.  If this is your first try at the Switch fruit sodas, I suggest trying the tangerine variety first, as it really better encapsulates the bright flavors of fresh fruit that I think the company is trying to achieve.

I know I can get Asian sweet rice flour somewhat cheaper, and I've tried it.  It comes in boxes that don't reseal or in flimsy plastic bags that I find somewhat difficult to handle.  I find the Bob's Red Mill sweet rice worth the small difference in price.  I trust their products, and the bags are the same as those for their other GF flours - a nice size, and a shape that isn't difficult to handle - I can stand one up on the counter while measuring from it, and don't spill flour all over the place.

I have been a Melitta coffee drinker for several years now.  It's the coffee I drank while living in Germany.  My husband enjoys the Colombian blend every morning.Two things caught my eye when I opened the hermetically-sealed bag: this is truly a dark roast and has a full body aroma, but despite the darkness is a smooth and bitter-free coffee. This blend can not compare to the D'Aquino brand I had been using for espresso. I am impressed. I use it in my espresso machine now for a smooth shot of java in the morning. The grind is a perfect grind for my machine without clogging the spout.My only trouble I had was opening the first bag without ripping the top off. I placed the contents in another tin can to maintain freshness.  If there is one complaint I have about this coffee, it's the packaging!
Surprisingly tasty despite being oven cooked!
summary: Not bad for not being fried

reviewText: this is my blend and I enjoy a couple cups daily along with French vanilla creamer. great with meal or as refreshing calmer
Again it does what it does, measure it out, you make have to make adjustments in the amount, but it works
I make my husband's granola, granola bars, oatmeal etc. We eat a lot of it. So its nice to find organic oats for very reasonable price

These are great! Even though they are 130 compared to most Snackwell's 100 calories, they are so worth the extra 30 calories. They are yummy. Would I say it's so good that I open up both seams of the bag to lay it flat so I can lick the chocolate crumbs out? Maybe. If you are trying to limit your snacking at work or school, these are great. If I don't bring portion controlled food to work, I will eat all of whatever I bring, whether that's a regular bag of chips or a VW bus full of cheetohs.Also if you like having popcorn as a snack without a microwave around, try the smartfood 100 cal bags! I love that white cheddar stuff. I like to bring one of each. I can never eat too much popcorn and this way I can decide "salty or sweet?" Also yes the sugar is high, but caramel is sugar. That's basically what it is, melted slightly "burned" sugar. I found another good way to limit snacking is to bring regular popping pop corn. People will smell it and before you know it your large sized 250 cal bag is suddenly a small handful. If you don't like sharing your popcorn, these are good because they won't attract any "can I have some?" coworkers.
This coffee is a packaged as a dark roast, however, I find the flavor to be more of a medium roast. It is also a bit acidic.

I got a different brand than pictured, but they were intact for the most part, the bag was the same 2.2 lb size, and prepared wonderful chewy pearls! I just drop them in water at a rolling boil, stir them constantly for about 3-5 minutes, then turn the heat to minimum, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes. Then drain, rinse, and soak in a little sugar syrup, honey, and ground ginger while you make your tea or smoothie.

This Switch Kiwi Berry drink comes is as great, easy to handle, streamlined candy.  However, it does delivery an intense, fruit, flavor.  Great when you really need a sweet fruit recovery from a hot summer day.  Otherwise, a bit overpowering. A nice treat though.

This delicious tea has become a bedtime ritual for my family. With its wonderful fragrance and lovely, mellow taste, this Camomile classic hasn't made any of us actually sleepier, but it does seem to aid deeper, more pleasant sleep through the night -- or maybe it's just wishful dreaming. Either way, a yummy bedtime treat which doesn't require any sweetener.

price is too high though, even on subscribe and save, I can get them cheaper from the local organic grocery store, let alone discount super centers...the product however is fantastic, start early, and go until they are 4.  nothing like a quick snack they can feed themselves after they get old enough, especially such a healthy one and one they have been having since a baby.

While hiking on Santa Rosa Island in Channel Islands National Park, my wife and I tried this new bar.  What a gem.  Hiking bars tend to by dry and often include an overkill of sugar.  This bar, on the other hand is at once moist and filling.  The insistance on using all organic ingredients will undoubtedly raise the price, but the flavor is worth it.My only concern is that sometimes, after a product becomes popular, manufacturers will substitute less expensive ingredients.  And I do expect this bar to become popular.
So nice to be able to shop on line for this product. Live in a small area, the stories do not carry chia seeds.

We frequent Whole Foods and love to buy the larger "Pop Chips" that they make. They are about 7 inches across and so unbelievable crispy! We like to eat them more for fun than anything.So when I was offered a chance to try these PopChips, I was excited. The size of each chip is about that of a potato chip. The bag is 100 calories (3 Weight Watchers +Points if you are calculating).The first thing I noticed is the sweet, followed by salty of the chip. Second is the crunch that is oh-so satisfying! My 5 year old just loved them while my 8 year old wasn't so hip to the flavor.There is a distinct sweet potato flavor, where the sweet comes in. There are also some other spices that I can't place, but the taste is not spicy hot, is considerably salty. I like them a lot and will continue to buy them to satisfy that late night or mid afternoon need for a crispy, salty snack.

The bottom shelf of my refrigerator is full of different flours.  Sometimes when I think about baking something, I don't because it is a hassle to pull out so many different flours.  Bob's Red Mill gluten-free flour makes it easier because it is pre-mixed.  I have used it in my regular pancake recipe--just added a little xanthan gum.  I have been satisfied with it in other recipes I have tried.  However, because it has bean flour, I would avoid eating the raw dough.

If you've never grown your own sprouts, you're missing something wonderful. Takes a few days, but the taste is incomparable and they're always fresh. Note that you don't need any fancy sprouting equipment; you can do just as well with a jar, some cheesecloth, and a rubber band.
summary: Fresher and cheaper than grocery store sprouts

reviewText: Less plastic waste than traditional k cups (YAY!), a great bold taste, organic, and more affordable than many k cups. SOLD!

I was unimpressed with SWITCH WATERMELON/STRAWBERRY. It's just another entry into the sparkling juice market--a market that really didn't need another brand, especially not one lacking in anything new or interesting.Like all the other sparkling juice drinks, its flavor comes mostly from apple and grape juice concentrates; the flavors on the label are only a small part of the ingredients list. The result is that this doesn't really taste like watermelon OR strawberry.  Instead, it fits some food scientist's "flavor profile" of those two tastes, kind of watermelon-ish, kind of strawberry-ish, but lacking in both. The flavor is just not anything to shout about, and no better than the other products on the market.I'm also not sure why it's called SWITCH. I guess it's a marketing thing--they want people to "switch" from IZZE or whatever they currently drink. Well, I know that *I* won't be switching anytime soon, at least not for this boring, low-quality drink.

Don't expect an oreo covered in chocolate--This is a different cookie altogether. It consists of a thin chocolate wafer topped with a layer of creamy peanut butter. Then the whole cookie is covered in a layer of chocolate fudge.I enjoyed the cookie. Even though it was rich and delicious, the cookie itself seemed like a lighter snack than the typical heavy Oreo sandwich cookie. (Plus not as crumbly). It had the perfect combination of softness and crunch. The taste was similar to a peanut butter cup candy with an added crunch.Next time I'll try the Mint Fudge Creme. It sounds divine!These are great for an indoor snack; however, I'd be cautious taking them to an outdoor picnic. I haven't tried it, but they may just turn into a melted mess!When I opened the box, a few of the cookies had shifted and broken in transit, but it was just a few in the middle row. Not enough to bother me, but just be aware of this when ordering online.
summary: Peanut Butter Lovers--This Cookie is for You!

reviewText: I was looking for a dark roast of decaf coffee for nighttime consumtion. I use Timothy's columbian decaf for my vanilla flavoring coffee but it is too weak to stand on it's own. This one fits the bill just fine.

Broccoli sprouts are expensive, but mix well with alfalfa,radish,and clover to lower the cost, and retain nutrition/health..  Organic, 100% germination, reasonable cost, and (best of all)  great tasting= a good value.
Added this to beef stew and it really perked it up ... very tasty.  It also tastes good alone.  I will order it frequently.

First of all it send the most delicious aroma throughout the house…then while it's perking into your mug, a fresh scent wafts into your nostrils making you salivate!  Don't lean to close to inhale, it could splatter and burn your nose!  The taste is heaven sent!

These were fantastic. My wife and kids loved them and we quickly polished off the package--within a few days. What is nice is that they are not too heavy. You can eat a few for enjoyment, but don't find yourself too stuffy or full. And it seems there is a perfect blend of fudge and peanut butter, where neither overwhelms the other. My wife and daughter are chocolate lovers, but they enjoyed the nice blend with peanut butter. I'm more of a PB guy, but I enjoyed the mix with chocolate. We love these and will continue to purchase them.
summary: Where Have You Been All My Life?

reviewText: I enjoy a bold coffee.  This is one of the best.  Rich flavor, no bite.  Great aroma, especially that first cup in the morning.

I tried this product through Amazon Vine, as have many other reviewers here.  Personally, I liked the flavor ... it was a little on the sweet side, but for me the carbonation added a nice bite that complemented the taste and kept the drink from being too one-note.  As others have noted, the drink is more strawberry than watermelon in flavor, but overall I liked it.It was interesting to read others' reviews, as many people focused on the drink's calorie and sugar content.  I personally do not look at nutrition labels, but from others' reviews it appears that this drink will have a difficult time winning more health-conscious consumers.  I imagine the target audience is more the "it has fruit on the label and is 100% juice, so it must be healthy" crowd.  Suckers like me, in others words!  The problem is that even for consumers like me, as someone who rarely drinks soda and would much rather just have water, it needed to be a five-star drink in order to make a convert of me, and it just wasn't at that level.  Since I got it through Amazon Vine, the product was free, but I don't know that I'd go out of my way to buy it again.In the end, I thought it was pretty good, but just another pretty label on a crowded grocery store shelf.  From the reviewers here, it appears that it might be healthier than cola ... but it's not really "healthy".  I guess I'll just stick with water to quench my thirst!
summary: Personally I liked it, but won't go out of my way to buy it

reviewText: This Community Coffee definitely has a strong vanilla flavor. It's something I tend to like, but those who dislike flavored coffee will probably hate it, as the vanilla smell goes everywhere while this stuff is brewing. The taste itself is quite bitter, and it doesn't blend particularly well with the vanilla. Strong coffee and strong vanilla isn't the greatest mix, but it isn't the worst either.It might be quite good with a lot of milk.
summary: A bitter taste with a strong vanilla smell

reviewText: Although this is not the Golden Oreo, this addition to the Oreo family is certainly tasty if not healthy. What we have here is what appears to be an original Oreo cookie topped with a layer of peanut butter covered with chocolate. While this little delight is not as peanut-buttery as say a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup, it has a great texture and flavor. It is perfectly fine to like this latest sweetie and still remain loyal to the original Oreo that we have all come to love with a glass of cold milk, in a pie crust or nestled inside a cheesecake. It is not wonder that the original is considered-- I believe-- the world's favorite cookie.If you are avoiding fat and sugar, however, beware as this cookie is high in both.

I have been eating Annie Chun's Express Rice for a very long time now. I have tried other brands and they are not as tasty or perfectly sticky like Annie Chun's.I do the auto-shipping through Amazon, so the price is less then most of the other like rices I've tried.It is cheaper to buy through Amazon's auto-shipping, then buying in the stores. It's fast and easy.You're given the opportunity to stop shippment, add or reduce quanity being shipped, change the date of shippment or cancel  future orders and shipping all together.My entire family and friends love this rice! So yes, I would recommend to all!It's fast, easy and taste great! I have also tried the white and used to make sushi, it's great!
summary: Annie Chun's Rice Express Sprouted Brown Sticky Rice!

reviewText: I am a big fan of Sorghum flour for my baked goods. It gives everything a bit of sponge (especially cakes) and adds an extra bit of sweet to the baking. I highly recommend this for baking flour mixes - you may not want to add it to savory recipes though because of the light sweet flavor.
You get a lot of seeds for the price.  I don't think I will life long enough to use all of the seeds.  This is a good product.
summary: Better find a friend to share this with.  Lots of seeds!

reviewText: One thing I don't like about low calorie sweeteners is the taste. Most have this alcohol-like after taste which I can't really take. The Yacon Syrup doesn't have any weird alcohol-like taste which is nice. Although it's not as sweet as granulated sugar (which is our usual sugar at home), I loved mixing it to my lemon water. It tasted nice. It actually tasted a bit like honey for me. I like that it's low in calories and I also like that it didn't make my stomach upset.

Almost as good as the top selling original Donut Shop (extra bold). You sure can't beat the price--unless you buy the 50 count box for 40 cents each k-cup. My only complaint is typical of Caza Trail-at times too many coffee grounds wind up in the cup--something about the filter inside coming loose?
summary: Good daily coffee at a great price!

reviewText: I got the Peanut Butter version of these things. I like how they call it "Crème" - like it's some sort of fancy parisian pastry. C'mon guys, this is America! CREAM. "Crème" is not something I wanna see in my kitchen cabinet!-Let's get down to business. So, what are these things? Well, they are like 1/2 of an Oreo cookie dipped in chocolate. And by half, I mean literally, half. They are composed of three elements: 1) A thin cookie - this is about half the thickness of the standard oreo cookie layer. 2) A thin layer of "Crème". Can I call it cream? No? Well it's literally 1/2 the thickness of the filling inside a normal oreo. 3) Chocolate covering.-I love peanut butter and chocolate. It is like the perfect gluttonous combination. These come close to hitting the mark.These things are thin, overall, so you think "Boy I am not getting too fat eating these" but in reality you at half the box standing there with your milk - so really who are you kidding? But I do like that they are thin. If you posess the willpower, you can have one or two and not feel like you ate a brick.-Taste: I like them well enough. I do personally feel the peanut butter flavoring could be stronger. BUT, they still have that addictive quality we have all come to know and love with Oreo products.Texture: I gotta tell you, I found these things to be slightly greasy. I did not mind it so much, but still they felt a little weird. But this is such a minor point because they are still awesome with milk.-So overall, I did really like them. Addictive, a little greasy, but still a bona-fide Oreo product.

I have a glass of this tea every night before bed. It tastes great and is calming like most Twinings teas I have tried. I can usually get two small glasses of tea out of one K-Cup- Still tastes good and strong ;)

reviewerName: Gertrude, the Innocent "Live well, laugh loud...
reviewText: This sandwich cookie has a really pleasant lemony flavor that is exactly right - not too sweet and not too tart.  I am pretty much the only one in my house who likes them a lot. It's not one that my husband or the children like, unless they are in a pinch for a snack. Then all of a sudden, these cookies are perfect.Left with one line of lemon cookies, I admit to hiding them. Someone had to.

If it is possible to fall madly in love with a box of chocolates, then the assortment is the perfect place to start such an adventure. These chocolate are named after Leonidas Kestekidis, who definitely knew how to create chocolates for the true chocolate connoisseur.When he moved back to Belgium he not only married his true love, he created chocolates the world now adores. When you taste these chocolates, your taste buds will also finally know true chocolate happiness. Whether you try one of these with a cup of coffee or tea or enjoy one as a daily indulgence, these will impress.If being "in love" gives you a zest for life, then the "I Love You" chocolate with dreamy lemon filling embodies this sentiment. Each chocolate has a unique design and the I Love You chocolate has two hearts, ribbons and a seal. After you sample the variety of chocolates, specific flavors will stand out as favorites.Here are my favorite creamy fillings (ganache and butter cream) which come in dark, white and milk chocolate depending on the selection (dark if you order this box):Antoinette - A smooth Brandy flavored ganacheLingoit Lait - Absolutely delicious vanilla flavored fresh butter cream filling. Time definitely stopped while tasting this chocolate.Irrésistible - Dark chocolate and Strawberry sauce.For ever - If you love coffee this may be one of the most delicious milk or dark chocolate chocolates ever made as it is filled with a special coffee cream that has hints of caramel. I ordered an entire box of these and they come in a variety of flavors. The milk chocolate and cherry filling is like Claude Debussy's Rverie. It is difficult to describe besides saying it is like a delicate cherry icing wrapped in milk chocolate.Merveilleux - Milk or dark chocolate filled with coffee ganache.Europe - Dark or milk chocolate filled with rum filling.Ganache - Milk or dark chocolate with pure ganache.Tosca - Milk chocolate with a special ganache.Poésie - Dark chocolate and a Cointreau filling.Antoinette - Delicate caramel hints in the milk chocolate coating mingle nicely with the vanilla filling.Eve - Milk or dark chocolate with a creamy dreamy banana filling.Alexandre le grand - A milk or dark chocolate with caramel cream.Also Recommended:If you wish to also try the Napolitains, I'd suggest the 1 pound sampler Ballotin with six varieties. You may also want to look for the new Palet d'Or. A deeply delicious and strong bitter chocolate filled with ganache. The center is made with butter, cream and chocolate and the outer coating is a masterpiece with gold decorations.Leonidas now has over 1700 stores and sales locations worldwide and they offer over 80 varieties of fresh chocolates. The chocolates are air freighted weekly from Brussels so you will always find the quality to be superior.My chocolates arrived fast and were as fresh as if I had purchased them in Belgium. They were carefully packaged in the famous gold boxes with signature/seasonal wrapping and a ribbon. The boxes were then placed in protective Styrofoam containers to protect the chocolates during shipping. The expedited shipping is recommended from May to early September.~The Rebecca Review

I picked this up at my local grocery store in the seasonal aisle [with the Easter goodies].This moist cake mix can be made with or without eggs. I used them, and wasn't the least bit disappointed.I paired the cake with Pilsbury's Pink Lemonade frosting, too. But you could have it totally un-frosted if you'd like! You will still love it!Perfect for the family dessert, children's cupcakes, or a lovely addition to the ladies afternoon tea! If you love pink lemonade you are going to love this!The color just screams Spring and Easter! And the taste will leave you screaming for another bite!I give this 5-stars and my thumbs up!

The sample came fast.  But then I read the label!  WOW!  I am sure it tastes fine.  I have only opened the packet to smell it.  But after reading the un-tested ingredients I will not be using this.  I went online and looked up all the parts of the EBOOST Blend:Green tea leaf extract, glucuronolactone, 5-HTP, Huperzine-A, vinpocetine, Astragalus membranaceus extract, and grape seed extract.There are too many unknows about these key ingredients to think it would be ok to consume them together.  Plus, natural flavors leaves it open to whatever they want.  It seems to be a cross between an energy boost and a weight loss boost.I would check out the ingredients before using this.  Check out Zenergize.  I use that since I can easily know what the ingredients are.  Only 2 calories per serving and a recyclable container.

I can honestly sayThe Switch's Watermelon Strawberry flavoris terrible.It has 4 main ingredients1. Carbonated water2. these juice concentrates - Strawberry, Watermelon, Grape, Acerola, And Apple3. Natural Flavors4. Vitamin CYet TheWatermelon Strawberry flavoris terrible and tastes too artificial. You'd think with all these natural, real ingredients, It would taste real. All I basically tasted was the Watermelon. It's flavor overpowered the Strawberry flavor. Sorry, I can't recommend this flavor

This tea provides a luscious and refreshing break from your daily grind and helps you relax as well. It's got a great lemon taste to it that is not overpowering and if you let it steep about three minutes you're bound to enjoy it as much as I do!Each bag contains the natural ingredients of dried whole lemons with hibiscus, rosehips, and lemon grass. There are no artificial ingredients! The stringless tea bags can easily be removed from your cup whenever you want simply by using a spoon to get them out. I also recommend using to spoon to stir the tea bag around and up and down a bit while it's in your cup before you drink it.The tea is also gluten free, which is a plus for those of us who don't want gluten in our diets. It is decaffeinated, too, which is something I always prefer.If you like a lemon flavor to your tea, this is highly recommended! Enjoy!  SMILES
summary: A really nice way to start your day, take a break during your day, or even end your day!

reviewText: Smooth and mellow is how I would describe this coffee.  With low acidity and a mild demeanor, it has both fruity and smoky qualities that are sure to upset no one.  On the contrary, some people may find this coffee too benign and may feel the need to switch it up with a more robust roast at times.  For the most part, however, this coffee would be fine to serve at large gatherings where different tastes need to be accommodated and is certainly well suited for a breakfast blend.I drink my coffee black and without any sweetener and found this blend to be mild and pleasant.  I used a good quantity of coffee in each 12-cup pot so I did not notice any watery attributes or weakness.The flavor and body were good for a breakfast blend though after a while I did miss my more robust roast.  For the purpose of helping one wake up and easing into the morning grind, this coffee and it's mellow nature does the job.
So hard to believe that these are good for you. Wish I had bought more. Chewy, tasty, and good enough to make you feel like you aren't missing anything by giving up gluten.

A healthier natural alternative to the .30 Ramen on the market.  I love them but if you are not into natural / vegan products, you should stick to the cheap version and save the money.  They are good and easy to prepare with a long shelf life.  Convenient to have on hand.  The seasoning pack is very flavorful.  I do recommend them to others.
summary: Better flavor, better for you and Vegan

reviewText: This is the best honey I ever bought. Period. I will absolutely buy it again. It is cheaper in price than the junk honey you get in the grocery store. I will continue to buy this honey as long as Amazon stocks it.  I was slightly concerned about 4 bottles of honey getting to my house without leaking, but it arrived well packed and without one drop leaking. Do yourself a favor and try it. You won't be disappointed.Update: Since posting this the price of the honey has jumped 5 bucks. Still not a bad deal but not the great deal it used to be.

Riviera Sunset Decaffinated Coffee, from the Melitta Café Collection, is a good coffee for that first, morning cup of coffee.  It is a South American blend for those who prefer a brighter more acidic kind of brew, but is still well balanced and make s a fine cup of Java.The coffee comes in an attractive,  black bag with a bag with the now ubiquitous air valve.  The folks at Melitta know how to compact coffee for travel--all ambient air was sucked out of the bag, shrinking the usual size of the 10 ounces from its expected size, to a small, dense brick.  Cutting open the bag, there was an audible hiss as the bag seemed to expand to double its size.  The aroma was intoxicating--think deep coffee with chocolate hints and with nothing acrid about it.  The bag does not indicate the level of the roast, but on inspection the coffee appears to be a darker roast (somewhere between a `full city' and European).  The bag states that this is an extra fine grind, but on inspection it seems to be less powdery than you'd want for fine espresso, and is more of a fine grind.  This, I imagine, is meant a compromise so that the coffee is suitable for both the common drip coffee machines that use a filter or could be used with an espresso machine.For some reason, the instructions indicate that you should use two level teaspoons for every six ounces of water.  I'm not sure how they drink coffee in Europe, but in the US coffee machines measure by the cup.  This leads to a bizarre ~2.7 teaspoons of coffee per cup and (to my taste) a slightly weak cup of coffee.  In spite of the grind, I'd stick with the usual 1 tablespoon per cup proportion for your drip coffee maker and work up from there.  Your intuition should serve you well, and I'd stick with your usual measurements (I'm one of those `heaping' tablespoon per cup guys).The coffee definitely shows its South American origins.  In spite of the darkness of the roast and richness of the aroma, the coffee once  brewed is more light, breakfasty, and slightly more acidic than I imagined it would be. Given the type of coffee that it is, it also might have benefited from a slightly lighter roast. Still, it is a well balanced South American blend.  It lacks the distinctiveness of a single origin coffee but given that it is a blend has a more rounded, less biting flavor.  Although decaffeinating can sometimes sap the bold flavors of a coffee, this coffee still has a lot of personality and a distinctive taste.This is not for the pure coffee lover who likes a dark, earthy, and oily cup of java that can basically stand on its own.  This coffee is more for people who like to add a lot of buffer--a fair amount of milk and sugar or one of those Torani syrups (e.g.Torani Syrup, Vanilla, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)) for a little extra flavor, for those who like those kind of things.  It also makes a great iced coffee.  If cold brewed, the coffee loses its tannic edge and is more smooth and sweet, but also loses a little personality in the process. (I did not try using this in an espresso machine as I do not have one, but I don't think that it would yield a great espresso.  Concentrated, I think the acidity might become overwhelming.)All in all, this is a fine blend of coffee at a fine price.  With a little experimentation on the proportions, it yields a fine cup of breakfast coffee.
summary: A fine breakfast coffee for your drip coffee maker

reviewText: These tasty new Peanut Butter Fudge Cream Oreo cookies have the same look as Girl-scout 'Thin Mint' cookies.  Each cookie is like a single chocolate top of a standard Oreo cookie - but with a dollop of peanut butter, then dipped in fudge.  They are quite delicious - and are 3 to a portion.Some nutritional info:Calories 170 (80 from fat), Cholestorol 0MG, Sodium 100MG, Potassium 80MG, Total Carbs 23G, Protein 2G.Of course, those with nut allergies should avoid this product.The flavor is very good, and they go very well with milk.Give them a try, you won't be disappointed.
summary: Tasty New Twist On An Old Favorite

reviewText: EBOOST is billed as a "Daily Health Booster" - 5 calories of Energy, Immunity, Recovery and Focus (the "vital elements of performance") and comes in a little packet of powder to be mixed with 8 oz. of water - similar to Emergen-C. And EBOOST is supposed to behave in the same way that Emergen-C does, by giving you a strong dose of various vitamins and minerals which is supposed to help prevent sickness and provide energy.The Look/Taste/Smell: This particular pink lemonade flavor looks mostly pink with a slight orange shading. It smells like pink lemonade and tastes mostly like pink lemonade but with a strong vitamin undertone that's not entirely pleasant. I'd say Emergen-C doesn't necessarily taste better than EBOOST but it doesn't taste as strongly of vitamins.I decided to try EBOOST in the morning instead of coffee or tea to see what the effects would be and I did find myself feeling a bit more focused and "energetic" - I work at a desk so you can't really get that energetic, but I was feeling more intense and interested in my work as well as more awake. It doesn't have the same morning boost as coffee but you can't expect that from a powdered vitamin drink. (And coffee doesn't boost your immune system). I'd say it's a decent supplement for stronger caffeine-filled drinks.Overall I'd probably still choose Emergen-C over EBOOST on a normal basis based on the taste alone, but if I was looking for something to give me a morning jolt along with my immune system boost I'd go with EBOOST instead of Emergen-C, as I've never felt particularly energized by Emergen-C.
summary: Seems to do everything it says it will - like Emergen-C plus caffeine

reviewText: Standing on it's own, this is not a bad cookie.Being branded as an Oreo Cookie works against it, since it sets up expectations that this cookie just doesn't deliver on. It's a thin little thing, roughly the size of a Girl Scout Thin Mint cookie, and they're oddly packaged. They could probably fit twice as many in a pack if the redesigned things a bit. As it is, the cookies arrived jostled and tossed around in the package. Those little slots didn't hold them, so get rid of them and put more cookies.Taste wise, they're not bad......they remind me very much of a Peanut Butter Kit Kat or a Tagalong. I don't know if I'd rush out and buy more, but they were enjoyable enough.

I ordered these from the Vine program and Peanut Butter Fudge Cremes arrived instead of the Golden Oreos--so this review is for the Peanut Butter Fudge Cremes.If you are looking for a snack cookie, these probably will fulfill your craving for a sweet snack. If you are looking for a dessert cookie, these cookies would probably be okay if served at home. These cookies just don't make the palate tasting grade. The primary flavor is peanut butter and I was hard pressed to say I tasted any fudge. The chocolate seemed to taste a bit waxy and not the smooth rich flavor one associates with Oreo.I would suggest you skip these cookies and go for something with a better marriage of chocolate and peanut butter--perhaps aHershey Reeses Peanut Butter Cup, 1.5 ounces Boxes (Pack of 36)?
summary: Not what one expects from Oreo

reviewText: I use this product everyday in my shake of Amazing Grass Super Food (chocolate flavor) and almond milk.  I used to use regular PB2, but once I saw the chocolate flavor I ordered it and love it.

Received my order today and within minutes had a can open.  For years we have only eaten Brunswick Kippers but am having trouble finding them in area stores.  The last two cans we bought were different from what we always ate.  Watery, less flavor and odd pieces of fish.
