Mother Earth has very good products that work well whether you are camping, prepping or simply want good wholesome vegetables on hand when you cant get to the store.

I splurged when I bought this, a gluten-free mix for chocolate cake.  So I bought one 4-pack.  I haven't compared this to my own from scratch chocolate cake, so I don't know how it compares, but it does make a great cake!  It is expensive, comes to something like $3.89 per 1 lb mix, but so is everything that is gluten-free.  If you are an occasional baker and you need for it to be gluten-free, try this one.  I'm pretty sure you'll like it.Even at this price, I doubt that you could beat it elsewhere.I recommend it.Hazel

Quaker Instant Oatmeal Cinnamon & Spice flavor is not too bad for instant oatmeal.  You see, I love oatmeal, but I love non-instant way more than instant.  In a pinch, this packaged instant oatmeal would be a good go-to.  The Cinnamon & Spice flavor is not too strong but still a good flavor.I give this product 3 stars mainly because of my prejudice against instant oatmeals in general.
These are so easy to prepare, and taste amazing! The soup base didn't taste too fishy to me, but I eat seaweed as a snack all the time, so take my tastebuds with a grain of salt (har har)!

I always have a case or two of Maruchan ramen in the pantry. Their shrimp flavor is especially good. I always drain the soup off the noodles before I serve them. I especially like it with some spinach sauteed with an onion and a head of garlic -- seriously, try it, it's remarkably flavorful and costs next to nothing. Or just the noodles with some chopped green onion to dress them up. Or with a little curry powder. I've tried Top Ramen in the past but prefer Maruchan.

Have tried many brands but one can is usually the last can since these oysters from China just don't look good or taste good at all. I dump any oil that is in any can of fish anyway, even the ones with EVOO since that is where the salt and additives linger around, but regardless the main dish, in this case oysters have never been any good.

We love Asian food so I was sure we'd love Nong Shim Hoo Roo Rook noodles - and we do!  They are simple rice noodles with separate packets of soup base powder, soup base paste and vegetable flakes, but unlike ramen noodles they are MSG free and not fried.  They cook in the microwave in a couple of minutes and are a great snack or small meal without any embellishment.  Cook them in a pot on the stove, add some meat and vegetables and they are a healthy, filling meal.  We love adding chopped bok choy or spinach, frozen shrimp or pre-cooked beef or chicken chunks, and some bean sprouts.  Add a squeeze of lime juice and some cilantro and you won't believe how delicious they are.  Because they are portioned into small packets you can decide how many to cook.  When you buy rice noodles at a grocery store or Asian store, they come in one big block that is often too much for one meal.They are quite a bit more expensive than ramen noodles, but it's not fair to compare the two when ramen noodles are about as cheap and unhealthy as you can go.  I'd rather pay more (these noodles are a dollar per pack) and have healthy, tasty food.What I like best about these noodle packs is that they don't go rancid on a pantry shelf.  Because the noodles aren't fried, they store well for several years. The individual packets are mylar (metallic plastic), which also protects the noodles from humidity. If you like keeping food stored for emergencies, these are wonderful.
summary: Healthier than ramen noodles and good for long term storage

reviewText: I'm originally from Singapore, and I used to have these for tea-time (around 4 in the afternoon) with my family (a common practice back where I'm from). When we moved to the States seven years ago, I looked all over for these tea biscuits and finally found them at an upscale grocery store, selling for much more than its retailing on this site. I've been buying it from the grocers all this while mainly because I'm concerned at the packaging issues mentioned by many reviewers here.These biscuits, though extremely tasty (sweet but not overly so, and great for dunking), are also prone to crumbling. The mildest pressure will see the biscuit crumble into itty bitty little pieces so if this is being shipped to customers, the packaging has to be able to protect the biscuits and prevent crumbling. The biscuits themselves are superior in quality and taste, no complaints!
summary: These biscuits are a staple in my home

reviewText: Cascadian farms parent company contributed to the millions spent to defeat the simple label GMO prop 37  in California. They have betrayed the people and are now being Boycotted. Its a shame my family loved your products but your parent company betrayed the American people. Boycott Cascadian farms and all their products until they contribute to the Label campaigns in Vermont and Washington state to redeem themselves. No GMO's for my children. GMO's have been proven to cause organ failure and massive cancerous tumor growth. Most countries now Label them or have outright banned them.

... you will never buy brown rice again. Love this whole grain black rice, also known as "forbidden rice". It tastes nothing like brown or white rice. It has an intense nutty almost chocolatey flavor. I can eat this plain as a meal, it is that good! Popular in Chinese, Thai and Japanese cooking. The grains are long and slender when dry but the rice plumps up sweet and sticky. Use in savory dishes as you would short grain brown rice or in desserts like rice puddings. I find it needs more water than the 1:2 ratio. It also helps to soak the rice overnight or at least 8 hours. Be sure to tend to it while it cooks as I often find myself having to add more liquid, unless you're using a pressure cooker.There are two different types of black rice. The more common variety is white on the inside and only the outer hull is black. I felt like I hit the jackpot when I ordered this and realized this is the far more rare variety of Chinese black rice with both outer hull and inside grain being black. Black rice contains the same antioxidants as blueberries, which gives it its color and is therefore more nutritious than brown rice.The bag contains the recipe for a traditional Japanese dish, black rice with sweet potatoes and scallions, one of my favorite recipes. I boil the rice in Japanese dashi, stock made with bonito flakes, kombu seaweed and dried shiitakes.I also like preparing slow cooker rice pudding with coconut milk and a hint of almond extract. Delicious both warm and cold, with a sprinkle of Chinese 5 spice.

This Taco Bell Jalapeno Sauce is good on taco salad and as a dip, having a fairly mild jalapeno flavor and being only slightly spicy. The sauce is smooth and creamy and should be shaken before use as it definitely settles a bit.I would have preferred a more pronounced jalapeno flavor and a little more "heat" but, as it is, the whole family can enjoy it as a good tasting sauce to augment normal taco toppings.Recommended!CFH
I like the mini pretzels and the large tub container. The pretzel flavor is great, crunchy and I do recommend this one!
I use these Goji Berries in my smoothie every morning.  I hydrate them for 10 minutes and pour into my smoothie mix.

Somewhere in my late teens or early adulthood I declared myself a Popcorn Purist.  After having been to too many movies and had popcorn with that weird syrupy 'butter', I thought enough is enough!  Henceforth, I would only consume popcorn with a little salt and perhaps a little real butter as well.Until, before too long, I was coerced into eating kettle corn at a carnival, and of course I loved it.And now I'm trying the Kernel Season's Cheesy Seasoning Variety Pack.  While I was worried that my popcorn would be overwhelmed by artificial cheesy weirdness, all three of these flavors are actually very tasty when applied in the appropriate ratio.  The White Cheddar is my favorite, but when my wife walked in on an unlabeled bowl I had seasoned with the Garlic Parmesan, she just kept taking more and more and finally said... "why is this so delicious?!"Popcorn is a healthy snack which has been rendered unhealthy in a zillion different permutations (the horrors of 'movie theater microwave popcorn', for instance), and seasoning your own popcorn is a good way to see how addicted you might be to salt...  These seasonings have around 75mg sodium, or a modest 3% of DV in a serving; HOWEVER, HOWEVER, HOWEVER. this is in "1/4 teaspoon".  The directions say "sprinkle 1 capful onto freshly popped popcorn and shake well".  ONE CAPFUL IS AT LEAST 10 "SERVINGS".  At least!  So, sure, you'll be sharing that bowl with 9 other people, so no biggie.  But you can see how easy it is to max out on sodium.  The great thing about this type of additive is, of course, that you can control how much you add!  So far our gang is getting by with much less than the recommended amount.I look forward to trying these mellow, cheesy flavors out on different foods ("potatoes, fries, pasta, eggs, vegetables and more" are recommended), and pretty much livin' life on easy street from here on out.
summary: Hinting at cheesy goodness is easy!

reviewText: I have had these seasonings in the past and have been very pleased. This assortment of cheese variety meets the mark. The Garlic Parmesan gives popcorn an Italian flavor that's very good. Nacho and White Cheddar has been good before and still are. I am very happy with this three pack from Kernel Season's. Recommended.

I'm not a great cook, so we wind up eating a lot of burgers and fries in our house. Instead of picking up fast food, I prepare frozen burger patties and fries in the oven. I tried some of this Taco Bell Jalapeno Sauce tonight on the burgers and as a dip for the fries instead of the usual ketchup and mustard. It really woke up the taste and made a normally boring meal a little bit special.I don't know which particular thickening agents are responsible for mouth-feel in a dressing, but I tend to dislike whatever Kraft uses in their salad dressings and sauces; they tend to feel almost slimey or gummy (for lack of a better word) on my tongue with a decidedly "plastic" (i.e., overly processed/fake-food) taste. (And forget the low-fat versions of anything; I'd rather do without than have to taste those!) I prefer the taste and mouth-feel of Ken's salad dressings (especially the 0-carb Creamy Caesar), so if you are familiar with both of these products, maybe the following will make sense to you:The Taco Bell Jalapeno Sauce is a lot closer to the mouth-feel of Ken's than to Kraft, but it still has something in it with a bit of that gummy feel to it. It's not nearly as "plastic"-tasting, though, and it's quite tasty on hamburgers I think. It's not scorching hot, but it's got a bit of a kick to it. It pairs well with a slice of raw onion. I actually like it better thinned with a little Duke's mayonnaise, but only because that cuts down even more on the slight gumminess.I expect we'll buy more.
So I add additional raisins when I have them.  I hope the Cascade Farms reads this and adds the raisins.  I feel cheated each time I open the box.
summary: :Love it, but they're strangly stingy with the raisins.

reviewText: I buy Bob's Red Mill as much as I can. Love their products -- all of them. Some I like more than others, but all are superior to anything ive ever found by other producers. I eat quite a bit of granola and this is some of the best. Only thing i dont like about the Honey Almond variety as apposed to the apple blueberry or other mixes, this granola is very loose. no clusters. makes hand snacking challenging. I end up cutting a corner of the bag and pouring it into my mouth. it gets 4 stars due to the difficult hand snacking. if more clusters, 5 stars no doubt.the flavor is on point. really makes Bob's Red Mill steel cut oats pop!

My 1 year old just got his first teeth last week. I got some of these teething biscuits on sale to try them out; wasn't expecting him to love them so much! He squeals in excitement when I pull one out! :-) They keep my little guy busy if I need to finish cooking dinner or something else; they last him at least 5-10 minutes per cracker. I really like that these biscuits don't crumble or make a mess, and don't break off in large chunks (rather they get softened & "chewed" down). I appreciate the fact that they are organic and have some veggies in them. I highly recommend them!
This is a great all purpose oil we use for many of our frying needs.  I regularly mix this with olive oil to create an oil that has a great flavor and a higher smoke point.

I would definitely recommend these awesome wafers to all parents of tots that are in the process of teething. They are gentle to the gums but at the same time it gives a gentle massage and they enjoy them very much.
summary: Yummy treats for babies and their gums

reviewText: I also modify the recipe but then I modify most recipes.  However, I love this product for it's versatility.  Chocolate chip cookies, yep;  Surprise Jelly muffins, that too;  Brownies, you bet; crepes, oh my what a hit with the family; yeast rolls and so much more.  I order this on the Subscribe & Save and am glad they offered it.  When I need buns I make my pancakes a little thicker and use them as bread.  My family say they like the Surprise Muffins best then pancakes and they love pancakes any time of day.
summary: Best I have used with Modification

reviewText: i love this "new" find. i've never used dry orange peel before. it adds sweetness and wonderful subtle orange flavor. it's a must have for my pantry and i'll be buying it again.
summary: why didn't i know about this sooner

reviewText: Maca root is a healing root vegetable and this brand is a good buy. Slightly vanilla caramel taste and great in my morning shake. 1 to 1.5 tsp in 2 cups liquid and 2 cup fruits / vegetable
My partner who is not sensitive to gluten loves these too. Easy to make and absolutely delicious. I've re-ordered this product many times!

The taste of Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa is so good, it's hard to resist. But, since it's such a good source of calcium, we have the perfect excuse to enjoy it, anyway! Not only is it good mixed as per the package directions, it's fabulous added to a mug of hot coffee -- every bit as good as the expensive coffe beverages at Star*****!!The 60-pack box is a bargain, and I promise you it's never gone stale in my house. Take it to work or school -- yummm!!

I have yet to find a frosted mini-wheats that I didn't like and this one is no different. It is the first time I have had the "little" mini-wheats and I like them just as much as the regular size. These little mini-wheats pack a powerful punch of cinnamon roll taste. I think they are a good compromise if you a craving a cinnamon roll but still want something that is good for you. While this cereal does have a lot of sugar it is also full of fiber and iron. Sounds (and tastes) like a good compromise to me!

We have an air popper for making popcorn, so I had an issue with this type of seasoning. Specifically, it won't stick to the popcorn and all falls to the bottom of the bowl instead. Perhaps it would work better if I lightly spritzed the popcorn with butter or oil first.Instead, we've been using the seasonings on other items. Namely potatoes (mashed & cubed), tater tots, french fries, and even as a dry rub for chicken breasts. The Bacon Cheddar & Cheesy Jalapeno were tasty on tater tots & french fries. It was sort of a mixed bag of results in mashed potatoes, tasty but we prefer their other flavor (Ranch) for those. The dry rub for chicken breasts was pretty tasty.Now if Kernel Seasonings came up with some sort of low-calorie butter or oil spray I think it would make these seasonings work a lot better for popcorn. Otherwise, we'll probably skip buying this pack again and just stick with their Ranch seasonings for our potatoes.
summary: Not great for popcorn, best for other foods

reviewText: For me this is a good strong cup (9.25 ounce) that is smooth and NOT bitter like a French roast. Another contender for my first cup in the morning is Jet Fuel.
This works great when you do not have money to spend on the K-cups.  I use it for loose tea and coffee ....works great!  Love i!

Hi,Bought these for healthy breakfast after pregnancy. These taste great, but only issue is I find them too sweet at times, not always. I put them in Milk and microwave. I can buy again but wonder if there is a less sweet version of these..Thanks!
summary: tasty but just a little sweet for me

reviewText: Nice coffee with a bite but no bitter!  Not at all bland like some coffees tend to be.

Yuck! I have been eating Quaker instant oatmeal since I was a kid (almost 40 years) and I loved it! I'm certain Quaker did something to the recipe that has been working forever, why change it?! About a year ago, I bought a few flavors at the local store, ate a few packets and gave them away! I figured maybe it was just a bad batch. I tried again with this order, eww, yuck, gross, disgusting. Even the smell isn't right! I guess it's to each their own, my mid-teen cousin likes it but friends and family my age don't. Anywho, no more Quaker for me, Great Value is better, Best Choice is better, MEH!!!
summary: It wasn't broken, why fix it?!

reviewText: Wife was on a gluten free and soy free diet due to breastfeeding a very stomach sensitive child.  She ate these for 16 months at least once a day and never got tired of them.Very solid product.
There are alot of chocolate candy bars. There are taffy in the box as well. Everything is easy to find in the box.

This seasoning kind of has a funk to it.  It's cheesy flavored, but not in a good way.  I love cheese, but this tastes so unnatural that it's hard to feel anything but ashamed for having eaten it.The product description recommends trying it with a variety of foods besides just popcorn.  This seems like a bad idea.  I like the taste of so many of those other foods and don't want to alter them to taste like funky cheese.Frankly, there are other seasonings that I can sprinkle on my popcorn that probably won't be so unhealthy.

I had never considered ordering this before but am so glad now that I did. The rich warm smooth  taste of sweetness added to my coffee was  so delicious that I felt that I was drinking a high priced brew from a local 5 star coffee shop.
These are really delicious and a fraction of the cost of more highly priced 'Irish oats'. I highly recommend this product.
I love these mints, especially knowing there is nothing artificial in them.  They taste great without the overwhelming hotness.  I will definitely buy them again.
The 3 bags were a good value to stock up the pantry on this product. It is good for baking and cooking.

After testing the Melitta Javajig, I will come right out and say it's not what I'd hoped for. It's not a bad device, but I definitely wish it had met my expectations. I love the idea and certainly hope more people will look at alternatives to the expensive, non-recyclable K-cups. Melitta is almost there.I got the Melitta to compare it to my Ekobrew since I've been unable to find them locally and the price through Amazon is double what I paid locally for the one I do have. Melitta seems too flimsy though. You have three main parts. There's a plastic frame for the paper filter, the plastic cup that fits around the frame, and then a snap-on lid. To use it, you place the frame upside down on the counter, place the paper filter over it, make sure it's even or you get gaps that the coffee will leak out of, and then push the plastic up over it. Fill it with coffee, snap the lid on, and you're ready to brew. The outer cup seems sturdy, but that plastic frame bends easily, so I'm afraid it's going to break after repeated use.My first attempt led to leaking grounds, so I had to try again. This time it was better, but it seemed like such a fuss to get the filter positioned correct, that I felt like I'd wasted time. Subsequent uses made it easier to know exactly how to line up the paper filter correctly, so I think it's a learning process.Now that I've used it consistently for a few days, I am pleased with what it does, but hands down, the Ekobrew is so much easier to use, and I'm not throwing away a little paper filter in the end. The paper filters are the other issue I have.I called around to local stores where I usually buy coffee filters and none of them have the Javajig filters. Most of them had never even heard of them. That means when I need more, I'm going to have to order them online or make my own from normal coffee filters. Amazon is currently sold out, so I can't see what their shipping would be. You can order the filters directly through Melitta for $3.99 a box and then $6.99 for shipping and handling. The shipping being more than the filters makes me think it's best avoiding the Javajig unless you want to make your own filters.
summary: Feels Flimsy to Me & Filters are Hard to Find

reviewText: Got them in time for Halloween... almost too early, I had to fight off family members and my own self-control just so I could have enough to give out on Halloween!
The whole family likes this product and in this size.  Am so glad I was able to buy it here, and will do so again.
love this parmesan i use a lof of it in my cookingand it has no fillers unlike the supermarket kind and it made by kraft  enjoy

Soups two or three times more money are no better than this. Because Campbell's is condensed, you can make the soup thick, thin, or in between. A disadvantage to condensed for a bachelor like myself is that you need to use the soup in two or three days, and it's rare that I'll want to eat the same flavor soup repeatedly till it's gone. I guess I could freeze the leftover part. But that involves another dish I'll have to wash sometime, and I'd rather stick my head into a meat grinder than wash dishes.

For the money, I think this Folgers series of coffees is pretty tasty -- I've had 3 different ones now.  However, I was expecting a better chocolate flavor based on the other reviews it's received.  Though I typically like the bitterness of (dark) chocolates, this cocoa flavor has a slightly unpleasant bitterness to my buds -- It may even be a sourness -- I'm not quite sure yet.  Since I got it during a sale, I'm not too disappointed.  It's drinkable, but I plan to do some blending with other grinds, to see if I can subdue the odd flavor that comes through.
summary: Drinkable, but not what I was expecting

reviewText: Gringo Bandito Hot Sauce.  Really good taste, really good flavor.  I do like hot sauce.  Even though I don't eat it everyday, I do eat it.  I like it on rice and beans (together or separate).  This hot sauce is my favorite.  I especially like it if I am out of onions and/or peppers.  I also like hot cornbread and hot fritter cakes/hush puppies.Highly recommended if you like hot sauce.
A perfect start to the day!  I think they might be good for you too, but I don't care!  I love em!

I like the noodles themselves, and as has been written here before, they're relatively plentiful for this sort of product.  The killer for me is that the broth is fairly well pervaded with mushroom taste, which is a real turn-off, and IMHO anomalous for a product describe as miso-flavored.  I'm fortunate that a certain local Japanese place offers fish-free miso soup, but we also make it at home (or use the Miso-cup instant).  For noodle cups, I'll stick with the chicken-flavor variety.Others have written complaining of salt and that the flavor doesn't knock their socks off.  I submit that this is the what you get in the dehydrated instant soup cup arena.  Tasty volatiles by nature aren't going to be captured in a dry broth powder, so there's only so good any product like this is going to be. If there wasn't a fair amount of salt added, it wouldn't taste like much at all -- this is true of anyone's soup cups.The tradeoff is that these are inexpensive, extremely lightweight, and last indefinitely on the shelf.  I use them for late night snacks, and especially when I crew sail races -- the boat owner generally has various processed food items to offer, but they're nearly always laden with animal products.  I can throw a couple of these in my bag and when hot water is available, have something warm to put in my stomach when I'd be otherwise limited to chips or such.  The value of this is not to be underestimated when it's 45 degrees and raining with 20 knot winds.
I tried it I prefer a heavy dark roast this is a good medium roast. if you like a good coffee that is not too strong this is the way to go
Use these in cooking all the time.  Breads cookies  muffins and scones.  Just an added grain in gluten free cooking.

I was surprised this tastes so good. As I said in my cacao butter review, yes it gets hard (as some other reviewers have commented on) but you can either warm it up or I just scrape it or use a knife the chip away at it. No matter, it tastes great. I mix it with cacao butter, almond butter, hemp seeds, nuts and seeds and mix it all in my popcorn for my crazy live it up Friday night dinner and it tastes really good! It is very filling. I look forward to other applications.As one reviewer said, you can make this way cheaper but first I am lazy and second my blender will overheat if I run in even on low for 6 minutes as recommended by the other industrious and budget conscious reviewer. However I was glad to get that info and may do that if I get a different blender..cuz I too like to save $
this coffee is unique in flavor, not too strong or light, this has been requested by some of our employees.  nice afternoon coffee as well great taste.

I've tried several different brands since getting my Keurig, and this is by far, the best so far.  Really smooth flavor.  Not bold, but more of a medium roast.  Like it says, Donut Shop is comparable I think to Starbuck's Breakfast Blend in flavor and strength.  Tried Timothy's Kona and it was bitter.  Also tried Green Mountain Nantucket, and was just okay.I will buy this one again and again.

These "Donut Shop K-Cups" are one of the best deals around for Keurig coffee brewer machine owners. My expectations were fairly low since these are priced so reasonably (at least compared to other K-Cup types), but I was surprised by the great taste of the coffee. I also like that it is good for a full cup since even some of the "premium" brands come out weak when made in the "Large Cup" setting.It should be noted that the "Amazon Frustration Free Packaging" means that you get 50 of these K-Cups in the shipping box. That's it, no packaging, no baggies, nothing... just these loose in the shipping box.We use them in ourKeurig B-40 B40 Elite Gourmet Single-Cup Home-Brewing System.Highly Recommended!CFH
summary: Good Taste, Great Price - Highly Recommended!

reviewText: If you know Mexican food--real, good Mexican food--it is hard to think of putting a creamy sauce on a taco. I can't. It just doesn't seem right. However, this sauce does have a relatively good "mexican" flavor and it is good for other things, like a salad or a sandwich. The "creamy" part of it is definitely there. Seems like milk, or some component of it, is a prominent feature. Not for me, but some may find uses for it.
summary: Doesn't seem right on a taco

reviewerName: Thomas A Nagy "Author of  the Cannabis Consum...
reviewText: This is a delicious and nutritious product. I can tell an organic peanut butter from those that are not. In this one, you can be sure there is no sugar added, like name brands ... and happen to believe that adding sugar to peanut butter should be made a crime. I like the crunchiness, although you can get the smooth as well. Really, this has more roasted nuts flavor than most other "natural" peanut butters, which indicates that it must be packaged while quite fresh, and flavors sealed in. I recommend this product as a good source of nutrition.
summary: The roasted peanut flavor stands out

reviewText: After trying the OV chocolate milk, I decided to give the plain 1% milk a try.  It is creamier than I am used to with most milk and has a bit of a sweet taste, but is very good.  I like that I can take these to work and keep one in the fridge and not take up lots of space (we have one fridge for over 50 people!) while the rest can wait at my desk.  They are also nice to have in a pinch when I run out of my full gallon of milk and am cooking and need a cup or less of milk.I'm happy to support Organic Valley not only because it is organic, but because my friend's parents own one of the dairy farms in the co-op.  I am not just supporting family-owned farms, but also one that I know.The expiration date was months in the future on the ones that I received and they were easily all gone by the time the date arrived.

I like to mix things up a bit with my popcorn, and really liked the Kernel Season's spicy variety pack, or the Malt Salt, salt and vinegar shaker toppings. This variety pack, despite having decent overall ingredients, just didn't make the cut for me.  I found them all to be too sweet (overpoweringly sweet, even) and not so much caramel or chocolate (in the case of the caramel or chocolate flavors).  The Kettle Corn flavor was my favorite out of the three for popcorn. The other two flavors seemed to me to have more sugar than flavor.  I even tried them on my Kashi cereal to add some life to it, but again more sweet than flavor. I did like that they weren't full of artificial sweeteners and the like, but they just weren't to my tastes (whereas I seem to be finding more foods to try the spicy variety pack on by the day).
summary: Kernel Season's Sweet Seasoning Variety Pack, 2.85 Ounce Shakers

reviewText: Very pleased with purchase. This flour is more fine than some other brands I've tried. I use this in conjunction with Wellbee Almond flour for alternatives to APF. Not an overwhelming coconut smell either. I'm looking forward to using these flours to maintain a low carb/gluten lifestyle.
This is my 2nd purchase for this product. Great size and would highly recommend it to everyone who uses Coffee-Mate Creamer, great price as well for the container size

I'm picky about my honey, and most is too bland (blended) to impress me.  I don't require a honey to be a specific variety, but it should represent some good variety well. This is the best citrus variety I've ever gotten mail order.  I was raised in the Rio Grande Valley in the fifties, and, sure, I've tasted even better fresh from the hive during the citrus bloom, but that's not a fair comparison. I've got this on subscribe and save, which is my endorsement!
summary: BEST honey I've ever gotten mail order!

reviewText: This is the best muesli I have ever tried.  I would buy it if it wasn't healthy.

When you first open the container of Eggnog Matcha, the eggnog aroma is strong and smells delicious. I prepared my eggnog matcha as a warm tea with hot water and milk. The smell made me think it would taste would be amazing but, it was just too bit bitter in my opinion. I think this tea would be better as a cold drink, blended with ice and milk, and possible a little honey or sugar.

A couple of years ago, I moved from Florida to North Carolina.  The honey here is good and generic clover honey is decent, but I missed Orange Blossom Honey.  It has a tangy, stronger flavor than the others and is the best for many uses.  I still use the others to sweeten hot drinks, but for all other uses I prefer OBH.  Tropic Bee is not the best of the OBH field, but it is a good one for day to day use.  For those of you not familiar with OBH, I would recommend it for a beginner, as it has a milder flavor than most.

Being able to find products without gluten, dairy and soy is very difficult!  I think that Enjoy Life's mini Chocolate Chips are the best ever so I couldn't wait to try their new decadent bars!  The S'mores bars are our favorite.  The Cinnamon Bun is very good.  The Chocolate Sunbutter is satisfying.  I haven't tried the Cherry Cobbler yet.  I will be buying more of these yummy tasting bars!!  They are not too sweet, they have a slight crunch and chewy texture and my family and I can't get enough of them :)
summary: I LOVE These bars from Enjoy Life

reviewText: This coffee is for my hubby so I'm doing the dictation. He says he loves the flavor.....really good coffee and very similar to, even as good as DD coffee. He's had his Keurig for about 4 months and has tried lots of brands. This is his favorite. And I will vouch for the value. We ordered the 96 count on this second order. Try it, you won't be sorry.
I was not impressed. It was bland and did not dissolve. There is not a very strong chocolate taste. I threw out the can.

I love the taste of tangy roasted red pepper in this soup. It makes for an interesting twist on the boring old tomato soup. This variety is thick, tasty and filling. I like to accompany the soup with Glutino Cheddar Gluten Free Crackers and/or plain low fat Greek yogurt (instead of sour cream). A few points about the size:Each box contains 16 oz of liquid (many stores sell only the larger 32oz size). One serving is 8 oz. However, for a filling meal I need double that (16 oz). Even doubled, the soup has only 220 calories and 4 gr of fat. Under the Subscribe and Save plan, the price for the 16 oz size is better then in my local WholeFoods.This soup makes a great work lunch. I use one box for one lunch even though the container is resealable. In fact, it is also sold in 32 oz containers (also, with lower sodium content). Once opened, you should store it in the fridge and consume within a week or so.Enjoy!PS: The soup is certified organic and kosher dairy, for those to whom it matters.
summary: Thick, tangy and filling! Yes, the size is 16 oz!

reviewText: Over the years, I've tried various k-cups from different vendors and different flavors.This one tops them all being great every time.

I am a big fan of Navitas Naturals and purchase a lot of their products. However, I don't really care for these goldenberries. Maybe it's the tangy flavor... Maybe it's the unusual texture... I don't know. I'm glad I gave them a try, but I'll definitely be sticking to goji berries.

I was excited to try this stuff, but to be honest, it has more of a creamy flavor/texture to it than a "spicy ranchero" sauce I was expecting.  Sour cream - that's it - it has that texture/flavor of sour cream.  I'm not a huge sour cream guy, but that's what it reminded me of.  It did not make my tacos taste like Taco Bells'.  Did I use the apostrophe correctly there?  Anyhow I love spicy food, and this barely made a blip.  It was almost distracting to use on my tacos.  I mean, the taco meat I make already has good spices in it, so covering it with this stuff kind of kills it.  Just know that this stuff is more "creamy" than "spicy".  Maybe it would be better on plain grilled beef?  I wasn't blown away by it, but I didn't hate it either.
summary: Not blown away by the flavor.  Pretty creamy.

reviewText: I am a huge fan of Dr. McDougall's products and this oatmeal deserves a lot of praise.  These oatmeal packs contain a reasonable 120 calories (most store brands have 150 calories).  One package of this oatmeal truly fills you until lunch.  Each packet has the perfect mix of apples, cinnamon and oatmeal.As you search for healthy oatmeal, you will find that the company makes large oatmeal cups.  I found the cups to be too large -- I started to remove half the oatmeal for my next day's breakfast.  I don't have to do that with the oatmeal packets because the portion size is perfect. I hope the company begins to make packets for the Dr. McDougall breakfast cups.

This is good candy but as far as energizing you......I don't think so.  I will admit that I only got a single package to base my opinion on but I could not detect any "jolt" of energy from it. Maybe I wasn't lacking enough in energy to notice a difference but all I can say about it is that it does have a pleasant taste, however so does a lot of other candy (and this is coming from a real candy fanatic) that costs a lot less and is a lot more readily available!

Some licorice products leave the teeth with a black film but not so with the Panda soft licorice chews.  It is a delicious licorice product that improves with age, in my opinion.  The candy from a freshly opened box is very soft and tends to stick in the teeth more than candy from a box which has been opened and closed for several days because it hardens as air circulates around the candy.  If I place it in an airtight container, it remains soft, but I really love it as the texture changes.  The flavor is consistently delicious and it is now my licorice of choice.  I was expecting the box to contain a plastic bag but it simply has a plastic seal along the top of the box with nothing inside to seal.  Therefore, if you want your licorice to remain fresh, I'd recommend placing it in an airtight container.  I've also purchased the raspberry flavor but haven't tried that yet.  I have a hard time considering fruit flavored candies as "licorice," but enjoy the confection also.
Of all the flavors that ice has, I really enjoy this one the most. and the larger bottles are a great value.

2.75 starsThis dressing/sauce is pretty good. The ranch flavor isn't very pronounced, but it has a slightly spicy kick to it. I don't think I would use it regularly because it had an artificial taste. However, it's not horrible and I could see those who are tired of the same old ranch dressing giving this a try.
Good coffee, although I am getting away from k cups as they add to landfills.

I like to have these around for a quick salty snack. They taste great and don't have that nasty old/burn weird flavor you can get sometimes with pistachios. I will buy these again when I run out! Thanks

If your child is not gaining enough weight or is very finicky about milk, this may help.  It is a tasty, vanilla treat.  It is pretty loaded with corn syrup so essentially you're giving your child vitamin enhanced vanilla milk.

This new, to me, salad dressing is very tasty and has a nice creamy texture. It is very good on a taco salad and makes a good sauce for a sandwich. Used on a turkey and bacon sandwich, it adds a nice zip.
summary: A very good sauce from Taco Bell.

reviewText: Its similar to Mini-Wheats but not quite as stiff since it is more oat flour than wheat. It definitely has a cinnamon flavor but not over powering. It is nice and crunchy if you don't let it get soggy in milk. I think that this would be a great item to add to a Chex-Mix style of snack along with nuts and dried fruit.I also tried using the Oatmeal Squares to flavor some non-sweetened cereal and found that really helped stretch the food dollar. One thing I really like is that it does not have the over powering sweetness of say Kellogg's cereals. That was a pleasant surprise.

i don't know what happened to them but the problem started with a new jar like several months back. the taste was bad and the smell was different and lacking. and the worst thing was it wasn't effective stimulus no more. i tried several of their jars and they were all like this.i have to say i can't do business with them no more.but strangely, their cappuccino seem alright enough. i don't know if that has the same instant formula in it or what but you do have to take more to get the hit but cappuccino is diluted stuff so thats not surprising.

Since Lacroix no longer is available through Prime, I tried several similar products. This is my favorite, and I do hope it continues to be available through Amazon Prime. The price is great, the taste is very refreshing, and it has to be the healthiest soda beverage you can find. Keep in mind that people seem to either love products like this or hate it. Of course, there's no sugar, and if you want a sweet drink this isn't for you. I do notice that the carbonation doesn't last that long, so if you put your can down and come back a half hour later, you'll be looking at a pretty flat beverage. Not so much a problem for me, and maybe typical of most carbonated beverages. Overall, my highest rating.
My husband loves the smooth texture of this blend.  My kerig makes it just right.  Much cheaper to buy 24 at a time since he always has a second cup!

This water is disgusting and tastes like another brand also sold at Costco. The after taste is stale bread, I ordered 2 cases of http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BN6BX9M/ref=oh_details_o08_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1 when I got this with a coupon and subscribe & save discount and now I'm choking this down.Move on to something else if you want a clean crisp coconut water, this definitely isn't it!
My employees love this coffee... and I wasn't sure that they would because they often go to Starbucks and may be a bit spoiled.  But they do enjoy it and I will buy more as soon as I run out again.
This tea is delightful. The aroma is wonderful and will appreciate it in the middle of our cold Minnesota winter!
Love donut shop flavored coffees but this is one of the best.  Wakes you up in the morning without being bitter or too strong.

This is an easy to use product that results in mild flavoring that was o.k. but lacking in intensity and punch. There were no instructions for using this in a rice cooker, so i used the instructions used by the manufacturer.Would I buy this or use it again? No. It is loaded with MSG which I usually try to avoid, but worse yet this has a lot of sodium. I can do better winging it.

I always find the Maple & Brown Sugar more tasty than making plain oatmeal with maple syrup and brown sugar myself. Why is that? Regardless, these instant oatmeal packs have been a staple breakfast for numerous camping trips -- just add hot water and it's ready to eat. I tend to stick to the plain quick oats in the cardboard cylinder for most breakfasts, but I occasionally splurge on these instant packs for normal weekday breakfasts as well. It's fast to prepare and keeps me feeling full for a few hours.
summary: Tasty, great for camping or fast breakfasts

reviewText: I was excited to try this in hopes of getting rice like my favorite tortilleria. I followed the directions perfectly. They were simple.But the only flavor I got was salt. I could not identify one other flavor profile. The red one was just as bad. I ended up giving the rice to my cows. Very disappointing.
I recently discovered quinoa, and make it often.I have bought both from Amazon and from Costco (Costco is cheaper FYI) but I was very happy with the product both times.
Great flavor, says Vegetarian but ingredients suggest Vegan.  Have tried lots of these products and this is one of the absolute best.  Filling, rich, well seasoned w/o being too spicy.

reviewerName: A. Marcroft "Wife, Mom of Four Boys, Spanish ...
reviewText: Mmm...our favorite thing to do with Carnation Malted Milk is to make chocolate malt shakes. The instructions are on the package. We like to top them with whipped cream and mini chocolate chips! Delicious! This stuff is the best and the price on Amazon can't be beaten!
summary: Love it! We make Chocolate Malt Shakes with it!

reviewText: This product was okay however it was a tad too bitter for my taste. So far my favorite is the Green Tea Citrus which has a milder taste. Stay away from the diet versions as they made my whole family nauseous. They contain sucralose (Splenda) which some people can be sensitive to.TIP: Best way to get in contact with Amazon.Go to "HELP" on upper right corner. Then go down the right hand side to where it says "Get Express customer service or contact us by e-mail or phone". Click on "Contact Us" and then proceed to follow the directions. You have the option to be contacted by phone. It's the ONLY way I ever deal with them. Hope that helps everyone for future problems. :)

I haven't found worms, as other reviewers have commented, but I've certainly had better pistachios.  These tend to be somewhat small, and at times not very fresh.  To top it off, since they are now using Dennis Rodman as a spokesman, I won't be buying Wonderful products again.

I was impressed by the nutrients and benefits when I read the information about this product.  I use them sprinkled in my salads or mixed in my nonfat vanilla Greek yogurt along with Goji Berries (another Superfood by the same company).I can't name anything specific that feels different but I'm happy to be eating these instead of junk food.  That's a benefit in itself!
This one is all righ but still not really fresh.I tried this one because some of the reviews mentioned that is was excellent and fresh. I just can't seem to find really nice fresh organic popcorn.
summary: not quite what I would consider really fresh

reviewText: FIRST TIME I ORDERED THIS DRY SOUP, TASTE WAS NOT GOOD TO ME, WILL NOT ORDER THIS ONE AGAIN--THOUGHT IT WOULD BE VERY TASTY, BUT WASN'T
summary: DR MCDOUGALL'S TAMALE SOUP WITH CHIPS, CUP

reviewText: This flour works very well with regular recipes. I actually think it's better than the King Arthur GF flour, which I have always thought was the best.

For bottled tea, the Original Sweet Tea is the best I have found so far.  It has a very good, fresh tea flavor and nice tea smell.  Nothing funky, just tea, sugar and water.  Organic if that matters to you.  This tea is the only one that actually tastes like homemade tea (that I have found so far).  It's a bit expensive, but very good.My current favorite, for sure.9-28-2011 Update:  Have now consumed several cases and this is still the best.  Tastes like the tea my mother used to make. ;)11-24-2011 Update:  I continue to enjoy this very fine tea.  Panicked when Amazon was out of stock for awhile, as it's hard to find locally.  Good news is the price actually has dropped - woo hoo!

This Gluten Free alternative for flour is a GREAT substitute.  Anything you can make using regular flour, you can do with this flour for us that are GF.  Some of the GF flours are not very good, but this one has made us believers.
This stuff is great, in theory. When I tried to use it I got a lumpy mess. I ended up straining a whole pot of chicken stew. Maybe I did something wrong. Still, I'll stick with Wondra.
summary: I Must Have Done It Wrong

reviewText: This is the 2nd bag I have purchased, and both have been the freshest, most succulent cashews I have purchased. No salt, no cooking, and organic, and tasty.

Fruity teas aren't usually my "thing." I got this as a free sample with my Teavana order. Delish! Note - the instructions (at least on the sample) were peculiar. They said to use the entire bag. I used about 1.5 tsp for a regular size mug, steeped for 2 minutes and it was great.The tea is lovely. Large chunks of dried fruit. It's fruity, but not too sweet. Would probably make a nice iced tea. So far, I've only had it hot.I described it as a happy tea, because it kinda' makes you feel happy. It's not overly relaxing, nor is it overly energizing. It's just kinda' gives a blissful chill. :)
summary: Suprisingly - I loved it (A happy tea!)

reviewerName: Donita M. Brown "Avid reader, tech geek.  Chr...
reviewText: Oh dear pumpkin seeds where have you been all my life?  I love these seeds.  They toast well, mix with sweet stuff well for trail mix, and bake well.  Very pleased.
summary: where have you been all my life?

reviewText: Gluten-free products and baking mixes are getting easier to find. The only problem with a lot of the products is that they don't always taste good. This was a fairly easy mix to make. Basically it's the cookie mix, butter, and eggs. I used a hand mixer instead of a stand mixer and although the dough was dry-ish, which was okay for rolling out the dough and cutting the shapes, I think a drier dough is better for that purpose. I had to bake about 15 minutes though the instructions called for 12 to get a nice golden color. It could just be my oven though.The taste of the cookies was pretty good with a sweet vanilla/almond flavor. They were sweet enough so that I opted not to ice them or that would have made them a bit too sweet. The texture was pretty good too, not crunchy, more chewy but I like that better than crunch.  This yielded about 25 cookies of various shapes.I would definitely try more of Pamela's mixes and gluten-free products. Very good.

I've always enjoyed Hershey's Chocolate Almond bars, but found this and tried it.  It was really delicious--smooth, creamy taste, and none of the "raw throat" effect I've had after eating a Hershey bar (whatever that is!).  This is my new, favorite chocolate bar.

I didn't know what to expect from a Jamba Juice energy drink but this took me by surprise.When you first crack open the can, you can't miss the crisp apple scent. The drink itself had no energy drink after taste which was surprising but even chilled the taste reminded me a bit of warm apple juice. If that makes sense. Let me just make it clear that this doesn't taste like apple juice at all, but it hardly tastes like an energy drink either.As for the actual energy effects, I didn't notice any.

This was a very hard review because I found the soy sauce and crushed red pepper the only real taste. The garlic and ginger were really not tasted. It really tasted like teryaki sauce with a little kick. It is not overly spicey but you will notice it. It is also very salty tasting. With all of that said, I will tell you what I did. I had some frozen cod fillets and decideto try it out for the family for dinner. I defrosted the cod and cut it into large cubes (cut it into cubes while frozen to make it easier). I put about a tablespoon of oil into a sauce pan and just seared the cod,careful, careful not to cook it. I thin poured the sauce into the pan and mixed it into the oil and over the cod. I used a pound of cod, but I should have used two pounds. I left it to cook for a few more minutes, watching it closely because I did not want to overcook the cod. I also boiled some pasta while everything else was happening. To let you know, my kids hate fish. They will taste anything I make but they just do not like fish, even cod, which has a very mild flavor. Well, they ate a huge bowl each! So, here was my problem, had my kids not eaten the fish so ravenously, I would have given this 3 stars, but because of the kid factor, I will not only bump it up, but will also buy more!
summary: Ginger and garlic flavor lacking but my kids loved it...with FISH!

reviewText: Pistachio originated from Iran is a superb tasting nut only if you can get the Persian version of the nut since all other type of pistachios are just commercial production something close but nothing like the pistachios of Iran. Commercial pistachios were dyed red to hide stains on the shells from handpicking. Today, pistachio harvests are automated, preventing staining and rendering the dying process obsolete. Avoid dyed pistachios, as many food dyes can be harmful. Pistachio is a five star nut only the ones from Iran. Commercial types are like three stars but what is disturbing is when claims made on this site for description of pistachios that are misleading since do not align with nutrition facts of pistachios. Always read the nutritional facts and evaluate a food item. WONDERFUL brand products on Amazon have claims like;1. The most nutrient dense nut:Pistachios hardly even come close to other nuts for nutrients. Nuts lack in vitamins but are better in minerals. Almonds contain magnesium, vitamin E and iron, and have more calcium than any other nut.2. One of the lowest calorie and lowest fat nuts:All nuts are high in calories and pistachio is no exception. Pistachios are 30% higher in saturated fat than almond without the nutrients of almonds.Accordingly for 28gr/1oz servings size of;SESAME__FLAX__CHIA__AMARANTH__QUINOA__HEMP__PISTACHIO__ALMOND__CASHEWCALORIES565__534__490__371__368__567__557__575__553SAT FAT34__18__16__7__4__17__27__19__39CALCIUM99__26__63__16__5__0__11__26__4MAGNESIUM89__98__0__62__49__167__30__67__73POTASSIUM14__23__5__15__16__167__29__20__19ZINC48__29__23__19__21__83__15__21__39FIBER47__109__151__8__11__4 __41__49__13PHYTOSTEROLS714__0__0__0__0__N/A__214__0__03. One of the highest fiber nuts, The highest Phytosterols nut:Pistachios have 20% less fiber than almonds without the nutrients of almond. I never consume nuts for fiber since beans and seeds offer me all the nutrients with fiber for less cost. Phytosterols are high in pistachios but I get 300% more with sesame seeds with the highest nutrients of any food item like calcium.4. One of the highest antioxidant nuts*Antioxidants are such a misuse word since there is no measurement of such item anywhere in nutrition facts.Accordingly for 28gr/1oz servings size of;Amaranth__quinoa__flax__peanut__almonds__chia__sesame__sunflower__cashew__pistachioTOTAL CALORIES28.6__33.6__ 150__166__161__137__160__162__155__156CALORIES FROM CARBS21.2__23.6__33__28.9__24.6__50__26.8__31.2__34.4__31.8CALORIES FROM FAT3.7__4.8__98.8__121__116__72.1__116__112__103__104CALORIES FROM PROTEIN3.7__4.9__17.8__16.8__20.6__15.2__17.2__19.1__17.7__20
Mu husband loves this stuff and drinks a lot of it. Can't seem to find it in our stores so got it here.

Knorr Mi Arroz Rice Seasoning Mix, White is okay. Not as strong of a flavor as I normally enjoy and way too many additives including MSG, too much salt, and has 660 mg of sodium per serving.It's easy to use but not so good for people who have high blood pressure or edema. Looking at the ingredients, there seems to be more additives than actual flavoring.
summary: Tastes Okay But Too Many Additives + MSG

reviewText: It's not bad coffee, but I prefer a stronger brew. It brews up very mild and light. It's smooth, not too bitter nor offensive. It would be a safe bet to have for people as it a straight forward cup of coffee.For me, it's a little too weak. I would much prefer a slightly stronger darker cup.
Good product - but we find these too sweet. We've gone to ordering the almond / cranberry ones instead.

I had been up for about an hour when I drank one can of this after having one cup of coffee in the morning. Then I engaged in moderate physical activity for about 2 hours. I felt wide awake and focused. Initially I felt a bit jittery.After about 4 hours I was so tired I could hardly keep my eyes open. A big crash. I looked at the ingredients and high fructose corn syrup is the second ingredient listed. I assume that was the reason for the crash. The coffee I drank had no sugar added.Taste: My first impression was yuk. But it grew on me a bit to rise to the level of not awful. Really though, most of these drinks do not taste very good in my experience.This review is through the Vine program so I only got one can. I'd like to have tried another can to see if the crash was circumstantial or something you could count on. I know the little bottle energy shots advertise no crash because there is no sugar.My recommendation is try it unless you want or need a sugar free dose/drink.3 stars for yukky taste, jitters and sugar.

Wake Up Call Bold has quickly become our coffee of choice.  I like mine black; my wife prefers hers with a bit of creamer.  No hints of this or that, just great flavor, without the acidic aftertaste of many bolds.
I use this all the time.  So happy that bobs makes this product.  I am getting to be a purchaser of Bobs Red Mill products.  It is a reliable brand with great products.

I have been looking for a stevia flavored water enhancer that has a full flavor profile, is reasonably priced, does not require me to use two thirds of the product in one serving just to ensure it can be tasted, and doesn't have the bitter after taste that some stevia products have. Unfortunately, my purchase of the STUR Variety pack (Mango Orange, Strawberry and Lemonade) did not satisfy my needs.  It actually failed in EVERY CATEGORY that I listed above. The Stur Mango and Strawberry flavors was very disappointing as it took nearly 30 seconds of squeezing the product (they recommend 10 seconds) to get even close to a little sweetness, and even then the flavor was almost non existent.  The lemonade flavor was my favorite as after the 30 seconds of squeezing the lemon flavor was bolder and the sweetness was there for the most part - but because of the overall product size it seemed I would only have gotten 3-4 servings out of a bottle. Simply not woth the price.I would strongly recommend purchasing Stevita or Krisda Field Berry Stevia drink mixes instead, with Stevita as the definite winner as it's very portable and the flavor stands alone by itself without me needing to add anything else, although I do prefer adding a little lemon juice and flavored seltzer water as a special treat.
summary: Flavor is almost non-existent and barely sweet - even using 3xs the recommended serving

reviewText: These are delicious chewy ginger candies.  I like them as a candy but many people like them for settling their stomachs, they do help.  I also enjoy the hard candy version of this Gin Gin but sometimes I'm in the mood for a chewy treat.  The texture of these is somewhere between a taffy & jelly candy.They are individually wrapped in a sealed wrapper so it's easy to take them with you.Ingredients:  Cane Sugar, Ginger, Tapioca StarchServing Size: 2 PiecesCalories in Serving: 40Sugar: 10 gGluten FreeThere is a hard candy version of this that is also delicious.Ginger People Gin-Gins Natural Hard Candy - 3 pack - 3oz Bags - Great for morning sickness and nausea!
summary: If you like ginger & chewy candy, try these!

reviewText: I got this in the variety pack. The entire package, which I did eat in one sitting, is 325 calories and 12 grams of fat. For me, it requires something bland to eat it with, as well. As such, I very much enjoyed the nice curry seasonings and all.This has 3 grams per package more fat than the Red Kidney Beans Curry I also tried, but does include a broader variety of veggies and other ingredients.
Had this delivered to me in 2 days flat with Super-saver shipping. Grits are great--I have no complaints!

The flavoring is absolutely caramel.  No doubt about it.  It smells so rich and sweet you'd expect to get a sugar shock from drinking it, but it's only as sweet as the natural sweetness of a good matcha.  And the matcha base used is good!  The flavor isn't just some mask for an inferior tea!The color of this tea is a bit brownish.  Those who are used to the vibrant green of matcha may be a bit shocked at first, but the brownish tint is undoubtedly from the flavoring.  The awesome awesome flavoring.  Drink it straight for a decadent treat without the cavaties, or make it into a mind blowing latte.  yummy!  You can use it to add caramel flavor to anything!  caramel vanilla matcha milkshake?  Yes please!  Caramel matcha hot chocolate?  Mmmmm...no words.
Delicious, easy to prepare and very easy to incorporate in other recipes. No fat but plenty of flavor and nutrition!

Excellent taste with or without sugar.  Best without sugar.  No after taste in your mouth.  Does not have that strong flavor like green, red or black tea.  It's mellow and very pleasing to the palate.  Husband drinks it twice a day.  He has been drinking it for about 3 years!  I have been drinking it for about 10 years.  Can't be without it LOL.  LOVE IT!!
summary: The Best  Tea in the United States LOL

reviewText: I go thru like a bag a week. LOVE THIS SHREDDED COCONUT!No problems with shell fragments like others have mentioned.& I like the size of this shred - some of the other brands are too fine or too big.Good stuff!

This is a great "entry into herbal teas" assortment, particularly for those trying to get off caffeinated or sugary products. I must admit I'm not the biggest fan of licorice/orange-peel flavors, which feature (in my palate's opinion) a little strongly here, but the Lemon Ginger and Strawberry Pomegranate are absolutely FANTASTIC. This is also a great assortment for keeping at work.
summary: A little heavy on the orange-peel flavored ones..

reviewText: This Bokar Blend Whole Bean was liked by everyone and was put on a higher level than the Starbucks they sell at our local Costco. The Starbucks I mentioned is a little too bitter for our discerning taste with indicates that a coffee bean with less bitterness is what we kind of like. I was mixing the Starbucks with less bitter beans and it came out just key. The Eight O'Clock Coffee Bokar Blend is very enjoyable and affordable. Two attributes we can really welcome in our neck of the woods (I think that is a valid expression?) So for the money, the value and the taste this one gets a solid 4 Stars, no less, no more.

I have repurchased several times. They are great for someone "on the go." Very satisfying. At under 200 calories, they are just the thing for a late sleeper such as me to "tide me over" until mealtime.

As other US reviewers have noted, this snack does consist of dehydrated apple bits that have been compressed into a ball shape.  I thought they were just okay.  I didn't love them and I didn't hate them to the point of spitting them out as a few other reviewers have.What I did was put them in milk and eat them as one would a cereal. It was not bad.  I thought it was just okay.
summary: Just Okay - Can Be Used as a Cereal

reviewText: I bought these beans to make tacos and serve as a side dish. They would be especially great if you are traveling or camping since they are lightweight. The texture and taste is superb for a dehydrated product. I will definitely buy it again!

Some of the flavors are great. most are decent, one is absolutely awful (Peppermint), and one is awful for coffee (it even coagulates in hot coffee) but instead makes a wonderful ice cream topping (Raspberry ... yes that is spelled right).I bought this as a set at a good price and it was nice to try all the flavors, but I soon found that I tired of them. So while I would recommend having them around for parties if you invite a lot of coffee drinkers, the fact that you get such a great variety of good to bad makes me recommend buying separate bottles rather than the sets unless you get a great deal.

I searched for salt-free pasta sauce.  This product was listed.  The notes say no salt added, but if you access the pic of nutritional info you will see that one can contains more than 600 mg of sodium....way too much.  Muir Glen is playing with numbers:  they have one product that lists 110 mg sodium per serving and another that lists 200 per serving, but if you add up the "servings" amount per can, both products total the same amount of sodium per can.If sodium is an issue for you, you can't take as true the information Amazon lists for the product - check our the label first before ordering.
summary: Description says NO salt, but NOT TRUE

reviewText: I tried the variety pack on a lark with the recent sale pricing + coupon.  I found the product to be very enjoyable.  The cups had no failures in the brewing process (ie no overflow or escaping grounds).  The flavors are on the light side of medium.  I found that the best brewing option on the Keurig B60 to balance out flavor vs cup size was the medium cup size.  Trying the largest cup setting produced a watered down flavor, while the small size produced the most flavorful brew but didn't stretch out the product economically.  My personal favorite flavor was the House Blend, although all were enjoyable.  I would definitely recommend this product.

Not being an aficionado of energy drinks, preferring my caffeine to come from coffee beans, I decided to try this drink on the advice of a colleague who raved about it. It has a nice green apple flavor, is slightly carbonated and does give a little "burst" of energy. But the addition of the Stevia is a turn off... Too much of an aftertaste.

I wouldn't say these are bad tasting.. they're just too hard. That's the same reaction I got from 3 people I shared this product with. I was expecting the clusters to be somewhat soft and moist. Instead, they are hard dry balls of desiccated apples pressed together into a cluster.They do taste cinnamony, with a nice balance of sweetness and acidity, but I would be hesitant to try these again. Vitamin C content is surprisingly low.. only 2% RDI per serving. On the other hand, fiber content is relatively high, at 8% per serving. This product is not for me, but it may be for you if you like the convenience of apple snacks on the go. The bag is resealable and easy to stow in a lunch bag. Same size as popcorn, these would do well while watching a movie or TV show.Lastly, it would've been more friendly on the earth and reduce its carbon footprint if these apples were sourced locally or even from within the US. Product of Chile.

I tried this many years ago (same ingredients as they have now) and I really did want to like it because I know how bad regular wheat pasta if for me and I've been loving elbow macaroni since I was a kid and  hoped I could make my own mac and cheese out of this. But white rice also gives me tummy trouble and this is made mostly of white rice. But that's not the only reason I gave it just 2 stars. As I've said in my other bionaturae pasta reviews, if I had to eat gluten free I'd rather give up pasta than eat this stuff. All of their pastas are made from the same "formula" (that's what they call it). And no matter how many times I've tried it, different types of pastas, different cooking times, they all taste chewy and sticky. The taste is not horrible but texture just ruins the entire eating experience.My full review is below. This review will not show as a verified Amazon purchase because I bought mine locally. But if you do choose to buy this and can't get it locally, Amazon Prime is the way to go. Check out Amazon Prime (http://www.amazon.com/gp/prime) for details on how to get Amazon Prime shipping perks for free, or ask me about it.~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~PROS:> Organic> Gluten Free> Kosher (circle K symbol)> Produced at a dedicated gluten free facility with no risk of cross contamination with dairy, tree nuts, peanuts, or eggs.> The manufacturer is one of a select few in Italy who are authorized by the Italian Ministry of Health to produce gluten free pasta. The factory tests for the presence of gluten during each production cycle. Independent testing is also done at a laboratory in the United States on each lot before the products are distributed in this country.> The actual taste is a little like regular pasta. But the texture was so bad I couldn't finish it.~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~CONS:> Tacky, sticky, chewy. It was so chewy it stuck to my teeth.  They claim it has a true pasta-like texture. As an Italian-American from NY who has been eating pasta of all kinds regularly for over 50 years, for me it does not have the "true pasta-like" texture as they claim. Like I said, sticky, chewy, tacky.> It felt like wet cement in my stomach. It made me constipated because it is not made from whole grains. And smothering it with my special melted cheese sauce didn't help any. It just made it heavier in my tummy.> Being organic and gluten free is the only thing I can see good about this stuff. But as I've mentioned in other reviews, poop can be organic and gluten free but that doesn't mean you should eat it. Sorry if that sounds crude, but I think it really goes make a good point.> It is expensive, but if you have already tried this and like it and can't get it locally, then Amazon Prime is the way to go. Ask me how to get Amazon Prime free shipping perks. But I don't see it being worth the price, at any price, not even free.~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~INGREDIENTS: (same as all of their pastas)Organic Rice Flour, Organic Rice Starch, Organic Potato Starch, Organic Soy Flour (and water is used)~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~COMPANY INFORMATION:Euro-USA Trading Co., Inc. (importers of bionaturae)5 Tyler DrivePO Box 98North Franklin, Connecticut 06254phone (860) 642-6996fax (860) 642-6990
summary: No good with tomato sauce or mac & cheese sauce

reviewText: Mauna Loa has excellent name recognition in the snack nut market for decades. However, it is always challenging to insure that their products are fresh because Mauna Loa still insists on placing cryptic embossed alphanumeric codes on the bottom of each can which makes it nearly impossible to insure you are receiving fresh product (despite Mauna Loa's insistence to the contrary). I would contact Mauna Loa (now owned by Hershey Foods), register your vote for making an easy to read "fresh through" or better still, "Produced on" date MANDATORY for all food products. While on the phone, ask them to decipher your can codes and provide you with a code deciphering" sheet until they do the right thing. You can find their toll free number listed on each can or package they sell. These cans are nearly impossible to find on grocer's shelves in the U.S. mainland,due to shelf space limitations and competitive slotting fees in the supermarkets. Nevertheless, they are still in my opinion, the best quality macadamia nuts on the market if you are a nut aficionado like myself. I now only purchase them through Amazon via subscription to insure a continuous supply and avoid "macadamia nut withdrawal"! Enjoy!
summary: Go Nuts Trying To Find These!

reviewText: I've ordered this honey before and am very satisfied with the quality, however, the packaging seems to be an issue.  Three cases and each one had leakage from several bottles--not too significant but enough to make a mess.  Caps appeared to be tight but somewhow the honey oozed out??  Other than that, the product is good and I'll continue ordering it.

I am a believer of the benefits of curcumin, though mostly on faith so far and not so much on actual results.  I don't think I have been taking it long enough or consistently enough to notice a difference myself.  I've read it helps to prevent cancer so have been giving it to my dogs.  I've also heard that taking it with boswellia can help relieve chronic pain, another reason I give it to my dogs.  I did notice that it can cause upset stomach so it's best to build up gradually and maybe take it with a meal.  Another weird thing was that it made one of my dog's poop smell sort of flowery and pleasant.  Swear to god.I've tried a few other brands and have no complaints about any of them, other than I'm just not sure if they did anything and any improvement was just a coincidence.  But I still believe.  I was intrigued by this particular brand because it is the only one that says "certified organic."  Also, it doesn't have all those little extra ingredients added by most other brands like magnesium stearate and silicon dioxide. I actually honestly don't know what those things are but figure I'd rather not be ingesting them if given a choice.For the reasons above, I like this brand.  Time will tell how well it works.  I do notice the powder is a much darker brown than the bright orange gold of other brands, but I suspect it has to do with the bioperine (fancy name for black pepper).  This is the first curcumin supplement I've used with this ingredient so I'm interested to see if I notice a difference in results.UPDATE 3 DAYS LATER:I have a 9-year old 55-lb dog with an arthritic leg. She is very active and still thinks she's a puppy so very little slows her down as of yet, including a limpy leg.  Over the past couple of years, her limp has come and gone away on its own, usually within a week or so.  However, late last year, it came back and has stayed for several months now, despite our attempts to control her activity level a little.I'm not keen on rimadyl without at least trying more natural remedies.  I have been giving her some herbal concoction for pets marketed for arthritis for the past month and it hasn't helped at all.Enter boswellia + turmeric.  I started her onSource Naturals Boswellia Extract, Boswellic Acids 243 mg, 100 Tabletsabout a week ago.  1 tablet twice a day with meals.  No difference.I then added Dr. Danielle's Turmeric a couple of days ago.  Started low with 1 pill once a day with a meal to help avoid stomach upset with the intent to increase it to 1 pill twice a day after a week.  To my surprise, after just 1 day, her limp was noticeably better.  Still there but much more mild than it's been these past several months.  She ran at the park yesterday so I was expecting her limp to flare up like it usually does after a hard run, but it is still only mild.The skeptic in me scoffs at the possibility that the turmeric could have made such an improvement--heck, ANY improvement, in just a day.  But I know what I see and there has been definite improvement.  So I'm increasing my rating from 3 stars to 4 stars for now and will continue to monitor to see if this is just an awesome coincidence.UPDATE 3 WEEKS LATER:I think I'm sold on this product.  My dog referenced above has still been running like a puppy.  Every time she does this at the park, I always expect her limp to get really bad later at night or the next morning.  But it never has.  The limp remains very mild, no matter how hard she plays.Also started giving this to my other senior dog.  He injured his front leg a little a few weeks ago and walked with a really bad limp for several days.  After giving him the turmeric with boswellia for about 3-4 days, the limp improved--although it also still flares up after a bout of running.I also took this myself for a couple of weeks.  I have something going on with my left hip.  It comes and goes and is some sort of muscle tightness, I think, caused by bad posture.  It's been creeping up on me for the past couple of months until finally it got bad enough that I really had to be careful about how I moved and bent to avoid straining my back, as I have in the past.  It was also painful whenever I walked.  I was at this point for about 2 weeks.  Finally took 1 pill 3x day, along with boswellia, and within 1.5 days, I felt the pain decrease. I can still feel a minor issue at my hip, but I wouldn't really call it pain anymore.  I stopped taking the turmeric after about a week but will go back when I have any other pain.I'm not ruling out coincidence completely, but with the experiences of my 2 dogs as well as myself combined, I think I can say with confidence that the turmeric has definitely helped.  It's pretty rare to notice an actual improvement with any supplements so I'm very impressed.RETRACTION: I previously wrote that the company offers a free bottle for positive reviews. But after reading a comment left to my review, I went back and reread the email the company sent and realized I had misinterpreted.  The company offers a free bottle for ANY review, but does ask that you contact them if you have less than a 5-star experience (no, I haven't contacted them yet because my experience may change over time, and no, I've not requested a free bottle--yet :)  So, sorry Dr. Danielle's Company for the unfounded criticism and thank you, Abbiegail Davy, for putting me straight.
summary: Using with Boswellia & Working for Me and My 2 Senior Dogs

reviewText: The bag I received was about20% assorted mints20% starlight fruit20% strawberry soft center10% assorted fruit soft center10% cinnamon discs10% root beer barrels5% werther's original1% jolly ranchers and misc. fruit candy4% butterscotch discsseemed fresh, delivered on time

Vegan. Organic. Kosher. Wow! Fantastic energy drink. Vegan and organic = double plus purple goodness in a can. Kosher, too. (Many energy drinks are not suitable for vegans because they contain unkind, non-vegan animal-derived ingredients.) Only 140 calories per can. [There is also an even lower cal version, but I don't prefer it.] Widely distributed. Check your local co-op, grocery store, supercenter, or health food store. My locally available price per energy drink (for retail packages of 4 cans) is and has been lower at the time of writing this, than the online price per energy drink, so check around and compare. Made with sparkling filtered water, organic cane juice, organic acai juice, organic acerola juice, organic natural flavors, citric acid, organic guarana extract, guayaki, organic yerba mate extract, organic green tea extract, and fruit & vegetable juice. This review is out there for those for whom it makes a difference. See all of my reviews and the vegancompassion Profile for more great choices. Check out "Vegan Grocery Favorites" and "Vegan Grocery Top Ten" & all the other helpful "Vegan Grocery" Listmania. Your input counts and will be greatly appreciated to benefit the search of others. Thank you.

I love these shells. I cook hotter than they recommend, but that's mostly a matter of which sort of cheese you use to top the pizza (I like whole milk mozzarella, which takes more heat to get bubbly & awesome). Pizza is one of those wheat products I missed most, and getting to have it again is pretty awesome.
These teas are so good, and naturally sweetened with Stevia, so they don't cause a sugar spike. Love this flavor.

This is a great tasting drink. It tastes like an actual apple, not like apple juice. It is an energy drink that actually quenches your thirst. Packed with flavor, I tried this drink and loved it immediately. I would recommend this drink to any adult.  I do not recommend energy drinks to school age children as it's known to make they hyper.

I absolutely love this cereal.  Smells soooo good!  Almost has a banana-y smell to it in my opinion.  I mix it into whatever food my son is eating just for some added health benefits. I also really like the packaging.  A canister is so much better than a non-sealable box like another organic brand (and non-organic brands) comes in.  I've tried the rice and multi-grain cereals too but prefer the consistency of the oatmeal better than the multi-grain (which is a good cereal too but was more flakey and "soft".  Will continue to buy this product for some time.

Except for the cavities, these fun "gems" are exactly the way you remember them!  Yummy, cool (if you're in elementary school) and almost fashionable, they're some "funnest" candy of my childhood. Now my kid can have the same fun without the dental danger.

I usually make my own coconut milk from shredded coconut but I could never get enough of the lovely fat that I wanted to make whipped cream and so I decided to purchase some canned for the holiday season to make my life a little easier.  I am now hooked.  These cans are BPA free and the nothing is in the coconut milk, it is just coconut milk.  There is no guar gum or preservatives and I love that because I don't stomach gums well.  The box the cans were packed in was a bit beat up and so were the can inside but the damage did not puncture the can and the product was still good.  There was a best by date on the box that was well over a year from purchase.  The flavor is wonderful, the milk is super thick so one can can be thinned with a can of water and is still rather rich.  This I like because it makes it go further.  I highly recommend this brand of coconut milk and have already bought a second case.
Kids inhaled them within seconds of receiving them - what more can I say?  They said all flavors were equally delicious

Let me first say that I don't think I've ever had real truffles. I've been to restaurants where they were offered, but I never wanted to splurge quite that much. That being said, I love truffle oil, so if you're complaining that it doesn't taste like real truffles, I don't care!
