It tastes amazing to me, it doesn't cost a fortune, and it's not rare so you can have it any time you want.There's an award-winning pizza from a little pizzeria in Olympia, WA with potatoes, onions, fresh basil and a white sauce, drizzled (tableside) with truffle oil that I've been recreating at home. Delish.

reviewerName: terrirn143 "Terri Dunaway, RN BSN RAC-CT MHA ...
reviewText: Yummy, fast, delicious, high quality and we would buy again and again!  Great with butter or you can use like shortcakes and put strawberries over them.

This is a superb product!  Excellent service and packaged with care.  I used to purchase this high quality olive oil at the Farmer's Market in San Francisco but have recently relocated to the East Coast so I now must have it shipped to me.  Shipping is less when you order in multiple quantities.  I will definitely order from this vendor again since I was pleased with the transaction.  Thank you very much!
summary: This is the BEST olive oil!

reviewText: The hold grail for people who drink instant coffee is for one that has the aroma & taste of a freshly brewed cup of coffee. While this is one of the better instants I've tried it still a far cry from that fresh brewed taste. The biggest reason for buying this brand over say Nescafe is the fact that this is a fair trade coffee company that pays attention to the needs of the growers. That this is a company that cares about where it's coffee comes from makes it a moral choice as well as one for their attention to quality. Taste wise the place this coffee really shines is in cooking & baking. I used it in a chocolate/coffee/cream cheese frosting & it was wonderful. It blends well into smoothies and in baking the flavor doesn't cook out. All in all this coffee comes highly recommended

I have tried quite a few brands (usually the organic store brands of the grocer I am at because they are cheapest) but this was on sale at Mother's so I picked it up and it is so delicious compared to the other kinds! I put a tablespoon of it in my oatmeal with a little bit of organic grade b maple syrup (Coombs Family, also awesome and available on Amazon for the best price) and some organic ground flax seed and it was awesome. My kids like it too. Love that they use organic raw almonds and no other ingredients!
summary: Favorite Almond Butter I have tried!

reviewText: This is an excellent olive oil.  I always look for 100% virgin, first cold press - nothing else.  The price is good for this type of product.

Ok, I purchased several bags of these and set them out in bowls for guests' enjoyment around Easter.  Seemed like a better alternative to cheaper chocolates or those marshmallowy things.They went fast.  I adored them, myself.  They aren't fine chocolate but are certainly much preferable to the cheaper brands.  Smooth, melty in your mouth and tasty.  Exactly what you're looking for in a chocolate snack.Packaged nicely, too.  The blue and silver wrappers look cute in fancy bowls.

Tried numerous brands of almond butter over the yrs; this is hands down the best. Nothing but ground up raw, organic almonds in a jar. Superior taste and texture. Only downside is that cost-wise, it's higher than most. But frankly nothing could keep me from repurchasing this product, because it really is just SO DARN GOOD! (Ok, maybe I'd think twice if it cost 50 bucks or something...oh who am I kidding? I'd prob still buy it, haha, not even gonna lie!)

Like most people, I was attracted to this product for two main reasons: it claims to be healthy and it's strawberry-flavored. But most importantly, I was hoping to find another healthy yet tasty snack to have on-hand at work, and it seemed like these semi-new Quaker Stila bars could fit the bill with their Nutra-Grain Bar-like approach. And, expecting something like what is pictured and promised on the cover, I requested the bars.I wasn't really sure what to think when I got them. Everything seemed fine at first glance -the nutrition facts matched up with what precisely was promised, but I feel like the "healthy" aspect of the bars were a little exaggerated and it was implied on the cover that these bars are healthier than they actually are. While they may only be 100 calories per bar and have 0 trans fats, they are packed with super-high levels of sodium and have very few beneficial things, like vitamins or fiber.Then, when I bit into the bar itself, my very neutral expectations were immediately destroyed. These things are disgusting. They taste like cardboard and have absolutely no substance. The photo on the label implies that there is a solid layer of fruit filling, but once I bit into the "cookie" bar, I was left thinking "Where's the fruit?" The thin layer of strawberry flavoring is virtually non-existent and I felt like I was eating a hollow shell that tasted like cardboard. I'm not sure if Quaker is convinced that something "healthy" has to taste gross, because they completely nail that concept here.These bars have no redeeming qualities -they taste terrible, the fruit filling is so thin that it's an afterthought, and the bars themselves are so small that they don't really make for a satisfying snack. I'd have to eat 2-3 in one sitting to get something substantial, and I'm a small person. By then, I would have consumed 200-300 calories in just one snack, much more than the label implies. Not really "healthy" and certainly not enjoyable.I had to force myself to eat just one bar for the sake of this review. Then, I threw the box away.

I bought these and have eaten them topped with a Teriyaki sauce or a chicken cream sauce. There's no way you can serve this as a side dish by itself. It would be just a solid clump. You can't take a few kernels onto your fork. If you place your fork into them, you'll get the whole pile when you pick up the fork. The texture is very gummy and it does have a weird taste. Not like any other brown rice in the supermarket. The rice is roundish and plump and goupey. Almost like little balls of squish. It's a little disturbing so I won't purchase again. Too bad, because it sure is convenient.
I love this decaf Donut Shop coffee. Others were too weak or had a flavor that screamed decaf. This one has a caffeinated flavor with no bitterness.

Different kind of coffee container for K Cup (not Vue) use than I am used to but brews up a nice cup of coffee.  I prefer the larger brew setting rather than the recommended 8 oz. setting.  It brews a very smooth cup of coffee that drinks well black with a couple of teaspoons of sugar.  Adding half and half creates a nice relaxing cup of coffee.The K cup issue isn't really a problem.  The coffee container still comes in individual packets for the K cup except that you open each individual packet first and install the clear cup inside in the K cup holder to brew.  The container is useful for disposing of the used cup as well.Great tasting coffee!

I have been on something of an apple binge this year.  Ever since I picked up a honey crisp at the Hastings (NY) farmer's market I have wondered how I could have been so oblivious to apples ;)  While I grew up in NY, I now live in Hawaii, far far away from apple country.  I have a kid who has always been huge on apples and apple products, and I am big on avoiding chemicals, pesticides, and anything else which is not especially good for us. Up to this point our favorite has beenSeneca Cinnamon Apple Chips,.7-Ounce Bags (Pack of 60)though when I noticed that there was sugar in it (not very much, actually) I went looking for something without.  I tried several brands and found some too tough, some too light, and finally came acrossBare Fruit 100% Organic Cinnamon Apple Chips, 14-Ouncewhich I find almost as good in terms of taste and texture, and about as good as you can get nutritionally.I triedPeeled Snacks Organic Apple Clusters, Cinnamon Crunch, 60 Gramthinking they would be much like the Seneca based on the manufacturer's description.  When I tasted them I thought it was something l;ike a "rice crispy treat" albeit flavored with something like concentrated cider: not bad, but very very sweet.  I looked at the ingredients and saw 10 grams of sugar/ serving and thought... that's not so bad, so why did it seem so sweet to me, and then I took a closer look, and saw that that was per 15 gram servicng.  15 grams! (note, that is 1/4 of the 2 oz package!  It is 2/3 sugar!!  I sincerely doubt you will find a candy, other than rock candy or cotton candy which has such a high percentage of sugar.  That said, just for fun I did a little comparison.This past Sunday my son deferred from breakfast, saying he had already had it.  O.K. , once a year he can do this (he's skinny as a rail, no weight problems here).... so I pulled up the information, and... will let it speak for itself:Cadbury Chocolate BunnyServing Size 1 pc (40.0 g)Amount Per ServingCalories 210Calories from Fat 108% Daily Value*Total Fat 12.0g 18%Saturated Fat 7.0g  35%Cholesterol  10mg 3%Sodium 40mg 2%Total Carbohydrates 23.0g 8%Dietary Fiber  1.0g 4%Sugars 21.0gProtein  3.0gPeeled Apple clustersserving size 15 gramssaturated fat 0trans fat 0cholesterol 0sodium 0fiber 2 gsugars 10 gSo that we are comparing apples to apples, per 10 gram "serving," the Cadbury bunny has 5 grams of sugar, the apple clusters roughly 7 (.67), so Peeled Snacks Apple Clusters have half again as much sugar by weight as your average chocolate bunny.  Is it off base to call these candy?Other than that, I like that the ingredients are wholesome; no chemicals or otherwise unidentifiable ingredients, BUT know that these are mostly (2/3) sugar and treat them accordingly.  For me, that means more or less banishing them from my house.  I like sugar as much as the next person... BUT my personal strategy is to treat indulgences as just that, so I would personally rather have the chocolate and say that I, or the kids, have had our desert, treat... whatever, than to treat a product which is 2/3 sugar as if it were food.  Again, they are made from wholesome natural ingredients.  I just thought I would point out to whoever is watching their weight, has dietary concerns related to sugar, or is watching out for someone else... that these have an awful lot of sugar.  That said, I am off to reup my subscription to bare fruit for myself, and get a box of the Seneca chips for the kids.I am aware of a recent study which showed how food producers twist facts to make their products look healthier by tweaking the serving size.  How realistic is 1/2 oz of fruit as a snack?  If it were a piece of candy, maybe.  If a serving size is 1/4 of the 2 oz package, why to they not either package it in 1/2 oz bags or call out on the front of the package that you are getting 4 servings in that little bag?  In any case, I find it misleading in the extreme.  I like that it is made with natural ingredients.  I do not like misleading labeling, particularly when it is something which could cause serious problems for people with diabetes.

For what is, a variation on Hamburger Helper but more expensive, this is OK.  There was something about the flavor, possibly the spices, that I just didn't enjoy.  Moreover, it really didn't taste like Velveeta cheese, which I really enjoy cooking with.  This is not something I would actually buy and eat on a regular basis. If I really want a boxed meal I'll go with Hamburger Helper
I got this by mistake I thought I was getting the green tea energy which I LOVE- however this is not bad tastes like regular geen tea nothing out of this world or special

The whole family LOVES these fudgy, chocolately treats! Knowing they are 100% Organic and have only healthy, pure ingredients not only makes them Taste Better but I (mom) feel much less guilty when I am enjoying them! My daughter demands that two of these always be present whenever I pack a school lunch. My toddler can't get enought so I have to hide them sometimes and my husband would sit down and eat half the container if I didn't shoo him away. Good Stuff!

The Peeled Snacks Organic Apple Clusters, Cinnamon Crunch, 60 Gram is a great, healthy snack. Not overyly sweet or sugary and is also a great source of fiber. Also a great way to get your daily fruit intake in a crunchy and fun way. Although it is not packed that much with sugar at 10g per serving, I just wished it could be a little lesser, maybe in the range of 3-5g per serving. Free of fat, cholesterol, trans fat and saturated fat, it is deemed healthy and they taste great too. A truly apple delight!
summary: healthy snack, great source of fiber

reviewText: This is a very mild delicious tuna that is packed in olive oil. It is much tastier than water packed or soy bean oil packed tuna. Nice quality tuna in each and every can. With very little mayo you can make a moist tuna salad or eat it straight out of the can. These are smaller cans than the standard grocery store size. Because olive oil is used it is a great to topping for a salad without the added use of dressing.Very good tuna that I would highly recommend!
summary: Very mild tuna fish in olive oil...

reviewText: Since I have lime and Meyer Lemon trees, I bought the "plain" unflavored cans.Don't waste your money!FD:  I spend a month a year in Italy; was married to a half Italiana for 28 years, and lived with a primera generacion Italiana for 8 years.

We're trying to eat less meat - but still love dishes like meatloaf, meatball soup, etc.  I've been using this TVP (plus some additional seasoning) to substitute for half the meat in some favorite recipes and both of us eat them happily, though it's taken a bit of experimenting to get quite the same taste and texture.  I look at dishes that call for plain TVP but am not so sure I'm ready to try them yetWhen a dietician told me I should to add more protein to my breakfast and suggested adding an egg (ugh - really don't like eggs), I tried adding a couple of tablespoons of it in my morning oatmeal.  It needs a bit of flavoring (cinnamon and/or raisins plus some stevia for sweetening) to keep from tasting like dog kibble, but with the flavoring it tastes great and I can really tell the difference in the amount of energy I have in the morning.
summary: Good way to get protein while cutting down on meat

reviewText: We love boxed meals because they're so easy to make after a long day and better for you than fast food.  However, we do get tired of the same ole', same ole' meals so decided to give this one a try.First off, they recommend 1 inch pieces of chicken which really cutting them even smaller would have been much better.  Personally I didn't care for the flavor but I love velvetta cheese so I'm guessing that's due to the seperate spice packet that you have to add to the mixture.  What I do love is that there's a completely seperate package with the brocolli so you can add a little of it or a lot depending on your personal tastes.My husband said the dinner was actually very good though he agrees the flavor is a bit dull.

These Quaker Stila Blueberry Cookie Bars have some nice qualities, but when taken all together are not that great. What you get is a sandwich of two rectangular cookies with a very thin layer of fruit "stuff" in between and a coating of grains and oats on top.The cookies are not very sweet, in fact they're almost cracker-like and savory. The filling is quite sweet and has a very syrupy fruit flavor. The grains and other crumb makers on top are just for show and the only thing they add to the mix is a heightened degree of messiness.The overall problem is that there is no balance between the hard, crisp savory cookie and the liquid, overly sweet filling. If there was the amount of jam shown in the product illustration above actually in the bar, it might just work.As it is, you end up with an overall impression of dryness instead or crispness and snowcone syrup sweetness without the natural fruit flavor. These are not bad, but not something i would seek out.
summary: A Little on the Dry Side

reviewText: I purchased this flour for baking Gluten Free and I like that it is very fine compared to the other ones easily available. Most of the recipe books that I have shun Bob's Red Mill almond flour for being to coarse and I decided to try a finer one just to see how the recipes would turn out. It is much better with this flour, my baked good seem to have more of a robust consistency rather than runny like I had with the coarser flour.

I agree with the other reviewer--this might be a bit pricey but the flour is very finely ground and yields excellent results!  If you use a lot, it might be cheaper to buy directly from the manufacturer, but otherwise Amazon's price is pretty good considering the free shipping.  The other almond flour I used was Honeyville--this brand is finer and much preferred!
This is the closest thing to actual "flour" (instead of meal) that I've come across yet. The baked goods that I have made have been delicious, and the price is pretty awesome.

The verdict is in for Barrels of Yum, classic flavors.  These are large (yes, they're big), barrel shaped candies in eight flavors: chai tea, granny smith apple, blueberry crumble, hot cinnamon, peach cobbler, orange cream, sour watermelon, and apple pie.  My favorite so is sour watermelon.  Amazingly, my son tried the blueberry crumble and liked it.  He doesn't normally like blueberry.  Everyone in the family approves.The only flavor I didn't care for is the chai tea.  I'm not sure how many of them are left.  It's a little challenging to distinguish the colors, even though they are listed on the box.  That's okay, I haven't heard any complaints.  My only problem now is the kids keep asking for more.This product was provided for review by Barrels of Yum.
Terrific for a quickie ham salad sandwich with mayo and relish. Very flavorful, low cost. Definitely an excellent pantry staple.

Taster's choice decaff is a pleasant mild tasting instant coffee. For travel and long term storage these sticks are a clever packaging option since the plastic lined sticks will keep the coffee fresh and help to avoid making a mess.  This is apparently  the same coffe as Nescafe Taster's Choice Instant Coffee, Naturally Decaffeinated, 7-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 3) but currently at just more than twice the price per ounce.  At the current price of $23.42 for a double pack of 160 (total) coffee sticks the price per serving is a rather reasonable $0.15. The price per ounce of coffee is $2.50 which more than doubles the price of the same coffee in 7 oz canisters.If you enjoy Tasters Choice instant decaff you might want to buy this for travel, camping or to take to work. That is if you drink your coffee black and have easy access to hot water. It is easy to tear open the stick and pour out the coffee making this a convenient low mess option unless you also need to carry creamer and sugar.  Keep in mind that that the sticks are sized for a six oz cup rather than a 12 oz mug.An interesting concept would be to offer an assortment of flavored and non flavored regular and decaff coffees that a host could offer to guests for example. In my case I don't see any need to have 160 mini packs of the same instant coffee that I can buy in a canister.While slightly more expensive I recommend the more convenient packaging format for this product of 24 packages of 6-sticks each (144 total) since these  smaller boxes are easier to pack in a suitcase, pocket, purse or backpack or give as a nominal gift to a friend.Nescafe Taster's Choice Instant Coffee, Decaffeinated,  6-Count Single Sticks (Pack of 24)

I thought Eight O'Clock coffee had gone by the wayside. I used to see it when I was a kid.  I am now a Grandmother, and was so surprised to see it is still around.  I like it very much, especially first thing in the morning.  It is one of the best as I see it.

We just invested in a Keurig coffee maker, and this is one of the coffee flavors we purchased.  I'm really glad we did because this is really good.  You can taste the butter toffee flavor, but it's not overwhelming.  This isn't too bitter.  It's worth the price, especially if you subscribe to it.
Love this selection of the International Coffee's most of all. Delicious, invigorating, makes you want to have another cup right away.

IMHO... One of the biggest let-downs in the Gloria Jean's flavored coffee category is Butter Toffee. While this brew hints at toffee flavor, it is significantly weaker than other manufacturer's flavors.LUCKILY.....you can sell, give, or trade your unwanted k-cups at the K-Cup Exchange on Yahoo Groups (Amazon prevents me from listing the site's address here, but you'll find it if you go on Yahoo Groups and search for K-Cup Exchange) This site is a great idea for K-Cup users. You can find excellent brewing info and hear about REAL specials on K-Cups.
summary: IF YOU DON'T LIKE IT, TRADE IT!!!

reviewText: I have eaten beef jerky occasionally, so I'm not an expert on the product, but I didn't really like this brand.  It is high in sodium; MSG and hydrolyzed soy protein are used in the product. The Teriyaki flavor isn't very pronounced to me, I like spicy foods and I didn't think it was spicy enough. So if you like a mildly seasoned beef jerky product this will probably appeal to you.

These puffs are our go to trip food.  They're not too messy and they taste fresh and not too sweet.  They're also not bad for adults either, when you need to nibble on something but don't want a huge calorie commitment.

I love dried apples. Sometimes I don't like the cinnamon with them but this was a perfect amount. These were very fresh tasting, very refreshing. Healthy and crunchy- Just what I crave- I will order these again- Very yummy!

I will preface this review by first saying I don't normally drink decaf coffee, but I thought I would try it.  It was easy to prepare and had a very convenient packaging.  The instructions say to mix with 6 ounces of water, but I had to add 8 ounces because I found it to be a very strong tasting coffee.

Easy to open packages, but lacks aroma and flavor.  Good as far as convenience for camping, work, etc, but if I were to buy this coffee, I would opt for the jar as it would be cheaper and less packaging.Thanks!

These little "tubes" are perfect to take with you anywhere.  I took them camping, they are fast, easy and portable. Bring them anywhere that you can boil water or make just one cup of coffee in the microwave.
Midnight Magic seems to be one of the strongest flavored K-cups that I have tried.  For a good, bold flavor, this is the one.

I am sipping a cup of this Chai as I write.  First, the positives = it is delicious, aromatic, and full bodied.  And it is sweet, which is a positive for me, but might not be for others.  Then the negatives = it is sweetened with sugar and every cup contains 45 calories.  I did not realize this when I ordered the product, and probably would not have placed the order had I known.  I personally do not mind the taste of stevia, so I would like a version made with that artificial sweetener and having no calories.  If you like sweet chai, and are not counting calories. this may be the Chai for you.  It is delicious!
summary: If you don't mind 45 calories per cup, this is the Chai for you!

reviewText: Liquid aminos are healthier than soy sauce and just as tasty. Once you give it a try, you won't go back!

Best brown rice pasta that I ever tasted! It's not mushy at all as you may concern it may be when it comes to rice pasta. Flavor, taste, texture, and pretty much everything, I prefer this pasta over regular pasta! I don't have any problem with wheat or anything, but I keep buying this pasta after I tried once. Great with any kind of pasta dish, creamy or tomato-based. Totally recommended!

I'm a big fan of brewed teas (I have a huge collection of tea herbs and spices) and I regularly brew up my own tea blends.  I don't normally buy the sort of "ready-made" tea that comes in individual serving size bottles.  I also don't usually care much for green tea.  Despite all that, when I saw this product, I just had to try it.  I was really intrigued by the bits of aloe vera, something I've never eaten before.  So, I went ahead and ordered one.First off, I really like pulpy drinks (like the Sac Sac Grape Pulp Drinks from Asian stores), so I knew that the bits of aloe vera in this drink wouldn't bug me at all.  And indeed, I did enjoy them.  However, if you don't like pulp, you'll really not like this drink.  As for the flavor...  It's not bad.  I've had things that had a bit more interesting flavors to them, but this one is a bit bland/mild tasting.  It's not terrible or anything though, just that I felt like the passion fruit maybe could've been a little stronger.  As for the green tea, I could hardly tell this had green tea in it.  That's great for people who don't like green tea (like myself) but not so great if that was what you were wanting from it.  As for the aloe vera, I'm not sure it really had a flavor at all, as all the bits in here seem to have simply absorbed the flavor from the tea, and thus I can't tell what they would've originally tasted like.  Oh well, the whole thing isn't bad though.As for nutritional content, well, this is mostly sugar and it tastes like the green tea is pretty weak, so I can't pretend that it's terribly healthy or anything.  To be fair, though, the product never claimed to be a health drink.  So, would I recommend this?  Well, I don't know.  I don't really like it enough to want to run out and buy more, but it's not bad, so I guess you'd just have to try one and see if you fall in love with it or not...

Disclosure:  I'm a tap water drinker at heart.  Give me a Camelback bottle and an hour in the refrigerator and I'll gladly drink our city water as is.  When I got the chance to try Essentia's purified, pH balanced water for review purposes, I jumped at it, mostly to find out what I was missing.  On balance, I like it better that tap water or some of the store bottled waters.  I'm probably too stingy to buy more myself, but if you think it would make the difference between drinking water and going without, I would highly recommend Essentia.Flavor:  Essentia is osmotically purified, then electrolytes* are added to mimic the subtle mineral flavors that you get with groundwater.  The result: A very clean water flavor, with an almost silky feel as you drink it.  The difference isn't huge -- it's all water, after all -- but it's definitely there, and it's definitely an improvement.pH Balance: As stated, this is pH balanced at 9.5.  I have to confess I haven't read anything on why you might want water this alkaline, and I didn't notice any difference while drinking it.  Still, if you're looking for an alkaline drink, this fits the bill.

I usually add these to the chocolate smoothie we enjoy in the mornings.  Raw milk, organic cocoa powder, banana, ice, peanut butter, some turbinado or stevia, and a handful of these nibs.  My whole family enjoys it and we really miss the nibs when we run out.  They are a little tasteless to eat alone, but a great addition to other things.  This brand is very good.

An excellent full flavored decaf coffee -- if the label didn't say decaf, I couldn't tell the difference.  A great choice - if you sign up for subscription delivery through Amazon, you can save another 15%.  A very fairly priced product.
summary: Full flavored Decaf K-cup for Keurig Brewer

reviewText: I haven't really tried to many energy drinks but I can understand the concept of regularly drinking if you were rich.  Most of them are disgusting to me and come off super sweet and unfufilling.  I do really like FRS though and if you haven't tried those, I would recommend them.  If I was well off, I would drink one every afternoon instead of some other caffeinated drink.Anyway I do like Jamba Juice so I had high hopes.  This tasted pleasant enough for energy drink standards and what I mean by that is that it didn't make me gag.  It claims to have about as much caffeine as a cup of coffee but to me it felt more like a mild cup of tea.  I guess if you are into energy drinks you can might want to give this a shot but it didn't leave me with a desire to try it again.
summary: Merely ok - did not give me a boost

reviewText: Hey there!  This is an Australian/New Zealand candy bar that is fantastic.  Have any of you ever eaten sea foam candy here in the United States? That is what this tastes like.  Excellent chocolate with, crunchy, "honeycomb"center.  Hard to describe the taste, honestly.

Not a great deal to say other than.....keep the variety & great flavors coming.  Grateful to have a simple machine to THUS FAR service us with great tasting coffee, tea, cocoa (Whatever ones' preference)!!!!!

My wife and I have recently been turned onto Velveeta, and have begun to prefer their macaroni and cheese mix over the regular Kraft Mac & Cheese that we've bought in the past. Our kids seem to have enjoyed it too. When we saw these new skillet meals, we figured we'd give them a try. The cheeseburger meal we tried definitely wasn't something to be too excited about, but it did taste good. Throughout the whole meal, it reminded me personally of Hamburger Helper. I didn't feel like there was much of a difference other than the signature Velveeta cheese. The huge plus to all of it is that our picky kids who hardly eat anything ate up everything on their plates. To them it was another mac & cheese meal (even though there was other things thrown in), and that is all that mattered. From that perspective, the dinner was a huge success, and would definitely be something we'd want to purchase again.  It's hard to find meals where our kids will actually eat everything, and enjoy doing so. Too often than not they don't even try the meal, and yet says, "I don't like this."To sum it up, for adults, nothing too special. For kids, especially those that love mac & cheese, this was a winner for us.

I drank four double espresso's of this smooth mild Magnum Kona blend of coffee just now. I made it without adding anything to it. It tasted pretty good. It does not have the complex flavors of their Jamaica Blue Mountain blend; but it a Kona blend and therefore mild and smooth. I like it; but the Jamaica Blue Mountain blend is still my favorite as it has a lot of flavor though I do like this Kona blend as it is so smooth and tastes good. The beans are roasted a little dark; not as lightly roasted as the Jamaica Blue Mountain blend. I have enjoyed other Kona coffee blends so I wanted to try this. I feel happy with this Kona blend as I can drink it neat and enjoy it full strength.
summary: Smooth Kona blend; mild coffee tastes good neat.

reviewText: these do have the usual drawbacks of all food bars - gooey and overly sweet, but they are better than most.

So here's my OMG Tom and Jerry:  4 cups brewed Bigelow Pumpkin Spice Tea; 1 cup fat free half and half; 3oz. Rum. You'll need to hide this if you want some for yourself. (Tis the season to be a little greedy).
I love the spicy flavor of this tea, it's like fall in a mug.  I don't know of any other brands that have such a good selection of seasonal teas.

Pink in color with great flavor!  Minerals from nature; not processed from crude oil and labeled "Natural"!  Personally, I use Himalayan culinary salt in all family cooking & canning.  Modifying my "salt restricted diet" for my high blood pressure and to my surprise my blood pressure dropped 4% over 2 1/2 months.  I still don't sprinkle any form of salt on food after cooking.

I highly recommend this to anyone who eats a gluten-free diet. Other than price, it stacks up quite well to wheat spaghetti, though the taste is slightly different. My pasta-loving kids eat it happily and I can enjoy "spaghetti night" with them now. The texture is very good with either the normal or energy-saving cooking directions. However, I've found that there are a few things that make a difference in the final quality.First, regardless of which cooking method you use, after you add the pasta to the boiling water, STIR until you're sure all of the noodles are completely separated. If you don't separate them when you first add them to the boiling water, they might stick together and not cook properly. (This is true of wheat spaghetti, too, but the Tinkyada pasta seems a little more prone to it.) After they are all separate, you don't have to stir again if you're using the energy-saving method. With the normal method, I recommend a quick occasional stir to make sure none of the noodles are sticking to the bottom of the pot.Second, don't skimp on the rinsing. You'll see the water goes very cloudy when the pasta cooks - a lot of starch is being released into the water. You have to get that rinsed off or the pasta will stick together after you drain it. If you do the rinsing right, it won't stick together - even leftovers that have been refrigerated won't be sticky.  The cold water rinse seems to be particularly important. Since I like to serve spaghetti noodles hot, I start rinsing with cold water and then finish with hot water. The result is hot spaghetti with no stickiness.Third, unless you're on a low-sodium diet, I recommend salting the cooking water as directed on the package. Salting improves the taste (it's slightly sweet if you don't salt the cooking water) and it also seems to improve the texture slightly.About the energy-saving cooking method: This is great in the summer time since you can turn off the burner sooner and not dump as much heat into the house. But when it's time to rinse you may find that not only is the water very cloudy, but a skin of starch has developed on the surface of the water. It's not pretty, but it rinses right off. (I mentioned this because it freaked my husband out the first time he saw it; I thought I'd save someone else from that surprise.)
summary: No need to miss wheat spaghetti anymore

reviewText: These triangle tea bags are small, so I thought they might make a weak herb tea.  But it's quite pleasant in flavor, not weak, not overpowering.  My taste buds first picked up the blackberry, with a candy-like flavor, followed by the vanilla.  Best flavor is experienced when the tea is allowed to cool 5 minutes before consumption.  I do not find a sweetener necessary in this tea.

Wow...I guess "beauty is in the eye of the beholder" when it comes to coffee.  I purchased this for my hubby since he drinks WAY more then he should.  This is his after dinner/night coffee.  It's GREAT!  Yes, I actually DID try it....I do not like decaf coffee and this is excellent.  This is like going to a fine resturant and getting their decaf coffee.  So....this gets 2 HUGE thumbs up from me and OH YEA, hubby loves it and this is our second order here from Amazon on this.
I like theses little pods first of all and I like that they are easy to use so that's a plus plus and I like a change from just reg tea or lemonade and theses gave both yummy

These taste really good to me and I think they make a great snack however, what sort of surprised me is how many almonds comprise 100 calories. It's a scant handful and it's a girl handful, not a guy handful. I didn't realize this so I really like the individual bags because it keeps me honest and I don't over do it.It's super easy to throw one of the packs into my purse or my coat pocket so if I'm late to a meal, instead of just being starving and eating more than I normally would, I can have one of these and it takes the edge off my appetite so (hopefully) I don't just pig out when I finally do get home to eat.One last thing: I have type 2 diabetes and these hardly spike my blood sugar at all. Just a few points. I would definitely buy these again.

I love velveeta's macaroni and cheese and this is pretty much that with added seasonings and adding your own hamburger. It fed two adults and we even had some leftover for lunch. Took 20-30 minutes to cook, but was very easy. It's rich and very filling. I would get again and will certainly be trying the other skillet dinners they are offering.

I was very excited to try out Viva Labs Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil. Not only have I heard that Coconut Oil has great health benefits if you use it as a supplement, but I also heard that it is a great option for cooking oil. Reading the label on the Viva Labs container I learned it can be used for skin and hair care too.Viva Labs Coconut Oil is certified USDA Organic, CCOF Certified Organic and is a NON GMO Project Verified. Besides all the health, cooking and skin and hair care benefits, the certifications caught my attention too. I know that USDA Organic is a seal I look for and respect because the process to be able to be USDA Organic is extensive and I usually choose products with this seal for my family.I did not know about the other certifications so I had to look them up. CCOF Certified Organic stands for California Certified Organic Farmers and was the first organic certification entity in the U.S. The NON GMO Project Verified seal means that there are no genetically modified organisms used in the product. I did more research on NON GMO, because I was curious and found their website very helpful and interesting.Trying Coconut Oil out in the kitchen, I found that we will have to get used to the taste of it for sautéed vegetables; it's not a bad taste, just different. As a family we have made other healthy changes that we had to get adjusted to and I think it will be just a matter of time and we will prefer coconut oil to all other oils.I originally only wanted to only try the Coconut Oil in cooking but I decided to give it a try on my hair too! As for hair care, I found coconut oil to be the perfect restorative mask! My hair is dry on the ends and tangles easily. The Viva Labs Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil really gave my hair a nice soft feeling. So needless to say, I'll be getting another container so that I can have one in the kitchen and one in the bathroom!

With low expectation, I opened this pack and was pleasantly surprised.  These apple clusters have the perfect size and tastes for a perfect snack.  It's crunchy and supposedly healthy.  It is a bit on the sweet side (I don't like sweet) but I like this snack a lot.  I think I'm already addicted to it.  Price wise it is reasoneable I guess.  If it were $2.50, I'd buy them in bulk and send some to others as well. On a funny note, the package of this snack looks exactly like the ones my cats love, I hope I don't mix them in and accidentally chew on their snacks.

Velveeta Cheesy Skillets look like your typical 'boxed dinner'. You add a pound of ground beef to macaroni and seasoning, for a quick, tasty meal, but the similarities end there. Velveeta Cheesy skllets dinner kits have a package of creamy Velveeta cheese sauce right in the box, so the meal is much more creamier and cheesier. It comes in four varities, but I tried the Ultimate Cheeseburger Mac. Very easy to make and really tasty.  The box makes the directions very clear and concise and all you need to add is water and ground beef. I really think having the package of Velveeta cheese sauce makes a huge difference from other brands because it didnt turn out watered-down like some of this type of meal so. It was very rich and creamy.The seasoning pack gives it a little "zing", so it is more than just mac and cheese with meat. The box also suggests "cutomizing: it with chopped tomatoes and lettuce. Although this sounds good, I prepared it the regular way.  I love to cook, but sometimes I come home from work and dont feel like preparing a big meal. Those are the days I like to have something easy to prepare. This was perfect and  because a package makes about 5 servings, so there was plenty left over. Very filling and satisfying, I would definitely buy it again. I could preapare it and divide into servings for several lunches during the week. I think it's also great for kids who like mac and cheese. While, it certainly is not a "gourmet" meal , it is quite excellent quality.

I've been trying to recover my healthy the last few years after being severely disabled. I've  changed my diet and drink more tea now and wanted a tasty substitute for sugar, but a lot of that garbage out there is more toxic and harmful than white sugar. After learning that I needed to get back to whole foods with enzymes intact. I read about raw honey. I purchased this brand and was pleasantly satisfied. I have found a local farm that carries raw honey for a little cheaper than this so I probably won't buy from here again, but I do highly recommend this brand.

This elbow pasta is delicious.  It take a little longer than regular pasta to cook but it is so worth it.  I have served it to others and they don't even know that it is gluten free  I would definitely recommend it.
summary: Tinkyade Brown Rice Elbows if Rice Bran

reviewText: Since Right Foods was sold or consigned to another company, the quality has gone down.  Almost none of the ingredients are organic anymore.  Ingredients often smell and taste stale, the flavoring isn't as good as it used to be, and I often find bits of packaging in the food cups themselves. The food itself is still vegan, or at least we hope so.Overall, I can't justify spending in the neighborhood of $1.50 to $2.00 per food cup any longer..
summary: Not bad, but quality has gone down

reviewText: Good, but not good enough.  The people developing these either are producting for those that do not need to be Gfree the rest of their lives and obviously have never tasted Gfree foods.  Chocolate Chip Cookies should not have an aftertaste from the flour blend used.  Do yourself a favor and invest in the book Cooking for Isaiah (found on Amazon).  There is the most awesome recipe for your own Gfree All Purpose Flour and from there you can make the most awesome chocolate chip cookies of your life.  My non-gfree family members will eat down my gfree cookies before they will finish off a bag of Chips Ahoy.
summary: You have to really be in a pinch.

reviewText: I have used this product for the past month for my Gluten Free, sugar free, soy free, dairy free eating habbits.I absolutely love eating this and the delicious baked goods from pizza crusts to chip cookies and breads. Recipes from the spunky coconut and elana's pantry will help you get started and keep U fullfilled!Eating Almond based leaves you so satified and full. The GF diet tends to be very starchy/high carb diet. I realized the "hang-over" from, firstly, the sugar and high carbs were making me feel ill & sleepy after eating.ONE DAY is the difference! No bloating, no belly/digestive discomfort.It is so nice to be able to get this from Amazon! However, Honeyville is the best price at 29.99 with 4.49 shipping. Purchase the 25lb bg. for the best price/lb.[...][...][...]

These look like gummy candy, but that's where it changes. They are soft and chewy and do not stick to your teeth or pull out your fillings. The flavors are right on to tasting like the real thing. The one down side is the bag is 2.5 oz and has 2.5 servings. It is very hard to not eat the whole bag at one time. That is 200 colories which is less than a high fat candy bar but still if you are watching what you eat..it's 200.
So tasty and so quick and easy. Love it. I knew it was going to be good when I licked the spatula. Bad news is it additive.;-)

I bought these last summer from Amazon to use for cooking and on appetizer plates at my fish camp in Alaska and they were an overhwelming hit!  The first time you try one they are SALTY and you "wonder" if you like them...  Then you find yourself reaching for another just to see if you do like them...then another, and another, and another!  I used them to cover salmon fillets and roast in the oven...every time I did this I had to cook more than the time before to satisfy everyone.  I will be using them at camp again this summer...on Demand!
summary: They ARE Addicting!  You can't just eat one!

reviewText: when I went to make a larger order of it at Amazon, found it's cheaper and immediately available at the local grocery store ($22.68), though I do have to add tax. (On the other hand, I'm supposed to declare the tax avoided on my state tax anyway.) So, double check on pricing at your local grocery chain, etc. Another problem - turns out my digestive system is allergic to its non-sugar sweetening ingredients.
A bit grainy but good taste, not crumbly like some mixes and full of chocolate chips.  Bake up nice a fit flat though
summary: Gluten free chocolate chip cookie mix

reviewerName: P. McCoy "Friend of Bill W. and Dr. Bob"
reviewText: Much as I LOVE coffee, coffee is not always good for me.  I've been trying to find K-Kups of tea for use in my Keurig and was DELIGHTED to spot this!!  It just arrived yesterday and I had my first cup this afternoon.  LOVE the taste hot or cold!!!!
summary: I LOVE Being Able to Brew Tea With My Keurig!

reviewText: Lipton's Herbal Pyramid Tea is a quality product. It is made with real pieces of hibiscus and blackberry, giving it an authentic flavor. It is also caffeine free, making it a good tea to drink before bed. The tea is also calorie free, making it a good choice for those trying to lose weight. The tea is somewhat strong, so do not let it steep for too long. The diamond shaped tea bags are unique and allows more room for fruit and herbs to infuse.
Very good. I use it in my hot tea in the morning and it tastes great so I will def recommend

not like some mediocre juice [especially apple], that's, sometimes, weak on flavor.......VERY robust natural grape. you have to add sugar; way to tart.you can dilute by 1/2 and it's still very good. makes it  much more economical than it looks............ love it.p.s......it does contain some Apple juice
I like this product as a tasty, healthy hydrator.  It has a good, clean taste and the special nozzle with screw cap for Amazon buyers only is a terrific feature.

We LOVE these little juice boxes because they contain very little sugar and are compact in size - making them not only easier for little ones to consume, but also easier for mommy to schlep to the park! Our friends are appreciative of them when they come over for play dates. We serve them at our kids birthday parties and provide them at school for snack time. The kids call them "Clifford Juice."Amazon's price is about 30% less than what we have found at the local (major) grocery store chain. This one has become a 'subscribe and save' staple in our household.
My kids like it.  It's organic.  And it is the right size - not too big, so they don't get too much sugar.

My son is 11 months and has severe peanut, egg, oat, and wheat allergies. His diet is limited right now, and while I don't normally give an 11 month old a chocolate chip cookie, in his case I felt like he deserved a treat. As a parent it's upsetting to realize that all the things you took for granted with your other kids aren't even an option now with this one. But I'm determined to make his childhood as "normal" as possible. Figuring out all the different flours and ratios is more difficult than I thought it would be so right now I'm trying to ease into it with mixes. I made these cookies with butter, vanilla, and flax seed water that I let gel for a few minutes. The dough was sandy, but they looked perfect once baked.  I left them on the baking sheet long enough for them to set so they didn't crumble at all. My son  really enjoyed his cookie. Flavor was excellent, really shocked at how good they were, even the next morning. They were crisp, but still tasty. I'm really excited about how well they turned out. And I'm also so thankful that Betty Crocker doesn't put eggs or peanuts in their GF mixes.. Thank You!!
this has a sour taste and no sweetness as expected.  one was enough,had to return it. did not taste like the coconut water i know and love.

I LOVE Tinkyada for making this and all their other brown rice pastas!  Since rice pasta is the only thing they produce, there's no possibility of cross-contamination with gluten products on the same machinery.  We added it as a Subscribe & Save item which makes it just over $3 a bag delivered to our door.  Pretty reasonable in my book.The taste and texture are virtually the same as semolina pasta and far better than whole wheat pasta.  Cooking time is a bit faster than wheat pastas, which is another benefit in my book.  Hubby and I tend to make a big pot of something and then eat it for a couple days in a row.  If you do this, I recommend cooking the pasta separately and adding the soup or sauce to it, as it has a tendency to get too soft if stored as leftovers.

This is akamiso, a red miso paste. Some other reviewers apparently do not know the different types of miso and gave poor reviews because of their lack in knowledge (or their lack in ability to use google). This is a red miso paste, a very good red miso paste. I've used this in many recipes and actually prefer it to other more expensive types of miso. I've even used this to replace white miso (shiromiso) in certain ramen/udon dishes with great results.Akamiso is general stronger in flavor. If you are looking for a lighter i flavor white miso please do your research first. This is a fantastic red miso

This Blue Sky zero is a delightful treat and has a bite to it; I really enjoy it because of the bite, and it's not too sweet.  If you are used to the taste of a specific cola drink, keep in mind that it will just take a little time for your taste buds to adjust. But this is the healthiest cola on the market--stevia and erythritol are a very safe combination of sweeteners--and everyone will do themselves a huge favor by cutting out the unhealthy ingredients contained in diet sodas.
summary: BEST NATURAL COLA ON THE MARKET BY FAR!!!!!

reviewText: My Nonna Lucia started buying this whole bean coffee at the Grand Union under the Pelham Parkway El,  MANY MANY years ago. The checkout station had a coffee grinder at the very end, so once Nonna paid for her groceries, she'd open the bag and dump the beans into the biiig grinder and flick the switch -- brrrrrrrrrrrrrp....!! the beans would grind, and oh what a wonderful smell!!! Rich, WARM coffee-in-the-raw aroma -- the coffee-bean oils would float in the air and surround us with a foretaste of the delights waiting at home when Nonna Lucia brewed a cup in the old glas percolator!!Every morning at breakfast, Nonna would set the glass percolator on our humble Bronx gas range, and brew herself a cup of 8 O'Clock Coffee. There she would sit at the kitchen table, listening to Italian operettas on Pasquale C.O.D.'s radio show, while dismembering a big chunk of Italian Bread (from Arthur Avenue), eating a soft boiled egg and regally quaffing her cuppa 8 O'Clock Coffee. This is etched in my memory forever. Back then we kids could not drink coffee (By Edict of She Who Must Be Obeyed, Mom Sylvia). But when I was "old enough to drink coffee", 8 O'Clock Cofee (in the red bag) became one of my favorites! (The other, was Schrafft's Coffee, which has gone to Coffeee Heaven as far as I know -- luckily 8 O'Clock is still on earth).The wonderful 8 O'Clock Coffee, in its wonderful whole bean-ness, is still with us. Nonna, unfortunately is not. She left the world at the age of 94, and now listens to the angels (and most probably Pasquale C.O.D. himself) singing in Heaven.Nonna, this cup is in your memory!! * * Lifts cup, toasts Nonna Lucia, savors excellent brew flavor that brings back intense memories of a Bronx childhood and an Italian grandmother's love * *
Tasty and easy to use -- you just pour it into water and it gives you a fizzy boost.  I'm a repeat customer!
This honey is wonderful, but hard as a rock, always have to use upper body strength to get it out, and warm it in a pan to get it spreadable. Other than that, it's wonderful honey,
summary: awesome taste, one thing that bugs me

reviewText: i have purchased this product before. 2 individual sealed pouches of potatoes. i used what i need for single serving and roll down the pouch til needed again. a brand name i will always trust.
summary: betty crocker loaded mashed 100% real potatos

reviewText: I ordinarily have not been a Lipton hot tea person in the past.  I had always considered Lipton to be rather on the weak side.  Not so with these k-cup pods.  You get a robust black tea with a Starbucks-like kick off energy.  You can drink it hot or it would make excellent iced tea that reminds me of Peak Tea.  If you like black tea, you can't go wrong with these with the added convenience of not having to let a tea bag steep for 15 minutes before drinking it.

The Jamba Strawberry banana from Nestle is a pretty nice energy drink. Here are the pros and cons I can figure out with only one sample.Pros:Pretty good taste.Calories level not too high (90)No HFCS (Extracts of Stevia used instead)Good level of PotassiumLow SodiumNo fat22g of carbsMade mostly with fruits (70%)Contains some caffeine (80mg)Cons:Need of additional sweetener (Stevia)No Protein (for a good post workout drink)Conclusion:If you do need energy during the day and do not find your satisfaction with Coffee or Tea, maybe if you are travelling and need something ready, this drink is a pretty good substitute.I did try it today, right after finishing a pretty exhausting workout and I feel quite energized after drinking it. As I said, it was post-workout so I just finished stretching and took a shower. It is hard for me to say if it was because of the shower, the fact that workout tends to energize you afterwards or because of the drink. I would have to study the impact on a longer term to figure this out.As I also wrote, the drink is missing essential nutrients to be a perfect post workout drink but it won't likely be its main use.Would I suggest its use? Yes if you are willing to replace some less healthy drinks with it and not overdo it (because of the caffeine).I still have a personal gripe with all the "All Natural" produces which are not all that natural. Remove the sweetener, use real fruit juice (not concentrates) and I may be interested.I could have given it 5 stars if I wanted to use it on a regular basis. It is not the case.I could have given it 4 stars if the claims of all natural weren't a bit stretched in my opinion.3 Stars is what I give it because it seems a better and healthier alternative to most of the crap on the shelves these days...
Product is great and doesn't have extra sugar added.Can't really say that it compares to buying actual coconuts and chopping them open yourself but for ease of access this stuff is great.
summary: Good coconut; doesn't compare to the fresh stuff though

reviewText: Carnation is no longer making the already made bottle version of this so this is your only option. Mixes easily with milk and really shows we don't need all that sugar. I had every flavor but strawberry and like the chocolate and french vanilla but will be giving strawberry a try.

This is a sourdough tasting bread, that resembles compressed grains. It has a lovely tang and toasts up wonderfully. It doesn't hold together well for large sandwiches, but you can make a nice lighter, open-faced one, like a Smorrebrod. It keeps forever! A very healthy option!

Dark, rich, complex flavors.  Sounds like a description of an outstanding wine?  Nope, this is honey we're talking about here, and it's delicious.  This is not your bland and blonde plastic honey bear honey; this is a richly flavored honey, dark and rich with character.  Add to the flavor the fact that it's organic and fair trade, and you've got a winning combination.An aside here: the first time I saw honey labeled as "organic", I immediately thought "how do they do that??", as honey bees can go several miles in any direction from their hives to collect nectar and pollen, so how could a beekeeper ensure they are harvesting only from organic crops?  The answer is "they don't".  The "organic" refers to the manner in which the hives themselves are managed.  This still has real benefits as today's beekeepers are finding it challenging to keep ahead of tracheal mite infestations, hive beetle incursions and the like.  An organically managed hive will NOT be treated with the chemicals used in conventional hives to control these pests, an advantage if you are looking to reduce your exposure to pesticides and toxic chemicals.The bottle even gets a thumbs-up!  It is designed to sit top-down, so then you're ready to pour honey, just pop the top, squeeze (the honey's already at the lid) and pour.  There is a small inner seal in the hole in the lid that stops the stream of honey as soon as pressure to the bottle is released; this is the most drip-free honey bottle I've ever used.  I'm almost down to the end of the bottle and there is no sticky residue on the outside, no sticky ring left on the countertop.  The bottle is so leak and drip-proof that, on a recent trip, I was able to toss the bottle in a cooler without worries.Great flavor, great packaging, organic and fair trade...short of having your own hives, this is a winner.
summary: Excellent flavor and LOVE the bottle

reviewText: This is a very delicious brand of peanut butter. I love this brand. Jif  makes a delicious sandwich, Good on crackers, vanilla wafers or a spoon full. My Daughter is on a diet she eats it from a spoon. It is a great energy food. It makes Yummy cookies How every ones choice to eat this Jiff Peanut Butter, It will be delicious. It is good to keep extra for children after school snack Peanut Butter & jelly sandwich, yum, yum. One can't go wrong..

When I finally was able to open the bag (which I thought was a good thing, as it DOES preserve freshness), and smelled the coffee aroma, being used to strong Colombian coffees, this Vienna Roast definitely smelled different to me, and honestly, a little strange.After brewing it, though, a friend and I both agreed that it was indeed strong (the way I prefer brewing my coffee), and like Melitta says, "satisfying and full-flavored," but we didn't find it necessarily exceptional, rather very good. We also both agreed that it was a very strong brew, not for everyone, and while it isn't bitter, the full flavor does leave an aftertaste - not necessarily a bad thing.As this was my first time trying Melitta coffee, and enjoying its robustness and full flavor, while the Vienna Roast isn't quite for me, I would absolutely try some of their other flavors - especially Colombian and Hazelnut.  You can definitely taste the richness and quality.  Four and a half stars.
summary: Strong and Flavorful, But This Roast Isn't  For Everyone

reviewText: Nescafe with Coffee Mate (French Vanilla) powder is a delicious instant coffee for those who enjoy flavored coffee but without the hassle of trying to brew it yourself.  The canister is filled with instant coffee and vanilla flavored creamer.  Two tablespoons and some hot water is all you need to enjoy a cup of great tasting vanilla flavored coffee.  I enjoyed the taste of it because it was kind of sweet and the vanilla was strong enough to not overpower the flavor.If you enjoy vanilla coffee and don't want to either brew it yourself or go to an overpriced coffeehouse then you'll want to pick up a canister of Nescafe with Coffee Mate (French Vanilla) powder today.
summary: A great tasting instant flavored coffee for those who enjoy french vanilla

reviewText: I love the strong ginger taste of this ginger ale. As others have noted, it's closer to ginger beer than ginger ale.  However, this variant, sweetened with Stevia, has such a strong stevia aftertaste that it overpowers the ginger.  My advice is to skip the zero calorie version unless you're used to the taste of Stevia from other products.
summary: Unless you're used to Stevia taste, skip this and go for the non-diet version.

reviewText: Lipton's Blackberry Vanilla tea is a solid product with a fine aroma and a pleasant taste. The pyramid bag allows the tea to brew quickly and a bag should be fine for most cups of hot tea though it is not as strong when used for a second cup. The aroma is pleasant and the two flavors mingle together to make it tasty. This is a good tea for most days though, without caffeine, some tea drinkers may prefer it for the late afternoon/evening instead of the morning.

LOVED THESE ALTOIDS...They are great especially after meals. If you have a sore throat or a cold; dissolve some altoids in hot water, add some honey and lemon juice to your taste......relax and sip slowly. You'll be glad you did :-)
I love Betty Crocker gluten free!  This makes wonderful moist cake and cupcakes.  I substitute applesause for the butter and you can not tell the difference.
I love that there are no artificial colors or flavors in this product.  it's just the right amount of sweet to satisfy my kids when I want to give them a treat.

It's hard to believe that Emerald Cocoa Roast Almonds have the identical calorie count per serving as plain roast almonds, because the flavor of this product is so much more intense.The texture is light and crunchy, and the sweet nutty flavor is accented by the cocoa. This is an awesome little snack with a cup of coffee, and it is also quite filling.The word seems to be out on these fabulous little nuts, because every time I search for them in the supermarket, the Cocoa Roast Almonds are totally sold out! Buy them on Amazon and stock up. Once you try them, you won't want to be without them.
I bought this because of all the health benefits, but the taste is pretty bad.
Maybe a little too good as the box seems to be getting empty.  :) Definitely will reorder these!

reviewerName: J. Rose "JR From the Ball so Blue"
reviewText: I got these because I am familiar with the brand and had enjoyed their products in the past. These things are amazing. They're my new favorite snack.I love chocolate.I love almonds.And here I have two great tastes together, but without the added fat or sugar. As a diabetic, I love finding food that feels like I'm doing something bad, but I'm not.These are it.My biggest problem is making myself measure them out and only eating that amount, and not the entire package.For those with an aversion to Splenda, it is present in this product.For everyone else, enjoy!
summary: Chocolate Almonds for the "price" of regular ones? Amazing

reviewText: First, I am a huge fan of real Jamba Juice.  However, this tastes nothing even remotely like that you might find in the stores.  The taste of the strawberry banana is particularly odd.  From the ingredients, it is mostly apple juice and lemon juice (from concentrates), then water, then the rest.This appears to be a cheap licensed product by Nestle.  I'm surprised Jamba Juice let them put their name on the label.  As far as "energy" goes, it does pack a whopping 20g of sugar.  It also has 80mg of caffeine and some light carbonation.  As far as natural or even "all natural", I am at a loss to explain.Considering the price, if you are fortunate enough to live near a Jamba Juice store, save your money and head there.  There, you can get something actually healthy and packed full of nutrition (and sugar if you want) along with various "boosts".  You will feel, hands down, much better than after this.

This is one big bar full of soft sweet granola and peanuts on a bed of peanut butter. My kids thought the bars were simply delectable. Not having a big sweet tooth myself, I would have preferred more salty nut and less sweet granola and peanut butter. That said, the bars were fresh tasting and everyone else seemed to think they contained plenty of nut.With 220 calories per bar and 13 grams of fat, this is obviously not a diet food. It is probably a half way decent choice for an snack; after all sometimes a celery stalk really won't do.

Like many gourmet-type food products you have to buy a lot to get a good value, but since rice keeps well it was worth it, and I share with my family. I really loved the nutty taste. The grains cook up in small bulgar-like pieces, and are softer than a lot of wild rice I've bought in the past.
I was buying this bread regularly, enjoyed it a lot at firstbut got really tired of it and cant imagine ordering it again.Given enough time, maybe, who knows?
This coffee sells for twice as much as the other brands at Safeway. It has an unusual taste and is quite satisfying.

Celsius drinks claim to be "negative-caloric", which is to say that you actually burn calories by drinking it.  Hmmm. . . Sound too good to be true?  Well, of course it is.  It's low-calorie because it's made with Sucralose (Splenda to the average consumer) and it promotes weight loss because its a combination stimulant (taurine) and diuretic - so basically, it works on your body like any over-the-counter diet pill.  That said, the Raspberry Acai flavor does taste pretty good, but it will be up to the individual to decide whether or not any potential benefit justifies the downside.Unlike many other reviewers, I actually liked the taste - I thought that it was a smooth blend of green tea and berry flavor.  However, there is just enough of that artificial tang at the end to tip you off that it's sweetened with Splenda.  But the absence of any fizz or overly harsh flavors made it easy to drink - which is good because it comes in full-size cans and leaves you feeling pretty full (i.e. just shy of bloated) afterward.So is it any energy drink or a diet aid?  It's a little of both.  Most of the crucial ingredients are lumped together into a single line item (i.e. their secret, proprietary mix), but taurine is listed and the caffeine content is obvious.  I found that while Celsius could beat back an afternoon energy swoon, it didn't really make me any more alert or focused - just instantly awake, albeit in semi-zombie form.  This effect came on quickly and did last for a couple of hours at least.Now for the bad news - the "crash" effect that a lot of these drinks try to pin on their competitors was overwhelming with Celsius.  As a little bit of background, I'm a grown adult in good health and am very caffeine-tolerant.  However, during my testing of this product, I made the mistake of drinking two cans about three hours apart and ended up unable avoid my first all-nighter since college.  I was completely awake and pretty functional throughout, although I wouldn't have operated any heavy machinery at the time.  But by the morning, I was suffering headaches, muscle twitches and even a flutter in my chest.  I'm completely sure that this was all temporary side effects of the outrageous amount of stimulants and not permanently harmful, but it was still enough to make me wary from that point on.So, the bottom line is this - if you're looking to occasionally avoid getting sleepy mid-afternoon at the office, or if you need to stay up late once in a while, Celsius may be an option for you to try.  As a prolonged weight-loss regimen, I wouldn't take on the potential health risks in order to grab at some too-good-to-be-true advertising come-on.  There's still only one way to lost weight and keep it off, and it ain't fun and it ain't quick, but it works:  eat better, eat less and exercise more!
summary: Know What You're Drinking and Use with CAUTION

reviewText: * All in all it was a okay drink. However, the banana flavor was very overpowering and the strawberry did not come through as well. I could also taste the herbs really strong so it made me not want to drink it that much.* The energy was not a jittery energy like with most energy drinks. It came on in a subtle way and kept me alert for most of the day. Didn't even need my afternoon coffee fix!* The price for a pack of 12 is $25, which roughly runs about $2.10 per can. Honestly, I would much rather buy the Amway version from my friend Lisa. I tried theirs (it was either orange or citrus) and it tasted like an Orange Crush with no herbal taste. It was REALLY good! They have TONS of flavors and was delicious!* These use natural caffeine where the Amway version uses B vitamins and NO sugar to give you a natural boost.So there you have it. I was not really impressed with this energy drink and will probably not drink another one of this brand. That is just my opinion!

I make the crunchy shortbread cookies from the recipe on the bag constantly.  This is a clean tasting sugar but it won't melt in brownies.12 packs is a lot but I am nearly half way through this order and have no regrets buying in bulk.

This is high quality chocolate and it is easy to tell the difference between it and lower quality ones.  I make a chocolate flourless cake and it comes out so good using Ghiradelli's.  It is not grainy or bitter, unlike Hershey's, IMHO.  Amazon has the absolute best prices for this and beat the retails store prices virtually every time.  Amazon Prime shipping makes it even better with 2-3 day delivery to your doorstep.

This is a sub-par product.  While the idea of it is, in and of itself, good, the execution leaves much to be desired.  The candy on each little card strip is about the size of a Smartie.  In addition, the card strip is waxy, so you have to write on it with a ball-point pen (and even that is a challenge).  You'd be better off writing a note on the back of a 3 X 5 index card and leaving a Peanut M&M on top of it.

This sugar made beautiful floss that's for sure. Personally though, I did not like any of the flavors. I am sort of partial to the traditional pink cotton candy flavor, none of these taste anything like that. It was for a birthday party and the little kids liked it, that's all that mattered!

I love the Stevia Select powder and it’s the only brand I buy. So decided to try their liquid to have an easy way to sweeten cold drinks, since the powder doesn't dissolve instantly in cold beverages. I have tried other brands of stevia liquid and I have to say this is my favorite.  It is very important to me that it has no bitter aftertaste. Plus, it mixes instantly, (perfect when eating out), and it is small and fits easily in my purse or pocket. The liquid is concentrated and easy to measure.  It only requires about 7 drops to sweeten a large glass of tea. I also like that there is no alcohol added. I prefer the glass bottle since there are chemicals in plastic containers that can be released into any liquid that's stored in it. Long story short, this is my favorite stevia liquid and I recommend it for an easy natural sweetener that tastes great in anything.

I was expecting something bold with some richness or extra bite. It was kind of bland. Mind you, there was nothing wrong with it, just wasn't anything I'd buy again as there are so many other K-Cups out there with more flavor.
We love this snack at my house. It's tasty and has a nice crunch. The ingredients are much better than snacks like Cheetos and makes a perfect snack to include in your kids' lunch.
We seem to be going through a lot of these since I first ordered them. We are on our third or fourth order. That speaks for itself.

I have been a longtime Celestial Seasonings drinker for years, but they do not have a blackberry flavor among their "Zingers".  That is why I decided to try this Blackberry Vanilla Herbal Tea from Lipton.  I use a large cup; therefore, I used two tea bags like I do for all of my other hot teas.  After brewing my first cup, I was very pleased with the flavor.  It started out with a strong blackberry flavor, but the hint of vanilla gives it a very mellow finish.  The "Zinger" teas by comparison can have a somewhat harsh finish.  If it were only about first impressions of taste, this would be a hands down five star product.  However, I have a couple of complaints about the packaging.  The tea bags are loose in the box with no container.  Once you open the shrink wrap, the flavor will decay fairly quickly as the box does not close tightly.  In addition, the is a small piece of tape or adhesive strip on the string attaching it to the tea bag and taking up the excess string.  I understand that this is to keep the loose bags from becoming a tangled mess.  However, wrapping each tea bag individually would solve all of the problems noted.  If Lipton would do this, they would have a true five star product.  Until then, they lose two stars.  I would only recommend this if you intend to use the entire box quickly.  Otherwise the flavor from your first cup will only be a faint memory on the last cup from the box.

These have a very crisp texture.  I've found them to be fresh and flavorful.  I usually enjoy a pack with sardines or canned salmon.  They are very low-calorie, but have quite a bit of flavor.  When you eat these, you realize that nori is a very key flavor in sushi, because that is what these remind me of.

I like lime and I like chili so I figured this would be a pretty tasty nut. It is definitely very flavorful but the lime overpowers the chili so much that the chili might as well be nonexistent. So if you are a lime lover you will probably enjoy this flavor, otherwise you might want to try one of the other varieties instead.  Personally I will finish up this batch but once they're gone I will go back to my habanero bbq and wasabi.
stuff is amazing (shouldnt tell you) the price will just go up..stick with your walmart sweetener..pleaseeeeee

Peanut lovers will love this granola snack because the peanut flavor is overwhelming!  The bars are a nice size too.  I assumed that these bars would be fairly small when I ordered but was pleasantly surprised when I saw the pack.Not as crunchy as you might expect with so many peanuts and that may disappoint some.  I looked for a little more crunch based on the picture on the package but the flavor is smooth and strong and is enough to overcome the need for a crunchier snack.  Definitely would use these snacks again.

I hadn't had a Bawls in 5 years and I was actually sponsored by a company that sold them back in 2006 (played CS on PC competitively) and would drink one daily. So it was mega nostalgic to finally see a place sell Bawls w/ free shipping with Prime.. and I recommend everyone try it. It's not just something that "packs a punch", the distinct flavor of the berry really is something to try and I wish they made bottles at a more comparable price but my cans came in perfect shape. In fact it was so cold outside that while they were sitting on my porch I was able to open the box and crack one and it was like it came out of the fridge. I will be ordering these on a regular basis, probably ending up doing subscribe & save. You won't be let down, I've never seen someone not like it!

My kids (18 mo and 3 yrs) love the HappyBaby Tots.  We have tried every flavor and they eat all of them.  I love that they are getting good, organic nutrition, and that the ingredients are wholesome.  They are very convenient to throw in your diaper bag or purse on-the-go, or to stick in a lunch box for a snack.  We use a spoon and sometimes a bowl at home for self feeding with my little one, but you can also give the pouch to them to eat directly from the squeeze pouch.  Thank you, HappyBaby, for such great products!!

I gave up cola eight months ago. But I still get a jones for cold, carbonated beverages. Enter Hansen's!This one's s a good blend of citrus flavors and also a refreshing change from the lemon-lime variety. Just a tad too sweet for my taste, but I like it enough to keep reordering. . With Subscribe & Save, it's *almost* affordable.

In reading the reviews I am surprised that the appearance of this dish is repeatedly mentioned. I didn't notice what some other reviewers view as a disgusting appearance. Perhaps it is because my first experience with this product was a few years ago in a food sampling. Small cup, not a big plateful and I focused on the intense flavors, and the fact that the base is spinach -- something I love and don't consume enough.Everyone is entitled to their opinion, but I adore this dish. The smell is distinctive -- decidedly earthy --which I relish. The paneer cheese is very light and soft with a texture like silken tofu, but the flavor is of a mild cheese. The cheese serves as a perfect counterpoint to the spicy spinach. Going against tradition I sometimes add a small amount of cooked brown rice, but I prefer the dish undiluted. And, I found the cheese chunks plentiful.The ingredients -- spinach, water, tomatoes, paneer cheese, onions, sunflower oil, salt, garlic, cornstarch, chilies, cumin are startling in their simplicity. Where is the long list of chemicals? Grabbing a convenience meal often means sacrificing both flavor and health -- this gluten free, Kosher dish sacrifices nothing. I will buy this dish as long as Tasty Bite continues to produce it.
I get many comments when making a Manhattan with these cherries. Customers say they are the best cherries they had with these nice cocktails.

This is a wonderful new flavor in the Kettle Potato chip line up.  It was really good and crunchy, you get a great taste of the sweet chili at first crunch and then not an overwhelming taste of garlic at the finish.  The Crunch for this chips is the best and  though they may be a little oily for some tastes; this adds to the flavor of the chips.  I will definitely be ordering the chips again.  The chips were devoured within two days of sharing it at the office and that was a pack of 15.

This bar would make a small dessert or substitute candy-bar snack for a dieter who is craving something gooey and decadent.  The bar seems to be mostly goo with little bits of crunch.  The mocha flavor was good, and a nice change from the usual bars of this sort.  The overall decadence was too much for me, but others may like this.  In order to keep the calorie count down, they are small:  3.25 inches long by 1 inch wide by 3/4 inch thick.  The bottom half is sort of like chocolate candy with crunch bits, the top layer is sort of like mocha frosting, and then there are chocolate stripes on top.I passed these around my knitting group.  One friend said they were better than Kellog's Fiber Plus.  Most liked the flavor, but they couldn't agree as on other attributes.  One said she would definitely eat it if she was hungry because it was natural, an attribute which others (including me) disagreed with.  They also couldn't agree whether they were nutritious or not, because they are low fat and high fiber.  In my mind they are empty-calorie carbo-bombs, with only 2 g of protein and 25g of carbs (3g sugar alcohols, beware; and 9g of fiber).  These may or may not fit into your nutrition goals, but if they do, you'll probably enjoy the flavor, but I'd rather eat a small piece of fine dark chocolate.
summary: Better than K's Fiber Plus, debatable nutrition

reviewText: Newman's Own Organics Dark Chocolate Bar is a pretty good chocolate bar that has more going for it than just taste. First, it's USDA certified organic. I try to use organic products as much as possible, particularly on less costly products and those where organic matters. Second, the product is Rainforest Alliance Certified cacao. So the cacao is produced using sustainable growing techniques. These are the things about the product that I like best. And sometimes, it's these factors that make the difference between buying product A or B.As far as the taste ... well, it is not the best chocolate bar I have ever tried, nor is it the worst. First, the bar is about 7 mm thick ... moderately chunky as bars go. There is a classy-looking N emblem embossed in each piece. The nutritional panel says that one bar is a serving, but that one serving is going to provide about 330 calories ... actually 1/3 of a bar is a serving for me. The chocolate is not very melty.
