This is more common in higher cacao content chocolate bars; Newman's Own bar is about 54% cacao, so I was a little surprised. The bar was also a little sweeter than I expected. The chocolate was not unpleasant, but it just seemed to lack a "smack your face" slap of chocolate flavor that you expect in good dark chocolate.So, bottom line time: Newman's own is a decent but unremarkable chocolate bar. It's organic and Rainforest-friendly, and earns the product bonus points in my book.
summary: Pretty good taste, even better fringe benefits

reviewText: For whatever reason, I didn't realize this was the 'chicklet' style gum squares as opposed to stick gum.  Normally I wouldn't purchase this style of gum because the packaging seems wasteful for what you get product wise and because there's no wrapper left to spit your gum out in on the go (blister pack houses the gum pieces).That said, I think the box is pretty cool (the top 'clicks' when you open and close it) and the gum is tasty but sticky!  I could definitely see this as being problematic for anyone who has dental work, such as braces (though I suppose technically if you have braces, you shouldn't be chewing gum).As for the Vitality "Awaken" aspect of this gum, pure gimmick IMO.  Ginseng infused my tushy!  It seems to me they just put 'Ginseng' on the box to attract 'wellness seekers'.  There's absolutely no Ginseng flavor to this gum whatsoever and that doesn't surprise me, since it probably wouldn't suit most western palates.  If you want to know what Ginseng is 'supposed' to taste like, albeit sweetend, so you at least have an idea of what this gum 'doesn't' taste like - do a search for Lotte Ginseng Gum.  Haven't had it in years but that's the gum we chewed as kids in Korea for that real 'ginseng' taste when there weren't any honey soaked ginseng roots available for us to nosh on.That said, if someone were to offer me a piece of this gum, I wouldn't decline - but it's something I would pass by at the checkout counter.  I'll probably stick to my orbit or stride.
summary: No ginseng taste, very sticky, a bit gimmicky

reviewText: I have enjoyed the KIND bars, but these Almond Cashew ones are definitely not for me.  Much more dense and gooey that the other varieties that I have had, they did have a good crunch.  However, even the crunch felt slightly mushy at times.  With no real flavor to make up for the texture, I would not buy these again.
LOVE 'em!  Easier to serve from a jar than those flat cans.Buy some!---------J. Lehman

Trident Vitality Awaken is a long lasting sugar free gum, shaped similar to Chiclets gum, that has a very strong peppermint taste with a slight after taste that I associate with food/candy that is sugar free. The after taste is not very noticeable for me but my husband who can't stand anything "diet" doesn't really care for this gum. Most gums I've chewed usually doesn't last long in flavor since I have a tendency to stuck the flavor out while chewing, within 5 minutes or so, but I found this one lasts much, much longer while remaining soft and not becoming hard to chew after chewing for awhile.I like the fresh feeling this gum gives me, like I'd just brushed my teeth, leaving my mouth feeling clean and minty. This gum will definitely do in a pinch when in need of fresh breath and your caught without your toothbrush. Another plus, it also helps with dry mouth which attributes to bad breath.As for the "Vitality" part of the gum, I felt the same while the chewing gum and after chewing it, not anymore alert than I usually am. Also, the ginseng in the gum is not noticeable in the flavor.For those who need to know, the package states:Allergy information: Contains Soy.Phenylketonurics: Contains Phenylalanine.

My 10 month old loves these and they seem pretty healthy.  There is some sugar in them, but I assume it is used as a binder and a little for taste.  He has 8 teeth so he is able to chew them, but if your baby is really young, Happy Puffs are probably better.

Delicious, Scrumptious, Melt in your Mouth Yummy! They were so fresh when they arrived and still are. Absolutely worth every penny. The convenience of ordering online is undervalued!  I highly recommend these, and the option of buying online, which is a major reason to be a Prime Member!  Thanks!

If you like the taste of cheap instant coffee then you would probably like these bars.  They are basically half granola, half gooey coffee tasting crap.  I'd recommend that you eat FiberOne bars over these, as the FiberOne bars contain more fiber, taste better, and don't have as much fat.  I can't say that I'd recommend these bars to anyone, but they get 2 stars because they do have a decent amount of fiber.
summary: Good if you like the taste of cheap coffee

reviewText: I was recently introduced to Tasty Bite entrees and have stockpiled my office with a number of different varieties (so expect to see quite a few reviews).  I'm not one for instant meals but I've made an exception for Tasty Bite because I recognize all of the ingredients used, they're vegetarian (I'm not a vegetarian but I prefer to eat meat that's been just prepared), MSG and Preservative Free and the convenience can't be beat.  Since I eat these in the office when I haven't had the time to prepare anything else or go out for lunch, I mostly enjoy them as soups though I believe most are meant to be served on rice.  The Janipur Vegetables are very good and I love the Paneer Cheese cubes :).  I just wish that this dish were a little spicier to suit my taste.  I'll definitely be purchasing this one again.
summary: Very good but wish it were a little spicier

reviewText: Reinventing granola is how this Renola Larabar is advertised.  I have poured a handful of the Renola onto a dish and it looks just like granola.  However, the list of ingredients on the package back up the reinvention statement: almonds, sunflower seeds, dried molasses, pumpkin seeds, pecans, raisins, cashews, tapioca syrup, cinnamon, and vanilla extract -- no grains anywhere to be found.  All the ingredients are ground up fine so its difficult to identify each item.  The taste is sweet -- the mixture does contain 8 grams of sugar.  The granola is more chewy than crunchy.  Bottom line: my wife and I think the Larabar Renola tastes very good and we will take several small packages with us when we go on trips.  The Renola seems ideal for this purpose.How about for snacking while watching a movie on TV?  Absolutely.  Why not do something good for yourself when you want a between meal treat?  That said, the small package of Renola will add 200 calories to your diet and that small package seems to disappear quickly.  I think the key word in all of this review is "treat."  When you want to reward yourself with something healthy and tasty, the Larabar will do the trick nicely.
summary: A tasty treat when you want to reward yourself.

reviewText: You might as well eat the box it came in.  If it weren't for the almonds, it would have no taste at all.It's too fine to eat dry as a snack, and too solid to eat with cold milk as a cereal.I imagine it would be a decent substitute for granola in a fruit and yogurt parfait, but I haven't tried it that way yet.But remember, it's HEALTHY.

These oysters are so good and such a great healthy alternative to being put in cottonseed oil. Sizes of the oysters kind of fluctuate- some are huge and some are tiny, so its like a surprise with each one that you open. This product is very tasty.

Marcona almonds have become increasingly popular in the United States in the past decade, as the popularity of cuisine from their native Spain has grown. They are less oblong, more squat, than other varieties of almond. And they are reputed to be sweeter due to their higher fat content. The pleasant, comparatively lighter texture of Marcona almonds make them a nice gourmet snack food. They have a nice crunch, but are not as dense or hard to bite down on as other almonds.This canister of Marcona almonds from Emerald is filled to the brim with blanched almonds, lightly roasted in sunflower oil, and sprinkled with sea salt. No preservatives. The airtight lid screws on and off to preserve freshness. I would call these almonds moderately salty. I don't care much for salt, but these are not too salty for my taste, while they are salty enough to make me thirsty after a couple of handfuls. I don't find their flavor as strong as raw almonds, but that may be due to the salt.Emerald boasts about the health benefits of almonds. One serving, which is a handful of almonds, contains 35% of the recommended daily intake of vitamin E, or about 5 IU. There are 15g total fat, 170 calories, and 190mg sodium per serving as well. Twelve servings in a container. Fat, salt, and vitamin E. Their light flavor and texture make Marcona almonds a snack food that's not too filling and a nice alternative to a mundane bowl of nuts to serve guests.
summary: Light Flavor and Texture Distinguish the Marcona Almond.

reviewText: I just got my order today and had to try it out.While I'll disagree with others that have gotten 'mush' outta the can, my initial can was above that.Not what I would call chunks by any stretch, but not mush.As for taste? Pretty much none. If it weren't for the additives, it wouldn't have any taste at all.I've never had Blue crab. But if this is the 'comparison', I'll not try it either.Keep in mind that I can get Dungeness year round, as well as Red Rock crab.I'll likely add it to the cats food. Maybe she can get some flavor out of it?

I found that I have to use more than regular sugar in my coffee to have the same sweetness. By the time it is sweet enough there is an after taste that I do not care for. Bought a whole case that I may regret. Have not yet tried in baking or other use. I do not know if it is the brand as this is my first try of agave sweetner. Probably will not buy again..

Who would not like blueberry poptarts?  These are wonderful, and since we bought 12 boxes of them, we have been giving them away to friends and family too!  One of the best ways to make a kid smile is to give them a couple warm poptarts and a glass of milk.  All the more reason to pick these up.  These I got from Amazon were nice and fresh and very yummy.

We love these bars...they make a great snack for my preschool daughter who has multiple food allergies.  No soy, hooray!  I have been buying them for about a year and a half.This box we got from NetRush, though, tastes "off" and "old"...perhaps they were not properly stored.  I will not buy from this seller again, although Cranberry KIND bars will remain a staple in our pantry!
summary: The Best KIND Bar...NetRush Not The Best Seller Though

reviewText: WOW! What can I say about this? I got a small bag of these at Walmart and then they didn't have them anymore. Then I ordered a big bag here on Amazon and I'll be reordering. These are real baked apple chips, and dried. They contain NO (zero...nada) artificial ingredients. Only apple and just the RIGHT amount of cinnamon. They're low calorie: 58 per serving. They are utterly delicious, not bitter, not super sweet but just sweet enough with just the right amount of cinnamon. I'm betting that if these get marketed more extensively they will catch on as a major snack.
summary: OMG THESE ARE GOOD! Will ALWAYS HAVE THESE!!

reviewText: It's been sometime since I personally had beef jerky so when I had the opportunity to try this, I thought it would be great.  I was very happy with this product.  The meat was thick, not paper thin and hard like a lot of other brands.  In fact, it was "tender" for jerked beef.  The flavor is outstanding as well.  I'm a fan of the teriyaki.  If you like beef jerky I highly recommend this product.Very nice.

My mother has been making kombucha for over 10 years now, and suggested this tea to me because I wanted something organic. I have never drank it as just a hot cup of tea, but when used to make kombucha, the flavor of the final product is lovely.

Ok but if you have a big 2 pounder bread machine like the newer ZO, Panasonic and others I would pass. The flour or package weight needs to be at least 16 oz for better results.It tastes good but is really for smaller machine or no knead use.
I add a little with the chai latta to my coffe and have it with my breakfast each morning. It was indroduced to me by a friend .Good taste in each one.

Great Sugar Free cough drops when you have to watch your sugar intake. No unpleasant taste, and do not stick to the wrapper. These are the only sugar free cough drops I buy for a member of my family.I recommend Halls sugar free cough drops to anyone who has to watch their sugar intake.
summary: Halls Menthol Eco Bag, Sugar Free Cough Drops

reviewText: I sent this to my son at college. He thought it was very good. It is a nutritious and easy meal. The cost is good and it arrives at their door. Let Amazon do the shopping and transporting.
These are delicious! I love them. A great deal

I am NO kind of expert, I don't have a fancy "food critic" palate.  I'm just a regular middle-aged guy who occasionally likes to have some tasty warm tea.  I generally refrain from adding sugar or cream, so I enjoy strong tea...but not too bitter.Numi Organic Tea Magnolia Puerh is not too bitter...that's good.  It was easy to drink and tasted nice.  But it was nothing special.  All the marketing materials and fancy write-ups about what Puerh tea is sort of set me up to expect something really special.  On the whole, the taste was quite pleasant, but I noticed nothing to set it apart from Bigelow or other name brands that are a cut above Lipton but a cut (price-wise) below Numi.I was disappointed that the tea didn't smell better.  With magnolia added, I expected to catch a whiff (I lived in the South for awhile, so I know magnolia).  Nothing.  It smelled like "regular old tea."My daughter (aged 17) liked it a bit more.  I think she appreciated the lack of bitterness, and she did add a half-teaspoon of sugar.  My wife was quite neutral.  And in the end...I'm neutral too.
summary: For me, not worth the extra

reviewText: We've been buying this milk for years but $25 for a case? Whole foods has the 18 pack for $14.99 and it's at BJ's for $12.99. I bought a couple of cases when Amazon ran a sale. Free shipping with prime makes it great, too.Send back any product that is dirty or too close to exp date - write to Amazon! Our shipment doesnt expire until well inton 2008 and all my kids, from 6-16, love it!
summary: Great milk but only buy on sale - at BJs for $12.99

reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: I am always on the lookout for a nice, light, side for the summertime.  Since the temperature gets up to 110f here, a cool healthy salad sounds good to me....not to my husband.  Here's the conversation before I served the Suddenly Salad;Him: "What is this?"Me:  "It's called Suddenly Salad"Him:  "Is it supposed to be healthy?"Me:  "It does'nt say "full is health" on the box Grae"Him:  "I don"t like cold pasta salad"Me:  "Not pasta Grae"Him: " Probably won't like it"Me:  " PLEASE JUST TAKE A BITE!"By the way, we have grandchildren who will eat what's placed before them.....I am not exaggerating--I go through this everytime I serve something that sounds too healthy.  I did chop up a little brocolli and stir-fried it in some Olive oil so he would think I was "cooking."  Tossed it in with the dressing, cranberry/seeds mix and the "whole grains" (ssshhhh) and he gobbled up half a plate!Really tasty and light side dish for your summer BBQ or day at the park.Will purchase again.

These cookies taste great, are soft and chewy and are easy to pack and carry in individual packages. However I do question how healthy they are. They do seem to taste of preservatives because they remain the same even a month later. Not freshly made, but great for a quick easy snack on occasion.
summary: Taste Great, Can Give a Little Hearburn

reviewText: This has always been one of my favorite candies. Love the honey flavored crunch

I used this coffee with a  French press, to me, and many, the French press method is the best for extracting the most flavor out of coffee.The most important thing you must remember is never pour boiling hot water over your grounds, that will burn it, with that said.I boiled my water and let it stand a few moments and poured it over the grounds the same way I have for years.  I have not been drinking coffee for some tome but I still love it.I waited a bit then pressed, I poured the hot coffee into a warmed mug.The aroma was divine I could not wait, I added a small amount of creamer, to my liking, and took a sip.  Oh it was bitter, the underlying favor was there but it was too bitter for me. I drank half the cup full but that did not help. It was bitter.  I do not like my coffee strong so I wonder how bitter it will be if I drink it strong.I really wanted to like this but I am sorry I do not..

With the many selections of instant oatmeal cereals that are produced, how can one choose?  Simply, try and taste each one and decide.  Indeed, that sounds simple, but not every instant oatmeal cereal is alike, and Chex proves that sentiment once the hot water is boiled and any one of the packets of gluten-free oatmeal is dispensed into the bowl.  And it is only after the first taste of regular, maple sugar, or apple cinnamon flavor that the decision will be made.For a person that has tried other well-known brands of oatmeal, such as Quaker Oats and their sweet and fruity flavors, trying Chex and a gluten-free oatmeal may be a slight difference in terms of flavor and ingredients.  But after trying and choosing a favorite, which may be apple cinnamon that contains much chunkier bits of apple than the other brand, Chex may be an oatmeal to consider. Plus, it is a healthy meal to begin or maybe eat any time of the day.
Very delicious - can eat half a bar for a "sweet craving"- good price - good nutrition. Expensive  but best price around.

reviewerName: Fred Vogt "author of See Sally Kick A**: A Wo...
reviewText: There are a lot of granola/snack bars available so I thought this might just be one more, but I was surprised. This reminds me of eating a moist oatmeal cookie only better because it is gluten free, low in cholesterol, lots of omega 3 fatty acids and a good source of fiber. Not only tasty, but healthy too. My wife has a gluten intolerance so these also work for her. These are my new favorite choice for a snack. Excuse me while I go get a glass of milk to go with Pamela's Oat Raisin Walnut Spice bar. Highly recommended!!

Usually I am not a big fan of tomato soup.  But if I can ever find this one in a store where I shop, that will change.  It has a wonderful flavor, nice zippy seasoning that compliment the basic ingredients nicely, and a smooth creaminess.  Way to go, Campbell!
summary: very nice tomato and cheese soup

reviewText: Next to Orange.  Refreshing & keeps bubbles the longest of any other flavor I've tried.  Repeat purchase, one of the best.

I use this as a substitute for salt in many foods. my father is on a no salt diet. often no salt equals no taste but this product makes food taste good. you can actually eat food and enjoy it. It is hard to find but worth the search.
I love the bar. For midday snacks it is ideal. I recommend to all in particular diabetic patients. It will supress the craving for extra food and very tasty. Better than sex

I didn't care so much for these crackers.  I know that they are supposed to be better for me, but I suppose I'm a die hard Cheese It fan.  I like the Kashi granola bars because they are definitely healthy and chick full of good ingredients, but these had a weird aftertaste and the texture was a lot like the reduced fat Cheese Its.  I didn't like the flavor and they were pretty bland anyway.  Sorry, Kashi.
My kids love these.  Added plus, low sodium, all natural and low sugar.  Wonderful all around and Amazon adds the best price I can find.  Thanks.

The first jar that I opened had a live bug in it!  I promptly put the remaining jars in my refrigerator after carefully inspecting them for contamination.  I wasn't all that panicked at the sight of the bug, having shopped continuously from other organic, natural, or regular grocery stores and on-line sites and knowing that sometimes rice and other grain-type products attract unwelcome pests.  The remainder of the jar, I promptly rinsed and boiled per instructions--thankfully, I had a large potluck for which I needed a large salad.  Thankfully, my fellow gourmands weren't all that surprised, either.  Just watch out, though--even when well-sealed after preparation, there is a risk.Besides, I love couscous and where I live in the Arctic, one cannot find it in the local grocery stores.
Justin's honey peanut butter is amazing! The sweetness the honey brings is great. Its also gluten free and helped lower both my cholesterol and blood levels!

I occasionally get an urge for salsa but it has been hard for me to find one that suits since Carrillo's disappeared from our local Whole Foods' shelves. I thought I'd give Arriba! Fire Roasted Mexican Hot Red Salsa a try to see if it might be a suitable replacement.I'm pleased to say that although I don't think anything is ever going to QUITE scratch my salsa itch the way Carrillo's did (more's the pity), Arriba! Hot Red is REALLY good . . . if you can handle the heat. This one isn't for woosies--"hot" means just that. Fortunately, in addition to heat, Arriba! also supplies flavor, which is a lot more difficult to get right because let's face it--anyone can add heat.Arriba! Fire Roasted Mexican Hot Red Salsa makes slammin' nachos and is a great addition to dishes like tortilla soup (fellow Vitamix owners will understand exactly where I'm coming from). A little goes a very long way, so proceed with caution until you know how it hits your "hot spot." The flavor isn't quite as complex as I'd like but it's head and shoulders above most of what I've sampled that's available. I have to say, I'm very impressed.This is salsa, so there's no sense in belaboring the point here. If heat is your thing and you're discerning enough to realize that heat sans flavor is a very one-dimensional culinary experience, you owe it to yourself to give Arriba! Fire Roasted Mexican Hot Red Salsa a try. I'd be interested to try some of Arriba!'s milder (if they exist) offerings as well. Thank goodness I stumbled upon another good red salsa. :) (Do they do green?)

I love it.  Kind bars are consistently awesome, but the Almond Cashew with Flax is one of my two favorites (the other is Almond & Coconut).  I like that it's not too sweet, but also not bland.  It's got excellent texture and flavors.  Don't know what else to say.  The only down side is that they get a little sticky inside the package, but if you're careful not to touch the bar directly when eating, they're fine.

Recently discovered this drink and I'm completely hooked! It was cheaper to order them by the case rather than buying the same amount at the store. You don't really taste the coconut water (if that's an issue for you) but more of a sweet, creamy latte drink. While I love making Greek frappes at home in the summer, I will make sure to always have some of these on hand for an easy way to get a little caffeine in my system and stay hydrated at the same time.

I was sincerely looking forward to enjoying this product and reviewing it, however, it's hard to sing the praises of anything when the roof of your mouth is on fire.Emerald Sea Salt & Pepper Cashews is a good idea gone terribly wrong. The nuts are wonderful. I plan on soaking off the seasoning and using them in a chicken recipe. But there is no possability I could eat them as the manufacturer has served them up.To be sure that this was not some oversensitivity on my part, I offered the cannister to a friend -- casually and without comment. He ate two or three and begged me for a beverage to clear his mouth, saying he thought he must be "allergic" to something in them, because they "made his mouth burn."I'm just baffled that the seasoning is this unpleasantly strong yet sold in a cannister that suggests a mild freshness. I truly regret that I could not give Emerald Sea Salt & Pepper Cashews a higher rating.
summary: Excellent nuts ruined by an intolerable seasoning.

reviewText: I just add a little to my first cup in the mornings and it really livens up the first cup!  Good deal  with the only odd thing being that there are two of one flavor, and four different ones.  One would think that if you wanted two vanillas, you would just order vanilla!

I'm not sure how honey, natures sweetener, can be un-organic, and for that matter, I'm not sure how it can be un-fair trade since the little critters that create the stuff are insects. The packaging gives an indication of this: "Produced on traditional family farms in Central and South America". Without seeing the farm to know some industrial farm isn't really producing it, I'll give Wholesome Sweeteners the benefit of the doubt and humor their organic, fair-trade honey. The product design is lacking and makes you think of a typical generic brand--it should involve natural earth tones and rustic fonts, but that shouldn't detract you from stocking up on this delicious sugar-substitute. The packaging allows for easy, clean access to the goodness and you won't struggle with golden stickiness all over the place. Enjoy and be healthy (and fair)!

I am writing this review fully acknowledging that tastes are matters of personal preference, whether in music or in food. That being said, I have to come out and say I just don't like these cashews, which are practically encrusted with salt and pepper.In our family we don't salt and pepper our food liberally, so maybe my wife and I were particularly sensitive to the salt-and-pepper blast of these cashews. Again, it's a matter of taste: if you love salt and pepper, you might like these.To write a fair review, I decided to wash the seasonings off the cashews under tap water to taste the bare nut underneath. I was surprised to find that the salt and pepper didn't just rinse off. Something was making it adhere to the cashews. So I soaked and rinsed and rubbed with my fingers a little more and finally got all the seasoning off the 5 or 6 cashews I had in my hand.Once I got all the seasoning off (or so I thought), I noticed something else that surprised me: the cashews were still greasy. This wasn't intended to be a whole-day affair, so I just popped two in my mouth. The first thing I noticed was that the cashew retained a slightly crisp, roasted character even after the drenching. That was the good news. Then I dropped the remaining cashews in my mouth, and a few seconds later came the bad news: I started tasting that pesky little prickly pepper picked for palate pop, poking its way through an otherwise tasty though plain roasted cashew.If you'd like a simpler review, my wife, a no-nonsense woman, ate just a couple and said, "I hate these. Do they have those Emerald almonds with the cocoa back in stock yet?"
summary: Pesky Little Prickly Pepper Picked for Palate Pop

reviewText: This rice is good, but I did have a moth fly out of one of the jars I got from Amazon.  We use it very fast (and of course we boil it), so it was a non-issue, but I wouldn't recommend getting it to store for very long.  I would imagine there were more moths about to hatch...
I'm so pleased to have oats that are Gluten Free.These taste and behave exactly like all other rolled oats I've tried.For sure I will order these again.

I like the Emerald brand nuts. The canister is very convenient and easy to take along. I was a bit leery about the salt and pepper flavor. It wasn't as bad as I thought. I was mainly concerned that the pepper would be too strong. I actually found the salt to be a bit overwhelming. As I got closer to the bottom of the canister, the salt taste became stronger and the nuts at the bottom were very salty-almost inedible. If you love cashews this is a nice change from just salted as the pepper gives the nut a little "kick."
summary: Love the Cashews, but a little Salty

reviewText: I bought this for my wife and son, they love it.  I like the smell of the coffee brewing, but don't drink it myself.

I love cashews, and I love black pepper flavored potato chips, so when I saw these, I knew I had to try them.  At first taste, I wasn't sure what to make of them.  The pepper taste was strong, almost overpowering the cashew flavor.  But I soon found myself enjoying the flavor, even craving them.  This is certainly not a flavor for everyone, but if you prefer savory flavors to some of the sweeter nut varieties out there, give these a try.  And I have to once again comment that I love the canister these come in.  They fit well in a car cup-holder, and I can just pop the canister in my messenger for a between-class snack, without worrying that the container will pop open, scattering nuts everywhere.

If you've never tried these fire roasted tomatoes, you don't know what you are missing.  Fire-roasting doesn't just add "black pieces" to tomatoes, it really adds an amazing flavor.  Yummy.  Give them a try.

Eating these, I felt much more like I was enjoying a nicely balanced cookie instead of a healthy bar-type snack. With other brand bars, I often find them too chewy (too many oats, etc) and a little too hard. These had a nice balance of ingredients so it's more like biting into a cookie instead of a granola bar. Not too chewy, not too dense, good flavor. The only issue for me is it comes out of the package a little too moist. It felt like biting into a somewhat soggy cookie, or a cookie that had briefly fallen in a glass of water and left for a few hours to dry. It was moister than any other packaged cookie or bar that I've tried. That was a major turnoff for me, but two family members I shared this product with made no mention of that and rather enjoyed these bars and their level of moistness very much, so it might just be me.
LIKE THIS RICE EVEN THO WOULD PREFER REGULAR BROWN RICE - because it cooks better - easier, faster and still is NOT WHITE RICE -Recommended for - Rice Lovers
summary: LIKE THIS RICE EVEN THO WOULD PREFER REGULAR BROWN RICE

reviewText: If you've always thought kidney beans were sort of flavorless, just a filler, then these will change your mind. They are without question the most delicious kidney beans I've ever had. I've tried both slow-soak and quick-soak methods to soften them and both ways they're still great in the end. They also produce less foam/scum on the surface of the cooking water, and (if I may be frank) less stomach distress later than other brands of beans my family has tried. The box has instructions for both cooking and soaking, so there's no guessing involved. These are excellent beans and I will be buying them again.

Nothing special but we did get a good deal on the price. Its also nice to have decaf around for friends and family who don't drink caffeine or when you want a cup later in the day. Don't think we would pay full price for these since there are cheaper options that taste just as good
summary: OK but wouldn't pay full price

reviewText: I don't like most commercial salsas - they tend to be bland and too salty.  Also commercial salsas tend for the most part to be too mild or too lean on vinegar to get the heat out of the pepper.  Arriba! has none of those flaws.  As the Peach Fresco salsa tasted tomato-eh but also distinctly of peaches and the Pineapple Chipotle salsa was the same.  I would have liked them to have even more heat than they did but truthfully, I like my salsa much hotter than most people.  The unique peach and pineapple flavors were fun and I can say they were as good as any bottles salsa I have ever had.
These raisins are very good. Moist and plump and sweet tasting. Highly recommend as an addition to cereal or for snacking.

OK, I'm close to  tea fanatic. I've probably sampled 100's of tea types over the years, and like them all. Originally, it is said tea was a muscle and fatigue relaxer, a drink to calm the spirit, and mend creaky bodies. So when I wake up, mending the bones is first on my agenda before heading out into the real world. So, I ordered this Higgins and Burke tea here, and now it's a staple. Not only for the taste, but more important, the fact that it calms my bones; so it is good for all meals and all breaks. If you've ever wondered why the Brits, Chinese, and many others go for a tea break, this particular tea is the top reason!
summary: Super-mellow, tasty, which mends the bones!

reviewText: I'm not usually a big fan of soup but these Go Soups may just change that.  I've tried two of these so far and really enjoyed them both.Chicken & Quinoa with Poblano Chilies- I absolutely loved it.  The pieces of chicken are a very nice size and it's nice quality too.  The veggies are nice and whole too unlike how they are all mushy, smashed and diced up in many other soups.  I love spicy things and the Poblano Chiles in this soup gave it a very nice kick that tasted incredible.  If you're a person that hates anything spicy it may be too much for you but it was perfect for me.Creamy Red Pepper with Smoked Gouda- I really enjoyed this soup too.  The flavor was really good.  I could really taste the Smoked Gouda which was nice in a soup.  The soup was very rich and creamy.  There was a pretty decent amount of Red Pepper Chunks too.Spicy Chorizo & Pulled Chicken with Black Beans- I wasn't as big on this option as the other 2 that I've tried.  It's a bit thicker and although I do like Black Beans, the flavor of the liquid was a bit overwhelming with the black bean flavoring.  The meats were good but the black bean flavor kinda overpowered it.  Wasn't bad, just wasn't one I'll be getting again.The Pouch- I really like the Microwavable Pouch that the soups comes in.  They're very easy and convenient to use.I would highly recommend the two soups that I've tried and I can't wait to try more of them.

We were so effusive in our praise of the last batch of Emerald nuts we tried that we'll sound like corporate shills when we say this one's the best of the lot.  The pepper adds a nice tang that lingers as the final aftertaste.

bought this b/c I needed a container to make dressing.  The seasoning packet is delicious and the recipes on how to make other dressings using the measurements on the container are an added bonus.  I even got two containers for the price and now have a back up should I slip and break one.  It does leak a tiny amount but it's negligible and as long as I remember to wipe it off before putting it away there's really no problem.  I did stop using olive oil to make my dressing as t tends to solidify but once I switched to canola oil the dressing is perfect.

These cherries are an excellent taste treat!  A perfect blend of sweetness and tartness is to be found.  Great for snacking out of the bag or putting on cereal instead of raisins.  They are rather expensive and that will preclude me from purchasing them often.  Highly recommended.

I had never tried Timothy's brand until I bought this box of Cinnamon Pastry. It is very delicious! I am usually very picky about coffee flavors because I don't like the taste of regular coffee. I won't drink it unless it has a lot of flavor and this was exactly what I was looking for. I normally buy Gloria Jeans Cinammon Mocha but I think I am going to start buying more of this Timothy's brand because it tastes so much richer and with more flavor.

We love the Happy Creamies at our house. They are a great snack for all ages and the taste is very pure and natural. We have tried all the flavors and was most pleased with this flavor (kiwi, spinach, peas, apple). My 7yo really enjoys these, and we have been taking them along for snacks on the go for a few months now. I would recommend these to all toddler and above ages. I keep them in my desk for my own late afternoon snack too!
summary: Best dairy free snack out there!

reviewText: Light sweet smell of coconut while brewing. The taste translates well on the palate. This is an excellent special occasion coffee. Don't hesitate to at least try it!
Delicious as always Peets Coffee is - but they should offer a variety in environmentally better options as the San Francisco K-cups do.

I don't know what happened, but up until recently this stuff tasted exactly like the stuff in the packets at Tavo Bell and it was my favorite taco sauce. Actually, it is the ONLY taco sauce I've ever cared for. Most bottled taco sauce is sweet and tomatoey. Taco Bell sauce is a little tart and thin and peppery. Last couple of bottles of mild and hot sauce I bought it tasted the same as all the other sweet, tomatoey sauces on the shelf. There is nothing to differentiate it from any other taco sauce now. Time to experiment and make my own clone at home I guess.

This is a tough product for me to review because at first taste I thought, "hey these aren't too bad," but the second time around I thought, "these are not good!" and then the third time I thought, "there're not as bad as I thought they were last time."  Hmmm.  So my conclusion is they're not too bad, but not that good either.  Each bar comes in an individual package and tastes pretty fresh.  The bars are kind of mushy, with a non-descript brownish color and soft rectangular shape.  I don't know that I really tasted much coconut flavor, and the chocolate chips certainly gave it a boost in taste.  I would not buy these or eat them as snacks, but I do not typically buy snack bars or power bars because on the whole I don't find them all that appealing.  I am always willing to give these types of bars a chance and would LOVE to be won over, but unfortunately these ones didn't do it for me.

To start with, Amazon is mixing reviews again.  The featured product, which this review applies to, is Kashi Creamy Truly Vanilla.  Other products, such as the Kashi Honey and Cinnamon, have different flavors and different availability.  Reviews for other products are meaningless and should be ignored.  In actual fact, the local Krogers only has the Honey and Cinnamon in their hot cereal selections (they have a vast array of Kashi cold cereals).  This Creamy Truly Vanilla is a basic cereal that you can dress up with other ingredients to your own taste.  I personally add cinnamon, nutmeg, and local fresh honey, along with dried fruitGood Sense Berry Medley, 5 Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)The prepared product can be eaten without milk because it already has a creamy texture - that is an advantage over dry cereals as some people do not drink milk - it is also helpful when you forgot to buy milk at the grocery store.  Overall, this is an excellent cereal, particularly because you can add ingredients to your own taste.  Some reviewers have recommended almond butter and/or bananas, although I have not personally tried those combinations.  I would note that the Amazon price is good, and is comparable to what local grocery stores charge for comparable cereals.  They only down side is that you have to buy six boxes at a time.  I would note that I remember somewhat larger portions when I first started using Kashi cereal.  You can double the portion size by using two packets, but be aware that you need a larger bowl for the microwave to keep it from boiling over the sides.

Twenty years ago, my husband and I took a fabulous one-week Backroads' bicycling vacation through Louisiana. That's where we first learned about Community Coffee. It was the brand that the luxury bed-and-breakfast inns were serving and those where the incredible inns where we were staying. I remember the trip vividly and I also remember the coffee: the intense arresting aroma and the bold smooth strong taste. I can still conjure up the marvelous sensation of getting up in the morning in one of those charming B&Bs--each; one oozing with Southern hospitality and charm--and finding a steaming cup of Community Coffee waiting for us. It became the special ritual that I anticipated every morning. That was Cajun country, so I'm pretty certain that the blend was French Roast. I remembered it as very dark, rich, complex, and fabulously smooth...incredibly satisfying. It was just what I craved to put the perfect start on a day of invigorating and adventurous bicycle touring. So recently, when Amazon gave me the chance to receive a free sample of Community Coffee French Roast to test and review, I really jumped at it!Did the coffee from Amazon match my memory? Would I buy it on my own? Unfortunately, the present experience of drinking this coffee was not as magnificent as my memory; I wouldn't buy this now. It is not that this coffee isn't good. In fact, for ground, packaged coffee, it is pretty good, far better than you'd find in many upscale restaurants. The reason why we wouldn't buy it now is that my husband and my tastes in coffee have become far more discerning in the ensuing years. Now we buy our coffee as whole beans, in small batches from special local roasters, and we grind it ourselves. You can't beat that with any type of prepackaged ground coffee no matter how good.But that gets me to the topic of freshness. Each of these packages of Community Coffee comes in a very large 32 oz (2 lbs) bag. It's a premium bag, easy to open and reseal, and obviously well constructed to maintain freshness (in fact, these bags have special freshness valves that keep oxygen from entering the bag but allow interior pressure to be released). The problem is, if you read the FAQ section on the Community Coffee website, they make it very clear that you should use their ground coffees within two weeks of opening. There is also a "use by" date stamp on each package (in the case of the batch I received, that date was 65 days later). If you value freshness in coffee (and personally I think this is extremely important), before you buy these large packages, be sure your family's coffee drinking habits are big enough to drink all that large amount of coffee within the recommended freshness limits.In summary, this is a decent, medium-ground, French Roast coffee. If you're in the market for a full-bodied coffee, with medium acidity, and a dark color but not a burnt taste, I would definitely recommend this brand.
summary: Very good, but not as good as my memory of it from Louisiana!

reviewText: This is my kids' favorite cereal. They love it so much they don't want any other cereal. It's hard for me to resist as well! The flavors aren't super intense like conventional brands might be, but they are still strong. Using natural ingredients, as opposed to unknown chemicals engineered into mainstream food products to get you addicted, means that this cereal tastes like real chocolate and peanut butter, not like candy. It also means that it's better for your health, which is the most important factor when selecting foods for my family. If you're used to eating junk food, this might be a bit of a disappointment, but if you're used to eating natural foods, you'll enjoy it.

GoodSense Pediatric Electrolyte is the generic for Pedialyte. The flavor of this is grape and my kids think it's yummy so I don't have any trouble getting it down them. Restores fluids lost during diarrhea or vomiting. My kids are young and in school so we have sick kids quite a lot and I'm thankful for something that they will drink and I can feel good about giving them so they don't lose fluid and get dehydrated.You need to refrigerate this after opening and then use within 48 hours after opening. I try to keep some in the refrigerator during cold and flu season so I'll have some cold and ready if we need it.

I like this. The portion is smaller than expected, but delicious to snack on at work. I like that they will last a long time per the shelf date, and they do not spoil and can be left at room temperature. I put a little soy sauce on it, and sometimes some True Lemon. So good.  Adopt a shelter pet.
summary: It's Pink. It's Salmon. It has Omega 3's.

reviewText: If you have TMJ, steer far away from this. It's inedible. Never mind the taste, which is completely bland and somewhat chalky, but this is very, VERY tough to chew for someone with TMJ issues. I made the mistake of looking at the picture and spotting "nougat," which really shouldn't be *that* chewy. I mean, if I can handle a room-temperature Clif bar...Maybe I'll microwave the ones left in the box to make them edible.
summary: When they say chewy, they really do mean CHEWY.

reviewText: These may not be the #1 healthiest snack for toddlers, but they are very good.  The flavor is perfect.  It's not too strong, nor too bland.  They have a touch of salt, but it's not nearly as salty as many alternatives.  They are just the right size for little hands.  They're crunchy, yet dissolve easily.  In fact, these were my toddler's first finger food.  I often like to go with store brands to save money, but I've found that the taste of these is quite superior.As my toddler is getting older, I'm not buying these as often as I used to since they are expensive.  However, when she was still in the early stages of eating table foods, these were awesome.  I'm actually a little bummed that I'm not going to be getting them all that often anymore.
summary: My toddler LOVES these!  I wish they made these for adults as well.

reviewText: There was a younger, stronger time when frowns appeared at the sight of HH, but the products have gained much more respect in the golden years so much so that my spouse can help w/cooking!  Be beef, pork, ham, chicken or tuna,or just plain Alfredo, the basic contents of these products can be prepared to taste gourmet w/just a FEW added ingredients one most likely has on hand for any given meal!  For instance, Sloppy Joes w/sauteed onions and peppers served over toast points w/a salad and a fruit makes for a completely balanced meal.  Have stockpiled cases for emergencies in my safe room, as well as for daily use!
This is a medium hot curry paste in my opinion. It's still hot but not REALLY hot, though you might like a drink to cool your tongue now and then. It could be more flavorful but it's not bad at all.

I haven't yet baked with this product, but I have used it in several drinks to sweeten the taste and every time it ends with me cringing. Give me Splenda or sugar, anything but this. It has a bitter aftertaste. I will soon bake with this one time to try it out, but my expectations are not high. When I do I will update this review. I give it 2 stars for it being reduced calorie.
I like natural and less seasoning! These just barely have salt on them, great great price for a seed that is better for you than a nut for protein!

This is a great idea, chickpea snack. It is also executed well. While a little on the dry side, these are a hearty but not heavy snack that have a very robust peppery taste. Af first I thought they were a tad bit on the expensive side which is my only down side in addition to you REALLY need to like a pepper taste. However, especially with subscribe and save, you get a good amount of snacking for the price. Especially for something that is better for you than most snacks and filling.But I still think many people who are just ok with pepper might find the taste too intensely peppery. But overall for a hearty, healthy snack I do recommend these. And if pepper is not your thing you might want to consider a different flavor.

Colman's mustard, yes the best thing next to wasabi. Use it on fish, in sauces etc.I grew up with this stuff and knew what I was buying before I purchased it.I am very pleased with the product and the price.Rick

Normal granola bar-type snacks quash my hunger for half an hour or so, but then it gradually comes crawling back.  However, I found Planters Big Nut Bars to be far more filling (they're bigger, so they're more filling). Also, they have large chunks of almonds, peanuts, and cashews, which provide a nice crunch amid the chewy bar.  They're a bit sticky, but if you hold the wrapper while you eat them, you're set.  Recommended.

i use this for stews and a broth to cook rice and lentils. it is the best bouillon i have used in that the salt is not to dominating and the herbs (parsley) are a pleasant addition. add some celery and carrot to it and it is hard to go wrong. i will say that it is still a bouillon cube and not as good as a homemade stock or an upper end commercial stock. if you use this type of product you won't be disappointed it is great addition to any budget stricken, ten minute meal chef.TO AMAZON IT IS BOUILLON NOT BOULLION. try checking in one of the million dictionaries you sell or read the package before posting it on the site.
summary: best boullion or bouillon i have purchsed

reviewText: I found that the pod made a very weak and not very flavorful cup of coffee. I didn't think it had much of an aroma either. Sadly, I would only consider this adequate coffee in a total coffee emergency. I prefer medium to dark roasts, and this just didn't have a good flavor. If you like very mild coffee, you might like this.

First let me say, these Nut Bars are bigger than your average granola bar.  There is real substance to these babies!  I am not a huge fan of almonds, but these are, for the most part made of peanuts with some almonds and cashews thrown in for good measure.  The peanuts are honey roasted and that sweet, slightly smoky taste is still there in these bars.At 200 calories this is a nice, hearty afternoon snack, and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised that the gooey binding was not too sweet OR sticky, a big plus for me.  I like to eat a nice piece of juicy fruit in the afternoon, but if I am running around doing errands, these are the perfect stand ins for me!  I can pop one in my purse and I am ready to go.These come in boxes of five, and since I am a big fan of planters products I am hoping that they are a decent value for the money.These are much better than your average granola bars.
Buy beef tips. Much better taste, if you can stand the price difference. Heavy handed loaded with salt. Shame, because overall, good value
Very tasty, chewy, dessert-like taste. They don't do well in heat though, like kept in a car on a warm day, so keep them cool. Otherwise they melt and get very messy. But they're delicious.

I tested this coffee using a regular Mr. Coffee brewer and a standard coffee filter.  Although the product is designed for those one-cup brewers, I don't have one so I used what I had.  It comes in the sealed pods that are designed to drop right in the the brewer without and mess.  I had to open the pouch to brew it in the Mr. Coffee but still found it made a lot less mess just pouring it from an opening in the pouch.  The first time I just made one cup; the second time I brewed two cups using two pouches.I found the coffee quite good, especially the aroma.  (I really loved the aroma!)  It definitely has floral and berry notes that do not overwhelm the coffee flavor. I like that it is organic and Fair Trade Certified.  This product also claims that "We use beans only from coffee farms that adhere to strict sustainability ethics."  You really can't get a much purer source than this.I'm not a coffee gourmand so I shared this brew with a friend who is very particular about her coffee to see her reaction.  I will drink just about any coffee but she likes her coffee strong.  She found this coffee strong and thought that it came awfully close to the coffee she gets from that Seattle chain.  She found the floral and berry "aftertaste" pleasant and not bitter.  She said for her it's definitely 4-star. (Remember, this is a gal who knows her coffee.)
summary: Amost as good as that place in Seattle.............

reviewText: this is probably the best natural no sugar added coconut drink you can find.  they use mature coconut and that is good idea. i also like amy and brian coconut but i rather have ripe than young coconut. i highly recommend Taste of Nirvana.

First of all fish sauce isn't something most of us non-Asians (unless you're Asian and then why are you reading this?) grew up with so we acquired a taste for it later in life.  In a side-by-side taste test between Tiparos and the more expensive Three Crabs Brand, I could barely tell any difference.  That's not to say there is no difference; rather, my palette isn't developed enough to tell the difference.I know that there's a difference because if there wasn't why would my local Asian Food Store dedicate almost an entire isle to soy and fish sauce?My advice is this: Try a low-end brand (plastic bottle) and then try a better brand (glass bottle) and see which one you prefer.  Don't go crazy on the price and keep it under ten bucks for a bottle max.  Step it up from there if you think it will affect you dishes.  Personally, I use so many other ingredients in my curries, soups and kimchee that fish sauce is just for that umami instead of salt.
summary: Not the most expensive but good value

reviewText: I have tried this flavor and the pepper flavor. I did not like this one which is called sweet and hot. The combination did not work for me, and it turned me off. The small chunks of beef jerky instead of strips allows you the choice to nibble only a bit and save the rest for later, but it is already a small amount in the package.
summary: I did not like the taste

reviewText: Good price and quick ship.  My family really enjoys this chai tea and sometimes it is hard to find.  I am happy to know I can order in large amounts through this company.

A nice strong "regular" flavor of coffee w/out being too bold.  Strong enough for the larger size cup choices without getting too weak like some of the flavored coffees do and yet not so "extra bold" that you can't bear it.  A nice option when you don't want flavor.
summary: Nice strong flavor w/out being too bold

reviewText: I used to drink the Green Mountain before Amazon seemed to get rid of them?? I started getting this and have been pleasantly surprised by the great flavor!!!!

When I see the names of Nabisco or Ritz on a product I expect high quality.  I got high quality in this snack cracker, but only to a certain degree.  This box contains only 6 servings.  Each sleeve has one long sandwich type cracker with a soft sharp cheddar cheese spread in the middle of two very crisp multigrain crackers.  I wonder why the decision was made to leave these in one long cracker instead of cutting them in half?  Because the cracker is so crisp and because the cheese center is soft, when I bit into the cracker the other end came apart and separated.  Perhaps I should have been holding it down at the end.  The cheese does have a very pronounced cheese flavor, not necessarily sharp cheddar, but definitely a good cheese taste.  The cracker was very crisp, almost a little too much so, but once I began chewing it the whole cracker came apart in my mouth and separated into a not very pleasant sandy, dry consistency.  Have a drink handy when you snack on these because the cracker was rather dry when eaten by itself.Taking into account that there are only six servings of snack crackers in this box and each one is supposed to be an entire snack I found the calorie count of 130 each (with 60 of those calories from fat) to be rather high.  I didn't notice this snack being particularly filling so I think people will be likely to eat more than one at a time and that calorie count can really add up.  The package states they are an excellent source of fiber, 20% of the daily requirement as stated on the label.  The label also says the cheese is "real" cheese which is nice to know.  One statement I found a little strange is when the description says:  Crackerfuls, Multigrain, Sharp Cheddar, Natural Flavor With Other Natural Flavors.  Obviously I don't speak "product" because I have no idea what that is supposed to mean.All in all, this will probably not be added to my list of favorite Nabisco products.  I did not like the feel of the cracker in my mouth when I was chewing it, but the cheese had a nice cheesy flavor.  Not enough of a trade-off for one positive to offset the other negative.
summary: Not entirely a success with me.

reviewText: Coconut water and me do not mix.  I have tried all of the brands out there and was very satisfied with this flavor mix.  I know all about the health benefits and try to drink one a day.  Much better for you than Sports drinks!  If you drink too much alcohol, try this the next morning, it will help with the recovery!  This flavor mix was very tasty and does not have a coconut after taste.  It has the Passion fruit taste throughout the whole experience.  I would recommend since the price is lower here on Amazon!

I've been using Lundberg Brown Rice Syrup for many years, on and off. I recently bought a new jar and have been using it in recipes and for a bit of sweetening to add to things like yogurt, dips etc...a little goes a LONG way, very sweet.I prefer the taste too, compared with honey for most recipes. It has a milder flavor.And as some reviewers have mentioned, nice that this company continues to use glass for this container. I appreciate that too. Getting harder and harder to buy staple items in glass containers these days, way too much plastic out there. :-(And organic is the way to go too!I was keeping my rice syrup in the fridge after opening but found out from the company recently that storing in a cool place in the cupboard IS ok too, for several months. That's good because it can take a while to warm up and be pourable again, when it's been refrigerated.Good product, will buy again.
Got this and opened the jar to smell and thought it was going to taste more like molasses but when I tried it the flavor is great! Really good stuff! .

This cereal has a great taste! Love the light vanilla and honey flavors. Stays crunchy and is just sweet enought but not kid cereal sweet. I enjoy cereal more at night than in the morning and this flavor is perfect for that late night snack, yum! :)

I like this cereal because it has 10g of protein in it. The sugar content (7g) is still high but better than most other cereals and you also get 3g of fiber per serving. Tastes is OK for plain cereal.
summary: Better than most of the other cereals

reviewText: Great value and yum yum yum!! Skippy Natural is the favorite around here.. will buy again and again!! Kid eats it right off a spoon!

These are excellent oats and are produced in a wheat, gluten and nut free facility, not all GF oats have this quality! Plus they are certified organic.  This is pivotal if you have other allergies and are prone to cross reactions.  You will be safe with these oats, I have not had any issue and I have severe food allergies.Great product, thank you GF Harvest!
summary: Gluten Free Nut Free Facility and Organic!

reviewText: I only recently became aware of the relative health benefits of using Celtic Sea Salt. Before this, I generally cut down on salt in recipes and as a result had blander dishes.  Not anymore! This cooks really well, "acts" like table salt, and adds a terrific flavor. Further, I used it on a sandwich for my salt-addicted father (he sprinkles salt onto potato chips...not good!), and he never knew the difference. I ordered this with the add-on item for the shaker, and the two work nicely together; the bag for measured cooking, and the shaker for sprinkling. I can't buy this locally and will definitely be ordering more!
summary: Would Never Know It's Good For You

reviewText: My whole family loves this stuff and it is great to add to things like yogurt.  Just make sure you get a good deal on it and don't eat it like cereal as it is pretty dense and has a lot of calories when eaten in same quantities as cereal.  A little goes a long way.
summary: Family loves it. Great for yogurt.

reviewText: It seems like none of these superfood/supplement powders ever taste GOOD. Some of them have made me downright sick. This one is about the only one I've found that is drinkable by itself. There is an earthy, grassy undertone to it that is a bit rough, but I mix one scoop of this (about a heaping teaspoon's worth) and one tablespoon of Ovaltine to 8 ounces milk (sometimes soy milk) and it's delicious. Sometimes I'll mix it with the Bolthouse Farms Chocolate Soy Protein drink. If I know I'm going to have a busy day I'll mix it with milk and a half-scoop of whey protein powder.No matter what powder drink supplement/meal replacement mix you choose, you'll want to invest in one of these:LaCuisineTM 18oz Tornado Portable Mixer. Add a little liquid, start blending, add your mix and then fill with more liquid. Your drink is now smooth and if you're a slow drinking like me you can zap it before a sip to keep your drink smooth all the way.Beyond taste, after a week of using the Amazing Grass Chocolate Superfood and changing nothing else in my diet or activities, I find myself having less trouble falling asleep, and I'm waking up earlier and with more energy.If you're wondering exactly what the difference is between this and the Amazing Grass Meal, the answer is about 100 calories and I'm not sure what else. The scoop in the meal can is about three heaping tablespoons (the superfood scoop is about a heaping teaspoon). The taste is almost identical.
summary: Best tasting superfood, but still not great tasting.

reviewText: These granola bars are a little sweet, but I think they taste great! I buy them often and have them as a mid day snack! I definately recommend these to a friend!

First, I guess I'll reiterate that this "Mocha" is not chocolatey. But it is a delicious, medium-strength cup. Not very acidic,which is perfect for the mornings and an empty stomach.  I actually subscribe to this, because I drink at least one cup of this every day.Also, all of Timothy's World Coffee is fair trade. They pay their farmers a living wage. That is equally important as taste, as far as I'm concerned.

I am no coffee connoisseur (my usual go-to brand is "Chock full o'Nuts"), but I know a good brew when I taste one.  I was very impressed by the quality of this Yuban Breakfast Blend.  The bag labels this as "mild" and I'd certainly agree with that.  However, while it is certainly not bold, it is definitely flavorful and rich.  It's a smooth drink with a nice full aroma.While I may usually prefer something a tad stronger, I certainly enjoyed this and relished my morning cup.  For someone who would ordinarily order up something stronger, this is a nice change of pace that doesn't equate mildness with a lack of flavor.

Overall, I like the way this granola tastes. It has a good ratio of granola-to-chocolate, and the chocolate tastes good. It doesn't taste cheap, and it's not too sweet.Unfortunately it melts pretty quickly to the touch, so this can be a messy to eat with your hands. (It's worth pointing out that the bag was in a hot car before I tried some, but I still had this problem even after it cooled to room temperature.)The granola itself is a bit dry, unlike more honey coated brands, and the pieces don't stick together that well. So, after the big chunks are gone, you're left with lots of tiny bits that are messy to pick up. I suppose this wouldn't be a problem if you like your granola in cereal or yogurt, instead of trail mix.Even though it's healthy, I wouldn't recommend this product (or any granola) for mindless snacking. Just 1/2 a cup contains 220 calories, which in my opinion is a lot for a snack. On the plus side, it's great for a hiking food or a quick pick-me-up.
Addictive. IMHO these are simply THE best cheese curls. I used to get them at a local whole foods market. Ordering by the case is a wee bit cheaper, oh-so-convenient and terribly dangerous.

I agree with the other positive reviews I see here.  Nice flavor, strong-ish, no bitter, grind-y or conference coffee flavors to mess it up.For reference purposes my in store drink is a Starbucks Americano.My favorite k-cups are:Starbucks French RoastStarbucks Caffe VeronaStarbucks Pike Place RoastGreen Mountain Xtra Bold Sumatran ReserveGreen Mountain Double Black DiamondGreen Mountain RevvGreen Mountain Dark MagicOther k-cups I've tried:  Coffee People Jet Fuel ,Green Mountain Dark Magic Decaf, Emeril Jazzed up Decaf, Starbucks Caffe Verona, Coffee People Black Tiger,  Starbucks House Blend, Starbucks Breakfast Blend, Starbucks Sumatra, Wolfgang Puck French Roast, Green Mountain Lake and Lodge, Green Mountain French Roast, Caribou Mahogony, Wolfgang Puck Sumatra Kopi Raya, Emeril Big Easy Bold

I've always been a fan of German Chocolate products, such as the delicious German Chocolate Croissant available at some of the local bakeries.  I like trying a variety of flavored coffees, so naturally I had to try this one - I was not disapointed - it's smooth and quite flavorful with just the right tint of coconut goodness. If you like a little bit of sugar with your coffee, you may want to try this one w/o sugar at first, as it's already pretty sweet.
I ordered this oil to make salad dressings with and I have been very please with this product.  I would purchase this oil again.

I love the fact that this works nicely in my breadmaker.I stirred the ingredients together and added them to my machine. Then, I set the machine on "Quick Bread." And I went off to a Community Event.When I returned home, it had baked and was still on the "warm" setting. It was moist and warm, and with a little butter was a treat made in heaven. This is one I will be keeping in the cupboard for company and emergencies. Well, emergencies like a snowstorm when I need comfort food around the house. :-)NOTE - because you use eggs, you can't do the quick bread overnight.

I read some of the other reviews here and decided to try putting a pod in my espresso machine. Worked fine, except the coffee was not very dark. Then I took the pod and dropped it into the coffee to make it darker. Still weak. This is the same problem I have with all the pod/cup/premeasured coffees. While I do know people who drink coffee brewed like this, it's not strong enough for my taste, and I think most people's. The flavor is good, would be delicious if strong, so maybe next time I will use two pods. However, the price is kind of high if you have to use two pods per cup.UPDATE: Today, I tried using two pods and boiling them in a cup of water, thinking it might work for camping. Still weak. I think you'd need two pods and half a cup, 4oz or so. I noticed that the coffee does not taste full-bodied. It could be dried out from all the processing -- ground coffee should probably be stored in a packed brick, not individual, non-vacuum-packed packets. Oh well.
This fat free dressing is so smooth and creamy, with nice chunks of blue cheese.  It has no artificial taste.  I keep this one on subscribe and save.

This drink is good if you don't want to drink sugary colas or other super calorie energy drinks and enjoy the taste of water.  The water isn't flavored, which I liked, just tastes like spring water.  I didn't notice a tremendous caffeine boost though.  It seems like I  get more of a boost from mountain dew.  My favorite caffeine pick me up is glaceau energy drinks, they work every time and taste good, orange flavored.
The entire family loves this product.  It is my go-to side item.  It is easy to fix and is priced cheaper than my local grocery store when using the Subscribe and Save program.

Mostly when cooking eggs (virtually any style), popcorn shrimp, fish and other seafoods.  I was worried the nutty flavor would overpower the recipe, but it didn't take very long to fall in love with it.  As others have stated, all three of my cans were dented, not enough to warrant losing a star over.
summary: I use it as much as possible

reviewText: Chia seeds are great if you are dieting. Two table spoons of these things are a hundred calories, which might seem like a lot, but they are nutrient dense calories, and will fill you up for a long time.I soak my chia seeds in a small amount of water for fifteen minutes, then add them to my protein shake. They taste good, pretty neutral, and are good for you. Make sure you soak them first, though. They soak up ten times their weight in water, and you don't want that going on in your stomach.Nutiva is a good brand, and these seeds will last forever in your fridge. Give them a shot.

I got this starter for Christmas. My well-meaning spouse received it in the mail on Dec 18, and instead of reading the package he wrapped it. I opened it Dec 25, and followed the directions to revive it that morning without much hope it'd work. It didn't show much activity until the evening of the 26th, when it was bubbly. A couple feedings later I have a nice healthy active bubbly starter with a great authentic sourdough scent. I'm still increasing the volume before I bake with it, but judging by the activity level and the scent I expect great results. I've tried making my own starter before and ended up with a product that smelled more like beer than sourdough, so I'm excited to try this one.If the packaging was easier I'd give it 5 stars. A lot of my initial starter was lost stuck to the baggie. It was sticky like a wad of soft gum, and had been squashed flat. I had a baggie covered on the inside with a thin layer all over instead of a neat little ball like the picture shows. I tore open the bag all around the edges and scraped as much as I could off with a spoon. Maybe it's easier to remove when you receive and revive the starter on time instead of getting to it after a week under the tree, but mine was a sticky mess. A small tub, maybe like the ones hot sauce or salad dressing sometimes use, might be easier to remove the starter.

I usually prefer the darker French Roast type coffees.  Much of the time I even grind whole beans.This Yuban Breakfast Blend was a pleasant surprise.  It has absolutely no bitterness and never tastes sour, but instead tastes smooth and with a very pleasant aroma.  I'm going to have to make an exception to my preference for French Roasts--this coffee is smooth and has the warm aroma you like in a breakfast cup of coffee.
summary: I'm finicky, and I like it.

reviewText: I add this to my smoothies, or I just add a couple tablespoons to some liquid (water or aloe vera juice for me), and let it gel, and drink. Fiber and protein and fatty acids... what more can you ask for? Just make sure you have floss or a toothbrush handy.
summary: Chia is supposed to be a super food.

reviewText: Was so glad to find this on online, not any easy product to find. Happy to purchase organge blossom water on line and for a reasonable price.

I had hoped that Hellman's mayo with olive oil would TASTE like olive oil, at least faintly, which it does not. At about $7 a bottle, this is a little pricey. I must confess that I love Miracle Whip, and only eat mayo in restaurants. My husband, the mayo-eater, did not notice a difference between this mayo with olive oil and others plain mayos we have used, including "lite" mayo. I will definitely use up the jar we have, probably in cooking and salads, but have no incentive to buy this over any other brand, especially considering Amazon's price. (Note: my review is based on the product's taste and texture only; I did not take any healthful eating pros and cons into consideration.)
summary: What can I say? It's mayonnaise...

reviewText: The only water I drink is bottled, mostly store brands and/or Dasani. I had never tried a Caffeinated Water product before trying a bottle of the avitae so I wasn't sure what to expect.  I really didn't notice any taste at all and no aftertaste.  I don't know about the caffeine effect on me as I didn't feel any different after finishing the bottle, not that I was expecting to.  I am a daily coffee drinker of 2 to 3 mugs, mostly in the morning, brewed in a Cuisinart coffee maker.I did not care for the shape of the bottle the avitae is in.  The plastic is very soft and the bottle could easily slip out of a person's hands.  It's just an odd shape.Despite liking the avitae, I would not purchase it because of the cost. I'll continue with regular bottled water and brewed coffee, but for those who do not like or drink coffee or tea or sodas, I think the avitae might be considered as an alternative.
Use to order this all the time...good, bold coffee...until I tried the Green Mtn Double Black Diamond - much stronger.  I do still order the Emeril's for when  want something not quite as bold.

These sweet puppies must have drugs in them, because I can't go two months without craving a box. I can only get these at World Mart in smaller quantities, so it's nice that Amazon has them in bulk.Make sure to keep them in the fridge. If they melt, use them for cocoa or mocha instead of wasting them. Melting & resolidifying does alter the taste.
Great quality chia at a fair price. I was paying extra for their white ones for awhile, but why when these are just as good!

I order my coffee from this supplier because you get it on time, packaged securely and saves me countless money from purchasing it from a vendor.. I can make it the way I want and know the coffee is the way I like it.  Save your coffee money in a jar and use it for yourself.  You will be surprised at how much you really save in the long run!
summary: Why pay more for your coffee?

reviewText: As with most green tea, the flavor is very mellow.  For me the flavor is VERY mellow and borders on the edge of drinking water.  The smell is there but just not the taste.  I would not buy this particular flavor again.  The price point is inline with Twinings so cannot complain about that.

I really like this brand of Chia seeds. Made by the same company I get my coconut oil from. It grinds up real nice in my smoothies. It suggest that you let it soak 10 to 15 minutes before you use it, and it would grind up better, actually it's supposed to be a gel then. I haven't had the patience to let it soak as yet....maybe next time....

I was not sure I would like this coffee after reading some of the reviews on it, but I like the coffee and the fact that is has no bitter taste. It brews beautifully in my Breville K-cup machine! It tasted smooth and full flavored, even using the larger cup setting on my machine.

My son who does not eat veggies or green stuff even admits this is better then normal pasta, my husband loves it too, so did I before I found out I have become allergic to Gluten thanks to the alteration of wheat.If only they made this with traditional wheat or Gluten free, till then, I still make it regular for my family.

I confess; I am a coffee snob. After moving to the US eight years ago, I had trouble finding coffee that I really liked. Some were extremely weak; others had either a burnt or acidic taste. Through time, I found some decent options, but I decided to go with an espresso machine instead.I do like to drink regular coffee though, and Yuban comes across as one of the few brands that I can thoroughly enjoy. It has a well-rounded and smooth taste and a pretty strong flavor. It may be too strong for some people, though.The fact that the beans are sourced from the Rainforest Alliance is a nice feature of this product. I highly recommend Yuban to anyone that enjoys a cup of coffee with full flavor and none of the burnt taste that some of the leading brands have.
I often like a cup of coffee late in the day or in the evening yet dont want the caffiene and this fit perfectly. Good taste, strong but not overbrearing.

I hate Hamburger Helper.  Well, hate is a strong word.  It's boring.  This product, however, is not.I wanted to try this out just for curiosity's sake.  I'm a big fan of Velveeta's Shells and cheese and wondered what it would be like as a meal.  I cooked my hamburger meat-more than the recipe called for-and began the process of doing the rest of the meal.  Oops!  I forgot the spice pack.  I added it later than when the recipe said I had to add it.  Nonetheless the meal was delicious.  I plan on keeping this last minute meal in my cabinet as an emergency back-up or just to have as a planned meal.

Really good and the baby loves it. I thought the combo of pear and greens might not be that tasty, but I even tested it myself and it's quite good! Love the pouch for easy travel, great ingredients as well. Definitely a must!

This coffee is probably the smoothest, richest coffee I've ever brewed at home.  It has a lovely full-bodied taste, an enticing aroma and not an ounce of bitterness.  Fresh and pleasantly addictive, it was difficult to convince myself to use the other coffee's in my pantry after finishing my 12oz sample bag.  Ordering this as a six pack is a no-brainer.

Okay, I'm not a coffee connoisseur by any stretch of the imagination but I LOVE this coffee!  I have had both the ground and whole bean and like the whole bean the best.  While it's a hassle sometimes to have to grind the beans, it smells heavenly and it just seems to taste better.  It's a good, smooth coffee and even though I do add Stevia drops and creamer, I could drink it without, it's so good!
summary: Great Coffee at a Great Price

reviewText: Red potatoes just seem to have more flavor and these are delicious and so quick to prepare. Time saver and taste buds are delighted!
I have tried a few different brands of Chai teas and only this one came close to the chai that was home made for me from someone who knows what she's doing.
I mix this with raw meal, a little more cocoa powder, rice milk and almond milk. It looks a little gross, but tastes and smells like chocolate milk.

reviewerName: Kilgore Gagarin "Those who believe in telekin...
reviewText: My wife and I are heavy espresso drinkers. We prefer to grind our own beans with French roast (really dark beans) being our preferred type. In the past we'd buy this by walking into a local Starbucks and get a 16 oz bag. Once we found that this was available via Amazon Prime (free 2 day shipping) we've been regularly buying this online. This is the exact same product we used to get in person from Starbucks, but all I have to do is "1-click" and two days later this 40 oz. package shows up on our doorstep. With Prime's free two day shipping this is the most convenient way to get our French roast fix. This is the third or fourth order I've placed (my wife JUST called me) and I finally got around to writing a review.For the record, the beans appear to be fresh and not stale. We've purchased "rot gut" French roast beans in the past, but after getting, grinding, and drinking the Starbucks French roast we're hooked.Convenient caffeine fix gets an easy 5 out of 5 stars.
summary: Great reason for Amazon Prime membership

reviewText: If you like a good spicey tea, this is the k-cup for you.  Wonderful in the winter.  I wonder how it would taste over ice?

Okay, so there's no juice here, and it's basically just flavored sugar water, but Kool-Aid is great for pepping up water and making it taste better than just plain old tap water. This flavor is Peach Mango, and it's heavier on the peach than the mango, making it a refreshing, sweet drink. I like to mix the finished product with real juice (whatever is on hand) to make the juice stretch further without having a watered-down flavor.This product is nothing new in the world of Kool-Aid, of course. It's sugar-sweetened. No bad-tasting aspartame, sucralose/Splenda, or other artificial sweeteners in here, thank goodness! Just good old sugar.You can't go wrong with Kool-Aid, especially if you use it as a way to make real juice last longer.
