It's certainly better than loading yourself or your kids down with high fructose corn syrup!Worth the price. Bring your own water.
Its hard to beat this for making iced tea. It makes a strong tea that manages to quench a thirst on a hot day. Just dont steep is too long or it will get bitter (I find that 4 mins is about perfect.)

I am a little dis appointed with this tea --  This was my first experience with loose tea --  initially this was good loose tea ---  after having tried for several months  -- I am dis appointed -- first it is a weak tea  --  I have tried brewing it  for long time changing my water settings and brew times and I keep getting same result  a weak tea  -- the amt of tea --  I just never seem to get the right mix  --
summary: tea is a little on weak side

reviewText: I have pretty much been living on Amy's food for about 8 years now, when I can't eat fresh or am too lazy to cook from scratch. The Berliner family (Amy's Mom and Dad) has done the world a major service in proving that frozen and canned food can be truly healthy. (Please stay private! Going public and thinking mainly of profits will ruin the food, no doubt.)Their pesto pizza is so good it's ridiculous. I've eaten about a thousand of those, maybe two. All their products are hand-made from organic ingredients, and the prices are more than fair considering the quality.I love Thai food, especially Tom Kha and green curry (hint hint, Miss Amy!). This soup holds up well to some of the better TKs I've had in good Thai restaurants. It is spicy but not overwhelming, creamy but not too thick, and in general simply dang yummy!! Easily the best canned Thai soup I've ever had (except for Satay soups, made by Austin's wonderful Foo Swasdee, but sadly her canned food biz stopped a while back (her restaurants are still here, though, and still great. Foo is a wonderful lady!)).Good Thai chow is almost everything I want from food: nutritious and healthy and extremely tasty, with many flavors complementing but not overwhelming each other. This soup is all that.And as always with organic food, by buying this not only are you getting the healthiest food, you're helping support people who care about the health of our planet, and not supporting people who don't.Many thanks to the Berliner family for making the best pre-packaged food on the planet.I could live on this stuff.Wait...I do...

I honestly do not like it.  I tried to drink it several times hoping to acclimate myself to the taste, all to no avail.  So, I brought the packets to the office and put them on the "free-for-all" counter in the breakroom so my co-workers could have it.  They didn't have a fancy for it either.  As a matter-of-fact, somebody shoved it way to the back of the cabinet and put a bunch of other stuff in front of it so we didn't even have to see it.  It's horrible, I tell you.  I finally just threw them all away.
Their website SincerelyNuts.com lists their name as SincerelyNuts, not Superior Nuts.  The quality and taste are very close to the more expensive Mauna Loa macadamias.  I recommend this.
summary: Tastes about the same as Mauna Loa brand

reviewText: I was quite surprised to find this drink gave me a good amount of energy shortly after using it.  The first time I used it, I gave it a double squeeze (like I did with other Mio flavors)...well that was a mistake.  The flavor was too much and I couldn't finish it.Now, I just use a quick squirt in my water bottle and the flavor is very subtle, yet I get a nice kick for the day.Definitely something I will keep on hand.

I have no idea how Quinoa should taste. I was looking to supplement my diet and reduce consumption of rice, potatoes, and bread. But this has a bland taste with a slightly sour flavor. Anyway, unless I eat it with some other food, preferably with a sauce or gravy, I do not think I could eat this and I will definitely not buy again.
summary: My first taste of Quinoa and it was not good

reviewText: I believe the title says it all.  While this might be the 'batch' I received.  wow.  too bad 0-stars is not an option.
Strong, flavorful, yummy!  The best way to start my day.  I use other k-cups, too, but this is my #1 favorite!

Yep, this is A LOT of curry powder, but if you use it often in cooking, it really is a better price than paying several dollars for a tiny bottle (even McCormick's own tiny bottle) that'll be gone in no time - or worse, make you feel like you have to ration it.  I like curry powder and for once in my life, I wanted to use it and not feel I must skimp.  I paid just under $11 and in about a month, I've used maybe 3/4 of an ounce (I saved an empty 1 oz bottle to keep a more manageable portion on the spice rack).  Like another reviewer said, it IS possible it tastes a bit different from the 1 oz version, but I couldn't say for certain, and moreover, I don't think it's bad - I'm using it, mainly on rice dishes.  To me, it's legions better thanTaste Specialty Foods Hot Curry Powder, 16-Ouncebut not as good asRajah Mild Madras Curry Powder 100g.Google "curry powder health benefits" and you'll find plenty of results; it's best known for its benefits to digestion and for anti-inflammatory qualities, but also said to boost memory and protect against Alzheimer disease and cancer.Ingredients: Coriander, Fenugreek, Turmeric, Cumin, Black Pepper, Bay Leaves, Celery seed, Nutmeg, Cloves, Onion, Red Pepper, Ginger.The expiration, I'm pleased to note since there is so darn much of this(!), is April 2014.
summary: No added salt is a big plus

reviewText: great soup for these cold winter nights, a perfect match with a grilled cheese sandwich.  I love how easy these are to pop into my purse and take to work with me,

I didn't taste the peanut butter whatsoever but aside from that, this is pretty tasty. There is a light drizzle of chocolate like something to give a hint of sweet. Good balance between crunch and chew. Overall pretty yummy although the after-taste is a bit strong for my preference. Spouse didn't notice whatsoever. I'd be inclined to pick this up over most other similar type bars due to the better than average flavor.
summary: Pretty good but strong after taste

reviewText: I'm not a big breakfast eater, but I eat instant oatmeal (and tea) every single day. Normally I eat the Quaker oatmeal that comes in packets and, even though I think it has way too much sugar, it's very good (the sugar is probably the reason I like it so much, duh). I thought this oatmeal sounded interesting, particularly since I really like pistachio nuts and cherries (but wow, what a weird combination for someone to think of--yes?). I will say, I really miss the old fashioned oatmeal that I ate as a kid, slow cooked and covered in butter. Yum. I probably should go back to that.Anyway, I only got one sample form the Vine, so I have to base my review on one try. (I probably will buy more and try it again, however.) I found that cooking it was simple enough--add boiling water and wait three minutes. There is a line in the cup and you add water to that line. I stirred it after I initially added water and the water level went down and so I added more and the only reason I even mention that is that I think if you don't add a second dollop of water, it will be a bit too thick.OK, texture and flavor: I really like the texture a great deal. I like to have something like nuts or raisins or whatever to chew in oatmeal. The pistachios pieces, slices of roasted almonds and cherries are plentiful. So they get great marks for both quantity and texture. Quaker did not cheap out with those ingredients, points for that.But the taste has a kind of, I don't know, a sort of flowery quality that I didn't particularly like--especially the liquid that is floating around in the oatmeal. I really really wanted to like this because the ingredients are a very nice combination. But there is something in the mix of sweeteners or whatever that is just a bit off. Try it though, you might like it. If I could, I would give it 3.5 stars--that's probably a more fair score. But since they were generous with nuts and cherries, I'm giving them 4.Anyway, bottom line: Very convenient, lots of texture and more than enough chewy stuff, but the flavor seems a bit off to me. I'll try it again though, maybe it will grow on me.Lastly, however, I think this stuff is way overpriced. It's more than $2 per serving--compare that to the basic packets (yes, much less in the way of added ingredients, I know) that sells for under $3 for 10 packets. Maybe they should just sell this stuff in simple packets and skip the expensive self-cooking cup.
summary: Love the texture, the flavor is so-so at best

reviewText: I'm from New Orleans and I know what good coffee tastes & smells like!  This coffee along with some real dixieland jazz will get everyone moving even the folks over there in the cemetary.

I think it was the smell that was most offputting.  It smelled like apples, too much like apples, like being under an apple tree on a hot day, the ripe, too sweet smell of the apples that have fallen to the ground and begun rot mixing with the sharp crisp odor of the still green apples hanging on the tree, so overwhelming.I've made my own instant oatmeal, I found a recipe for it years ago on a running blog.  The basic recipe is instant oats, instant dry milk powder plus whatever dried fruit, nuts, spices and sugar you care to add. You mix it up and whenever you want a bowl of oaty goodness you scoop some out and add boiling water, done!Dried apple and walnuts were my favorite add ins, so the smell of apples and nuts heating is a welcome and familiar scent, but this oatmeal just smelled weird.  Unnatural.  The taste was strange too, a little bit sweet and tangy.I ate just half of the container and couldn't entice anyone else in my family to give it a try.  My hubby said it smelled like kool-aid!On the upside, I liked the ease of making it, the consistency was nice (though I didn't add nearly as much water as recommended, it would have been watery if I had, blech!).Anyways, this product is a real miss with me.  If I want instant, I'll make it myself at home.

I am actually surprised with how bold these K-Cups are.  I thought a product with a mass appeal name like "Emeril" would have to cater to a broad consumer base and "Bold" would really mean "Not Weak".  In fact, there is a lot of flavor here.  Over time I think I became used to it though and required the further bite of a French Roast or Italian Roast to really get me going.  But, these are definitely bolder than your Donut Shop varieties and Bold really means "Bold" so I'm happy!
I tried the strawberry bars, they were very very sweet. I don't like sweet first thing in the morning, these have less sugar and yogurt coating. Not to mention the fact that they're cheeper.

Amy's Chunky Tomato BisqueThe name alone, makes this special!  Amy's products have always been a favorite of mine.  This is a healthy, comfort soup, to me.  Sipping, slowly, from a spoon, and savoring every flavor is a healthy satisfying pleasure!

I've searched a long time to find a K cup coffee that is rich and smooth and decaffeinated, and I think the Starbucks Decaf Pike Place Roast fits the bill.  The K cups are extremely convenient, and this is a great option when I don't have the time to grind my own beans and use my ekobrew cups.The price is right here on Amazon, and it's great to have this delicious coffee delivered right to your door with no extra shipping charge.

Chocolate always compliments coffee.  It's the same case here.  The dark chocolate taste is obvious but not overpowering.  The coffee smells and tastes very smooth.  So, it truly is a good combination for what it is.

I've been trying to figure out what this drink reminds me of and it finally hit me.  It tastes like an apple green jolly rancher made into a fruit drink.  Personally, I enjoyed the flavor, I found it refreshing and light but it would be a bit much to have every day.  The apple flavor is very pronounced and I can taste the lemon.  The banana  and strawberry flavors were more subtle.For those on carbohydrate-controlled diets, this is flavored with stevia. I like that the ingredient list is relatively short.  It contains apple juice, lemon juice, water, apple puree, strawberry puree, banana puree, natural flavor (?), caffeine, stevia, and carbonation.Overall, I enjoyed this drink for a quick energy boost with low calories.  It has 80 mgs of caffeine (equivalent to 1 8oz cup of coffee).

First, let me say, I do not consider myself to be a coffee connoisseur or snob. I do not have a refined pallet. But, I do enjoy a good strong cup of coffee. The Emerils bold is exactly what I was looking for. I know there are always those out there that say, "nowhere close to my custom grind and French press." But, I use the keurig for the convenience and variety. The emerils bold is perfect for what I want - a good strong cup of coffee to start off my work day.***********Update 7/26/12I've tried a couple other "bold" coffee's, just to compare. (Brooklyn Beanery Fugettaboutit and Jet Fuel)  Not all bolds are the same. The other bolds seemed more bitter. (Some people think that bitter = strong coffee. Not true, strong coffee = good coffee, bitter coffee = bad coffee.) I'm done experimenting with different brands. For a good, strong cup of coffee, Emeril's Big Easy Bold will be my go to coffee from now on.Also, I just want to make one more comment on defective K-Cups. I see alot of reviews for both Emeril's and other K-Cups saying saying that they are horrible because 1 in every 3 explode in their Keurig machine. My wife and I go through 60 - 70 K-Cups per month, since December 2011. We've never had a problem with any of them. (when I say 60 - 70, they're not all Emeril's bold - we would be bouncing off the walls. We also use Caribou breakfast blend, decaf, green tea, heral tea, and hot cocoa.)
I like it.. Strong, but not too strong.  It is a coffee taste without the burnt flavor that some others give.  Smooth is the best word of expression I can use.
these ARE very good to have around the house, you can either warm them in the microwave or eat them just as the  come

This stuff is wonderful for making dairy-free fudge such as peanutbutter fudge, chocolate fudge, coconut fudge, you name it! You can also mix small amounts of it with water and spices to create a coconut-based curry sauce.My only complaint really has nothing to do with quality and probably can't be fixed. During shipping or even storing in room temp cabinets, the product does separate into two layers, one soft and oily, and one hard and dry. To get it out of the plastic interior pouch, I have to cut the pouch open and scrape it down with a spatula to get all the product out. And because it has separated, it needs to be heated or melted in order to emulsify it. This isn't a big deal when I'm using the whole package for something, but if I only want to use part of it, the remainder has to go into a storage container in the fridge, where it separates once again. I'm not sure how many times it is ok to reheat this product.Again, I believe this is just the nature of creamed coconut without additives in it, so I'm saying all that just so people know how the product behaves. I love the taste and will continue buying this in order to make healthy goodies for the hubs.
summary: This is a regular in our house

reviewText: I've gotten Gunpowder Green, Green Tea Garden, Moroccan Mint, and this Imperial Green Tea from Davidson's.I've ordered them each at least twice and am now ordering this one for a second time.All completely different haha.... I like this one because I can brew it really strong and it tastes good while providing enough caffeine for me on 1-3 cups a day.I'm probably unusual in that I brew a loooooong time. Like brew and forget.So the Gunpowder Green would get VERY strong, the Green Tea Garden would get very flavorful, and the Moroccan Mint a little bitter maybe. Still all superb for my purposes and I would order them again.But for now I'm going to ride out my Imperial Green addiction.I've used this brewing basket for 2 years.No rust.FORLIFE Extra fine Infuser Porcelain DishOh, I've also gotten Chamomile and HIbiscus flowers from Davidson's! Forgot about those. The hibiscus I learned to steep for under 3 minutes (I set a timer) otherwise it is too tart, even for me. I was trying to recreate Tazo's Passion tea with the hibiscus and SleepyTime tea with the chamomile ;) More experiments are required....

I love this creamed coconut. It's somewhere between coconut milk and coconut butter.  It is pretty solid in the pack - and 2 distinct separate layers. Best way to use it is warm it them smoosh around inside the pouch to mix it. I use it many different ways - from a cooking thickener to mixing with coconut flakes and cacao paste to make a sort of chocolate coconut pudding. Delish!

With a name like Dark Chocolate Truffle, this coffee begs you to drink it. Whenever we entertain and I offer our usual array of coffee options, people always say "Ahh" when I get to Dark Chocolate Truffle.What I enjoy about this flavor is that it seems the right mix in terms of strength. Not too strong, but not weak, either. I had feared the Dark Chocolate part of it would make it much stronger. But its a great mix. And when you brew it, the smell wonderfully permeates the house.This coffee is a winner and you don't even need anything in it.
summary: Fantastic, Delivering Both Aroma and Taste

reviewText: I was eating too many peanuts for snacks, so I added hemp seeds as another option.  They are small like poppy seeds but are not crunchy.  I find them very satisfying just out of the bag or sprinkled over salads and cooked oats.  I was pleased to learn that they provide a good source of omega-3 fatty acids.  I understand that they are good toasted.  I wonder if they could be ground up for hempseed butter, like peanut butter.
summary: An Interesting Addition To The Diet

reviewText: This is one of my fav flavors so far. Do not let the word CREAM fool you. There is very little cream to these but they are still very flavorfull. I add either French Vanilla powdered cream or liquid cream to this and it's great.I have it on a regular basis. The flavor does not get old or eventually give you an aftertaste.
Another really good soup, light in sodium, from Amy's --- just tried a case of it for the first time, and loved it.  Will purchase again.
summary: Amy's Organic Light in Sodium Cream of Tomato Soup from amazon.com.

reviewText: This is a good hot sauce made up of a quality blend of vinegar and peppers.  Many kinds of peppers are used including habanero, jalapeno, red Japanese chili and "more peppers".  It is medium hot  definitely not mild but not mouth burning either.  Gingo Bandito Hot Sauce is delicious on scrambled eggs as it really gives that classic mild comfort food a much needed kick.  Really it is good on any food that needs a little spicing up.  Be sure to read descriptions on the label and enjoy the quirky humor.
summary: Hot Sauce With A Sense Of Humor

reviewText: These are very fresh  well flavored bite sized cubes of candied ginger.  These are beautifully processed  good ginger flavor with a nice bite but not too spicy. Pieces are a bit bigger than most packaged candied ginger and quite  suitable for eating out of hand. They  need to be chopped up a bit if you want to add them to  cookie  dough etc or add to jam. I've shared these with a friend who had  morning sickness and used them on a boat trip in rough seas to avert mal de mer and for mild stomach distress  they are a very useful folk remedy though of course they are mainly intended as a candy and condiment I will probably include some in a sauce/chutney  to serve with duckling

The smell and appearance of this coffee are very attractive when first opened. The bag is vacuum sealed. The coffee is very finely ground and has the soft texture of clay. The aroma is rich and delicious.Opinions will differ on taste. While I liked it, my husband wasn't so keen on the flavor. I guess it depends on your feelings about chocolate.Still . . . Folgers Gourmet Selections makes a decently priced chocolate coffee that smells just as good and tastes slightly better.
This is pretty good. May order again. Why not get some extra vegetables while your getting your tasty bean supply for iron and proteins.
This Starbucks is one of my favorite coffees. I use it in the Keurig machine - also bought from Amazon. Bold and perfect strength for me as the first cup of morning coffee.

Still my favorite coffee add-on.Gevalia's dark chocolate truffle coffee is very, very finely ground, sweet and not bitter. Not sugary, but cocoa at its best. For a more americanized cup of joe, add one scoop of your usual canned junk, but anyway you serve it, one of the smoothest brews I'veever tasted, and I've tasted a lot of coffees. Classy! I'll always buy it for a few cups of something special, like the holidays (right now). Tops for gifting if your recipient is savvy enough to appreciate it!
Lacking the sweetness of root beer, this product isn't worth drinking.  Rootbeer-flavored stevia mixed into seltzer, which is pretty awful, actually tastes.better.

Maybe they should have drawn a modern art picture of this bar for the box.  Because this visual is an over-promise.  It looks like it will really be rich and delicious.  But it isn't.  It's not terrible.  But it is a disappointment.

A quick read of the ingredients in this ranch dressing mix tells me this is not for me.  I avoid both maltodextrin (a sugar and filler) and MSG.  I can make my own dressing with little effort and using ingredients that I usually have on hand.  So why take chances with a known neurotoxin such as MSG? Why include a filler, maltodextrin, when my home made dressing contains no fillers?  Certainly, using a mix is somewhat more convenient than creating it from scratch, but is it really worth saving a few minutes of time to use a product that is not as good or as healthy as homemade?I will not be purchasing this product.
summary: A Quick Mix Containing Maltodextrin and MSG

reviewText: Finally, finally I have a great consistent source for buying my favorite British tea.  I've been drinking P G Tips since my first trip to England back in the 1980's but have often had trouble finding a source for purchasing it here.  I got it from British food importers for many years, then my local grocery stores began to stock it.  Except they don't always have it on the shelf and I often have to visit several stores to find it.  Amazon has definitely solved that problem for me.I really enjoy drinking this particular tea.  It is a very mild tea, without the harsh flavor some other black teas can have.  Since I make at least two pots of tea each day (and sometimes more) this lovely large quantity will come in very handy and keep my pantry stocked for a long time to come.  It was also much cheaper to buy in this larger size than the 40 count boxes I find in my stores, plus no sales tax and the additional savings of the Amazon Prime membership came in very handy with eliminating the shipping charges.
summary: A great source for my favorite tea.

reviewText: These K Cups are very good, with a smooth, medium strength flavor.  The vanilla flavor is mild, not pronounced or artificial tasting.

I'm writing this review after trying this herbal tea twice. Generally I'm not a fan of herbal teas, and I usually don't think of Lipton as having a winner of any sort of tea .... but this Ginger Twist really broke convention! It tastes really very nice. Actually, it tastes just a little bit like Fruit Loops cereal - with a bit more zing. The scent is lovely, too. So far I've had it with just a half teaspoon of sugar. I think it would pair with milk very nicely as well. It seems my sinuses open up when I drink it - a nice bonus. Haven't tested its powers on my tummy yet - but I'll update if I can. Quite yummy to sip anytime of day - and it has no caffeine naturally.
summary: Very tasty - Best of the Herbals - reminds me of Fruit Loops

reviewText: Babies seem to enjoy these purees. They seem to be high in sugar, but the flavor is definitely "gourmet." They are somewhat expensive for the number of pouches included in a bundle. I would probably make homemade purees for every day, and just purchase these for a special occasion, or a special and occasional treat.

These t-discs are not interchangeable with the ubiquitous k-cups. These are wider and flatter and can only be used as brewing cups in the Tassimo brewing system which reads the bar code on each cup and uses the appropriate water temperature and amount with each cup. One reviewer mentioned that you can open these up and use the coffee inside, but that pretty much defeats the purpose. The coffee you would get would not be as good as what you get using the Tassimo brewing system. I brewed mine in the T55 model. The coffee made from these President's Choice Tassimo Gourmet, West Coast Dark Roast t-discs is exceptionally good--I'd go back to any coffee house that served me this coffee. It was hot, fragrant, dark and rich tasting. Highly recommended.

Like others said, you probably won't want to drink this without sugar or honey. As soon as the Keurig is done brewing you'll have a room full of the wonderful smell of lemon... Perfect for when you have a cold, or just need a nice warm beverage.
summary: Awesome, perfect for those cold winter nights.

reviewText: These are very reminiscent of the old type of berries I used to buy in very high end stores in Chicago.  Nice flavor.
These cups are the best.. 60 pieces per cup?! Awesome. I no longer have to spend extra time purchasing the smaller gum pack sizes. Highly recommend this product. Saves you money in the long run.

I'm glad I discovered this tea awhile back. I really like it and look forward to using it to make sun tea later this spring and summer.I like it better than the mass market teas you can find at stores like Wally Mart, and sometimes you can get it for a great price with Subscribe & Save plus a coupon deal.I ordered early March 2011 and the tea I got was dated "BEST BEFORE END 07/2012", so good for at least 17 months. Not bad.Oh yeah, the pyramid tea bags work great.

In 2011, when StarBucks broke away from Tassimo Bosch over a contractual dispute, I was completely disappointed, and wonderedwhat other Options were going to be available, in the meantime, I purchased a warehouse supply of StarBuck's Coffee & Cappuccino andstarted researching a New Coffee Machine, and then ... in November, I found out that Starbucks was offering the "K-Cup" Version, for the Keurig Coffee machines. I ordered and received a Brand New B145 OfficePRO model, a supposedly 'Heavy-Duty' Keurig Model ...In January, I started to put the Keurig thru it's paces, along side the Tassimo, and frankly the Tassimo is still SUPERIOR, in the way that it Brews for Better Flavor, has a Faster Brewing Cycle, and heats the H2O to the Optimal Temperature, than the Keurig, which BTW, is/was a lot NOSIER than the Tassimo. In all fairness, this could be  a 'technical' problem with the Bar Code settings on the K-Cups. Note , that I continued to also use my Red Tassimo unit, as it is/was the only coffee unit to use the Milk Creamers, as Keurig still does not offer that option, anywhere!In February, I left on a 3-week trip, and as I always do, I turned off all the unnecessary electric Household appliances, and took off.When I returned back this month of March, I was so PISSED to find out that the Brand New Keurig was totally INOPERABLE!Nada! Zip! Zero! Despite, doing everything that was Recommended on Forums (don't go the Keurig Forums, as they are so Worthless!)Right now, I have a large, fancy Keurig BRICK that I am attempting to get a Refund for, so stay tuned!* Pike Place + Colombian + French Roast + Folgers are the different varieties that I tried on the New Keurig machine.The Colombian was the Best of the lot, then the French Roast, that is if you like a BOLD taste.Read my comments, after each bullet item:* Features fresh Starbucks coffee in an easy-to-brew single-cup (K-Cup) serving. - Not as good as the Tassimo, which is about2 Steps BELOW a StarBucks Coffee House. I often found the Keurig "Brew" to be a tad Watery, not Rich & Flavorful.* Brews in 1 minute or less, so you can grab a cup when you're in a rush. - BUT, you have to Turn the Unit ON FIRST,so that it will Warm Up first, before the Blue Light comes on, indicating that it is ready to start brewing.* Medium Roast Ground Coffee - They call it 'Medium', but I think it's more MILD!* Smooth & Balanced - Disagree, Balanced with What? Tea?* Rumor of a Sale Price of only 38 buckaroos at Sam's Club & Costco - I cannot confirm this rumor.* There is now a New Rumor that StarBucks is going to be offering their Consumer Coffee Machine in the fall!Stay Tuned!

I might as well just confess that I am a huge fan of Annie's products.  I haven't tried a single one I don't like.  Not only are they a much healthier alternative to the normal grocery store fare, I also think that they taste better.  Whenever I bite into an Annie's product, my first thought tends to be, "Oh, so this is how it's supposed to taste."I first picked up a box of these on a whim one day while out shopping with my 7-year-old and 18-month-old.  The little guy was hungry, so I opened the box to give him some and, soon enough, the entire family was walking through the aisles of the store, munching happily.  My daughter loves Goldfish and she also loves those faux-butter crackers, so she was thrilled with the combination of the buttery bunnies and the cheddar bunnies in this box.  The crackers have a nice, rich buttery flavor and a genuine cheesy zing.  The pretzels are also very tasty and shaped either like bunnies or like carrots, much to the amusement of both of my children (and, I confess, myself).  We were so hooked on these that I immediately looked for them on Amazon and set up a subscribe and save, which is also more economical than purchasing boxes at my local store.What I can't emphasize enough about Annie's products is that they are real food.  If you read the ingredients label, you can actually understand and know what each ingredient is, unlike all of the scary chemicals and preservatives that are thrown into foods traditionally marketed toward kids.
summary: Delicious and free of all icky stuff

reviewText: Finally, the US food industry has discovered the holy grail of snack marketing! Instead of killing their customers with lethal amount of fat and sugar and calories in their traditional bulk-size packaging, now the industry has learned something that should been completely obvious but somehow overlooked: put the same stuff into smaller packages (100 calories seem to be the magic number), market them as dietary supplements, and charge folks more money for it. Don't get me wrong, I think it is a good idea -albeit not the most economical option for consumers-but at least people can snack more sensibly without killing themselves. This South Beach choco-covered soynuts is another welcoming addition to the line up of the 100-calorie snack options. They taste just like what you would expect soynuts covered with chocolate would taste. The nuts are crispy, neutral in taste, and reminiscent pinenuts. Soynuts, the same beans in edamame, are not salty or sweet naturally, which complements the intensity of the chocolate very well. However, if you don't like soynuts, perhaps you should get something else. Nutritionally, these snack packs are comparable to most others out there - average fat content (6G) and carb (9G). I expected more protein, considering the chocolate and the soynuts and all, but surprisingly there are only 3 grams of protein, so not something suitable for pre-workout snacking.
summary: tasty, expexted nutritional contents, not a whole lot of protein

reviewText: You'll want to keep it for yourself!The moment a person opens the box, the mouth start to water.  This impeccably wrapped gift basket is chock-full of delectable snacks.  The basket itself is lovely and, once you've devoured the contents, will make a terrific basket for dinner rolls or muffins for a casual brunch or dinner.The snacks include:Sourdough Nuggets - This was the best treat in the basket.  Crunchy with that great mustardy taste.  It gets all over your fingers and, though not so elegant, you'll be tempted to just lick them clean!Angelina's Sweet Butter Cookies - My second favorite.  Remember those big tins of butter cookies they always sell around Christmas time?  You'll never buy one again after eating these.  You can literally taste the butter in these sweet treats. Yum!Black Truffle & White Cheddar Popcorn -  This is a savory treat that keeps you munching.  The flavor was addictive and it wasn't long before the whole package was gone.Cucina Olive Oil Chips - Delicious, crunchy goodness!Savory Snack Mix - A fantastic munch!Cranberry Harvest Medley - Probably the healthiest treat of the bunch.  A nice mix of sweet and salty.Sonoma Cheese Straws - This was my least favorite, though not bad.  At first taste, they seem sort of mild, but after a chewing a bit, a very strong flavor hits.  I think that this one is more of an acquired taste - I just didn't acquire it.All in all, this is a gorgeous gift basket - suitable for just about any occasion - and you just may want to keep it for yourself!
summary: You'll want to keep it for yourself!

reviewText: Good value for the price - just need to properly store it (sealed containers - avoid freeze/thaw cycles).

This was my first time using ghee.  I was very impressed.  I love that it does not burn or brown like butter.  I used it in eggs and to sauté fish with homemade herb salt.  Yummy!  Really anything that allowed you to really taste the flavor.  Looking forward to trying it on popcorn.  Love also that it is a grass-fed organic product.  Will certainly be buying again and look forward to experimenting more with the product. Would highly recommend.

I have enough wheat berries for years.  I keep giving them away and still have half a bag.  I am going to try sprouting next.  But for the reason I bought them, to add fiber and whole grains to salads, they are perfect!

Not as satisfying as Orbit White. I was disappointed with the lack of flavor compared to Orbit White, and from the description of the product I expected more. But it's still better than most sugar-free gums on the market.
This is a pleasantly flavored decaf, which does require creamer, but is mild, not having a strong taste that detracts from the coffee itself.
My husband is a big coffee drinker. He enjoys this coffee. The price can not be found lower anywhere. I will continue to come back for re-orders.
I liked it, butnit took awhile to figure how long it took to pop without burning. The taste was great once I figured the right time.

I have purchased this mix twice so far and am very thankful that it does not have tapioca starch in it and that it's gmo free to boot!!Sorghum flour does tend to have a weird after taste if you eat it alone, but with syrup or other items mentioned above it goes down into the tummy quite nicely!I make them with virgin coconut oil and coconut milk, a splash of almond or vanilla extract and they are good to go for our little man. He eats them with maple syrup, honey, or as a PB&J; sandwich. I also sometimes add, chocolate chips, diced dates, cranraisens, cinnamon, nutmeg and many more ... oh and pureed bananas are really yummy too!!I can get 15-16 4-5 inch pancakes from the whole box. These are fluffy and pretty. Like someone else mentioned these will not get golden brown unless  you have more oil in the pan and sort of "pan fry" them. They also never stick in my cast iron pan.Enjoy!!
whether making Thai curries or making frozen drinks, this is a wonderful product.  Highly recommended for any chef or mixologist.
My husband is into yoga and food that come from this lifestyle.  He says this is great tasting and would like for me to get more.  It is easier than you doing the butter.

I've tried this ghee, Purity Farms and Organic India.  I'd rank Organic Indian the best, followed by this and then Purity Farms.  I've heard good things about Ancient Organics but never tried it.  The problem with the ghee is that it is way overpriced.  The cost is just unreasonable.  And for something this expensive, you'd expect the absolute best quality but that is not the case here.  And yes, all of the above brands are both organic and grass-fed.  I am also bothered by the fact that this company chooses to manipulate the customer review system.  Whether through soliciting positive reviews for a gift certificate or posting fake ones, these methods are deceptive and unscrupulous.  Two stars because the product is OK.
summary: Ok Ghee; way overpriced; fake reviews

reviewText: very cool and smooth tasting. the kind of snack that works any time and place. right on time and very affordable. i enjoy this a great deal.
Ahhhh I love this taste, very different from other teas I drink. Sweet, crisp and just yummy. I drink at least once a day, sometimes more.

It Works!I'm a caffeine lover & need an afternoon pick me up on work days.  Avitae water is a nice alternative to my standard tea/coffee choices.  The bottle claims to have 90mg of caffeine, which the manufacturer says is about the same amount of caffeine as a cup of coffee (coffee cup size not mentioned).I drink both tap & bottled water.  I can discern no taste difference between these and the avitae.  I would choose the avitae over standard bottled water if priced competitively.The plastic bottle seems a little studier than some water bottles. The bottle is recyclable.

If it wasn't for the packaging, I'd give Melitta four stars. The problem is that the packaging is hugely wasteful. You have the K-cup type form, though that part does contain less plastic than a traditional K-cup. It's a plastic frame with mesh to hold the coffee in. This K-cup-type pod is packaged in a second plastic cup that has a foil seal. I understand this is to maintain the freshness of the coffee, but none of the packaging is accepted by our state's waste company, so both the cup and secondary packaging have to be thrown away. I hate throwing out the extra plastic.For the taste, the Cafe de Europa is nice and smoky with just the right amount of bitterness. I like dark coffees in the winter, but in the summer when it's warm, I prefer medium roasts for iced coffee. This definitely suited that need.All in all, I still have to say that the coffee is thumbs-up in terms of taste, but definitely a thumbs down for the packaging.
summary: 4-stars for the Coffee, 2-stars for the Packaging

reviewText: Satisfying snack and nutricious plus low calories.
My son drank the organic Fruit Blooms all natural lemonade, but Amazon doesn't carry it no more, so we'd to buy this one and its not bad at all.

A delicious snack with a mild taste. I will enjoy it, and it's nice getting several servings in every bag, but really just lots of bags, so that the edamame will stay fresh and crispy for a long time.  This does not have a big spicy bite - if you like food that makes your eyes pop, this will be too mild for you.
Really, what else can you say about a great breakfast food, besides cereal isn't just for breakfast, lol.  Yummy, Yummy !!

Incredible price. The freshness date into 2012. Good quality packaging to keep them fresh. I've been snacking on these and they are not too sweet and they have just a light taste of apple in them. The cereal is light and crispy and easy to chew on. Not too bad!!! They are actually fun to eat.

I'm a coffee drinker, so I get probably more than my fill of caffeine each day with my morning cup. To try and avoid any kind of issues, I tried this on a weekend when I usually don't have any coffee. I normally drink lots of water after work and on weekends, so I figured this might be a better of both worlds kind of thing. It didn't quite turn out that way.My first drink was less than impressive. The water tasted stale. Maybe mine had been sitting for sometime before I got it. I couldn't tell, there was no 'bottled on' or expiration date I could easily find.I did end up drinking the whole thing, but I didn't get any kind of caffeine boost from it in the end. But it was nice to get some without the calories you normally need to consume to get caffeine.

I have been trying to cut back on my daily Dr Pepper addiction, so a caffeinated water has some appeal. Gatorade provides all sorts of good stuff when it's really hot, but it's of no benefit when you need a caffeine hit and I detest coffee for the most part. This Avitae tastes like regular tap water to me - no bitter flavor and no after taste that I could detect. The caffeine doesn't feel any different to me than what I am used to with a 16 ounce Dr Pepper in the afternoon, so I'm going to say it's fine and not too little or too much. I do actually like the shape of the bottle - the big, wide, flat bottom make it easier to balance while out at the barn or in the car.
This is the best flavor of Nature Valley bars in my opinion.  If you think of apple cinnamon, this tastes just like what you would think!
Great coffee. I love the rich taste and on the subscribe and save program, it's a great price for Keurig cups.

I'm so glad I found these on Amazon. They are the best. Crunchy, lots of chocolate chips for their size. A single serving size is plenty to take care of the sweet cravings. Most of the time half of the pkg is all I need. My husband loves to take these to work for a snack. Grand kids love them as well. We are all happy with Amos.
I am not a fan of this tea, it doesn't taste that great to me.  I hope to find something that taste better.
We used them as prizes for the students some days, and they really liked them.  The arrived in one piece and survived well.
Every one who tried these biscuits that I made stated, How great they were and where did I get them?

A nice blend that will make most coffee people happy.  Going through Amazon makes the purchase fast and really NOT expensive.  I always buy the biggest box available, or two or three together for a super price.  Not a strong coffee.  Says extra bold, but is a 'nice' drinker.  Even those of us that do not want an Extra Bold coffee will like this one.

These were bought to go with a Father's Day present.  The theme was Scrabble with a little box with his name spelled out in Scrabble tiles.  I sent the Cheez-It Scrabble crackers along with it.  A well-received gift.
It tasted like water no caffeine boost or energy.  Just another way to charge way more for a bottle of water.Tap water is just as good.

reviewerName: Heather L. Parisi "Robert and Heather Parisi"
reviewText: IN A NUTSHELL: 29 GRAMS OF SUGAR OUT OF 45 GRAMS OF PRODUCTSugar dominates the taste of these little dots and is the first ingredient. Add to that some red dye #40 and yellow dye #5 and I have lost my appetite. Our daughter Angela however was singing a different tune. She gobbled the whole bag down after I told her I had opened them but was finished. I informed her of the dyes, the sugar, the artificial flavors and more. After she wolfed the bag down she simply replied;-- "SO -- DO YOU HAVE ANY MORE?" --BOTTOM LINE: WE ASKED FOR THESE PRODUCTS BECAUSE WE BUY THEMI don't care for these 'fruit flavored snacks', but some people do, including people in our household. I don't like the ingredients, but that does not trouble some of the people in our household either. Until these things are objectionable to more consumers, including Angela, Kellogg's will be happy to continue churning them out and filling them with dyes, sugar and artifical flavors.[I AM NOT AFFILIATED WITH ANY PRODUCT OR COMPANY]
summary: FRUIT FLAVORED SNACK WITHOUT THE FRUIT

reviewText: I keep the big bag in the refrigerator inside another zip lock bag even though I consume this frequently and need to purchase another bag every month. Prunes are dry plums but amazingly California changed the name to DRY PLUMS in 2008 for marketing reasons. It is amazing what marketing does since here is a product called prunes which has twice the amount of antioxidants as blueberries but it does not get the recognition since it does not cost ten times more, or because it is not exotic enough or probably since it does not come from Amazon. Regardless I consume 5 to 10 of these every single day since not only these are excellent tasting fruit, it has no additives except preservatives but no added sugar. Just like any fruit the natural sugar is high, since five dried plums comes with 15gr of sugars. Tastes great with hot tea but more importantly this is a natural medicine since what a help it is when I get up every morning. The best thing you can offer your digestion system, not organic but at Costco priced for $6.29 it is a steal... Bravo.

We've been using Agave as sugar substitution for several months now and loved it.  This is the best product out there that works well in anything that requires sugar.  We don't use any other sugar except Agave in our cooking. Besides, it is low in glycemix index which is great.For those who are health conscious as we are should try it and you'll love it without much hesitation.

These browns have many ways to use them:from browns & eggs,use in place of tater tots for hot-dish,pour curry sauce  or gravy over them,cheesy browns & many,many more uses.Kosher Certified OU Pareve..Nutrition Facts:serving size about 1/2 cup prepared (18g dry)..servings per container about 6Amt per serving mix..Calories 60..prepared 100..Calories from fat..mix 0..prepared..40..total fat 0g..mix 0%..prepared 7%..saturated fat 0g..mix 0%..prepared 0%..trans fat 0g..cholesterol 0mg mix 0%..prepared 0%..sodium 280mg..mix 12%.. prepared 12%..potassium 115mg..mix 3%..prepared 3%..total carbohydrate 14g..mix 5%..prepared 5%..dietary fiber 1g.. mix 4%..prepared 4%..sugars less than 1g..protein 1g..vitamin A 0%..vitamin C 10%..calcium 0%..iron 2%Ingredients:Potato (dry),salt,dextrose,freshness preserved with sodium bisulfite & BHT.."Contains Sulfite Ingredient".Produced & Guaranteed by "Basic American Foods" Walnut Creek,CA USA

I love these muffins!  They are so quick and easy to make and they taste great!  I also like the fact that each pouch makes 5 muffins. Just the right size for my husband and I for a day or two. I prefer these over the bigger box with the can of wild blueberries because I don't have to mess with opening the can and draining the blueberries.  Also that package makes about twice as many muffins which for just the two of us is usually just too many.  The price on Amazon is super, too and I know I always have them on hand and ready.

My daughter eats more of these than I do because my teeth don't chew very well, but I do know they are good for me and I often use my nut chopper on them so I can eat more. Flavor is good, and it's been awhile but as I remember the price was satisfactory. I most likely will order more at some later date. I keep most of them in the freezer to stay fresh.  Bernice in Oregon

****Celestial Seasonings' Sugar Plum Spice is a delightful holiday tea. It contains hibiscus, roasted barley malt, roasted chicory root, rosehips, chamomile flowers, natural plum flavor with other natural flavors, ginger root, roasted carob, and cardamom. It does not contain caffeine, so it's technically an herbal tea.Celestial Seasonings has been around a long time, and makes quality teas. All of their teas are free of preservatives and artificial colorings and flavorings, all are certified Kosher and none use irradiated botanicals, which I appreciate. Although they use "natural flavors" in their teas, these natural flavors are derived primarily from fruits, spices and herbs, and never contain monosodium glutamate (MSG). They use environmentally conscious packaging and sustainable sourcing. To remove the caffeine from green and black teas, they use a process called "effervescent decaffeination" (using carbon dioxide). Celestial Seasonings justifiably takes pride in being a company that makes natural teas.On the package, Celestial Seasonings writes, "Take a sip of Sugar Plum Spice and journey with us to the Land of the Sweets in Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker. Here you'll find gingerbread houses, trees laden with sugar plums and days filled with sunshine. This is the land of the Sugar Plum Fairy, who is beautiful, gentle and kind. We created this tea to pay tribute to her. Sugar Plum Spice is made with 100% natural herbs and the festive flavors of plum and spice, with just a hint of sweetness." This tea is slightly sweet and full bodied, tasting just as you would expect from the description. The cardamom and ginger give it a little zing. Each tea bag packs a lot of flavor and I only need to use one at a time.I recommend it, even if it's not a holiday. It's perfect for a cold or wet winter day.****
Nice to have these chips on here in case we need snacks for drop by company or to go with a light lunch.

one chip is not enough, when you start munching on these.  ...you'll need a room in the house, with a lock, and after a few chips, lock the chips in the room, and drive 10 miles, and place the keys under a rock, so you don't eat all the bags in one sitting... just kidding of course... but they are a very good flavor
summary: one bite, and you are hooked

reviewerName: Dianne E. Socci-Tetro "Never Judge a Book by ...
reviewText: I am no tea connoisseur, however I know what I like.  I generally love Earl Grey and Lady Grey tea and tend to stay away from bagged teas - I don't really trust them anymore since I've switched to loose tea.  But I thought I would take the chance on this one, simply because I've heard so much about the new style packaging.It is a pyramid shape and it (the bag it self) is no longer made from 'tissue paper' or whatever they used to use. Now it feels like some sort of nylon mesh.  If that helps to brew a better cup of tea then sobeit. If the tea is supposed to expand to fill the material -well, it doesn't.  That does NOT make this tea any less delicious.This is a rich, full bodied and very fresh leaf tea, with a pleasing after-taste. It smells wonderful as it is steeping and that translates to enhance the flavor and gives me a lot of pleasure when drinking this tea.  It is a wonderful tea to awake to in the morning and one that is a pleasant pick-me-up through-out the day.

Barilla is always a good brand to purchase, and this Whole Grain Linguine is a great product.  We enjoyed the pasta mixed with some olive oil, garlic and a few other spices.  It's great when you can enjoy a pasta that is also good for you.
I find it challenging to find dates where I live.  These are very fresh and tasty.  I just wish they were pitted.

My husband likes these a lot. They are a bit different to get used to as they are less greasy and salty in taste than the usual chips you buy. They are more browner than I would like to see and the chips are pretty sturdy in texture. Not bad, though. Just takes getting used to eating chips better for your health. They do have about 1/2 the calories in fat, however.
summary: Not bad but a little hard to get used to

reviewText: Not a big fan of raisins in baked good, but these little beauties are perfect. They are small so no raisin overload if that it a problem for you like it was for me.

These make a great all around snack (or Meal if you are hustling) for adults or children. I order them on Subscribe and Save so that there are always some in the house. Then, I always have something fairly wholesome in the cupboard if I do not feel like cooking a meal or if snack time is upon me. Is IS a SUGAR FILLED treat with two of the pastries (one package) costing you 400 or so calories. But if you keep that in perspective and balance it with good meals plus make sure you brush after eating, then it is a quite satisfactory way to enjoy oneself. I have found it to be the best all around thing that I can have on hand to munch on. Indeed, I also keep wholesome bars in the house and other things of good quality, but when I need a Sugar Loaded Splurge, this is the one I reach or time and again. Since I have these delivered, it costs me no time in the grocery store, and there is no hassle in getting to my house. These arrive on my doorstep at preset times and make my life easier all around. Whether you get these just for the Sugar Splurge, or whether you decide that they are an all time necessity, I think that you will find that they fit in to the modern day lifestle without being a McDonald's type load of calories. Fast Food from the pantry. I have been very satisfied with the taste and with the delivery of the product. I hope you will enjoy them also. Perhaps, they will also save you from having to hustle to the store to buy them, courtesy of Amazon.
got this as an add on item for less then $5 and love the flavor. very creamy and good tasty.  will order without the add on

These are the best!  Absolutely the best flavored potato chip I have ever had.  I had seen these in the store and worried they were 1.  too sweet, 2. too hot, 3. too garlicy.  They are none of those.  They are the absolute perfect combination of sweet, spicy, salty and a hint of garlic.  They are beyond delicious.  I usually eat 3 or 4 potato chips at the most.  I could not stop eating these until almost half a bag was gone and then had to force myself to stop.  I gave them to my husband who at almost the rest of the bag and said get these away from me before I eat them all.Kettle chips are always good -- it is an excellent brand but this flavor is outstanding. They have completely converted me and I will be back to buy more and more and more!
summary: Bet you can't eat just one -- bag!!!!

reviewText: Just as I am sure NO ONE thought vitamin water would be popular, no one will probably see a need for caffeinated water.  People will brush off this product, saying, "I get caffeine in my coffee or soda" and not try it.  Why not get an extra kick from water-with no added sugars or flavors, just the stuff you need to jump start your morning.  The water tastes wonderful-I had mine chilled-and I could notice rather pleasantly the effects of the caffeine afterwards.This product is ideal for someone who wants natural caffeine in their diet, and wants to not have excessive sugars or dyes with their caffeinated beverages.  I enjoyed it and would drink this again...and again...see, that caffeine addiction of mine is kicking in!

The chocolate in this prettily presented gift basket may be rich and calorie laden but the amounts included are small so it won't totally derail a diet.  The products included are exactly what is described in Amazon's description.  The item is nicely packaged but unfortunately arrived on an unseasonably warm April day.  Fortunately all but the fudge (which was melted) was seemingly unaffected by the heat.  Ghirardelli chocolates were delicious and exactly what you would expect.  I also really enjoyed the small box of chocolate nonpareils.  The rolled wafers were good but a little crumbly.  My husband and son really liked the chocolate chip cookies which I would compare to tiny "Pecan Sandies" with the pecans removed and a very small amount of chocolate chips added.  I'm not a fudge eater but my husband tried it and was not impressed and of course the fact that it was melted did not help.  Two chocolate covered pretzels were delicious but nothing much more than what you would find in your local grocery store.  There were also two small truffle cookies that were good but nothing special.  Amazon doesn't currently supply the price for this basket so it is difficult to calculate the value and gift baskets are sold for convenience sake in order to present a nice remembrance to someone with little time and effort for the sender.
summary: Won't Gain Too Much Weight From This Chocolate

reviewText: If you want a bar with a decent blend of fats, proteins, fiber, sugars, vitamins and minerals then this Knourish bar may be for you.  However while the variety I was sent claimed to be "dark chocolate nut delight" but mostly it was grain and nut delight with very little of the chocolate or cocoa flavor.  That's surprising given that chocolate, cocoa, and cocoa butter are included in the ingredients listed; the amount of nuts (almonds and cashews), peanuts and four types of grains are just too great to let the chocolate through; they also cancel each other out resulting in a very generic grain/nut flavor.I'd count this as a miss in Kellogg's arsenal of bars.  No better than some I've tried before and worse than others I've had.

Glutino Cheddar cheese crackers are one of the best crackers I have ever eaten.  Light with a mild cheese flavor they are great with soup, cheese, peanut butter or salad. The only drawback is that these crackers are expensive for the amount of crackers received in each box.
summary: a great cracker for any occasion

reviewText: Purified water plus 90mg caffeine is simple enough to review: It's wet and wakes you up with a mild stimulant.  The taste of the caffeine is barely noticeable.  Honestly, I would like to select the strength.

Each packet has 19g of sugar. I can't really imagine what 19g of sugar looks like, but when i got a box of sugar-free instant breakfast by accident once, each packet had less than half the powder in it. So, roughly half of what you're mixing into your milk is straight-up refined sugar. (Then again, watching people order coffee in the morning and load it down with sugar, maybe the sugar is part of the appeal.)This stuff dissolves pretty quickly and easily in milk, but if you're a stickler for a zero-grit experience, you might have to add a little extra milk, or be willing to use an immersion blender to really mix it thoroughly.
summary: Fast and easy, tastes ok, but is mostly sugar

reviewText: Gosh I tried to enjoy this, really.  Taste?  In a word .... gruel.  A real disappointment.So happy a case was not ordered!

I haven't eaten arare rice crackers in quite a long while.  I came across these and ordered.  They arrived today and they are very fresh...each large bag has 8 smaller individual bags inside - makes for keeping the uneaten arare fresh and crisp.I don't know where I have been living but I'd never known about wasabi peas...this is my first taste of them.  I love them!  A few had a hot bite, tasted exactly like wasabi and very crunchy.  Just for the wasabi peas I came online and ordered a 5 pound bag (that will be another review after they arrive).  These arare have a mild flavor...nothing really screams 'seasoned' and you can taste seaweed, taste soya sauce..each cracker has it's own unique flavor.  The hot bag of these will be arriving tomorrow.  "happy camper"

I really wanted to like this linguine. I have reached that stage of life where fiber intake is an important dietary consideration and this pasta offers *twice* the fiber for the same number of calories when compared to the regular product. Furthermore, Barilla is my favorite brand of pasta. It seemed perfect.Unfortunately, I found the consistency of the linguine to be not what I was expecting. It's difficult to describe why I find it unappealing. There's a chewiness to it that seems very un-pasta like. Do you know how pasta has kind of a "slick" mouth-feel when properly prepared? Well, this whole-grain product lacks that property and, for me, that's a deal-breaker.The box calls for a cooking time of 7-8 minutes. I've found that I prefer the shorter time with Barilla products, so I tried 7 minutes first. When that didn't work for me, I thought that perhaps more cooking time would help, so I tried 8 minutes. In fact, that was worse.As I mentioned, Barilla is my "go to" pasta. I think I'll stay with their regular line.

This Side Mates flavor would benefit from the addition of some extra dried mushrooms and an oil-packed sun-dried tomato.  Maybe a touch of lemon or balsamic vinegar, too.  As it is--convenient as it is--it is lacking in flavor and zing.  Use the water from re-hydrating your mushrooms as part of the cooking liquid.As an introduction to couscous, it is not bad.  But with its lack of flavor and high salt content, is it worth it for the convenience?  I don't think so.  It is so very easy to cook couscous.  It is simple to re-hydrate mushrooms and chop up a tomato.  Why not get used to cooking with couscous, then buy it plain, save yourself some money and add your own extras?
summary: Needs a lot of help, which takes away from its conveneince

reviewText: The taste is divine.  You won't ever use plain old long-grain rice or that quick rice ever again.  This has spoiled me.  Regular rice tastes like I'd imagine wallpaper paste tasting, now.  Jasmine rice soaks up the flavor of whatever you choose to serve it with, under or over.  The texture is good, too.  AWESOME!
This coffee tastes really good and it is not bitter when consumed without being sweetened. It tastes good with sugar too. If you want good instant coffee, try this.

I love hot sauce, I have tried so many kinds and have a few that I would put on regular rotation. Gringo Bandito just became one of them. Especially the Red Sauce which reminds me of Cholula but HOTTER.The green is also amazing, kind of tart hot. It went well on salad for that reason.The four pack is your best bet because you WILL want more!

I have a Keruig brewing system but I don't usually buy the tea k-cups or capsules for my machine. I tend to have favorite teas both loose and bagged and am quite a bit more picky on teas than I am on my coffee brews. I will admit I haven't tried many of the tea capsules or cups to completely swear them off.  In fact, recently I've come across a favorite capsule in the Higgins & Burke Green tea flavor that I'm happy to let people know about.The Higgins & Burke Tea Capsules in the Green Tea flavor are  unique in taste being a combination of both lemon and green tea, a flavor which I've never had together before. The Premium Sencha steamed green tea, enhanced with lemongrass and lemon balm herb provides a smooth bold  flavor that makes for an extremely tasty cup of tea. Whether I chose to brew a smaller or larger cup as well as hot or cold I found the flavor perfect to taste every single time.Reasons I would opt for this tea in these capsules is the convenience and most certainly the price! Not everyday do I have the time to make myself a cup of tea and wait for it to brew to desired taste and I don't have the means to always get something from my local coffee or tea shop. These tea capsules are ready in less than a minute using my brewer and the taste is great!Pricing on these makes each cup about .49 cents each and that's a price you can't really beat!  There's also a handy subscribe and save in which you can choose how often you pay and have these delivered to your home. 15% percent off coupon can also be added to an order of this product!

I have a friend who is a live-in grandma of a military family.  They are trying to feed a family of 5. I sent this and several other things via "Prime Pantry" and my friend reports it arrived quickly and in good condition.  Thank you Amazon for making it easier to help my friend.They go through a LOT of peanut butter ... Jif is the fav.

If you prefer something with a strong detectable green tea flavor then this tea is not for you. This tea doesn't taste much like green tea. You don't get the slight bitterness associated with green tea (the sort you taste in Japan). If you don't like the bitterness then this tea is ok for you. If you like the bitterness then this tea will not be very satisfying.The aroma of lemongrass is definitely detectable and stronger initially but lessens as your taste buds become more accustomed to it. This is a good thing (at least to me). I often find the aromas to be too strong in flavored teas  (like the sort you get in a flavored lipton tea bag) and it just smells really artificial and in the end makes you feel really nauseated. So if you tend to prefer very strong aromas then this tea is not for you. If you prefer something more subtle then this tea will suit you just fine.

I never used Coconut Oil of any kind, I like Coconut but not a Big Fan. I was surprised to see that "Nutiva Organic Coconut Oil" is congealed into a Thick White Paste with the aroma of Coconut. An Oil that is Good for just about everything, 1 Tablespoon has 130 Calories. I have used in Baking and Cooking instead of Butter with excellent results and the taste of Coconut is not that noticeable. I have also applied it to my Face, made it Nice and Soft...Next I want to try it on my Scalp I want to see if it will Grow Thicker Hair...Coconut Oil is Recommended as a Supplement, Take 1 Tablespoon 1 to 4 times daily, maybe use it as a Spread or added to Salad Dressings and SmoothiesFOR COOKING: Use it in Place of Butter, Margarine, Shortening or other Cooking Oils, for Baking or Frying in Temperatures up to 350F degreesFOR SKIN CARE: Use it as a Moisturizing Lotion, Place Jar in warm water to Liquefy, Massage small amounts onto the SkinFOR HAIR CARE: Use it as a Conditioner, Place Jar in warm water to Liquefy, then apply 2 teaspoons to the Hair 1 to 2 Hours before WashingCoconut Oil is a Natural Energy Source. it contains High levels of Healthy type of Fat called MCTs "Medium Chain Triglycerides" Pure Form of Coconut Oil, MCTs are different from other Fats primarily because they are digested much more easily and efficiently. This makes them an extremely efficient Energy Source much more than Sugar. Also MCTs don't add to Fat Cells or form Artery Hardening Plaque as readily as other Fats. Coconut Oil is a Good Addition to Physical Activity Exercise and Weight Loss Programs. I like the Pure Extra Virgin Coconut Oil to the point that has become a Staple in my Kitchen! ...Thank you D.D.
This is my favorite Tartar Sauce so I was glad to see this quantity offered by Amazon. I will always re-order this from Amazon as well as other food items.
Cool bag, cool beans.

These are great for boondocking and camping which is what I'm doing right now actually. I eat the salmon right out of the pouch (no dishes). I eat it plain, with salsa, and BBQ sauce sometimes too. Salmon is good for you in moderation since it supposedly has mercury. Between the health benefits and the price on subscribe and save it was a excellent purchase.

OK, let's be honest. I am a sucker for trying new foods when I get a complementary sample. It takes a lot of the fear away. And I would never have tried couscous unless I had received such a sample.What I have discovered is that I'm not a big fan of plain pearl couscous all by itself. It looks like little round fish eyes staring back at me. So I have started using this in combination with veggies instead of by itself.I fixed this particular couscous with zucchini (it IS that time of year) dressing up the zucchini and making the couscous into a full side dish for four (instead of the two listed on the package).I began by sauteing the couscous in butter while I set the water to boil. Once both were ready, I moved the couscous into the boiling water while I sauteed the zucchini in the same pan along with 1/2 onion.What I noticed when I was working with the couscous was that it had a wonderful garlic aroma, which later translated into a wonderful garlic flavoring. However, while it shows picture of parsley on the cover, they translate to little green dots of parsley in the couscous (the reason I gave it four stars).Anyway, once the couscous was cooked (12 minutes) and the zucchini was also nicely brown, I fluffed the couscous and mixed it into the frypan for a final saute before I served it along with the meat.Low calorie? Probably not. But very, very, nice. I did notice that after the first time, my husband is no longer trying the couscous with me. Too bad, just means more for me. However, if he isn't eating it, I probably won't be buying more ...

I chew this gum all the time, and never worry about tooth decay!  Yeah!  I stopped chewing gum many years ago, because of worry about tooth decay.  I love the taste of this gum, and love the fact that I don't have to worry about my teeth!

I bought spry gum because it was cheaper. Well, it tasted okay, but it was nothing spectacular. The worst part, it was made in China and imported. I found Xylichew and ordered it. Wow! Xylichew has a much stronger, fresher taste that lasts longer. Xylichew does not get mushy and stringy after chewing for an extended period of time. Xylichew is not made in China. I feel that Xylichew is worth the extra money. I chew it faithfully after every meal and usually several times a day because I love the taste. I used subscribe and save and I have it sent to me monthly. Highly recommend Xylichew!!!!!

I dont know that these taste any different than any other dry chic peas, but they do taste great. The main thing for me though is the peace of mind that comes from knowing that they are GMO free. I really dont want any of my money going to Monsanto and their ilk, and would probably forgo chic peas forever if i didnt have that option. That would make me sad, as they are a staple of my diet. Fortunately, i dont have to make that choice.Also, the packaging is appealing. Not a contributing factor in buying these, but nice nonetheless.Enjoy!

Frankly, I never dreamed that almonds could taste this wonderful.  My husband and I flat out love them. They are incredibly fresh, and the coating, a mixture of sea salt, honey and other flavors, vanilla prominent to me, is a perfect complement.  Here is the full ingredient list, all pronounceable:  almonds, dried cranberries (cranberries, sugar, sunflower oil), organic evaporated cane juice, white sesame seeds, honey powder (honey, rice starch), organic tapioca syrup, brown sugar, sea salt, organic honey, natural vanilla extract, natural almond extract, pure ground vanilla beans, natural honey flavor.  There are two caveats:  (1) calories are 220 per bag, if you can stop at one, and (2) cost is $1.49 per bag, which is a little pricey for me.  That said, they are so worth it to me as a lunch substitute or afternoon snack.Regarding the cashews, they are also flavored with a hint of real vanilla which makes the taste above average; however, notwithstanding the ingredients, there is not enough pomegranate flavor to suit me, and the nuts are a little on the dry side.  I actually rate the cashews a 4, while the almonds are a 10.  Here is the full ingredient list for the cashews: cashews, dried apples (apples, sugar, natural pomegranate flavor, citric acid, fruit & vegetable juice (for color), organic cane sugar, organic tapioca syrup, brown sugar, natural vanilla extract, sea salt, dried pomegranate, pomegranate juice concentrate, dried orange peel, pure ground vanilla beans.  There are two other items of note: (1) calories are 210 per bag, and (2) cost was around $1.29 per bag.  Yet, they are very suitable for a lunch on the go or afternoon snack.  The expiration date is out at August 2014, but they will not last that long.

Of the three types of seeds, I'd give the watermelon ones 5 stars, the edamame 3 & the pumpkin 1.  The edamame are harder than others I've had & I don't want to chip a tooth or to have to grind up the seeds.  The pumpkin seeds taste like & and are the size of sunflower seeds.

I got this to try in making my lattes (hot and cold) at home, where I was used to using the Starbucks syrup. This seemed like a very  nice deal, pricewise, with subscribe and save.The syrup is nicely sweet, so you don't need to add any other sweetener when using this. And it's intensely vanilla-ey. I just found the vanilla flavor on this oddly cloying and somewhat unappealing. Granted, this is very subjective, and you  may love it like so many others in reviews here.But if you like the vanilla-ey-ness of the Starbucks sugar free syrup or the Cook's vanilla extract, this is not comparable and you may, like me, not really want to use it in your coffee. I find it kinda makes me not wanna finish my latte.So, YMMV, natch. Just putting this here for those who do really like the particular type of vanilla flavor in the Starbucks syrup and who may find this "just not right" according to personal preference.HTH, enjoy!
summary: Sweetens well, but if you're used to and like the Starbucks Vanilla Sugar Free syrup...not comparable

reviewText: Very yummy syrup.  It doesn't take much to get a nice rich coconut flavor.  Shipped fast and secure.  I recoomend the pumps too, less mess, and after a few times, you will know how many pumps you want.

I opened a bag of these and poured them into a bowl. One of the chips on top had something black on it. It looked like black tar or melted black crayon. I assumed it was a contaminant of some sort, since it didn't resemble any kind of food ingredient. I wish I had not bought these chips. I am now wary of all Kettle products.

Good pasta here!  Easy to fix and holds together really well.  The pasta is not sticky and is the perfect size.  We just received our order and we have already had two spaghetti dinners that were really good.  We will be ordering this again.

Our family has been trying the Side Mates line of products.  Although there have been some hits and misses, I'm glad to report this is one of the hits.This is "pearl" or "Israeli" couscous, basically tiny ball shaped noodles about half as big as I imagine jewelry pearls to be.  This has a clean mild flavor - we could definitely taste the garlic and parsley, which compliment nutty pasta taste of the couscous itself.  There's also a fair amount of salt, but I thought it was very good.  Recommended.

I found using 2 packages at a time works a lot better for me.......don't have to worry if I have enough dough, and if there's any left.........roll out thinner, brush with some melted butter, sprinkle with cinnamon sugar...nuts .......dessert is done too!Add the olive oil and warm water.....I used more than called ... using my hands a little doesn't take any more time either.
summary: OLIVE OIL  DOES  MAKE THE DIFFERENCE!

reviewText: I suppose it was only a matter of time until water got a caffeinated jolt, and that time is finally now with Avitae. There's not a whole lot to say about this drink, as it's incredibly simple. It literally tastes exactly like tap water and isn't flavored in any way. That might end up being a negative for some people who would rather just drink coffee, but if you're looking for something portable and need some hydration, this is a fantastic option.Unlike the other energy drinks or caffeinated beverages out there, this one doesn't have any extra vitamins or sugar or anything, it's just straight up water with a caffeine twist. So how does the caffeine work out?  I replaced a cup of coffee in the morning with a bottle of Avitae and got essentially the same effect as normal, so it definitely works as advertised. With each bottle at or below the cost of a cup of joe, it's a nice change of pace for anyone who would like to try a coffee alternative.
summary: Tastes exactly like water and has a nice caffeine punch

reviewText: I fill the cup with two rounded coffee scoops-ful and it brews perfectly every time. Sometimes I even get a ground or two in the seal and it still does not leak. That's not to say that it won't down the road, but it's doing great so far. I had been using the My-Kaps, which work well, but they're more fussy to deal with and require that you have a supply of used K cups at hand. This one: open, dump old grounds, refill, snap lid closed and pop it in! Use over and over.
Look forward to using it when I use my favorite brand of coffee.  Bought one as a gift on a recommendation and the recipient like it so much, I decided to treat myself to one.

If you look inside the order window of your favorite drive-thru coffee shack, this is the syrup you'll see used.  What more can be said?  This is what you're buying in the morning when you order up your to go latte.  And based on the recipe below, this is the final taste you get from drive through coffee shacks.For a decent price, you get three, delivered, 750ml bottles of Torani syrup which is what you're wanting so you can make a morning vanilla, mocha, latte at home.  One half ounce of vanilla syrup, one ounce of chocolate syrup, equal parts milk and espresso brew in your favorite coffee mug (or thermos) with a whipped cream topping and it's commute time.This is the product you're looking for that will get you what you're expecting to get out of your morning's coffee making effort.Hope the above helps.

No Fear Super Energy Supplement is a big can. Well, about the size of Monster or Rock Star, but if you aren't accustomed to drinking energy drinks, start with something smaller like a baby Red Bull. The first thing that struck me about No Fear was the taste. Sort of a shock, really. I have always, in my mind, compared the taste of all energy drinks to melted Sweet Tart candy, if you've ever had any of that. But No Fear definitely has a more fruity taste that I would compare to sweetened grapefruit. May not appeal to everyone. As far as an energy boost, I really didn't notice one, despite the can being so big that it has over 2 servings in it, and despite the ingredients being pretty much the same as most energy drinks on the market. Some energy drinks get me wired for hours, but not this one. If it did affect me at all, it just wasn't measurable to me. But it's worth a try, at least once.

While I can't say that I've ever done the South Beach diet, I've had a lot of energy bars, health bars, fiber bars, or whatever you want to call them. In reality, they are a somewhat healthier alternative (or a `somewhat less-bad-for-you' alternative) to candy bars, and these South Beach fiber bars are no different.They have 120 calories, 3.5g of fat, 9g of fiber (38% of daily intake), and 6g of protein. That's better than probably any candy bar you would  find at a convenience store, but not the healthiest of options either. The bar itself has that distinct dark chocolate smell, but the taste is less bitter than typical dark chocolate, making it seem more like milk chocolate to me. It has a nice, rice-crisp texture, and, as the box describes, it's somewhat chewy as well.This bar strikes me as a nice pre-lunch snack. Of course, you'd probably do better with an apple, but that could be probably said about all the energy/health/fiber bars on the market. These particular South Beach bars are a decent option.

Fast shipping is all I can say, taste is like burnt coffee beans, no good flavor at all, as you can expect from Colombian coffee, very dissapointed, did not return this item because I've used it already, ordered some other flavors from some other brands that I've liked much better.

When I bought this coffee I was expecting a light-roast coffee with smooth body and great flavor as could be found in some donut shops in days gone by.  For me, this doesn't fulfill either.  This coffee should be described as bold, there is nothing light about it.  Forget about smooth body, instead it has an acidity and bitterness that I found unpleasant.  I'm still debating just tossing it out or letting it collect dust in the event I need to use it if I'm out of all other k-cups.This coffee made it to my "Do not buy again" list.

Brown Gold Ethiopian Coffee Capsules make a bold, but not bitter, cup of joe. The coffee is similar to a Caribou coffee. The gold cups the coffee is packaged in work perfectly in my Keurig. Great way to start the day!
