This coconut has a nice clean flavor along with a good crunch without over dryness. I grew up not liking coconut especially the strong stereo typical coconut flavor that almost had a rancid taste. These chips have a mild flavor, fresh, with very little aftertaste. I think these chips would also work great in cooking. Note this is not shredded coconut therefore the size would affect certain recipes.
summary: Best tasting coconut I've ever had

reviewText: Donut Shop is one of my favorites. Though it is also the blend I get the most failures with. So I decided to pick up a box of this Donut House flavor at my local Bed Bath & Beyond. To me it is awful! No flavor at all and hardly any color. I normally buy bold flavors/variants and pump the 10oz mug size. I had to lower this one to 8oz to not totally wash it out. I was very hopeful but just forcing my way through the batch. I'm hoping, because of the other reviews that I got a bad batch. So take my review with a grain of salt but I've been using K-Cups for years.
summary: Did I get a bad batch?

reviewText: I love a deep, dark roast and the President's Choice Tassimo Gourmet, West Coast Dark Roast did not disappoint.  The brew is reminiscent of a bold French roast and without any bitterness.  Everything from brewing aroma to taste hit all the right marks for me.  I've found some of Tassimo's other brews to be a bit underwhelming but this brew is a home run.  If you like a hefty dark roast, then you'll like this one.  Highly recommended.

If you are a coffee lover and like variety, essentially not stuck on one style, brand, or coffee bean, give this Ethiopian coffee a taste. You may even like it to the point where it becomes more than just part of your daily rotation and one of your favorites. It is bold enough yet smooth enough to rough out the edges unlike the more bolder styles like a dark or medium roast. In my estimation it has it's own distinctive qualities from the bean itself and lies in taste somewhere between a dark and medium roast  but different because of the unique bean qualities. Like terroir in wine, where each wine region gives a one of  kind taste,  the coffee bean has it's own distinctive qualities because of where it is grown and harvested. I find this coffee to be a nice change of pace coffee has I prefer  the more robust flavors of dark roast; taste is very personal but I do think most coffee drinkers will appreciate the quality of this product. It is not bitter at all and rather mellow. I would recommend this coffee to the java-caffeine heads who appreciate a good cup of Joe.

I saw this bread in a supermarket by me and having not tried any gluten free bread mixes except for chebe rolls (yum), I decided to give it a shot. I really enjoy this bread! The texture is a little different because I was never one to freeze bread when I wasnt GF, but I just pop it in the microwave for a little before toasting. I have not eaten it un-toasted yet. It smells nice and reminds me of normal, glutinous bread toasting in the oven from childhood. It is pretty crunchy but has a little chew too - I think you can probably tell it's not "regular" bread, but this seems as close as you can get!

reviewerName: R. W. Taylor "Wil O' The Wisp"
reviewText: I hope that one day this snack can reach the point where it is truly healthy and consistently good.A) Claiming to be healthy, at least - last bag I munched on had nutrition info that would in one serving give you the bare minimum healthy cholesterol score (<300) for an entire DAY. Many snacks do this. Like peanuts. Or popcorn. The idea is that since the products are from 'natural' sources, there is less control over the batch. But seriously - less than 300mg per serving? Give me a break. This gives no one trying to help themselves in this area any hope of control. It's almost like writing a blank check. To yourself. To state that your product's single serving falls less than the daily total max recommended is garbage. Read the label.B) The batches may be uneven in cholesterol, and they may avoid legal issues by setting it at the 'max'. But the uneven textures and flavors you may get (I consumed, along with family and friends, several cases of these over 2 years or so) don't add up, either. I had burnt tones, teeth-cracking textures at times.I used to love these chips, much as the majority of the reviews portray. I thought I was enjoying at the least a fair product, staying healthy, keeping the fat away. But - they are simply simple carbs with a little twist of fat that get you by in the place of their higher-fat brethren. In case you are not sure of where I stand, I am one of those people who think carb-laden chips are not a great food. You don't miss health until you lose it. These chips will not help your health. They might, at best, make it slightly less worse than everyday chips - at twice or more the price.A leading non-profit consumer org concluded this was 'junk health food'. They cited other causes, as well. I wholeheartedly concur that this is not a healthy food. It is a junk food that is masquerading as one.ADDENDUM:Just got around to adding this. My wife purchased a bag of the "Hickory Honey BBQ" at the beginning of July. They were real dental-rattlers, uneven but thick-cut and baked into seriously hard material. The spices were horribly uneven.Lot mark: 12JUL12 090227921:37Update:My wife purchased a bag of these locally today, 12-4-12. Green tasting off-flavors. These chips continue to be inconsistent. Maybe like the girl with a curl for you.Lot mark: 28FEB13 092504920.01Hits keep coming. Wife got a bag of the Aged White Cheddar, some chips had the same off-flavors. The bad tastes couldn't even be covered up by the cheese/spices.Lot mark: 24JAN13 092143915:53Over $14/lb. What else can you buy for that price?
This coconut water is the best I've had. It doesn't qualify for prime anymore though so I'm switching to Brian and Amy's

I got the citrus cranberry oat..these really are good!  They taste to me like graham cracker w/dried cranberry pcs in it.  The citrus/oat was not distinctive.  They come in thin cookie shape, several to each tray..makes you feel like you can eat several and not be loaded up on calories.  Needless to say, tasty w/cold glass of milk or some nice hot tea or coffee.  Definitely going to try the other flavors..this is certainly not just a squished fig newton! No cholesterol and I think 3 cookies were 140 cal
i use the little refillable cups in my Keurig.  I like that they are so easy to use and really can save you some money.  Or, you can use coffees from the beans that you can't get in a Keurig pod.
LIKE TO TRY NEW BRANDS AND VARIETIES. THOUGHT THERE WEREN'T ENOUGH NON-FLAVORED CUPS IN THE PACK. WOULD PURCHASE THIS BRAND AGAIN/

This was very easy to make in the microwave. The texture and flavor were both decent; I actually really liked the seasoning for this couscous. Overall, this is a fair option if you want something easy and quick.
These have no flavor. They all taste the same. They are way too sweet and my kids don't even like themAnd they love gummy candy.

I find that this cup works well for brewing tea bags. The tea bag acts as a filter, and the screens on the cup catch any tea that escapes if you manage to rip a bag. It is a great alternative to the more expensive  one-use K-cups, or when you can not find the tea you want in K-cups. It should work with loose tea as well, but I have not tried it.

These little Bumble Bee Sensations packets are nothing new.  In fact, this type of combo has been on the market for years.  I used to buy them all the time.  They are perfect for a quick snack and tossing them into a lunch bag was one of may favorite things to do.  With a full 16 grams of protein they make for a nice boost in the middle of the day or right along with your lunch.This type of package stores very nicely and the expiration date on mine is approximately  one year from now.  Stocking up can be done if there’s a sale or purchasing a lot for a family with teens is feasible.  The taste is nice, but rather light.  There’s no mayonnaise to boost the old calorie count.I love the “ready to eat” factor and I did notice the “Dolphin Safe” logo, another plus for Bumble Bee.  The calorie count for the tuna is 110 and the crackers add 80.  The taste is wonderful, the convenience a real plus, and is nutritionally sound.  The only thing that might be of concern to some is that the sodium in the tuna is 310mg.Sundried Tomato & Basil Seasoned Tuna Medley:Light Tuna, Water, Marinade (Water, Vinegar, Soya Oil, Tomato Paste, Sugar, Modified Food Statch, Salt, Citric Acid, Vegetable Broth, Guar Gum, Paprika, Sundried Tomato, BasilCrackers:Wheat Flour, Water, Palm Oil, Sugar, Coconut Oil, Leavening (Calcium Phosphate, Ammonium Bicarbonate, Sodium Bicarbonate), Salt.NOTE:  Contains soy, wheat.PRODUCT OF THAILANDBUMBLE BEE SENSATIONS:Bumble Bee Sensations Thai Chili Tuna KitBumble Bee Sensations Tomato Basil Tuna KitBumble Bee Sensations lemon pepper Tuna Medley Kit
summary: Perfect snack to have at home or add to your lunch bag ...

reviewText: I ordered this mix thinking i would be getting what is pictured for this listing! I did not receive the "premium" mix, as it shows in the picture. I got the other taco mix that is pictured for another listing for Mccormack Taco seasoning, minus the premium adjective. I didnt like this as much as the 'premium' and found another listing with the word 'premium' in it, so i am ordering that one, hoping its the actual premium mix that is pictured!

I never knew you could buy duck fat in jars till I found it on Amazon.  I absolutely love using it.  I am a fan of cooking duck, so this seemed so natural.  I use it for sauteing onions, tomatoes, and garlic.  I have used it for my scrambed and fried eggs.  I cook my burgers in it.  Well I want to use it for browning any items.  Great product which I hopefully will never be without.
summary: Vegetable oil and butter move aside

reviewText: My family loves hot sauce and this was a nice addition to our sauces. I like that they dont have that artificial taste most bottled sauces have. This tastes like actual peppers and chilis. The green went well with enchiladas and is my fave. My hubby prefers the red and uses it on everything from eggs to rice to meats.

This is delicious and mellow coffee with a rich coffee flavor, and yet not verging into "too dark." There is no burnt, over-roasted taste here that I find with other "premium" coffees (I'm looking at  you, Starbucks). It's delicious. Love the big package, too, 48 K-cups last a long time! My husband uses the K-cup in the office and really liked this coffee a lot.Recommendation: Yes, two thumbs up, delicious premium coffee at a good price.
summary: Delicious, mellow, and not too dark

reviewText: These cups work great in my Keurig.  They sure save money on coffee.  I have even given them as presents to my family and friends.

This is a nice take on what is normally a rather bland dish. The preparation is the same as it is for regular couscous - bring water to a boil, add the couscous, and let it sit off the fire for about 5 minutes. I can't imagine anything that's simpler than that!The couscous is very good. Excellent texture and it does not clump together when cooked. The cheese flavor is also pretty good, but just a little too salty. If the salt content was dialed down a bit this would be a 5-star product.It paired very well as a side dish with chicken, but would be a good accompaniment with pretty much anything - couscous is very versatile.Other than the salt content, an excellent side dish.
summary: Nice flavor; bit on the salty side

reviewText: There is nothing like the taste of Campbell's Soup on the Go, this makes life a little bit more like being at home, here in Afghanistan. Thank you for your prompt shipping and support.
I have been trying to have less wheat in my diet and love this almond flour for pancakes, cupcakes, even cookies. Recommend for someone not wanting wheat. It has a nice rich nut taste, yummy!

Thoughts on the Bumble Bee Sensations Tomato Basil Tuna Kit:This would be a good lunchtime option, especially for those who have a short lunch period and/or work in a desk job. The can of tuna itself has a handy pop-top lid.  It takes a bit of strength to fully remove it from the can, but I'm grateful to not need a can opener.The tuna itself has a nice flavor.  It's a little salty, but I liked the tomato/basil taste.  The kit includes 6 circular Ritz-like crackers. They were a little dry, but I was grateful for the savings in fat grams.I was surprised that the product had as much as 4.5 grams of fat, but it's far less than regular tuna packed in oil, and I'm sure the oil in this product improved the flavor and kept the meat from being too dry.The outer plastic packaging was surprisingly easy to open.  Usually with hard plastic-wrapped products, I have to risk getting cut in order to extricate the item from inside its casing. This wasn't bad at all.This product is a tasty, convenient lunch option.  Easy to throw into a lunch bag or briefcase, it would make a great choice for the working set.
summary: Convenient and Tasty Work Lunch Option

reviewText: This is a nice Cocoa to try.  It will depend on personal taste deciding if you want to buy it again.  It's not overly sweet.  It's made from pure ingredients.  Canister is smaller than I expected so not sure how long they will last.  I'm still trying different cocoas.

My opinion: I really like this product alot. I eat it alot. You can make all kinds of variations to it easily. No regrets. Great price. The quality is good. Delivered right to my door. It's very easy to create a quick meal with this can of beef. I buy it often from amazon.com.

My husband and I took this along on a six hour hike in the mountains, and even though it's supposed to be served chilled, it was delicious luke warm and did give us the satisfying fullness in our empty stomachs to continue comfortably on our walk. The drink isn't low cal, so I believe its intention is for 'athletes' or for a pick-me-up after an energetic activity. I had the strawberry flavor and found it to be just the right amount of sweetness...not too overwhelming like some flavored drinks I've tried. The texture is very smooth and goes down well. I really wanted to like this flavor of K-Cups but it's just not that good. It smells incredible when it's brewing but I think that because this isnt a true flavored coffee you come in thinking its going to taste sweet. Its bitter to me and even the undertones of the chocolate seem a little tart. I tried even putting creamer and sugar and still found it to be way too bitter. Ive even tried to drink it over ice and still a no-go. The chocolate flavor is too artificial tasting. I love the regular and deacaff versions(unflavored) of Donut House coffee but this is not good.
Just used this to make a loaf of bread and it was the best. Had been using just the regular wheat flour and what a difference. I will be using this from now on.
After reading the positive reviews I decided to take the plunge when this was on sale. It's wonderful and I highly recommend it.
We could not find WW pastry flour locally and many of the vegan recipes we like called for it.  This is a great product at a good price.  We are very happy with it.
Only 4 of the 5 flavors are gluten free but I love all of those. I understand the 5th flavor (which I can't eat) is very good as well. I definitely give these a thumbs up!

When considering the greater nutritional value of black rice, along with the great aroma and desired chewiness, this rice seems a good value. Please note it is not sold as organic, if you care about that.I wanted to discover its basic flavor and confess I cooked it in a variable temperature crockpot with a pork roast. In this case, I rinsed the rice prior to adding it to the roast and liquid, and had salted the water lightly. I noticed even while rinsing it, that it possessed a great aroma, which continued to manifest during the cooking process. And: FLAVOR manifested during the eating process!You may want to know that the coloring of black rice is so strong that it can and will stain white porcelain-type cooking vessels. Mine are Corning Cookmates and have been used for almost 40 years now (by my father before me) and have acquired a network of fine scratches, so it makes sense that a strong dye can enter. I will eventually bleach out the stain but couldn't get it with baking soda, which is my usual solution. So for this batch I used a slow-cooker with a black ceramic insert; that solved it.The grains are smaller than I am used to with the Lundberg brand. Thus I had to use a finer-mesh strainer for washing, as too many fell through my regular strainer. No big problem; just thought I'd pass on the info. I also would mention another aspect so you won't be surprised: If a few grains are scattered about, they will look precisely like small mouse turds. This was initially unnerving to me because I've been unable to catch some particularly small rodents (they may be shrews or voles) that are leaving this type of calling card, because they are too light to trip the traps. But they can take the bait just fine. Time for a new kitty. Wuv kitties.
summary: Excellent result, aromatic with good texture

reviewText: - The taste was just ok. I greatly prefer Muscle Milk which tastes like a treat to me.- I can't tell how well it works for recovery since this would take long term use and I didn't like it enough for that.

I know Arnold Coombs personally and he makes one of the finest syrups in the entire world. Arnold is one of those people you would like to have over to your house for dinner especially if you're having pancakes.

I believe this tea made my gas, bloat, and pain worse. Two weeks taking it 2-4 times a day. I switched to Heathers fiber, with great results! I find ginger tea works much better for me. I make green tea iced tea with ginger tea, no sweetners, and use straight up ginger tea at the first sign of any distress.
summary: Jury still out on this one

reviewText: My title for this review says it all.  Swiss Miss diet is good as you probably could make an instant product.  For me it tasted like all the enjoyable quick Swiss Miss hot cocoas that I have had in years past.  I like the option for a diet product and I do not think it tastes bad at all in diet form.  However this mix is not as good as cocoa made from scratch.  Using Hershey's dark cocoa, skim milk and Truvia sweetner you can make a far more superior hot cocoa than any instant mix.  But if you need a quick hot chocolate fix then this product will do just fine.

My husband loves these noodles.  They go nicely in all kinds of Asian soups and dishes.  They require a very short soaking time in hot water before adding as the final step in a dish so be mindful of not over cooking them.  I've never been as crazy about the thin noodles and much prefer the wider variety, particularly for stir fries, but hey I enjoy these too so will keep buying to have on hand. I was hoping to like this product better, based on my very positive reaction to SB's Vanilla Caramel Bars with Yogurt.This nut crunch bar, though, doesn't taste as inviting as I had anticipated.  It has a predominantly nutty flavor that could use a little more sweetness or another note to set it off.  The nuts in the recipe are peanuts, almonds, and sunflower seeds.  To my palate, the almonds dominate the mix too much.The texture of the bars is somewhat tough and chewy, again not as appealing as the vanilla caramel bars.On the positive side, the bar is supposed to be packed with protein and fiber, it's gluten-free (and glutton-free, too, as I doubt most folks will hunger for seconds).  The product is also priced reasonably compared to many similar snack bars.So if you're looking for a healthy snack bar that's reasonably priced -- and you really like nuts -- you may want to try this product.  Those who aren't nuts for nuts will probably prefer the company's vanilla caramel bars with similar nutrition claims and IMO better flavor and texture.

A New Yorker (Brooklyn) living in the South, I've been trying to duplicate the taste of a genuine Egg Cream for decades. I've purchased the CO2 cartridges and siphon bottles in my quest, but something was always missing in the taste. Blue Sky True Seltzer brought that taste back to me, and the missing ingredient all these years was sodium. Blue Sky contains 10mg of sodium and the taste of sodium was the missing link between a real egg cream and Blah. Along with whole milk and U-Bet Chocolate Syrup, I now have the complete recipe for a perfect egg cream, and it tastes like heaven. Sure I could nit-pick and complain that the carbonation doesn't fully rival that of the old bottled seltzer. But each can of Blue Sky contains enough fizzy seltzer for two nice sized egg creams. I could always infuse Blue Sky with more carbonation with one of those CO2 siphon bottles, and that may provide the powerful first splash that provided the "foam" topping of the old school soda fountain egg creams. But Blue Sky gave me the prerequisite carbonation belch of satisfaction and that's good enough for me. Hello Brooklyn!
summary: The Taste of Seltzer for a Great Egg Cream

reviewText: Knorr Pasta Sides, Thai Sweet Chili, is full of flavor.  Upon opening, I smelled a strong scent of onion powder, which wasn't so strong in the final product.  I can taste lime and there's a little kick.  I wouldn't call it spicy hot, but I'm pretty sure my husband would.It was quick and easy to make, but it was a little wet when I was done waiting the required minutes after cooking.  I thought all the liquid would be absorbed by then, but I ended up boiling it off for a couple of minutes more.If I were to use this just as a side, I'd say one package serves two.  If I had it as a main meal, there would only be enough just for me.  If I served the entire portion to my husband, he'd probably still be hungry afterward.  I didn't because he doesn't like anything remotely spicy.Overall, it's good.  Next time, I'll pair it with some chicken or try the lettuce wraps recipe on the package.
Excellent!  Good price - all have pretty much gone - need to hide some of them else they go too quickly!!

I rate this rice pilaf mix based on the sample package I received and in comparison to my long time favorite rice pilaf,Near East Original  Rice Pilaf Mix. I found the SideMates pilaf okay, certainly not bad, but not so great compared to Near East pilaf.I prepared the SideMates pilaf on the stove top and followed directions to the letter. This is the first of several SideMates dishes I've prepared that took longer to cook than expected according to directions. The directions for this pilaf call for 8-10 minutes of simmering before the water is evaporated, but after 10 minutes there was plenty of water in the batch I prepared so I had to keep it on simmer for another 5-6 minutes.Each package makes 3 servings, each of which contains 710 mg sodium (though it's not clear if this accounts for the use of salted butter, as the directions call for 2 tablespoons of butter; I used unsalted butter). Each 1 cup serving is 240 calories and there's no MSG in the mix.Side Mates are distributed by Osem USA, whose site tells us that, "The Osem Company is Israel's leading exporter of kosher food to the USA. The US subsidiary Osem USA (fully owned by the Osem Group) is considered the number one importer of food products from Israel, operating an efficient and strong marketing network." Osem started in Israel in 1942 when Israel's various noodle factories amalgamated. I found it interesting to read about Osem's history, vision, and code of business conduct at the Osem site.
summary: Good pilaf but I've had better

What a delight is this beverage!  I've been caffeine-free for one year, having given up coffee because of increasing physical effects of caffeine.  When I discovered Teeccino, I was skeptical at first.  The company claims that it tastes like coffee.  I tried it and I really, really like it.  Hazelnut coffee was my favorite flavor when I was drinking coffee, and to my tastebuds, the Teeccino Mediterranean Hazelnut Herbal Coffee tastes even better!  Of course, there are no side effects from caffeine because there is none, and the flavor is smooth and mellow and, well, hazelnutty. I would recommend brewing it in a coffee press to allow the coffee to be in contact with the hot water for at least 10 minutes to bring out the full flavor.  It is good by itself or with some organic half & half.  M-m-m-m!!!

When I was a kid in the 1950s, I think the most exotic spices that my mom used in cooking were paprika and cinnamon. Seriously, in that era, most Americans didn't use a lot of imported seasonings and spices. That gradually changed, of course, but my first encounter with saffron wasn't until 1971 on a trip to Spain - it was a big steaming bowl of paella. Then, about ten years ago, on his old Food Network show "Good Eats," Alton Brown gave a brief primer on saffron (you can find it on YouTube). So when Mehr Saffron offered me some samples of their saffron products, I was agreeable to trying it.My wife and I made one of our favorite home-cooked meals - chicken tikka masala with basmati rice. We used a Bobby Flay recipe for the chicken, and the Mahatma basmati rice was boiled. We used a "pinch" of the saffron threads (it would be approximately 1/8 teaspoon), and we steeped it in hot water for 15-20 minutes to let it infuse the water before adding the water, butter, and salt to the pot with the rice.The rice came out a nice golden yellow color and was very tasty. Basmati rice already has a certain natural fragrance, and with the added saffron, the rice was very savory, not at all like the bland rice that I grew up eating.In his TV show, I remember Alton Brown emphasizing that saffron should be fresh, and that it should be purchased from a specialty dealer, not a supermarket where it may have sat on a shelf for months. The Mehr Saffron saffron threads had a noticeably pungent aroma that I've read is a sign of freshness. Also, the saffron threads were all a deep red color, with no yellow threads that are a lower quality.I'm not a big Dr. Oz fan, but when I was looking for information on saffron, I found a video of one of his shows that featured "The Best Herbs for Your Health." The first herb that he described was saffron, which Dr. Oz claimed was a powerful cancer fighter.So after I learned a lot about saffron and tried it in cooking, is it worth the cost? In my opinion, yes, but everyone will have to decide for themselves. One thing, though: A little bit of saffron goes a long way, so it's not as expensive as it may appear.A product sample was provided by the seller for review purposes.
summary: Adds a distinctive taste and color to food

Nutritional benefits of Chia seeds are amazing.  Here are a few to start:*According to studies, Chia possesses the highest percentage of the polyunsaturated fatty acids(linolenic and linoleic) of all crops. Chia seeds contain 60% omega 3 fatty acids.*The protein content of Chia is higher that other nutritional grains. Unlike other grains, it is a complete protein, meaning that it has the appropriate balance of all essential amino acids. About 19 to 23% of chia seeds weight is protein.*Chia seeds are high in fiber, a 15 gm serving of chia seeds will provide 4 to 5 gm of fiber. Our body requires at least 35 gm of fiber a day to stay healthy.*Chia seeds contain boron which is essential for bone health.*Chia seeds are rich in calcium, about 2 oz of chia seeds contains 600 mg of Calcium, as compared to 120 mg for a cup of milk.*Chia seeds have 2 times more potassium than banana.*Chia seeds have 3 times more antioxidants than blueberriesRegardless of the astonishing nutritional values of Chia, it also tastes very good.  My girlfriend and I make a big pot of "steel cut" oatmeal at night (the quick way is throw a cup of oats in 4 cups of boiling water and just let it sit overnight), put in a good helping of chia seeds, and the next morning you have a wonderful breakfast that could last all week depending on how many people are eating it.  Feel free to add a little cinnamon, peanut butter, fruit, or your own oatmeal favorite additions.There are many other recipes for eating Chia, but oatmeal is my personal favorite.  I started eating Chia last year after reading the NY Times Bestseller 'Born to Run' about how a tribe of Mexicans that eat Chia will drink beer, smoke tobacco, and then run up to 500 miles in a footrace.  One of the primary contributors to their physical ability is that their diet is full of the nutrient-rich Chia seeds.  I started out paying an arm-and-a-leg at Whole Foods for Chia seeds, but have since started buying them on Amazon for a fraction of the price.Buy some Chia seeds and make a delicious bowl of oatmeal for one of the healthiest breakfasts possible.

I am so happy I found the KIND bars at Amazon.com..This Macadamia&apricot; is my very favorite.They arrived very fresh and packaged well.Thanks for the auto delivery.I sent a box to my daughter and her family.They loved them,too.

McCormick used to make a jerk marinade mix, which they sold in packets for a fast and flavorful alternative to more complex recipes.  They stopped making this a few years ago, replacing it with the PERFECT PINCH CARIBBEAN JERK SEASONING, found in the spice aisle of the super market (or here on Amazon, of course!).  The label on the jar suggests using this seasoning as a "rub" for chicken, pork, and other meats.  But it works even better as a marinade.  Here's the recipe:3 tbsp McCormick Caribbean Jerk Seasoning3 tbsp salad oil2 tbsp soy sauce1 tbsp cider vinegarCombine ingredients in a plastic food storage bag and mix until well blended.  Add chicken or tuna (the absolute best!) and let marinate.  The longer you marinate your protein, the spicier the end result will be.  Grill the chicken or tuna, basting with remaining marinade.This really is a terrific product which makes great jerk marinade.  Highly recommended!
summary: Makes a super easy jerk marinade

I served this with salmon, yellow summer squash and kale for a healthy late summer supper.
summary: Very Mild Cheese Flavor, Easy To Make

reviewText: Excellent price, excellent pitted dates! I loved these, and now, by purchasing such a big, bulk order of them, I got them for an excellent price. I think I have enough dates to last me for at least a whole year from now. They are soft, sweet and easily a better alternative to use in place of processed sugars, for recipes too. I snack on them all day long as well. Will order more dried fruits from this supplier again too. Highly recommend if you like dates.
Bought this and me and the family had it gone in two weeks.  Arrived fresh and sealed like from the store.  Will order more then my sweet tooth needs soothing :)

I love dark chocolate and especially the trend to use high levels of Cacao. I also love coffee, perhaps even more than chocolate. Scharffen Berger Mocha is a balanced dark chocolate. It is strong, but not painfully strong to any dark chocolate lover. A fair amount of ground coffee is in the chocolate contributes to the bitterness, but is also not over the top. It might not be for anyone that doesn't like the texture of coffee grounds, but I enjoyed it. Finally, it is worth knowing the process and that it is made with a minimal number of ingredients. Now I just have to try not to eat all six bars in a week.
summary: Well balanced Dark Chocolate and Coffee

reviewText: When I ordered this tea I was expecting a very nice, refreshing and revitalizing mint tea to mix with a bit of organic cocao powder for my minty chocolate tea treat.  However, even though Yogi boxed this with the title "Refresing Mint Revitalize Tea", it really isn't minty.  The flavor is very spicy.  So much so that I was really shocked by the flavor.  I LIKED the flavor, but it certainly isn't the tea that I thought I was buying by the box cover.  The ingredients are;  Peppermint and Spearmint leaves with black and green tea, Cinnamon, Ginger, Cardamom, Black Pepper, Kola Nut, Clove Bud and Guarana Seed.  All tasty if you want a spicy kick in the butt get a move on tea, but not a revatilizing mint tea.  I give it 3 stars because I believe that the title is misleading.  Refreshing mint doesn't sound like black pepper and cardamom to me.
summary: Not really minty but very spicy

reviewText: I really love Lindt chocolate. Swiss chocolate is the best chocolate in the world, and Lindt produces the best of the best. I have bought the milk chocolate truffles several times and I love them, and these are even better.They are SO creamy and delicious! I honestly expected them to be dripping with caramel on the inside, but it looks like the caramel has been blended in with the chocolate, which makes it almost like a fudge. My only complaint is that they had melted a bit, so I would be cautious about having them shipped in the summer.
I use this at work with the V cup machine.  Very good flavor, less bitter than a lot of starbucks
Stellar Nutella substitute. Not as readily available or as cheap, but grab it w/ S&S and enjoy a superior mouthfeel and better ingredient list.
This tea is very tasty.  I add stevia and it is a sweet and satisfying drink that I can have any time of the day since it is caffiene free.

I love this stuff, my first time to order it and try it and very good it is.  I had bought this for my son but he is out of luck and mama is drinking it with him.  It is delicious. Easy to make and fast and without mess.
summary: chocolate is the food of life

reviewText: not perfect but great for my way of eating I do ketogenic way of eating and have lost 25 lbs in the last 3 months will continue until I have lost 60-70 lbs of unwanted fat.

For once I can say that a nutrition drink is actually great tasting and apparently good for me, too.It is not chaulky, bulky or sickeningly sweet. As a matter of fact, it reminded me of an Orange Julius only without the sugar content and certainly much more convenient from right out of my refrigerator.I couldn't tell if it was giving me any additional energy benefits, but I do know that I completed the container and went out and hit tennis balls for about an hour without feeling bloated or wired.I can't wait to find out what other flavors are available so that I can add a little variety to the mix.  This one is definetly a keeper.

The mango Mix 1 surprised me. I had tasted the berry flavor first, and nearly spit it up it was so bad.This one, I drank most of it. The mango flavor is intense and pleasant. The texture does have a sort of chalkiness (which I've noticed in some other protein drinks) with a little edge of oiliness and a sour topnote, is how best I can describe it. Sort of like a mango milkshake with oil, chalky protein, thickener, and some lemon--that's my approximation of the flavor.However, of the two Mix 1's that I sampled, I'd never touch the berry again (not ever, don't even try to bribe me, DREADFUL stuff), but this one I'd drink on a day when I needed a solid protein drink (say after a workout), but didn't want a meal.If they could improve the texture and take that sour edge off it, this would be a really nice shake. However, at this price, I'd have to nix buying this again. I'd need it much cheaper or much, much tastier.Mir
summary: Surprisingly MUCH better than the Berry!

reviewText: These are my favorite chocolate covered nuts in the world...such a great combination!  My only complaint is that they're not always whole macadamia nuts...sometimes they're just chocolate covered pieces...more chocolate than nut.  They're still great tasting though!  They are hard to find, but Amazon has them for a decent price...for which I am grateful.

reviewerName: Baron Von Cool "Do or do not, there is no try."
reviewText: I tried a bunch of different Zevia flavors and they all have this weird, slightly unpleasant aftertaste from the stevia leaf sweetener. I've used stevia leaf liquid in an eyedropper to sweeten things in the past and that's how I know it's the cause of the weird flavor. Not all the soda flavors do a good job living up to what they promise, the best you can hope for is they'll be OK. They should sweeten Zevia with xylitol instead and then I bet they'd actually taste good enough to buy more than once. As for me, I won't buy them again.

We tried over three days to consume the entire bag of Snikiddy All Natural Baked Corn Puffs, Mac n' Cheese.  Made of the usual ingredients in puffed corn type snacks, these are labeled as gluten free.  On the reverse of the bag, however, is a little notice that they try to not be contaminated by wheat, so if you are a celiac disease suffer, I would be aware of that information.  The shape of each morsel is a little different than others because there's a hole in the center.  Imagine a penne pasta on steroids, you know, puffed up so the hole is tiny.  The cells of the corn are more airy and we described the texture similar to panko crumbs.  This was determined as we examined the large amount of crumbs remaining at the bottom of the bag once each puff was consumed.  None of the four people who ate this bag of chips liked them, we just ate them to give it a fair shot.  The flavor wasn't appealing to 3 out of 4 and the texture was determined to be too airy and gummy with mastication.  All in all, we agreed that it was nice to have a bag to try, but we won't be purchasing this product.  BTW, it won't leave your fingers or mouth orange in color, but you may end up with some whitish crumbs on your chest.  These aren't terrible, just not appreciated in this household.
summary: Almost crunchy with the initial bite

reviewText: My husband loves pop and I refuse to buy junk- the stuff filled with sugar, aspartame, and chemicals that harm our body- so I got this and it has been a hit! Now some of our adult kids and friends are getting it! Cheers to the wonderful companies that are beginning to give us products we can enjoy without harming our health!!
I tried this Tortuga Chocolate Rum Cake, but did not really care for it.  The Original is my favorite of all the Tortuga cakes I have tried.

Saffron adds an interesting flavor into just about any dish you decide to put it into. Mehr claims this is the best quality Saffron, and comparing to other saffron I have, I agree that the quality of the Mehr saffron, at least based on looks, is better. Compared to odor and flavor, I again give it to Mehr.The only thing you really need to be aware of is that you are buying 1 gram (2 bottles) of saffron. Yes, a little goes a very, very long way, but the size of the bottle gives the impression that you are getting a lot. The photo used, while artistic, hides just how much 1 gram of saffron is... it's a very small amount. The bottle could probably hold 20 times what is included. This is fine with me, but someone who doesn't realize what 1 gram of saffron looks like might be put off. Of course, if you've bought saffron, you likely know what 1 gram looks like, so just realize you will get a really nice, high quality corked jar to go with your 1 gram (OK, 2 bottles for 2 grams total) of saffron.Mehr claims this is the highest quality saffron, and while I don't have a lab to test and compare, just doing a sight/smell test, the Mehr saffron, compared to the saffron I currently have from a local "farmer's market" doesn't even compare.Recommended.I received a free sample from the manufacturer for review purposes.
summary: Pay attention to how much you are buying, not the size of the bottle

reviewText: You grow to like theses sodas if you, wait for it... don't drink ANY other sodas.  In the world of stevia, these sodas are great, but the second you try a normal soda (even natural ones or Izze ones) these taste like garbage

I absolutely love this tea piping hot & with a dash of cream! The chocolate flavor is wonderful & strong, the cream rounds it out and makes it smooth.This is a great tea for those watching their weight, but still longing for something sweet.I love to drink this tea all winter long (and even during the summer!), and it goes wonderfully with a few shortbread cookies.Hands down the BEST chocolate tea I've ever tried! (and I've tried a LOT!)

I'm really happy with this purchase. I got two sealed 8 oz bags. Since I only use 1-2 teaspoons/day, it goes a long way. The flavor is pretty smooth and not at all bitter. I shopped around and this was one of the best deals I found (shipping is what ups the price a bit). It also had some of the best reviews. I would definitely buy this again. My batch was a nice shade of green; not at all brown and not neon. I use it in smoothies, milk drinks, and other cooking/mixes. I haven't tried to drink it as a cup of tea.

These Cheez-Its are dangerous. They taste so good, you can go through half the box before you know it. Eighteen crackers have 150 calories, about half of which is fat. Carrots and celery sticks they are not, but hey...for those rare occasions when you decide to eat junk food instead of dinner, I can think of few snack foods that are tastier. They are a definite improvement over the regular cheddar Cheez-Its. Like the regular ones, though (and unlike those nasty Doritos), the taste is baked into the cracker, not dusted/stuck on too intensely. They don't taste too salty, either. They are just right.These little crackers lend themselves to the "hold on your tongue and suck" method of slowing down consumption. I had not realized how deeply flavorful the jalapeno pepper is because, most times, when I'm eating something with jalapeno, it's so hot my taste buds are burned before I can fully appreciate the flavor.These have a wonderful deep jalapeno flavor with that great Mexican-restaurant cheese dip taste. I can see how they would be very, very addictive. I think I'll try using them as a condiment when we're doing a meatless dinner of beans and rice with a side salad. Yum. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it...like I said, they are dangerous!
summary: Deep jalapeno flavor without the heat = too too yum

reviewText: I tried using this with my wilton white candy melts on cake pops and some of the colors like the orange would work for a second then dry out. The black worked well but not some of the colors.

Looks like a jar of black vaseline but denser. Taste like a cross between soy sauce with a mushroomy blend. I spread it  almost clear thin on my cracker...that 's all I can take. I ate on it all day when it first came in the mail...but barely making a dent in the jar. My hands were swollen the next day from the sodium.

What more need be said than this is a good, hearty chili.  Use it as a base for hearty winter-blend soups and stews, mix with refried beans for haystack base, serve with rice and peppers as a Tex-Mex dish, use it as a secret ingredient in Super Burritos - it is just plain GOOD.

I was very disappointing with the quality of 2/3 bags. I make popcorn daily. It's a good, low fat snack... If it tastes good. When I first purchased Great Northern Popcorn, I was impressed with the price and quality. Plus, an attractive price for prime shipping left me feeling like I could not go wrong. However, my next two orders were horrible, seriously. The last 2 bags that I made the mistake of ordering were terrible. One bag had several holes, and the popcorn leaked all over the box. It also smelled bad, like mold or dirt.Despite the problem with the previous order, I made an attempt to purchase again because the price was right. The latest package from "discount tommy" (a seller that recently changed names to something else), smelled really bad and musty.  Despite this, I decided to make a batch anyway; bad mistake, it tasted as bad as it smelled. I couldn't eat popcorn for a month because of how badly it tasted.I would not recommend this popcorn to anyone, and will not be buying it again. It's a shame, because it is priced right, but I would never gamble again with what to expect from this company; 2/3 chances of getting bad popcorn is not good odds. I have seen more recent reviews with the same complaint, so it is obviously a quality issue of the seller or manufacturer.
summary: 2/3 bags were not good, not worth the savings.

reviewText: For most of the work week, I'm a peanut butter sandwich a day guy. I don't have jelly and I prefer crunchy to smooth. This rich and powerful gourmet peanut butter was not to my liking, however, most likely because it seems to try so hard to not be peanut butter....if that makes sense. To be fair, I am not a fan of peanut butter flavored anything (candy, ice cream) or even pb sandwiches with other items (bananas, marshmallow fluff, etc.), so perhaps I am not the target audience for this product. Please take this into consideration when reading my review.Many have complained of the smell, an overwhelming, almost wince-inducing blast of funk and raspberries. It's enough to put one off before they even get a chance to taste it. Then again, I've heard that durian fruit is really good even though it stinks to high heaven, so I took the dive.The taste is simply too much of too many things that are good alone but not in this combination. The richness and array of strong flavors lends itself more to a unique dessert than a sandwich spread. Perhaps it might be good out of the freezer or as a substitute for peanut butter in a recipe, I don't know.  I got it for sandwiches.Additionally, as also previously noted by many, the thickness makes it unwieldy and there is a peculiar lingering sensation in your mouth after eating it. Seriously, I brushed my teeth twice after just a few spoonfuls, and it still felt like my tongue was coated with the sickly sweet pasty substance.I would most certainly not buy this.
summary: I didn't care for this peanut butter at all.

reviewText: Has soy grits and flax in it, not what you expect in chips, and not adequately labeled as such when purchasing. Not the usual corn taste, although it has some health benefits. It's just not what I expected/wanted, and won't buy again.
summary: The BAKED version of these chips is misleading and non-tasty

reviewText: I've gotten hooked on these as I'm doing chemo and continusly get a weird taste in my mouth but these take it away!
This is hands down the best apple cider on the market in a k-cup. My family and friends love it too. It tastes authentic and natural.

Vegan. Organic. Kosher. Beautiful fire-roasted tomato flavor. Well-balanced and mild. Not sweet or with too much tang. Medium thick puree base with nicely-sized crushed pieces. Great with organic pasta or mixed with your favorite organic veggies over rice. Also available in smaller size cansMuir Glen Organic Crushed Tomatoes, Fire Roasted, 14.5-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12). This review is out there for those for whom this makes a difference. See all of my reviews for more great choices. Check out "Vegan Grocery Favorites" and "Vegan Grocery Top Ten" in Listmania. Your "helpful" votes count and will be greatly appreciated to benefit the search of others. Thank you.
Yep - these almonds are big and tasty.  I will buy again.  I will always go back to buy quality yet reasonably priced items.

reviewerName: Jason Kirkfield "The Pride and Sorrow of chil...
reviewText: You watch your mouth!Simply, one of the best things I have ever eaten. Healthy organic blue corn chips with taste that packs a punch.I won't waste your time reading about these when you can be enjoying them instead. Just note that some bags seem to have a more generous allotment of cayenne pepper (the special ingredient that distinguishes Red Hot Blues from the standard Blue Chips). Or perhaps certain bags settle more during shipment, in which case the bulk of the cayenne dust is to be found at the bottom of the bag. You can always scoop up the loose seasoning and sprinkle on the chips (or any food! LOL) as you see fit.P.S. Amazon needs to figure out how to share reviews across products. In this case, for example, there are at least four different listings for Red Hot Blues. The only difference is the size of the bag or the quantity of bags that are bundled together. I am posting this review in those as well because other than one listing, none of the others have any reviews. Hopefully this will be of some help to customers, plus point them toward the main listing (the one with Free Shipping and sold directly from Amazon!).
summary: Those Red Hot Blues are one bad mutha...

reviewText: I bought the Organic French Roast because of good reviews and it is organic. The packing looks good. When I open the bag, the smell is not as good as I expected. In fact, I do not think it is freshly roasted although the expiration date is about 10 months from now. I brewed my first cup this morning and I do not like it at all. Now, I am stucked w/ 2 lbs of coffee bean. Can I return it to Amazon?

The popcorn popped good- used the popcorn oil - popcorn salt & popcorn.  I use a "whirligig" popper and always have good poppedcorn results.  I just prefer the smaller kernel "TINY TENDER YELLOW" has a wonderful taste and I prefer that.  Seller for Tiny Tender had reasonably priced Tiny Tender BUT the shipping charge was ridiculous!  ((I will drive 15 miles to a store that sells Tiny Tender for $3.00 lb AND doesn't charge shipping.)Thought I'd give this a try - it's decent but not as great as I expected after reading all the reviews.

Very good popcorn, I'll probably get it again - but fair warning there are a lot of shells that separate from the popcorn in the bowl.Overall though, it's very good.  Flavorful, fluffy, large popcorn.  Pops very well, not every one pops but almost all of them at least heat up and crack as opposed to some other popcorn I've gotten that leave a lot of super hard kernels.I prefer this over white popcorn as well, these kernels make much larger popcorn pieces than any white I've ever tried.Works great in my air popper, no concerns at all.-D
summary: Very good taste and size.  Fair amount of shells though

reviewText: I tried one of these bars the other day. I needed a quick, non-heavily-processed snack. It's hard to find a granola bar that isn't chock-full of weird ingredients. Usually I go for Larabars, which have a short ingredients list and don't contain anything I wouldn't use in my own kitchen. But the store I was in didn't stock them, so I gave these a try. I was impressed by the short ingredients list and that it used at least one natural sweetener--honey-- and no high-fructose corn syrup. These do contain non-GMO glucose, which I'm not too fond of, but it beats the miles-long ingredients of other energy bars. And they taste awesome. This flavor reminds me of ANZAC cookies/biscuits, which I love. Anything with sweet coconut in it is on my favorite foods list, and these are no exception. They're sweet without being cloyingly so. The coconut adds a nice chewy texture while the almonds provide crunch. Very satisfying.

I always loved these milk chocolate covered cherries from way back when I was a kid.  I'm 75 now and still enjoy them.  The delivery was timely, but several of the candies on the bottom of the box were damaged and leaking.  No problem, I was able to get the sticky wrapping off by rinsing them under clear water.  Good price on these too. Don't buy in the hot weather though.
summary: Just like when I was a kid!

reviewText: 6 months ago started drinking my coffee black.  I no longer use artificial sweeteners or creamer.  After making this change I have become much more aware of the actual flavor of coffee.  I used to use dark or French roast.  I started scaling back to med or light roast trying to find the right strength.  Lighter roast doesn't mean it tastes better to me.  I am happy to say that this Kauai - Garden Isle Medium Roast is a big hit.

I do love Cheez-it's and will give any new flavor a once over try and these weren't bad but they do have a bit of heat associated with them.  I made it to the second cracker and was after the water to help cut the heat but I don't like hot things to begin with.  My daughter-in-law ate half the box without batting her eyes and saying she thought they were really good.  They do have a lot of flavor and if you like a bit of heat you should like these.
summary: Just a bit of Heat here!

reviewText: We love this ghee. Being from India, we have been using ghee all our life. We make fresh ghee at home using organic milk, but there are times when that is not enough for us and we did not ave much alternatives as the ghee we get in india stores in the US is not organic, while the ghee from the regular grocery store in US is not good as they do not know how to make real ghee. Then found this product and have stuck to it.Btw, if you are thinking that ghee is bad fat and cholesterol, that is old thinking. It is best for your health. So go enjoy the wonderful taste of ghee and love well.

these undersized and overpriced packets of miso soup has additives like 'dry fish powder' and i did not notice the small print of ingrediants before buying and accepting shipment. i have other products ordered through amazon that are great and repeatedly shipped to my door but this product is inferior and i wish i could get a refund on unused and still sealed portion.
summary: bad price on below average product

reviewText: These arrived fairly quickly. They seem fresh and not too dried out but I was pretty disappointed to discover that they aren't just dried cranberries and sugar but they are also covered in oil. I didn't see that anywhere in the description. I probably won't order these again but if you don't mind oily cranberries, they should work for you.

My wife and I have tried just about all the flavors of Erin Baker's Breakfast Cookies.  They're all good -- moist, filling, and they keep well in the freezer as well as in tins.  They're easy to warm in the microwave, too; about 30 seconds if frozen, about 12-15 seconds otherwise. Just clip off the end of the individual package and zap. (Those who complain about about dryness may have put one in a toaster for too long.)  As to the ingredients, I looked at the list on the back of the 'Caramel Apple' version to see the dreaded "corn syrup" someone complained about. First, it's NOT HFCS. Second, it's in the caramel!  Most of the cookies don't have any.The only reason we don't give this cookie 5 stars is that they are very, very sweet for our tastes.  The sweetness may even prevent some from being able to detect all the other flavors.  Dried apples and unsweetened apple sauce are good ingredients, prune puree isn't bad either, the apple pie-type spices are very nice, and a little molassas is traditional.  It's the evaporated cane juice and brown rice syrup in the cookie and the liquid sugar and corn syrup in the caramel bits that may take the sweetness over the top for some.  The way we see it, this is a highly portable breakfast for when you're in a hurry, and it may be low fat/high fiber, but don't kid yourself -- it's a cookie.  We'd recommend drinking something like V-8 as well as something hot like tea with milk or a skinny latte to round out this quickie cookie breakfast. (Just watch your sweet intake for the rest of the day ....)
summary: Good Breakfast Cookies-- and BTW, corn syrup is not HFCS!

reviewText: Had never tried coconut aminos or heard of them until I began reading and cooking from a paleo cookbook. So glad that I have now. Much less salty flavor to my asian dishes or any dish that require soy sauce. Also, feeling so much better without the soy. I recommend coconut aminos to anyone considering going gluten free.

Makes good hummus. Slightly bitter taste by itself on crackers. I am told it is a healthier choice than peanut butter, which I also love. This tahini is slightly runnier than the one I get from the local organic market.

Which is a good thing.  Of course, for some reason they seem to think the serving size is only 1/4 tsp, which is really not all that much over a big bowl of popcorn.  I didn't think the cheese stuck to dry popcorn very well, so I added a little olive oil, which changed the flavor a bit, but it still tasted good.This is also good if you get the ranch seasoning as well and sprinkle both on the popcorn.
summary: Very tasty - makes your popcorn taste like cheetos

reviewText: These are pretty good as crackers for dip; they are a bit too substantial to be eaten naked. A few things:First, they don't really taste like pita chips, either the bought ones or the ones made at home, but there is an echo there; they are more like a cross between a pita chip and a reduced fat Wheat Thin. This is not necessarily a bad thing, but it should be mentioned.Second, just as with store-bought pita chips, they do tend to break and leave the bottom of the bag filled with cracker shards.Third, the variety I have is clearly labeled "sea salt." Well, not if you think that means they are salty. I did not taste salt beyond the normal amount usually mixed with dough, and I did not see a single grain of salt on the crackers themselves. Probably Keebler has succumbed to the Health Wardens, just like everybody else. I checked the label; not much sodium there. (Anybody else remember how good saltines used to taste?)BUT these small things are for information only. Truly, this is a decent cracker that has crunch and will not detract from the flavor of what is put on it. Just a thought--they would complement whatever is around that has a good bit of garlic and oil in it, like baba ghanoush. And the bits at the bottom of the bag are tasty if you add a small amount of real salt.

I really like this soup.  It is fast to prepare.  I just use my coffee maker for the water and just pour the water in the bowl with the instant miso and stir and cover the dish for about 2 minutes and it ready to eat. I use a real Japanese Bowl with lid to prepare this soup.
Delicious snack with some sweetness and VERY addictive!

I purchased this tea and the regular tea.  I normally love peach tea but this one seems to leave an odd taste in my mouth that I can not get out.  When I drink it, it has to be very cold.  The regular tea doesn't need to be very cold to taste good.  I won't purchase this again.  I think I will stick with the Snapple peach tea from now on.
would of rated this 5 stars if it included sesame on some of the lil snacks and if it eliminated the peanuts but a good family treat and lasted quite a while
They are Lays and tasty.

Similar to the Ragu product,  the Bertolli sauce in the pouch is a great idea for those looking to make dinner after a long day at work. It's fast and simple and is as good as what comes in a jar.  I personally always add other ingredients to any jar sauce, and this one was no exception.  but I did heat it up via the microawave, just to see.  I would definitely recommend this sauce in a pouch and will try it again.  Very easy dinner and husband was very happy.

The first thing I noticed about this sauce is that it comes in a bag, which is weird and new for a pasta sauce. The directions say you can heat up the bag in the microwave, but I chose to do it in a pan. I have to say, this sauce was really good for a pre-made pasta sauce. It contained all the things you want to see: Tomatoes, onions, garlic, spices. And none of the things you don't want to see: Additives with unpronounceable names. It was thick and, dare I say, tasted homemade.What I didn't like about the sauce was the bag. You're really asking for spills if you pour anything out of a bag. Also, I don't think you can recycle it, which is a minus. You can recycle glass jars.

I had tried many decaf green teas for years, and when my favorite was no longer available, I tried Bigelow, and it is a perfect replacement for me.  It has a very smooth flavor with a stronger kick that I prefer, by keeping the teabag in for a while.  Others were very week tasting, even with using two bags per brew.  I found something that will be helpful to others, I use Evian bottled water when I make this tea, and it made a big difference in the flavor.  My filtered tap water made it less tasty with a harsher flavor, so try your favorite bottled water if you're not happy with the taste.Love getting the bulk buy, a very good deal, and I only have to walk to my pantry to get another box!!

I conducted my own mini "America's Test Kitchen" and asked a number of co-workers to help me by sampling this product.I cooked some pasta, with no salt or oil added, to add to the taste, and brought it into to work, along with some parmesan to grate on top, if they desired.The sauce is packaged in a unique and interesting way. The sauce is in a pouch and you leave it in the package, snipping one corner, before you heat in a microwave for 90 seconds and let it sit for a minute more.I was happy to see real chunks of tomato and specks of basil, promising in a Crushed Tomato and Basil Sauce.Most of the testers said the sauce was "good". One person ate a few bites and said "I'm already bored". Many of the testers noted this sauce needs a lot of cheese to make it exciting. And many more noted it tasted acidic.One of my co-workers, who is very health conscious, looked at the list of ingredients and was very impressed. No chemicals, no preservatives. And, to explain the acidity, no sugar. No transfat, which might explain the need for cheese.I asked everyone if they would eat this sauce simply plain on pasta. Most seemed reluctant. But more seemed ready to use the sauce in say a chicken parmesan or a lasagna, a dish where you were adding something else to it.Personally, I love to cook so much it isn't a big problem to cook up a big pot of a simple sauce and freeze it in smaller portions for use in pasta, chicken parmesan or lasagna. I probably would not use this sauce again, because it is acidic and it just doesn't have the flavor of a homemade sauce, although it is closer than a run of the mill bottled sauce.But for people who are pressed for time, I can see the need for a product like this, to help speed up the process of making a more complicated dish. And the ingredients are impressive, so it is a better choice than a sauce laden with chemicals and preservatives.
summary: Good ingredients and healthy, but pretty acidic

reviewText: This is a decent product, a step up from most canned sauces.  The bag allows you to microwave right in it, or you can open it and heat it in a pan.The sauce itself is pretty tasty, with nice chunks of fresh tasting tomatoes with pieces of garlic and spices.I prefer to toss mine with my cooked pasta and serve that way, and in this respect this product disappoints a bit.  The product information says that the bag contains 3 servings. Using this there is barely enough sauce to adequately coat your macaroni.If you are serving more than 2 people you would have to use more than one bag, which can be a pain.  Perhaps a family sized bag shall come later?I think this would be good for travelers, college students, or if you are packing food for a trip, otherwise I'd prefer the tested and proven glass jar.
summary: Better than canned, but not as good as home

reviewText: They really are more like crackers than pita chips.  They do have a good texture.  But I really didn't like the flavor of these.  They were reminiscent of the herbs they use in pizza sauce.  I don't think I'd buy them again.  I do usually like things like this, but these just weren't for me.

After the local work coffee pot was removed in favor of a Keurig single cup brewer, I had tried a few different varieties of dark roast coffee looking for something I really enjoyed.  I tried a few varieties of Green Mountain and Tilly's coffees; all were OK, but nothing memorable.Then I picked up a box of the Barista Prima Italian Roast.  Wow!  Intense roasted smoky flavor, strong enough that I can brew a 10-oz cup and still be happy with the flavor.  But no issues with acidity or bitterness.  Barista Prima Italian is now my go-to K-Cup.  I do wish it was a bit less expensive, but that said I have no problem paying more for a coffee this good.(Note that are a few newer K-Cups that I'd like to try out, including the dark roasts from Starbucks and Martinson.  I'll update this review as warranted.)

My little one has always had trouble with the spitting up, so when I started supplementing, it only got worse.  I got this stuff b/c I thought it might help and I really didn't notice much of a difference at first (even with a slow transition) but after about a week, once she was used to this and on it completely, it cut the spit ups from like 5-8 per feeding to 3-4 per feeding.  So it is an improvement a little, but it didn't stop the spitting up completely.  Overall, it's more expensive for a little bit of an improvement, but after speaking to my doctor, ruling out allergies, etc. I was told that some babies just spit up more than others and there isn't a whole lot you can truly to do fix that, so for me this stuff wash kinda a wash.

This is an excellent sauce, requiring no additional ingredients. On those occasions when I purchase jar sauce, I usually devote some effort to doctoring it up to our liking. This sauce is naturally sweet, and the natural sweetness comes from concentrated carrot juce! What could be better than that?This sauce is a nutritional powerhouse with great flavor and a great time-saver. I've used it on spaghetti, and think it would be great to use simmering chicken in a crock pot!The natural sweetness and lack of acidity frequently found in packaged sauces makes this a favorite with kids who tried it.If you can't make it yourself, make it Ragu Fresh & Simple Smooth Pasta Sauce, Traditional Tomato Basil. I guarantee that you won't be disappointed.

We are a pasta family.  I tend to purchase both regular Barilla pasta & Aldi's pasta.  I purchase all varieties, but I am not a fan of whole wheat pasta because the I do not like the flavor & texture of any brand of wheat pasta.Barilla's Penne Plus pasta doesn't share the same bland and cardboard-y characteristics of wheat pasta & is quite edible & usable in a variety of dishes.I used most of my Penne Plus in a baked casserole.  It boiled up well - didn't stick to the pot when I forgot to stir - and held its shape during the bake cycle.I saved a little bit for a small pasta salad. Given that the pasta boiled well & tasted good plain (after resting in my colander), I think that it will make a nice base for a pasta salad.Great product.  I look forward to buying it in the future.

this I buy for my husband he loves this product from Dinty Moore...and being a one serving is disappointing to him because he loves it so much but it is best when you have to limit your intake at each meal...flavors are just like Grandmom used to make, chunky wholesome and full of flavor...we serve it with home made garlic bread or onion bread..(which is made with toasted bread slices with margarine and garlic powder or onion powder placed under a broiler to make crispy) we also reverse this and place the bread under the stew as cooked above ....or open a torpedo roll toasted and dig out the center of the roll and have it as a boat type meal many ways to enjoy this stew, indeed.

I found a wad of animal fur baked into these crackers. Fortunately, I opened the bag and poured it out in a bowl before eating any. There were 5 crackers stuck together with a mass of animal fur - looks like a mouse. Soooo disgusting.

THE TASTE WAS ADDICTIVE BECAUSE IT WAS FRESH, SWEET, AND SALTY- BUT IF YOU ARE SOMEONE WHO HAS PROBLEMS WITH SALT/FLUID RETENTION YOU PROBABLY SHOULD EAT THIS SPARINGLY.  I am 60 yrs old AND I did not listen to my son warning me to stop eating so much of it- I ATE THE WHOLE BAG and needless to say had 'balloon legs' later.  SO A NO SALT VERSION WOULD BE BETTER FOR 'PLUMP ELDERLY TRAIL MIX LOVERS'.  The rest of my snack supply is now 'off limits' to me.  This great trail mix should be reserved for younger, healthier nibblers who do not have water retention or blood pressure issues- maybe rinsing it off and drying it would help.

I usually make spaghetti sauce from scratch, and the results can be in consistent. Also, sometimes if you're in a hurry or making a big dinner, it's nice to have a short cut, so I decided to try Ragu Traditional Old World Style pasta sauce. This is a smooth sauce with a rich flavor and no high fructose corn syrup, and it was ready in just a couple of minutes. You could also supplement the sauce by adding onions, vegetables, etc. This is packaged well, in plastic, and is large enough for a family dish at an affordable price.Very good.
way way too sweet, how can one eat this.discarded the entire box.what a waste of money.will never again buy this.

Very good tasting animal crackers.  Not super crunchy ones, if that's what you prefer, but just a little bit soft like the actual animal crackers that come in the little circus box.  Big bags too.  Very good price for what you get.

Well, I bet that all of you have already had oatmeal some time in your life. I had my first oatmeal 10 years ago. Flavor-wise, it doesn't change over the years. If you want to be healthy, skip your Mc Donald and have oatmeal instead. Obviously, oatmeal isn't as tasty as a Big Mac, but you'll have 3 flavors to alternate!!! There're some dried fruit in the oatmeal, and I think it's sufficient for a quick meal. However, if you want a "good" oatmeal, you can always add more fresh fruit. Nothing to crave nor complain about this product. It's simply oatmeal.
Love this product and enjoy the varied selection. This makes having a great selection of healthy snacks on hand much easier.

These olives look and smell great. Nice assortment of olives with visible spices. They are packaged really well and come in their own storage container. The biggest problem is they are terribly salty. Maybe rinsing them in vinegar would help but it seems to defeat the purpose of buying marinated/spiced olives. I'm going to have to think of some bland foods to serve them with but I won't be buying them again.

I'm soon to be a mother of 3 and my two younger children both enjoyed Enfamil Formulas. Enfamil ProSobee Soy Infant Formula (with Iron) is a milk/lactose -free formula for children or families who have a history of lactose intolerance. It's extremely versatile and mixes well with cereal and oatmeal like all Enfamil/Enfagrow formulas.The Enfamil ProSobee Soy Infant Formula is for babies ages 0-12months. Like All Enfamil formulas It has extra DHA and Iron vitamins and helps support better growth, brain & eye development as well as immune system development. So your baby won't be losing out on any of the great essential vitamins and minerals needed for healthy development.Enfamil ProSobee Soy is also a great alternative for babies who experience a lot of gas or colic so find what's best for your baby. I would definitely recommend this formula to anyone with a special little baby.
summary: A Wonderful Alternative to Milk based Formulas!

reviewText: Well I never tried the hot and I have to tell you -it is HOT-it will really put in a nice flavor-like the 2 pack like thisGo very sparingly with the hot- the regular is mild and flavorful

Avoid all non-Organic soy products like the plague. roundup ready soy also is sprayed directly with roundup which is in the ground up soy flour as well. This combination does not bode well for the health of anyone who ingests it and has been shown by numerous third party studies to cause terrible health issues.Bottom Line this stuff is unfit for human consumption! (check out gmoevidence dot com)ALWAYS do your own research when feeding your children, I leave you with a quotation from Dr. Swanson, a scientist studying the effects of Glyphosate (Roundup):"The endocrine disrupting properties of glyphosate can lead to reproductive problems: infertility, miscarriage, birth defects, and sexual development. Fetuses, infants and children are especially susceptible because they are continually experiencing growth and hormonal changes. For optimal growth and development, it is crucial that their hormonal system is functioning properly.The endocrine disrupting properties also lead to neurological disorders (learning disabilities (LD), attention deficit hyperactive disorder (ADHD), autism, dementia, Alzheimer's, schizophrenia and bipolar disorder). Those most susceptible are children and the elderly."
summary: GMO soy product is poisoned with roundup

reviewText: It's a lot of tea!  Be careful unless you need tea for 6 months or so don't buy this.  Otherwise good product and price.

I will say this, the licorice is very flavorful, however, it is really hard to gnaw on. Maybe we got a not so fresh pack. Maybe we're use to softer licorice. To be honest, my sons and I prefer Lucky Country flavored Australian licorice more. That licorice is juicy, soft, and more flavorful than Newman's Own.

This Lipton Decaffeinated Green Tea is on the lite side, with no real overpowering flavors to detract from the subtle citrus undertones. We are heavy tea drinkers and always looking to try new flavors, and this one was a nice change.This makes one cup per one tea bag and does need to steep longer than most to get to the strength I like. This can also be enjoyed hot or cold, but I prefer it hot at night.Recommended!CFH

I don't like the burnt flavor of a coffee thats roasted too long, so I love the mild flavor of this medium roast. If you like coffee beans that are cooked/roasted a long time, don't buy this, otherwise you'll love it.

I thought this syrup would be better. I get Starbuck's iced and hot mochas and still nothing can compete. This mocha syrup is good, but not any better than Hersheys. Hershey has a dark chocolate syrup that I highly recommend. Can't go wrong with buying this syrup, but don't expect to be blown away by it.
summary: Thought it would be better.....but still good

reviewText: The rice and lentils seem really healthy, but they're so thick that my daughter would choke on them every time. There are also several ingredients - apples and carrots, in addition to the rice and lentils. We finally started mixing a jar of rice and lentils with an equal amount of winter squash, sweet potatoes or carrots, just to make it easier for her to eat. She likes them now, but they are a really gross color, unlike the other Earth's Best foods, which look much more appetizing.

I like this seasoning even better than McCormick's Buffalo Wing seasoning. Now I'm not saying it even comes close to real, honest-to-goodness barbecue because it absolutely is NOTHING like that, however it does taste really good- kind of a spicy bbq taste - and it's easy to use. You just coat the chicken pieces with it and throw it in your preheated oven.I put the pieces on a foil covered cookie sheet, spray the foil with a non-stick spray and clean up is super easy as well. I've used this with boneless chicken tenders, wings and legs and always had good results. However, as with McCormick's Buffalo Wing mix, this also tends to brown/burn easily if you try to use your broiler or your outdoor grill.Bottom line: This tastes good and is a great mix to use when you're in a hurry or don't feel like taking alot of time in the kitchen. You can do it in the oven which I think takes about 25 minutes or so (less with boneless)so you aren't having to hover over the stove or grill.

Great taste.  Wholesome.  I was disappointed by the expiration being just six months from purchase date.  However, I don't know if that's standard in the industry.  Remember, you can take whol milk and stretch it with water if necessary to expand the value.  Moreover, this is in boxed form and doesn't require refridgeration!

Cheez-It Zingz Wafer Chipotle are pretty good.  At first bite I was tasting bacon (from the salt and added smoke flavor), not a bad thing but unexpected. The spice build slightly as you go.  They are a little spicy but not much, they could have been spicier.  If you like Cheez-It and mild spicy smoke flavor you may like these but they are probably not going to be what you expect if you are just going off the name.
summary: More of a midly spciy smoke flavor than chipotle

reviewText: I stumbled onto Manuka Honey a couple years back and I was really blown away by all of the claims that were being made about this honey. My family eats a lot of honey and we have really made serious changes to our diets in recent years. We no longer eat processed food, get all of our meats & produce from organic CSA farms and we are constantly on the look out for ways to further improve our diets. After reading about Manuka Honey, I simply had to give it a try. The brand I ordered was Wedderspoon Active 16+.To say that I was impressed is a massive understatement. It was the best honey I have ever had. On top of that, my wife used it when her eczema acted up and it worked better than her prescription lotions. We basically became die hard Manuka Honey fans and would panic when our supply started to get low. I recently went to Wedderspoon to place an order and I noticed they now had Organic Manuka Honey available. Well, it took me all of 2 seconds to decide to buy some. We try and buy organic every chance we get so this was a no brainer. I often describe Manuka Honey as liquid gold. Not only does it taste amazing, it also has anti-fungal and anti-bacterial properties. Now its offered in an Organic version. Food doesn't get much better than this.The first thing we did when we received it was a blind taste test. I gave it to my wife and she gave it to me. We were curious if we would be able to tell the difference between the two. We both wound up having to guess as the taste was identical. We simply couldn't tell the difference between the two. If you were to pour this into my regular Manuka Bottle, I would never have been able to tell the difference. Basically one of the best foods on earth just got that much better! If you like the non organic version of this honey then you will definitely like the organic version.I cant possibly give Wedderspoon Manuka Honey a higher recommendation and that goes for both the standard edition and the organic edition. Both are amazing products!5 Stars!!
I don't know what the problems from other customers.  I loved it!!  I wish I could order more of it using Amazon Prime.

Pumpkin seeds contain an oil that suppresses the chemicals that cause hair loss and prostate problems, so can be eaten not only for snack, but for prevention, Braga seeds taste best of any others that I purchased from Amazon; probably due to the organic growing process. They come in heavy-duty resealable bags.

Ragu has always been my go-to sauce for making pasta. On occasion I get the organic specialty sauce for Trader Joes, make my own, or buy a generic brand on the fly (always a disappointment), but for a must have item I usually have one of these jars in my cabinet for that moment of what-am-I-going-to-feed-the-kids panic. Overall my family enjoys the taste, I do add a few extra spices, namely oregano and garlic, and a little bit of water to loosen it up a little since I think it's a bit thick. Throw in a couple meatballs while you heat up the sauce and it makes it especially tasty! There is a line of different Ragu flavors (Garlic & Onion, Tradition, Mushroom, etc.), but for some reason I can't taste the difference between any of them.The packaging from Amazon is really good. Four jars in a box with spacers, so the plastic jars don't bounce around. Overall I'm quite pleased with Ragu.
summary: A must have staple in your cabinet. Can't go wrong.
