reviewText: At first I thought vegetable flavored tea was not going to be good tasting but I have been pleasantly surprised.  These are every bit as flavorful as the many other teas (including the various fruit flavored teas).  I tried the cabbage/beet flavor tea first because that sounded like the worst of the flavors but it was really good.  I first tried it with no sweetener and though it was acceptable, I added a full teaspoon of honey and that really made it quite good.The colors are wonderful and I think these vegetable flavored teas are unusual and very drinkable.  On the box it says that these teas are Kosher and also accepted by the Islamic religion. The company seems to be highly environmentally concerned, even using soy ink on the box.  Also, the tea bags are very biodegradable and I toss them in the compost bucket when finished with them.
summary: Numi Organic Savory Tea Garden Pack

reviewText: I love Pop Chips and had been odering the variety pack.  However, there were some flavors in the variety pack that I didn't particularly care for, so I decided to branch out.  This is my first time trying this flavor.  While okay, they are not as good as I had originally thought.  I'm working my way through them, but will probably not order this flavor in the future.

Five stars because the taste is great. The one thing I want in a sauceare good taste. The date shows it is not old nor has it been sitting long.I have reordered for a third time. I recommend this product..

Bigelow Spiced Chai (pronounced ch-I, as in the world child without the ld ending) Tea does not disappoint. Having previously tried and enjoyed Bigelow Vanilla Chai Tea, I discovered that Bigelow had another  variety called "Spiced Chai." I looked to see what blend of spices it had, but found only the following: Black Tea, Spices, Natural Flavors. This further peaked my curiousity. I bought a box and eagerly awaited my first cup. I prepared it in the traditional Indian way, slowly took my first sip savoring the flavorful and tasty blend of ...well... just exactly what blend of spices are in Bigelow Spiced Chia Tea?  Who can say for sure, but after visiting the Bigelow Tea Blog on the Bigelow website and reading a blog entry entitled "The Mysteries of Chai Tea Revealed" by Julie, I would say that it is likely a mix of black tea, ginger, cardamom, cloves, peppercorn, nutmeg and cinnamon.Here are the Bigelow directions for making chai tea:*Quick Method: Pour boiling water over one tea bag in a 6 - 8 oz cup or mug. Allow to steep 2 - 4 minutes. Add a dollop of milk and sweeten to taste. For iced Chai, prepare product hot with milk and sweetener - then pour over ice.*Authentic method: For each 8 oz cup, place one tea bag in a saucepan with 3/4 cup of water (6 fl oz) and 1/4 cup of milk (2 fl oz). Bring to a rolling boil, lower heat and simmer 2 - 4 minutes. Pour into cup(s) and sweeten with sugar or honey. Traditional Indian Chai is served quite sweet.I prefer to use vanilla flavored liquid coffee creamer in my Bigelow Chai Tea and I sweeten it with stevia packets.
summary: Excellent blend of spices; RECIPE for traditional Indian chai tea

reviewText: I had never previously heard of or seen this brand, but when I saw these listed as a lightning deal here on Amazon, I decided to try a box of them. I've tried multiple other granola bars of similar flavor; Clif Bar, Kind bar, both make a similar flavor in their bar. This one bests both of them by far in terms of taste. The ingredient list is simple and relatively healthy compared to most normal on-the-shelf bars. But aside from the great ingredients, the real reason I'd recommend this is just the taste, plain and simple. The competing flavor in Clif and Kind, both of them certainly taste good. But I don't find myself actively craving them like I do with these Earnest bars.I'm glad I was able to get the first box super cheap, otherwise I likely never would have tried these because the price per bar at normal cost is more than I am used to paying. Now I can see why though, and I will certainly be buying a couple more boxes of their other flavors to give them a shot as well.
summary: Way more delicious than most other granola bars

reviewText: I love this flavor, especially when a little in plain water makes me drink more. I add this to my Soda Stream sparkling water and the flavor is better than the Soda Stream flavors that come with the machine. No off or after taste = yum.

Sun Maid raisins are the best brand of raisins on your grocer's shelf--period. These raisins are rather healthy for you. There is no fat, no cholesterol and almost zero sodium to boot! They offer fiber and potassium and that's good, too.However, this food is not an invariable substitute for a vitamin or other fruits with fiber, minerals and vitamins. They are relatively high in sugar (29 grams per 1/4 cup) and they lack vitamins. I'll have to take off one star for that.However, if you want a healthy snack or something to add to your breakfast cereal or oatmeal, these raisins are excellent. They taste great and they are far better than any candy to sweeten your food. Moreover, Amazon correctly notes that the raisins do not require refrigeration nor do they bruise or spoil easily.These raisins are great for persons everywhere who prefer to feed their children fruits as a substitute for candy. They are perfect for people who want to sweeten their food with something 100% natural, too. These 1.5-ounce cartons provide us all with a healthy snack; and that's a huge plus.Highly recommended--to life!

Desani Pink Lemonade Drops may be “Naturally Flavored With Other Natural Flavors”, what ever that means, but it is definitely not naturally sweetened. Dasani uses Sucralose or “Splenda” to sweeten this product, which leaves an aftertaste that stays with you for hours after consuming the flavored water.  It also contains several other chemical preservatives as listed in the product photo - Acesulfame Potassium, Sucrose Acetate Isobutyrate, Medium Chain Triglycerides, Potassium Benzoate and Potassium Sorbate (to protect taste) as well as artificial coloring, so this product may not be appropriate for health conscious individuals.The flavor isn’t bad, I guess it is similar to Country Time or Crystal Light, and you can vary the strength based on the amount you squirt into the water. I really don’t mind the taste of the product; just the lingering aftertaste that lasts for hours after the water is consumed. I think I will pass on Desani Drops.
summary: It SQUIRTS, not drops, and contains Sucralose which leaves an aftertaste.

reviewText: Tastes just like ginger ale's such as Canada Dry, but a bit more crisp in taste and you actually taste the ginger in it. Plus, no calories in a natural way for once! Not going back to sodas with corn syrup in them.
I gave this a 5-star rating for the wonderful taste and a nice coffee to enjoy after dinner meal. Will recommend to friends and family
summary: Gloria Jeans K-Cup Butter Toffee Coffee K-Cup

reviewText: Love this Sauce. Taste is perfect, I use this Sauce with so many food but mostly with macaroni cheese so Go for it. Best Sauce...!!!
Not worth the money, small bags of chips, the flavors are not very good; was definitely a rip-off. Will not buy again.

These are the same mushrooms that come sliced in soup and other dishes when you order Chinese take-out.  They are delicious.  These mushrooms rehydrate very quickly, have a more neutral taste than other mushrooms so they won't overpower your dishes, and the water left over from the re-hydration process can go into soup for extra flavor.  Nothing is wasted here.  Also, these are not little pieces.  They are the whole mushroom.  These are $13.95 for 3 ounces where I shop in a little cellophane bag.  I won't pay that, so when I saw these at this price for a whole pound, I ordered 8 bags.  They come well sealed in a heavy plastic bag, so they will keep well.  I like them in omelets.  It's a steal of a price.  Go Amazon!

This is one of the cheaper organic sugar options on Amazon.  You get about the same quantity per dollar as you would with the other brands here on Amazon.  I am not a connoisseur of organic sugars.  It tastes good to me, but then again, I probably couldn't discern the difference between this brand and another brand in a blind taste test.  Minus one star because I don't like the packing - it doesn't seal.
Good flavor, enjoyed by the grand babies as well as myself as a light healthy snack
They're quite good for an organic product.  Are they worth the extra cost over the heavily processed junk on the store shelves?  Every penny.
summary: They're organic, they're crackers, they're good, not much else to say

reviewText: This company makes several bars and the textures of them varies greatly. This one is like a cake brownie with a few almonds in it and it's delicious. I've got these on auto-delivery because it's a healthy snack I can use when I don't have time for a meal.
summary: Like a Brownie without the guilt!

reviewText: I cooked this up the day it arrived, as it went perfectly with the meal I was preparing at the time.  It was super easy - just add water, a tablespoon of butter, and pop it in a glass bowl in the microwave for 12 minutes.  I was able to time it to be ready the same time my oven main dish was ready, and both went onto the table hot and ready to serve.  The consensus from my family was that the rice is delicious!  I had hoped the Chipotle flavor would come with a little spicy hot as well but for those who don't like heat, this is perfect because there was non detectable.  As a quick and easy side dish, this can't be beat.
This takes the place of a microwave meal and has 220 calories.  I eat it with crackers.  It stores for a long time and is stackable so it takes up little space.  Good for dieters.

I am all in favor of eating healthy snacks, but I want them to taste good too. These snacks are okay if you crave something crunchy but taste wise they are not as good as the real thing. I will eat what I ordered but I am not if I will order more.

The twists are wonderfully soft and chewy, and they stick in your teeth in a good way. However, the mix of licorice and pomegranate flavor is strangely medicinal, and the twists aren't really sweet enough for my tastes. Still, they're a bit addictive, which makes it impossible to give them a one-star rating.

Chocolate and healthy just doesn't mix well. These bars are no different. And at 190 calories for one bar (and the bar is actually way smaller than the wrapper)  it's just not worth it, especially if it doesn't even taste all that great. These bars have a consistency of the fake, Little Debbie brownies, mixed with an earthy, dirt texture, and just a hint of bird food. The actual chocolate flavor is very masked and the almonds are completely tasteless.  There is almost no redeaming quality for them, aside from the fact that I've actually eaten far worse chocolate bars. There are FAR better, healthy alternatives for chocolate lovers who actually want something good out of their indulgence. South Beach Living Fiber Fit Mocha Granola Bars are pretty much the best one's I've eaten in the healthy category. At least they actually taste delicious AND have fiber. However, for the vegans and vegetarians in the world out there, these Pure Bars are certainly edible and like I said, better than some I've had. For the other population that actually want a good tasting snack alternative, buy something else.
summary: They may be natural, and the bad thing is- it tastes that way.

reviewText: Buying the individual serving coffees gets expensive.  I took a random sample of the first few things in Google, and then on the Keurig website.Sears: 18-count - $12 - $66 per 100 cupsStaples: 16-count - $12 - $75 per 100 cupsKeurig: 24-count - $16.49 - $69 per 100 cupsKeurig: 24-count - $18.49 - $77 per 100 cupsMelitta E-Filer: 5-count (x20 uses per filter) - $6.92 - $7 per 100 cupsWhen the 20 or so uses - some have extended beyond 20 - are exhausted, rinse and recycle.  The cups are sturdy with a little latch that keeps its structure well enough after usage and rinsing.  They do stain a little bit, however.The volume of 2 tablespoons provides enough flavor for a decent cup, but the stronger you require the more you have to pack it in.  Pretty obvious.  Also, filling it is obviously less convenient and messier than the actual K-cup.Overall this is a great product for the coffee addict who wants to save money.  The potential savings is quite impressive.  Take a 2-cup-a-day person.  They're going to save $400-$500 per year.  That is nothing to sneeze at, especially when many users have gone beyond 20 uses per filter.Other than the potentially weaker cup (some other reusable cups hold >2 tablespoons), I don't really see the downside.

Newman's Own Pomegranate Licorice has a very pleasant bite, both in texture and flavor. The twists are robust in size, not chewy, but rather have a snappiness in texture that creates good mouth feel. There is no oily residue coating the mouth after eating a twist. The flavor of the candy is almost tart, very pleasing. Thoroughly enjoyed this as a mid-afternoon treat!

I love poptarts. They've always been a staple in my household. As a child they were among my favorite breakfast food, and now my kiddies love them for an easy camping and outdoors snack. I purchased this collection when I saw how affordable they were, and how they offered up a nice variety- so each kid could have the kind they wanted.This big box comes with four smaller boxes inside. These boxes are your typical 'twelve count boxes' that you would by at a grocery store. There are two boxes of cherry, one of bluberry, and one of strawberry. The tarts themselves come in your typical poptart packages. Two tarts in one package. For children I find this serving to be a bit big. Toddlers and elementary aged kids will usually only eat one. But older kids and teenagers can easily eat two tarts (sometimes two packages!).For people unfamiliar with poptarts, they are basically fruit tarts with a very sugary pie crust. These tarts happen to have a frosting and sprinkles on them. Children love them, and as an adult I'll admit I crave them from time to time as well. The reason I rate these 4 stars is because I find them to be lacking filling. There are other brands of prepackaged fruit tarts that have a bit more filling, and that's something I really enjoy. Poptart brand has a thicker crust and a thinner filling, which I'm not the biggest fan of. Even so- all children seem to adore poptarts!Because they are 'non perishable' we like to take them on plane trips, camping, on picnics, and I also use them for daytime camp activities for local children. They are always a huge hit. I find that kids tend to prefer the blueberry and strawberry. Which kind of leaves me with a lot of leftover cherry- considering I recieve two boxes of cherry and other one of the other kinds. I, myself, am not a huge fan of cherry either. That's the only real downfall to this box.Other than that I think it's a great bulk buy. The boxes easily stack, which makes them easy to store away. And they're so delicious that I don't need to store them for long anyways. The poptarts came in good condition- no broken ones or crumbs. So I'm pretty happy!

So, these cups work well, and allow one to brew coffee in a Keurig machine much more cheaply than with a disposable k-cup.  They are easy to fill, easy to use, and easy to clean- just dump the grinds and rinse.  All of this stuff is great.  Where I still have some questions is on how one knows exactly when the utility of these cups is used up?  The packaging says they are good for 20 uses.  I don't really foresee myself keeping a running count of how many cups I've brewed.  Will they start to look ratty, like a sponge?  Do they start to degrade at the 20-use mark?  I haven't reached 20 uses yet, and I'm not really sure what the answers to these questions are.  When I get there, I will update- I've only been using them for a week or so.  In the meantime, I can certainly say that these work nicely at the beginning of their life, and they are easy and quick.

I enjoyed the taste of these cookies. They aren't as sweet as the regular Keebler Chocolate Chip cookies. The cookies have a tendency to crumble easily. I like the fact they are made with less preservatives and additives. The resealable package is definitely an improvement over the older packaging. Worth buying again.
Very good, and so convenient to just go online and have it delivered.  I like the bigger bag it saves me some money.  Every little bit helps you know.  :)
summary: Eigh O'Clock French Roast Whole Bean Coffee  36 oz Bag

reviewText: After reading the Grain Brain book we have been on gluten free food.  Actually the transition was very easy from wheat to gluten free.  I had no idea they had so many tasty non-gluten flours and baking mixes out there.I made the sour cream coffee cake on the back of this Pamela's Ultimate Baking and Pancake Mix and it is delicious. I did run out of this and decided to go to the store and get gluten free bisquick. Used the same recipe and was so disappointed that I had used bisquick. It can not compare with this brand.  This is 100 per cent better than the bisquick.  I was so happy when Amazon was offering it 4 pounds bags pack of 3.  I was really saving the money. 1 lb bag at Walmart for bisquick was almost $5.00 plus it is inferior to this brand.I also use this for quick bread recipes - Any recipes that are made with gluten free bisquick just substitute this brand and it will be delicious! I go on the internet and find endless delicious recipes.
summary: Much Better than Gluten free Bisquick

reviewText: Easy, quick, and addicting. Perfect snack to keep in the diaper bag or the hiking pack, Got them on a whim and now do the subscribe and save.
summary: Better than Fruit Roll Ups for Grown-ups.

reviewText: I make cookd egg noodles with sour cream and poppy seeds.  Yum.  I need to find more uses for the seeds.

This is a favorite in my family. Every time my Mother visits someone with a Keurig, this is her drink of choice. Everyone in our family likes this. It is sweet, slightly spicy and creamy. I still buy this.
summary: I have to keep some of this in the kitchen. Everyone in the family loves it.

reviewText: A relative gave me a can of this cocoa as a Christmas stocking stuffer last year. This has a slightly spicy kick to it and isn't too sweet.  It's definitely not the bland, sugary syrup that I had when I was a kid.I haven't had hot cocoa in many years but now I'm hooked. This has real cocoa. I bought this on a subscription plan; it is that good.  I prefer it with skim milk.If you haven't had hot cocoa in awhile, you should give this a try.
summary: Wow!  This certainly isn't Nestles Hot Cocoa.

reviewText: I bought this tea because I really wanted to try a green tea and was afraid I wouldn't like the taste. Blueberry sounded good, so I picked it up. I've bought at least 10 boxes since! It's wonderful...very flavorful without being overpowering or too sweet. I even like to steep it and drink it room temperature. I gave some to my mother when she was over and now she's hooked. Very recommended

I am on a low carb, low fat, high protein diet.  These are my "go to" snacks.  One takes care of my hunger for up to 2 hours, 2 with a piece of cheese makes for a great lunch on the go.  The don't need refrigeration.  They do come in a very large package, I divide them up into zip baggies and keep some in my desk at work and in my car.  Great price, great flavor, great quality, good nutrition.

I LOVE really good REAL maple syrup and Grade B is my FAVORITE!  Our Saturday morning family tradition is to make homemade waffles, so this syrup makes an appearance weekly at our house.  It has a stronger flavor than Grade A, as most Grade Bs do.  Good deal for the size!!

We have tried numerous syrups and fruit products for pancakes and waffles but nothing matches the flavor of real maple.The Highland Sugarworks brand is 100% Grade B Maple Syrup.  Grade B is darker and has a more robust flavor.  It is excellent for bake goods as well as crisp, golden brown waffles.  Most importantly it tastes great!The packaging was good and shipping prompt.

These are real meat, not that terrible tasting slim-jim jerky fake meat garbage... From the very first bite the taste from these old wisconsin snack sticks is ooooh sooooo satisfying for any meaty snack craving you might get. MmmmmmmOld wisconsin is the only meat for me...  YUM!
My son loves this stuff.  He will add leftovers - like pork chop cut up small, or chicken, whatever, and he has a meal.  Very nice, thank you.

Though these Jumbo Dark Fudge Sticks have three layers of chocolate--chocolate-flavored sugar wafers, chocolate creme filling, and a fudge-flavored shell--somehow the end product has a rather muted chocolate flavor.  The sugar wafers on their own have a nice cocoa-y taste and the creme isn't too bad either, but both get lost in the overly-sweet, waxy fudge shell which sticks to the tongue and teeth...and not in a good way.  Plus, the fudge shell melts very easily, so if you want to take a few of these sticks along as a treat while out and about, do it on a cool day, otherwise the sticks will turn into fudge puddles.  Even just the heat of your hand while holding a stick will make the fudge melt, which in itself isn't a terrible thing.  But why make the coating so waxy if it's not going to resist a bit of melting?  Wouldn't that be the whole point of making the coating waxy?At 170 calories, 9 grams fat (6 grams of that saturated), 0 mg cholesterol, and 14 grams sugar per serving, which is one bar of approx. 5" x 1" x 3/4", these numbers are pretty comparable to a serving of some other sweet such as cookies.  And the ingredient list isn't too deadly either, with pretty basic and pronounceable items, although it does include partially hydrogenated palm kernel oil, artificial flavors, and artificial coloring (why?).  In the end, as an occasional snack, these Fudge Sticks would be okay except for the rather dull flavor.  Which kinda defeats the purpose of eating something labeled not once, not twice, but three times as being "fudge."
summary: Surprisingly, not quite as chocolate-y as I expected.

reviewText: These are delicious. I subscribe to them. I can never have just one bowl, must have two at a time.Hint: Don't put the whole spice packet in.. I only put in a quarter and it's still very spicy. If you work in a office with a coffee pot that is attached to water, you can make those with that hot water and they will instantly start to soften in about 10 seconds.

I always liked puddings.  Now that you can buy them prepared, you save time.  The taste is good.  And you get a substantial amount of calcium, as they are made with whole milk.  That is why I bought Hunts snack pack--it doesn't need to be refrigerated.  It is good for school lunches and with any on the go meal.  The flavors are popular.  And they cost less than the refrigerated Jello brand, without compromising my taste.  I recommend this size pack for all pudding lovers who don't have a lot of spare time.

We did not like these.  We've been eating Triscuits for years (we love the slightly salted variety) but these were a real let down.  I don't even know how to explain the taste.  Definitely on the sweet side and the flavoring completely overshadowed any wheat flavor from the cracker and it's topping (we tried them with cheese, with tuna fish and with hummus).
summary: I'll stick with the other flavors.

reviewText: I have tried other products made by these people, to be specific the one with the chimp on the label, the bat and the rainforest.  In all previous cases, none of them had the flavor I expected due to the label of the product.  But finally, a chocolate bar by them that tastes exactly as it's described!  I can strongly taste some sort of cat, I assume a black panther based on the label when I bite into each and every bit of this delicious chocolate.  Don't get me wrong, as far as chocolate goes the chimp one, the bat one and the rainforest ones all were good..AS CHOCOLATE.  But the Chimpanzee one had no chimp flavor, nor the bat one any bat flavor.  And in no way at all did the rainforest one taste like a tree, or any compost caused by leaves rotting around a tree base, or anything else that might remind me of a forest.  But this..this very much has the strong gamey taste of a feline!  The fuzzy chunks within the chocolate, the fuzz from the animal fur (I assume) are a nice bonus!  Oddly enough there was no mention of black panther or any other feline in the ingredient listing.  But I can tell by the taste and texture, this very much includes cat meat, very much includes cat fur.Finally, they get it right!
The combination of bittersweet chocolate and chocolate liquor make this certified gluten-free chocolate bar delicious.  The only flaw is that it contains soy  -- of unknown, likely GMO, origin.
I love this as a replacement in many of my family's cooked meals. In the slow cooker, the flavor is enhanced with any meal!

I have been the blessed recipient of the most amazing eggplant parmesan recipe on this planet! The recipe takes three non-stop hours in the kitchen to make and it is so worth it.When my friend gave me the recipe, she said that there are two specific ingredients that are a "must" and that is why it is a knock-your-socks-off killer recipe. The smoked paprika was one of them.So, I turned to Amazon to see what you all have said about smoked paprika and which one I should get because this dish was going to be the "star of the show" at a dinner party and I wanted a good one.Oh, ba-by! This smoked paprika is smokin'!Not only did I use it to make my EP dish, but I have since used it in some regular standby dishes (such as a bean, kale and sausage soup) and it put that recipe into orbit! Now I won't make it without the smoked paprika!You gotta get it! It will take a recipe over the top to the next level and you will be so delighted. Keep in mind that while just a bit is a good thing, don't over do, so keep taste testing. You'll be so glad you did. Let me know!
This product works great in making my basic flour blends for baking bread.  I can keep a batch made up all the time.

I love that these fit in my cuisinart brand keurig k-cup brewer. when i first received them, i wasn's sure, because there is a filter on the bottom instead of a plastic cup. i like not having to throw away the plastic cups and these work just as well and make a great cup.
summary: best deal - best for the environment

reviewText: yummy

These are my (and my husband's) favorite date.  We were ordering them via Subscribe and Save.  No more, however.  Bergin Nut has raised the price by $10.00.  We were paying $25 for two (14 oz.) bags.  That is quite a hike in price!
Great flavor. Love the packaging..so much less waste. I like strong coffee and it works for me. Hubby likes milder coffee so he makes a larger cup. He loves it too!!!
summary: Great coffee at a great price.

reviewText: It is closed to impossible to find freeze dried mangoes.  I love these and my children love them too.  Was happy to be able to find these delicious & healthy snacks here on Amazon!  As far as them being made in China, please we can't trust the FDA anymore than we can trust another country!!  Our FDA allows our food supply to be genetically modified without allowing us to know which items they are modifying. They also passed aspartame and splenda when everyone knows that it is poison and slowly killing us.  Really, I have as much faith in products made in China as I do in the U.S.  thanks to the horrible job of our FDA!!!  They can't be trusted for sure.

Okay, we were so excited to try this cereal. We had just ordered koala crunch, and the kidswere just okay with it, but not very impressed. This really hit the spot. We added a it more cinnamon to the cereal, and that seemed perfect to us.
summary: Very good, and passed the kid test!

reviewText: Great tasting coffee, and smells good, they give a lot for the price, should last me at least 2 months :)
This is hands-down the best tasting coconut water I've ever had. Ive tried many different brands but this one definitely takes home the trophy
Why are other coconut waters so terrible. This stuff is great, a nice treat and not nearly as bad for you as a coke or pepsi. But universally ever other coconut water is so god awful.
great for diabetics that want a little sweet with only 5g of sugar per serving...serving is 2.5 per 3.5oz bar.  One bar lasts me a while.
This one is a little weak for my liking.  not bad on the smallest settings.  I do love the fog lifter from them though.

I have 3 children under the age of 8 and work fulltime, so we are always on the go.  The Happymorning product line has helped us immensely, not just in the mornings, but for afternoon snacks as well.  It is an easy way for my kids to grab a healthy snack while completing homework before we rush out the door to afternoon practices.  It is also an easy snack to toss in their lunchboxes and I do not have to worry about what they are eating while at school because they are not going to trade away their favorite snack! The Super Banana in particular is my childrens' favorite - they often fight over the last one!

I purchased this item after seeing the relatively lower sodium compared to noodle soups (~500mg vs. ~2500mg). Good flavor, a little spicy but tolerable. This is a SOUP and not simply a "couscous-in-a-cup", but for those who find it "loose", should drain the liquid while the lid is still on, to yield that "couscous-in-a-cup" result. Great both ways.

These are advertised as "Kids sport chews", "for active kids" and with the slogan "take a bit out of healthy nutrition!".Honestly I have to wonder. Upon opening the package, the most obvious thing about these is that the are doused in sugar -- the ingredients list doesn't use that term, oh no, they call it  "organic evaporated cane juice". The second ingredient is "organic tapioca syrup". Replace that with "sugar" and "corn syrup" and you get an idea of just what's in these. I cannot believe these are really particularly all that much healthier than gummi bears.That said, however, they do taste good. They have a soft texture, with a mild grape juice flavor....but they are still candy. I give the product a four based on taste and texture alone. They are a bit expensive too. Buy these if you want a quick tasty snack that at least appears to be mostly natural. But if you're looking for something good for you or your kids? Avoid it.

I was hesitant about ordering this product based on some ho-hum reviews, but I am so pleased that I did!Finally, I am able to make some microwave popcorn without all the fat and salt, and with assurances that it is USDA Certified Organic!  I used about a teaspoon of coconut oil with about 1/2 cup of popcorn, and made it in the plastic microwave popper sold here on Amazon.  Just that 1/2 cup made a gigantic bowl of popcorn that was probably twice the amount you get in the typical microwave bags.  It makes you realize with a slap in the face how much you've been paying for so long, to get so little!  Doing it this way takes only about two minutes longer than the convenient bags, but you get twice as much at a very small fraction of the price!!Honestly, I am not wild about the coconut oil on the popcorn.  I will probably continue to use it, because of the health benefits of coconut oil, and maybe I'll get used to it in a short time.  If not, I'll consider using nothing or perhaps canola oil or light olive oil.  I just don't know if I can get used to that slightly coconut-y flavor on the popcorn.  And it does add a slight oily-ness too, that I'm not crazy about.  I like my popcorn dry and unsalted, or sometimes with just a tiny bit of sea salt.  If I find, as some have stated in reviews, that a little oil is necessary to get good pops, then perhaps I will spring for a jar of ghee in my local healthfood store. (For those who aren't familiar with ghee, it is clarified butter... they skim off the solids once the butter is melted.  It has a higher smoke point and is loaded with fat!  It is also pretty expensive, although you could make it yourself at home.)  At least the slight oily-ness would have a buttery flavor instead of one that really doesn't complement the popcorn, in my opinion.  I'm sure you could make an entire bowl of popcorn with about 1/8 of a teaspoon of ghee, so the high price and high fat content might be worth the taste.There were some unpopped kernels in the bottom of the bowl, but honestly not that many.  There weren't any "half-popped" ~ which I find yummy but they're probably not good for my digestive tract anyway, so I won't miss them.  If you compared the number of unpopped kernels in my bowl to what you'd find in two bags of commercial microwave popcorn, it would probably be about the same.  So I have nothing to complain about.The popcorn was yummy, and now that I have a truly organic, salt free, low fat snack that's full of fiber, I will be eating popcorn a lot more often.  I have stocked up on it, and when it's gone I'll stock up again.  I'd better be sure to also stock up on dental floss, otherwise my dentist might not be too happy with me at my next cleaning appointment.Thumbs up!!!(Slight warning on the plastic microwave bowl though... it gets EXTREMELY hot and stays hot for a while after you take it out of the microwave!  Use potholders to hold it, or you'll burn your hands like I did... I expected it to have cooled down a bit, but no...)Nordic Ware 60120 Microwaver Popcorn Popper 12 CupAddition January 2012:  I just ordered my second half dozen batch.  I finally figured out the perfect way to make this popcorn, and it has become a staple snack.  I keep the coconut in the fridge, and use a knife to shave off a few pieces to pop a bowl.  Perfect combo is 1/3 cup corn and a few shavings of oil... perfect bowl of popped corn!  The teaspoon I was using in the beginning was too much... that was why my batch was oily and too "coconutty" at first.  Just a few shavings is plenty to pop it, and gives it just a very slight coconut taste (which is delicious).

The one star is for the classy appearance. I bought the double pack of liter bottles. Great packaging and elegant bottle but I'm glad I tried a bottle before gifting the other one.  The perforations on the lid would not break away.  We used a knife to cut beween the perforations. The threads of cap do not match threads of bottle so it just spins around and its a pull off lid.  The oil flavor is way off so If you havnt tasted avocado oil before please know it's supposed to taste fresh and buttery. Try a small bottle of Olivado brand and see what it's supposed to taste like.  This price was too good to be true.  Amazon resolved the return issue emmedietly. That's why I shop Amazon!

Very tasty and about $2/box cheaper on amazon when I bought a 6 pack than individually at my local store. Peanut noodle is much more like the "pad thai" I grew up with than the pad thai flavor which was somewhat icky. The peanut noodle flavor comes with powdered coconut milk as part of the seasoning mix. Quite good for quick lunch (warning: higher calorie). Planning to take some camping, but will empty the take out style box into a ziplock to save space.

200 calories, mostly from nuts and seeds, only 10 grams of digestible carbs, and pretty much everything in it is good for you.  Nice portion control packaging.  It is good out of the package, or with milk or yogurt.  For those of you not carb or gluten sensitive, split it with a friend and sprinkle it over your oatmeal.
I love these A Taste of Thai quick meals, but the Peanut Noodles is a bit too sweet.  Other than that, it is delicious and so quick and easy.  Will buy again.
summary: A little too sweet for my taste

reviewText: It's hard being gluten free and it's even harder finding quick easy dorm friendly food, but this stuff is great. It's delicious and easy and quick to make and virtually no clean up, assuming you count washing a fork and throwing away the carton even worth calling 'clean up' I swear by this stuff. Way better than the dining hall food any day.Update: I'm still loving this stuff. The peanut noodles are my favorite. You just have to make sure if your microwave spins that you fold the top down enough, sometimes they spill over, but I have a very, very small microwave, but it's still delicious food. Really hard to mess up too.

This coffee was drinkable, but I won't buy it again.  Having had pure Kona coffee, this is a pale impersonator.  It may be worth it to buy the real thing if you want Kona Coffee.  I felt this had a strong artificial flavoring taste to it.
summary: Not my favorite cup of coffee

reviewText: When I first tried these, I could not stop eating them! I had to get more, they were so good!! I never knew GF or granola could taste so amazing! You will not regret ordering these delicious bars! So much flavour and just the right amount of sweet!

You could say with some accuracy that I've sampled my fair share of Keebler cookies through the years.  With all the varieties and brands on the market today, the quality of packaged cookies is better than at any time in the past.  When I was offered the opportunity to sample two new styles under the Keebler El Duende brand, I couldn't resist such an offer.  Despite a twist on a traditional flavor profile, with one of the options being lemon based and the other coconut, the cookies themselves left something to be desired.Coconut Cookies (2 1/2 Stars):  These are a traditional wafer type cookie, a thin and rather unexciting no-frills presentation.  The wafer has a decent crunch, reminiscent of most store bought sugar cookies.  In fact, that's what it most reminded me of.  It's like a plain sugar cookie with a hint of coconut.  The flavor was pleasant enough, without being particularly noteworthy.  Like a biscotti, I might choose to sample these with coffee or tea but I don't think I'd have the urge to devour them on their own.  I want something more decadently delicious to expend my calorie count on.  Final Call:  I'd eat one if it was presented to me, but I would not go out of my way to buy them.Lemon Cookie (3 1/2 Stars):  Unlike the coconut choice, the Lemon Cookie is a sandwich type with lemon filling.  The exterior cookies are rather hard and plain shortbread, but the lemon flavor is tasty.  From a texture standpoint, they reminded me of the generic brand of sandwich cookies you might get at a dollar store except filled with lemon.  Once again, though, there was nothing exceptional about them.  I liked them better due to the filling, and am much more likely to indulge.  But would I purchase them to eat a second time.  Sadly the answer is in the negative.  KGHarris, 9/13.
summary: Comparing Two New Keebler El Duende Flavors: A Hint Of Coconut, But Not Much Of An Indulgence

reviewText: But it's not incredibly tasty, either. I'm not a big fan of the Gatorade type sport drinks but thought I would give this a try due to the heat and humidity of summer being upon us--we can all use a bit of replenishment this time of year, right? I like that it only has 10 calories per serving as opposed to lots more in many of those bottled sport drinks.The lemon flavor is very muted--kind of flat tasting. That said, it's easy to drink down without any carbonation and you don't get that 'salty' taste that these type of electrolyte-replacement drinks sometimes have. I'd like to have a little more of the lemon flavoring to make it something I'd really enjoy instead of merely tolerating, though. If I had to sum up my thoughts in two words, it would be, "It's okay."

We love these "fruit strips" (as my 2 year old calls them).What a great snack!  They are delicious and wholesome.  Just fruit, so you don't have to worry about feeding your kids junk.  They are really tasty--mom and dad like them too!  Buying on amazon using the subscribe and save option saves $$ compared to buying similar options at the store.These are my daughter's favorite snack and we are happy to give to her!

These graham crackers are a great alternative to the highly processed grahams that we have had since we were kids. Though my husband was skeptical, we have been trying to gradually improve our choices at the grocery store, and this was yet another experiment. He actually loved them and ate nearly the whole box himself (over time of course!).The rest of the family liked them as well, though they did note a difference, and we actually prefer them. They are slightly "dryer" than the average honey graham, but taste just like them, only a bit more natural and ever so slightly less sweet. The oats are in the cracker yet they are not grainy or rough like some health food alternatives can be. However, they are not a health food by any means, they are still a snack food.These are tasty, as are many of the other Back to Nature products (we also LOVE their cookies) so I would certainly recommend them. Enjoy!
summary: If my HUSBAND loves them, ANYONE can love them!

reviewText: I am not sure if I would recommend it.  Those are the words of my 14 year old son.  To elaborate, it's somewhat bland (it is) but it does have a nice crunch (it does).We got a box of this through the Vine program, and my husband, my oldest son and myself all tried it. We all had the same first reaction...wow, VERY crunchy!  In fact my husband, who is an invisalign patient right now, even joked that if you have braces this might not be the cereal for you.  I do like that it held up to the milk, as I do not like soggy cereal.It is a summer berry blend- Strawberries, raspberries, and blackberries-and the berries are certainly plentiful!  We all liked the strawberries, but I could have done without the raspberries as they took on a somewhat slimy texture when milk was added.  They tasted fine, but that initial foray into the mouth was somewhat off putting.The company has been around for over four decades, and from what I can see they certainly have a proven track record.  Eating healthy and organic is becoming more and more important to me as my children get older, and while this won't be replacing my favorite cereal anytime soon, I enjoyed it enough that I will certainly be seeking out some of the company's other products.

I smelled coconut as soon as I opened the bag but that was as far as it went.  These cookies don't have much of a coconut flavor but just a scent, which makes them good for coffee.  The crumb is nice and they are mild generally speaking.  I recommend reading the list of ingredients and nutrition label, there are several ingredients that could cause some allergens.  I might stay away from them due the high fructose corn syrup which in the past has proven to give me some headaches.

This chai is both fragrant and flavorful. Each teabag is wrapped within its own sealed package to ensure freshness up until you actually decide "it's time for chai." Unsealing the teabags produces and aroma that is reminiscent of Christmas for me - and why wouldn't it with Cinnamon, Ginger, and Cloves making up half the ingredients on the tea? The flavor is robust and sweet, leaving a little dryness behind as it slips beyond my uvula and into my belly (honestly, the back of my mouth "tastes" dry after I drink this, and I rather like that). Higgins and Burke chai leaves a pleasant aftertaste as well - always a plus.
This tasty dressing is great on salads but I use it more often for marinating beef and chicken.  It tenderizes and adds a great flavor.  I especially like it on steaks and roasts.

I've been eating Fantastic Foods' products for many years.  Their Vegetarian Chili has always been my favorite.  It's high in protein and can be mixed by just adding 2 cups of water.  I fix it up a bit by adding a can of tomatoes and a can of beans and it's as good as homemade chili.  I've given it a number of carnivore friends who said they really could taste any difference than chili with meat.  The texturized vegetable protein looks, tastes, and chews just like hamburger.

The Ceres Youngberry fruit juice blend is pear juice with youngberry purée. It is imported from South Africa.It has a delicious raspberry-blackberry flavor with a nice balance of sweet and tart and 120 calories per 8 oz. serving.
Good coffee once again from SFBC. I like the minimalist packaging and the price! Very close to Dunkin Donut coffee!
summary: Great coffee .. much like Donut Shop

reviewText: Amazon did not like my first review so I will pull some punches this time (but leaving this as 2 stars).  I ordered these with another grocery item which had less than 4 months before expiration (vs 6 months typically for that item in store).  The Go Go Squeeze pack which I received had only 2 months left before it expires (expiration 7/21/12 and today is 5/7/2012).  These typically have about 9 or more months of shelf life in store.  I also noticed a slight plastic taste/smell when I tried one which I suspect comes from sitting longer on the shelf.  I noticed this much more faintly on the ones I purchased in store which were good for another 9 months.  I am overall not really happy that I purchased these from Amazon, from now on I will be buying them locally.The two stars are for the handiness of the product.  They are just OK as applesauce and kind'a small for an adult at 3.2oz, but they can't be beat for pack-ability.  I am also not a real big fan of the plastic smell/taste that I notice when opening the product.  It does say on the package that it is BPA free, though it does not say what the packaging is.
summary: Like the product, but arrived with only 2 months before expiration

reviewText: I choose this item because of my wellness journey I started back in 2008. I try to eat low fat and remain conscientious of the earth and all its inhabitants. Back to Nature did a great job with the design of this box. It looks great from its simple earthy color to the feel of the cardboard. Staying true to nature you won't find a lot of frills built into this box.It looks like the item is retailing for upwards of $3.70 very comparable to what most crackers are selling for. Inside the box you get four sleeves of crackers with seven crackers in each. The crackers have the perfect name "Golden Honey Oat Graham" you can see the oats and taste the honey and graham. In each bit you get the gentle sweetness of honey balanced with the taste of graham we've come to enjoy.Good news....I can eat these crackers without all the guilt of other brands because Back to Nature Golden Honey Oat Graham crackers are made w/out refined sugar, trans fat and hydrogenated oils.Bad news...Be careful exercise portion control because its very easy to eat the whole sleeve or even the box they are so good and wholesome.YummyMissy
summary: Healthier Options Are Better with Back to Nature

reviewText: I have this on subscriptionit's so good. It has a soft and smooth consistency and has a really pleasant taste.

While this tea has a good flavor after brewed, I found there to be more stick and stem pieces than I can be happy with. It is alot of tea and the bag is good quality with fold over top for sealing. I will not buy again I don't think.

At 78%, these are a very dark chocolate bar, but if you have a preference for dark chocolate, these bars are well worth the purchase.  While there is a fruity flavor to it, what you notice first is the strong cocoa/chocolate flavor.  I recommend savoring small amounts at a time, perhaps with a nice cup of strong coffee or a glass of good wine, to accompany it.

This is probably one of the best cups of Orange Pekoe tea I have tried. The flavor is very good, not too weak and not strong or bitter. Sure beats the Lipton tea bags. Price was excellent and the fast service from Amazon was great. This will last a while, but I will sure be re-ordering when this gets low. Even tried making it in my Keurig with the single cup filter and it turned out great.
this is no different than regular corn other than the color. there were several dented cans and only a few that weren't. need to find a better stocking/shipping method.

I was skeptical, but hopeful, that these would be as good as the other reviews led me to believe. These brownies are as fudgy and chocolatey as claimed and in my opinion taste as good as any full fat brownie I've ever had. I like my brownies more fudgy/chewy than cake-like and that's exactly how they came out following the standard recipe. If I didn't know, I would never guess they're fat free brownies.
This tuna meet my high standards.  It is absolutely delicious and taste much better than other tunas.  Highly recommended.  Yum!

These are not too good.  They are mostly just nestle chocolate with a few pieces of butterfinger throughout.  They really just taste like chocolate...and not very good chocolate at that.  Buy a regular butterfinger if you are looking for the peanut buttery taste.
haven't tried it myself, was a gift for mom. she's hard to please and doesn't usually complement on lots of things you give her but she did like this honey and she does have good taste.

This tea is good peppermint. It is a little powdery. I love the quantity. I am very happy with it. I would buy it again if I weren't going to buy Heather's Tummy Tea instead. This tea just does not have the peppermint 'pow' I am looking for.
summary: Not as good as Heather's Tummy Tea.

reviewText: Not as good as regular Velveeta, clumps, isn't as smooth when heated in salsa...doesn't mix as well, it settles to the bottom.
summary: Not as good as regular Velveeta, clumps,

reviewText: These shipped fast and taste great.  I like the original flavor better than the cinnamon, but I love the convience of having it deliverd to my door, and quickly !

I discovered that I had a stomach problem where I needed to eat apple sauce and sometimes apple sauce with cinnamon. When I found this product, I was so excited. About a third of the time I need cinnamon to settle my stomach and this comes with a third of the apple sauce with cinnamon. Perfecto!!!!
summary: This must've been made for me

reviewText: I bought this bread mix due the high rated reviews.  The mix made a beautiful loaf, but the flavor wasn't the greatest.  The only way I was able to eat it, was to pile it with peanut butter and jelly.  As stated by one of the reviews it also contains milk, I'm lactose intolerant. I will give Pamela's a try.
We like this brand of garbanzo bean a lot... good plain, or cooked with just about anything.  Yummy!

Glad that I was able to find some good no salt added bouillon like this, This Rapunzel will last me a long time.  Also very hard to find no salt added Vegetable Broth in the local stores. For some reason they just no longer carry it.  I had some Pacific Low Sodium Vegetable broth, but for some unknown reason they no longer sell it, not even on their own website.
summary: Thanks Amazon, hard to find sodium free items.

reviewText: Let me echo the other reviewers thoughts of this product. Tasty, no added salt, no BPA lined cans, great texture, versatile - yummy plain, better with additional ingredients for hummus, salads, warm or cold dishes. I usually gobble these up at salad bars but this is my 1st time buying garbanzos and will do it again.

This brand does not fall apart in your mouth like another brand of xylitol gum does.I don't want aspartame in my gum. Aspartame can mess with your brain and cause depression and more. It was not supposed to be approved but there were shenanigans at the fda and conflict of interests that got aspartame on the market.Spry only has xylitol which is good for your teeth!
Bought these as an alternative to pretzels and crackers. Less salt, easy to carry in a ziplock bag. Very tasty. Good and crunchy too.

This snack is tasty, although not as good-looking as the picture on the box.It is two thin crackerlike biscuits layered over dried fruit. The color of the biscuits is rather pasty, but they taste nice and crispy, and not too sweet.Those with a stronger sweet tooth might find this snack not sweet enough for their taste, but for me, it was perfect.The fruit filling was a bit chewy, which dampened my enjoyment of the snack.Also, the crispy biscuit tended to crumble easily, making for a messier snack than I would have liked.On a whole, a very nice snack for when I want something sweet but not too sweet. I especially like the 100 calorie pack, because I know exactly how many calories I'm eating, and the two crisps in the package are just enough to satisfy me.Fat cal 15, total fat 2g, choles 0 mg, sodium 90mg, potassium 20mg, total carb 20g, dietary fiber 0g, sugars 8g, protein <1g. Contains wheat, milk.
These are one of my favorite Pepperidge Farm cookies.  They are sinfully delicious and I will definitely be buying more.

This new offering from our old friends at Oreo rates a definite "yum", with a delicious blend of chocolate crunch and creamy mint.  However, these little beauties bear little resemblance to Oreos.  They are lost somewhere between Girl Scout Thin Mints and Peppermint Patties, although if you try real hard you can catch a bit of the original Oreo taste from the cookie in the center.On the down side, the mint taste was, in my opinion, a little overpowering and maybe even a bit harsh at the back of the throat, which is why I only rated 4 stars.  At about 3 grams of fat per cookie, these have absolutely no redeeming nutritional value, but then again that's not why you're buying them, is it?  Lastly, the price is a little stiff considering that you only get maybe two dozen cookies in the package.  Nevertheless, these are absolutely worth a try as an occasional special treat.  I say again, Yum!
summary: Definitely yummy, but Oreo in name only.

reviewText: My 9.5yo son has been eating Tings since age 2. He is allergic to milk and wheat and on the GFCF diet. He loves them and the rest of the family can't resist them either. Now just get them back in stock, please.
summary: Tings are a great GFCF snack

reviewText: Note to Pepperidge Farm -- Crispy cookies don't travel well in your current packaging!  This rating is for the poor condition they arrive in.As many another reveiwer reported, I, too, received bags of mostly crumbs, with maybe 3 of the cookies in the bag recognizable as cookies.As for the cookies, themselves, they were fresh and tasty, just a little awkward to eat.  ;)  I'm annoyed at myself because I had intended to take these out of my cart when I read the negative reviews, but, somehow, instead I added another package.  So, I am the proud possessor of 10 bags of cookie crumbs.I may try to use them like graham cracker crumbs in a cheesecake crust, or blenderize them to make rum balls or something.  That a whole lot of cookie crumbs.

If only I could get a 5-10 free packages of this, I would write an extensive and eloquent review of how we were driving for hours thru Georgia, N and S Carolinas, keeping up on this Beef Jerky. But I'm not hoping they will send me a gift for a good review, so I'll stop here. Get if, it's good.

What a simple yet effective product!  I love it!  The handle fits perfect in my hand, it is easy to use and feels secure.  The pads you place on the bottom of the handle are secured like velcro to the bottom. Very easy to open the bag, grab a pad refill and slap it on to the bottom of the handle and start scrubbing away!  The scrubbing power is just as good!  You can easily control if you want circles, back and forth motion etc for tough welded on food on your cook top.  Once you "think" you have scrubbed and gotten the cook top clean take a clean cloth and wipe the cooktop to a shine...at that point you will see any small spots you might have missed when the cook top was hazy from the cleaner/scrubber.  I have been using another cleaner for my cook top that is a pad and a bottle of liquid.  The problem with it is the pad doesn't last very long and the pad and cleaner are never in the same spot!  This is a perfect solution-it's an all in one!  (AND IT WORKS!)

First a disclaimer: I am not possessed of a very large sweet tooth, but I have always been fond of Oreos. When mutations began to arrive- i.e. Double Stuff, which suddenly struck me as tasting like sweetened Crisco- my interest waned.Now we see a new type of cookie, an Oreo impersonating the famous Girl Scout "Thin Mint" cookie. It's hard to think of anything else, even though comparisons are usually to be avoided in a review. Among other impressions were "Better than a Thin Mint- not as minty" which one taster seemed to think was an improvement.There is actually not much to give this away as an Oreo, the wafer is just that- a rather thin round of the eternal dark crust. A ridge runs around the edge to contain the mint filling. the fudge coating just about the right thickness, and unlike other non-dark chocolate, is not bad. The mint still tends to dominate, so exploring each component is slightly more difficult.I found the chocolate tended to leave a lingering taste in my mouth, not unpleasant, but not a characteristic I would think desirable in a cookie.If I am found with cookie in hand, it would usually be La Petite Ecolier, of course, in a class by itself.So, if you are fond of all things chocolate- especially minty ones usually peddled once a year by underage vendors in green attire- these may be perfect for you.

Good as is, following box instructions -- or "improved" with a touch of salt, vanilla, and extra honey.  I also sometimes add eggs and buttermilk.... but they're good, regardless.  Nice fiber/protein ratio.  Excellent flavor.

I like the rice-the only organic white rice i have had that is better is at our local market-it is longer grain than this-my family likes it-everyone noticed it is better than the cheap crappy "instant'' white rice
These bags of snacks are a great size for a packed lunch.  They have a good taste to them as well.

Out of all of the Thai Kitchen Rice Noodle Bowls, this one is by far my favorite when it comes to the flavor.  The noodles don't get mushy and the broth is nicely done (for something you just pour hot water over).  It even has a little bit of a "zing" to it.Not sure it would rate high against real Thai food--what packaged food would?--but for something that you can snatch up on the way to work and have something easy to make and hot to eat, its great.  If you want soup you can use more water and if you want noodles, just use less.  Plus its gluten-free!The sad thing is that I can't find the mushroom one in the packets rather than just with the bowl.  Yes, its handy to have the bowl already when you go camping (which I've done), but I'd prefer to have the option.  Hint!  Hint!  And its not just because the packets are  cheaper to buy, but if you want to make this at home I'd rather heat it up in glass than plastic.
summary: Nice Flavor for an Instant Soup

reviewText: Makes stupendous yogurt and cheese -- but use spring water. I got this because my landlord won't let me keep goats.

Nabisco's Newtons Fruit Crisp Snacks combine Newton "fruity" with a fried pie style crispiness.  The texture is quite pleasing, and the snacks are sweet, but not -too- sweet.  The best part is that they are low in calories, so they make a nice snack any time of day.  (I am partial to having them as a morning snack with a cup of coffee.)  I haven't yet tried the berry flavor, but the apple cinnamon is super tasty.  Just think- It's like eating a fried pie, but without the high calories.  You'll be impressed.

Lindt is quite possibly perhaps the best producer of chocolate treats and the idea of a mixed bag of milk chocolate, dark chocolate, and white chocolate almost certainly must be making a chocolate lover's mouth salivate!  Quite honestly, what's not to love just from the description alone?  Lindt's chocolate is perhaps amongst the smoothest and most flavorful on the market and this assortment is great to put out in candy dishes or as a very private indulgence hidden away just for yourself.  I love a variety of chocolates from a number of different producers but really nothing quite matches the smoothness and creaminess of Lindt.  I've honestly never had a bad chocolate from Lindt which is testament to their quality control and even though I'm not a fan of dark chocolate theirs is absolutely divine!  You certainly can share, but for me these are all mine.
summary: Quite possibly the most perfect chocolate assortment

reviewText: I have an air popper and most of the popcorn I have used in the past produce hard kernals.  I am so glad I tried this one!!!  The corn popped fully and was still soft.  I will be ordering more!!

Take a York Peppermint Patty and combine it with an Oreo and you get the Mint Oreo Fudge Creme.  Not bad.  The only thing is that the Oreo filling itself is lost by the mint flavor.  So in a way, it lost it's Oreo taste.  If you are a fan of both the York Peppermint Patty and the Oreo, you may want to try this.  If you love the Oreo cookie flavor, this may not be the one for you.

This is fine tea. English Breakfast Tea is a bit of a commodity, and an increasingly familiar one. This variation is quite good, not as piquant as some alternatives--and not leaving the rather bitter aftertaste one sometimes finds in combination. If you tend toward a milder tea, this one may well please you.The company that produces this product is part of the Ethical Tea Partnership. For those interested, I would suggest visiting ethicalteapartnership dot org. The list of participating companies includes giants such as Tetley and Twinings, and is missing some other familiar names.Something more to think about, something else in favor of this product.My overall suggestion: find a tea you like, and find one that is from a member of the Ethical Tea Partnership. There's no one rule for taste--but there are universal expectations of ethics, realizable ideals.This tea will meet those criteria for many people.
summary: Excellent Tea with Delightful Ethical Aftertaste

reviewText: I've never been particularly fond of soy nuts, but these Ann's House dry roasted and lightly salted edamame are quite good. Nice and crunchy. Exdcellent taste. These fit my needs perfectly. I'm on a diet and I've gone almost all vegetarian. Of course, I need good protein to go along with it. I use Eggbeaters, non-fat milk, imitation crab and a variety of soy-based meat-like dishes. Now, when I feel like a few snacks, I can use the Ann's House Edamame. They have good protein and a quite high fiber count. Perfect!Gary Peterson

I have been drinking several of the Higgins & Burke teas for a while and they Never disappoint.I love to start the day with the flavorful English Breakfast, Hot in the morning to wake me up and then a tasty glassof a very strong and delicious English Breakfast cold over ice in the afternoon.This tea is wonderful both Hot & Cold, Strong but never bitter, just tasty!
summary: A Great Start For The Day

reviewText: I'll admit it. I'm addicted to this quick bread. It's really quite wonderful, and comes out perfectly every time in my bread machine. I've stocked up to tide me over to autumn when Costco may have it available at much friendlier price.

This works fine for places where you need chicken stock. I've used it in stuffing when I failed to have any home made chicken broth in the freezer. I've also used it to supplement the drippings from a few roasted chickens to make a simple pan sauce with the addition of some finely diced shallots and a bit of white wine. If you make a broth from it it won't taste terrible but it won't taste home made either. The price was decent on Amazon and I like to keep some on hand so I ordered it, I usually get it in the local stores but lately they have been out of it and Amazon was about 2 bucks less expensive than the local markets usually charge for the same amount.
This is very tasty.  You really do need to use 2 portions to get a decent sized bowl.  Super yummy!!

The Quaker Instant Oatmeal Fruit & Cream, Variety Pack 10-Count Boxes (Pack of 4) is a delicious way to start your day. You have a choice of four flavors to choose from, Strawberries & Cream, Blueberries & Cream, Peaches & Cream or Bananas & Cream, each with 130 calories per packet. For the flavor, they are all good choices. The dehydrated fruit tastes great after adding water and allowing it to rehydrate a couple of minutes. My only complaint with this product is that it's laden with sugar, between 9-12 grams per serving. Anyone with sugar.. beware.Please rate this review if you found it helpful.

Purchased this along with the Presto 04820 PopLite Hot Air Popper, (See review) and have experienced the best popcorn in a long time.  It pops up great and tastes superbe quite delicate.  Haven't used white corn before but this appears to be of very high quality.  It's already half gone.

To give this tea a fair shot, I first brewed it exactly as the box said to, and had a cup black, as I usually drink tea.  I was underwhelmed.  There just seemed to be some kind of stale taste there---it didn't taste sharp or whatever the taste is called that I like tea to have!  It wasn't just that it was mellow, you want that in a breakfast tea a little, but it just didn't have a standout taste, and it made the bitter bit of taste not something that complemented the tea flavor, but took away from it.  Then I tried it with sugar.  I liked it a little better that way, but no better than very basic tea like Red Rose or Salada.  Finally I brewed it strong and made ice tea.  I liked it the least that way.  The flavor issues came out more with the strong and the cold, and I didn't finish my glassfull.I like the ideas of this tea---that they are part of the ethical tea partnership and that the box is made from recycled materials, and I will certainly use the rest of the teabags, but it is not a product I would seek out or pay extra for.
summary: Any way I brewed it, a bit of a stale taste

reviewText: These are good.  I like to mix these with the Love Crunch cereal.  I would recommend.  Good snack and breakfast.

I've got two boys with sensory issues and autism so food jags are nothing new for me. I didn't like the idea of the crap that's in store brand and Kraft's versions, and he isn't thrilled with homemade versions unless we  use mystery cheese products like Velveta. Thus, I was looking for something that had a minimal level of crap to it. This is is. My son loves his "bunny mac n cheese" and aside from better ingredients the sauce is creamier than Kraft and tastes better. Get it on subscribe and save to save some ducats and have it on deck for the days when you want comfort food fast.
summary: My Mac and Cheese fiend approves

reviewText: Very similiar to the major brands found hanging at your local grocer.  More sweet than hot.  Made in Brazil.
summary: Decent product at a decent price

reviewText: Great for travel. I don't like the taste of plain water and I drink a lot of fluids. I always carry a refillable bottle. This flavors it without adding calories.
for a great product.  i use this in shakes and it seems to be pretty good quality turmeric. super pure

I loveBetty Crocker Scooby-Doo Fruit Flavored Snacks 8 oz.  I choose Kellogg's Harvest Acres Fruit Snacks, Strawberry and Mixed Fruit, to review hoping they would be similar but healthier; they are not.  These are simply fruit flavoured gummy candy.  I've never been a fan of gummy bears because they are hard to chew and I don't like the almost rubbery texture. The Betty Crocker Fruit Flavored Snacks are softer in texture and easier to chew.The name Harvest Acres gives the impression of being healthy or natural.  The first ingredient listed is Corn Syrup; the second is sugar, not fruit or fruit juice.  The label states one serving is 20% fruit which appears to be mostly apple puree with other ingredients including food dye.  You would have to consume 4 servings to get 100% of the recommended daily amount of vitamin c.  For less calories, more vitamins and the added benefit of fiber you could just have an apple, orange, grapes, or a serving of juice.  Yes, these are a little better than most candy but not by much.I received two different flavours to review, strawberry and mixed fruit.  The strawberry was to artificial tasting and didn't really taste like strawberries to me.  The mixed fruit has a much better taste but I still didn't like the tough chewy texture.

I like their original gummy bears so much that I grab a pack of this to try.  Not disappointed at all.  You can really taste the cola flavor on this bottle shaped candies.  It is not too sticky that it glues your teeth together; although a bit on the rubbery side.  Not too sweet neither. Just the right combination of flavors to taste.  .  From the biggest gummy bear manufacturer in the world (Haribo - based in Germany).Just FYI: 5 oz bag has 3.5 servings, with each serving at 140 calories, 10% carbo, 21g sugar, and 3g of protein. A serving is about 17 pieces of gummies.

I love gummi coke bottles and prefer them over choclate.  I have always got mine in bulk from a store called Henry's which recently stopped selling them.  So I tried the Haribo and was very disappointed in the several bags I have tried.  The candy was stiff and actually required severe chewing to the point that my jaw got tired.  The taste was there it just was not as soft as other brands and there was no way you could pull a bottle apart with your hands like other brands I have tried.
summary: Not as gummi as other brands

reviewerName: Rachel @ My Naturally Frugal Family "Rachel J"
reviewText: I love the toasted flavor of this sugar.  It isn't as sweet as white sugar but it definitely a superb replacement.  Plus I am very impressed with Wholesome Sweeteners and how they run their business (check out their website to see how palm sugar is made).I would definitely recommend this to my friends and would say it could easily substitute for any other sugar in recipes.
summary: A great alternative to conventional sugar

reviewText: This is my first experience with Yerba Mate tea.  I bought it for health reasons.  It contains B 1 and 2, riboflavin, carotene, iron, potassium, magnesium, 15 amino acids and other things I can't remember.  Google it and you'll see what a power house it is.It improves digestion, mental focus and supposedly helps diminish food cravings.I made my first pot yesterday and I'm enjoying another today.  I like the taste of it - I don't think it's grassy as other people do.  To me it has a slight spicy after taste.It's from the continent of the Amazon River - sold on amazon.com - HA! - good grief I'm easily amused.....Steeped in hot - not boiling water.  That's good for me because I don't think I let water  boil in the microwave.I'd recommend this for taste, health benefits and the fact that it's a sustainable product from the Rain Forest.

The Twinings green tea has what I call an American taste i.e., not too Asian or adulterated in any way.  It seems very pure and clean to me, similar toLipton Green Tea, Mandarin Orange, Premium Pyramid Tea Bags, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)(the very good flavored version that I mix with this) but a bit finer.  I look for it in the stores and often cannot find it.  Get it here by subscription with your Amazon Prime free 2-day shipping for about $2/box.  Also, this one is available in the 6-box lots while the Lipton Green Tea is only in a 12-box lot.  It will become a staple for you with lemon and honey (lime, orange peel, etc.)Green tea is also an extremely healthy drink with all the special polyphenol antioxidants that it contains.  It may even prevent Alzheimers disease.  (Black tea is dried which destroys a percentage of the antioxidants.) Although green tea also contains a small amount of caffeine it has another calming effect that is almost a high in itself.  Over a year ago, we quit coffee in the AM to go to green tea and have never looked back.  Now we only haveSenseo Douwe Egberts Colombia Blend Coffee Pods, 16-Count Packages (Pack of 4)(with some Starbuck's cocoa powder or carmel sauce) in the afternoons a couple of times a week and our nerves are perfect.
summary: My favorite green tea hands down

reviewText: We had a friend come to stay with us for week.  We found out she ate Gluten Free just days before she arrived.  I quickly got onto Amazon and found various products I thought worth giving a try.  She LOVED these cookies!  THANK YOU!  Unfortunately, she did not get to eat too many AS WE ALL LOVED THEM!!!!

As a rule I hate meal replacements, especially powders. I tried this because I was impressed with the Amazing Grass organic wheat grass.The amazing meal would mix better with a blender. I use a spoon and add water until most of it eventually mixes. The taste is very good for a protein drink! The organic Madagascar Vanilla is delicious and the undercurrent of chai complements it well. The organic fruits and veggie in the drink are not detectable and so this is an easy way to get them in my diet. This is a gentle drink for when it is too late for dinner. It also works well for breakfast when my stomach needs something light. I feel pretty good when I have this drink, too.
summary: Best Meal Replacement I Have Tried

reviewText: Yawn: Another mass market brand of beef jerky. But, being a jerky addict, I had to try it. Some of the mass market brands are quite good (World Kitchens, some varieties of Oberto) and some are...inedible.This stuff straddles the boundaries. It's not inedible, though the smell when you open the bag isn't particularly appealing. But it's surely not good enough that you'll find yourself seeking this brand out. Mouth appeal is modest: I didn't find any inedible pieces of gristle in my bag, but some pieces were unpleasantly tough. Flavor is extremely mild, especially for a variety sold as "peppered". There wasn't much flavor of any sort, and certainly very little heat.I won't be buying this brand again, but if someone had a package and I was hungry, I wouldn't decline the offer. There are other, better, options available, at similar or lower cost (check out the World Kitchens line, which is sold at Amazon). I recommend you look at those first.
summary: Generic jerky, not particularly flavorful, not very hot, not recommended

reviewText: This is a huge quantity of product! It beats Equal, etc., in the taste dept and you can cook with it too. I sweeten my coffee and Kool Qid with this stuff! Cereals too! The price I paid was great and del to the door tax free. I hope this continues to be found at Amazon.

First, let me tell you, I am a "mom" and not a typical consumer of Pop Tarts.  My kids, love them, but I have a hard time buying them when I see the sugar and calories. However, these are FANTASTIC!  When I looked in the pantry and saw we only had one package left, I had to try them with a cup of coffee. I was incredibly happy with the sweet crispy morsels!  Just enough to satisfy a sweet tooth and not enough to break the scale tomorrow morning!  I am really happy and just came to Amazon to order the chocolate. I think I may have to just hide this stash from the kids!  I hope you can keep my secret!!!
summary: I'd give it 6-Stars if I could!

reviewText: Jerky has been one of my favorite snacks, so much so that I have made my own for years.  It is a lot of work and takes time for the marinating etc.  Mr. Z Pepper has plenty of pepper taste which I like, it leaves that good lasting flavor.  The beef appears to be of excellent quality and is rather lean.  I have not experienced the tough pieces that some have noted. Much of the bag contains very small munchkin size pieces.....like the crumbs when to get to the bottom of a box of crackers, for that reason I went to four stars.  It may have been just the bag that I have been using.  I would give the flavor and the quality of the meat five stars.  I am ordering more...I need my munchies!
summary: Almost as good as I make!

reviewText: Great value, great tasting, fast shipping.  In the store a small 6 oz bottle is close to $9 - this is a no brainer.  Check out the health values of sesame seed oil -
summary: Great tasting sesame seed oil, terrific value, fast shipping

reviewText: i bought this to have a handy gluten free snack - LOVED the nut/fruit mixture - wish i could buy it in bulk, i love crunchmaster crackers.. the hummus was ok  tasting, chocolate fine . i really didn't like the edamame .. it had a funny aftertaste .. i would buy again to have on hand - would prefer twice the amt of fruit/ nut mixture and no edamame! ..
summary: wish there was more of that nut mixture...

reviewText: I do not recommend this product, which is essentially billed as a nutritious drink- think Ensure for kids.  What's wrong with real food these days?First, it's expensive- $2 for an 8 ounce drink.Second, the foil-wrap around the straw is very thick- I doubt if a child could open it.  I couldn't tear it and had to bite it open and had trouble doing that.Third, it tastes AWFUL.  It's not very chocolaty, it is excessively sweet, and it does not taste like any other chocolate milk or drink that I've tasted.  To be a nutritious drink you have to get it in your kid first!In short, YUCK, which is likely what your child will say when he tastes it.UPDATE-I received three pouches of this drink and tasted one to write the review above.  I recently offered my two grandsons- ages 3 and 7, the other two and told them it was a chocolate milk drink.  Both tasted it and said "I don't like this- it tastes yucky."  Down the drain it went.  'Nuff said!
summary: THERE'S GOT TO BE A BETTER ALTERNATIVE

reviewText: Any parent knows that kids can be picky eaters, and it is therefore hard to get them to eat all of the foods that are necessary for a balanced diet.  A drink like Boost Kid Essentials seems like a perfect solution as it adds lots of vitamins, minerals and protein into a kid's diet in a relatively small size drink.One problem though is getting your child to drink 8.25 ounces.  I tried this drink on 6, 4, 2 and 1.5 year olds and none of them even came close to finishing.  Part of this could be because while it tastes like chocolate milk when it first hits your tongue, within seconds the flavor changes and you are left with an unpleasant aftertaste (though the chocolate flavor is better than the vanilla).Another issue I had with the drink is that while it provides all of these great nutrients, it is also high in calories.  Milk and juice have less than half of the calories in the same size serving.I really love the concept of this drink and wish it was a better match with the needs and tastes of my family but, unfortunately it falls short.
summary: A mix of positive and negative

reviewText: Been using it for a while now in practically all circumstances .....I love in my teas and sore throat broths
Great stuff and great value.  Use it for kettle corn, popcorn, as well as general cooking.  I haven't found a cheaper source.

I don't know why, but I am addicted to these crackers. I bought them looking for a lower sodium content cracker and it has the added bonus of having some potassium in it. For me, that's a win-win. Sodium increases blood pressure which I am starting to have some trouble with and potassium helps to decrease it.
