I typically eat these with the Breakstone No Salt Cottage Cheese, then I mix potassium chloride salt to taste and I end up with a healthy, low (sodium, i.e., regular table salt in the U.S.) with a decent amount of potassium chloride meal or snack.I have to admit though. I will eat these crackers plain as a snack. I don't know what it is, but I really like these despite their lower (sodium) salt content (a good thing). I think they are more filling to me then other crackers, while being so light in weight.
My little celiac enjoys this on field trips, while my other child (non-celiac) enjoys it for its good hummus. Portions are definitely too small for an adult, though.
summary: A great gluten free, healthful snack

reviewText: The reviews that said the packaging was substandard must have reached the company because my packaging was quite adequate and the citric acid arrived in great condition, the bag was thick and undamaged and inside of a box - also which was undamaged.I love citric acid.  I use it to clean hard water stains in things like humidifiers and coffee makers, and I use it when I make my shower cleaner liquid spray (recipes abound online) as well as my powdered dishwasher detergent (again, you can find dozens of recipes for this online too).I have heard you can add a tiny bit to the water in steam mops.  Generally I add vinegar to my steam mop, but maybe I'll give the citric acid a try.So many uses, this is a versatile product.
summary: Good price, arrived in good shape.  No complaints here.

reviewText: Love love love this product!  Can't say it enough.  It is such a better quality than the stuff you get at walmart.  It is cheaper too as you are buying in bulk.  Have a ice cream bucket or a large glass jar ready as it arrives in a pouch.
summary: This is perfection in a bag.

reviewText: This tea is aromatic, tasty, and very relaxing. The best part of making it is standing over the K-Cup machine, breathing in those wonderful minty scents as the steam rises from the cup on a cold fall morning. Not too bold, but not weak by any means, it has everything I could ask for flavor-wise. It's definitely a more "mild" mint...not very overpowering, but I like that.
summary: Nothing quite like a good peppermint tea.

reviewText: Great cereal and always has been. I love Chex cereals period! I still love Chex cereals and always will so there!

No Fear, Super Energy Supplement is not all that its cracked up to be.  I was stoked to try it out because I really enjoy energy drinks.  I didn't care for the juice taste and it was too sweet.  The "juice" taste was too overwhelming for my taste buds and it made me feel loggy instead of refreshed.  You can taste the HFCS in the drink and it taints the product in my book. The sticky sweet taste ruins what could have been a really good energy supplement.  The crash I had afterwards was even worse.If you are looking for a good energy drink I advise you to look elsewhere.  I do not recommend No Fear.
summary: I didn't enjoy the taste at all.

reviewText: I got the coffee for 12.50 per box.  Ordered 4 boxes!!  Such a great deal, as the coffee is a great blend.If anyone is upset because of the website having issues when they were trying to buy it, they shouldn't review the product poorly, as it is not the product that is the problem.The problem is that you're jealous you didn't get such a great deal on the coffee.  Grow up kids, this coffee is great!!!  Will buy from Amazon.com, LLC again for more K-Cups for my Keurig.ALL OF MY COFFEE ARRIVED PACKAGED WELL AND IN NEW CONDITION, NOTHING WRONG WITH IT!!
summary: Just got the coffee... LOVE IT!!!

reviewText: I tried VIA when it first came out. I tried it the traditional route--as a hot cup o' java. I did not like it. Not this roast and not the Columbian (which was so weak, why bother).So, it's hot. It's summer. I normally hit Starbucks after the gym for my fave iced sugar free vanilla latte. I saw the ad for the iced coffee VIA, but it has sugar. I don't want sugar. So, it hit me, why not try making iced coffee from the regular VIA. (duh, should have thought of that sooner). I bought a 3-packer (like this one shown in image).It was amazing. 2% milk (about a cup), ice, Starbucks sugar free vanilla syrup (I buy it at my local Starbucks), in a blender bottle and shake, shake, shake. It comes out frothy and delicious. FOr me, I like it BETTER than my habitual 2 to 3x a week fix of it at the store. Because you add the VIA to the milk and the milk is cold and the instant coffee is not hot (like espresso), there is NO DILUTION. It makes for a much more flavorful, less watery, iced latte. OH MY GOSH SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO good.Now, my problem is not having three lattes a day, instead of three a week. Seriously. I'm a junkie now. (And I have coffee everyday, but my homebrew is so much better than Starbuck's that I don't get hot coffee there, I just used to like the convenience--still do--of grabbing a fast latte after exercising. I have a great coffee set-up at home with Paradise Roasters and Terroir gourmet single origins and a Technivorm and a Barratza burr grinder and filtered water pitcher, so really, now that I can make a fast latte at home and take it with me to the Pilates studio and put in the fridge there until I'm done, I may not be visiting the Starbucks as much, except to get my fave protein plate now and then and stock up on VIA.)The product is crazy overpriced. What...more than five bucks for what's 3 servings? How sick is that? Buy it at the store unless the price is dropped. That's crazy.But, nummy latte.So, if iced lattes are you vice of choice, might wanna consider this. And if you don't want sugar, skip the one they're pushing now in the blue packaging and buy the unsweetened.And I just slurped one after dinner (latte that is). Addictive. (Er, literally, I guess.) But at least I'm getting my calcium. :DThis price is much better than the other one I reviewed on Amazon (by another supplier). But I still think it's overpriced. Once you pour out all those servings, it's just a few teaspoons of instant coffee. Amazon would move tons of this if they priced it more reasonably.
summary: FIVE stars for this as iced latte; TWO stars as a cup of hot joe

reviewText: Vita-CoCo has a few different flavored coconut waters... this one (acai and pomegranate flavor) along with their original (just plain coconut flavored) are their best flavors! I don't really like any of the other flavors out there, but these two are the great.

I loved Nerds as a kids but as I got older the sugar shock became too much.  I could practically feel my teeth melting as I poured tons of the little nerds into my mouth.  The chewy nerds gave me some of that childish pleasure back without going over the top.  Still has the distinctive sweet/sour blend, but a little more on the sweet side.
I KNEW that Dandelion tea was wonderful for your health, but I had no idea how good it tastes!THUMBS UP! Great product and service!
They are good. Even my husband liked them. They are not cheezits but they are good and healthy and made from real food not chemicals and won't kill me.

It has a good noticeable chocolate flavor. I find it smooth and rich with and without creamer and sweetener. It it one of the best K-Cups I've tried and I have tried quite a few. I don't think anyone will be disappointed who tries this coffee.
This is the nicest brown rice that I have ever tried. It cooks up in the same time as white rice (20 min) and has a soft but not mushy texture. I found a new favorite rice!

These are a version of gummies. They are sweeter than the usual jelly/gummy candy. They come in pouches, but the majority of the pouches have had a preponderance of one flavor in them. It would be nice to have a better mix. The shapes add some interest.The pouches themselves say open here, but they are almost impossible to tear. I wound up using scissors to open them.As for them being fruity they do taste fruity, which is amazing, since out of 10 ingredients only 3 - apple puree, citric acid and ascorbic acid only have the faintest relationship to fruit. Corn syrup and sugar are the 2 main ingredients.There are 70 calories in each serving and 20 to a box.It's a sweet little treat, but there are other gummy candies that I would rather have.

The Salmon isn't like Pics, if u eat all items, it WILL FILL U UP, but...it's not good like the others, the Salmon dip is NASTY...it's runny, dark Orange colored,with little bits of Salmon in it...not pink/fluffy like pic.THERE IS PLENTY of the Salmon, cause it's SPICY, a little goes a long way...you GLOB a LITTLE on a sumptuous cracker *those are good* so it is enough to eat w/all the crackers.With this meal  YOU DON'T WISH THERE WERE MORE Salmon, like you wish there were morein the other meal-type containers...cause eating all what is given is ENOUGH.IT'S THE OTHER SNACKS THAT WILL HELP FILL YOU UP...something that tastes like SOY NUTS is also NASTY, doesn't go with the rest of the culinary attempts AT ALL.IT'S A HORRID MIX OF TASTES...but it will fill you up....I did not eat only the Salmon/crackers and a little soy-tasting soy nuts cause Salmon left nasty taste in my MOUTH.saved rest for later....WISH I DIDN'T BUY TWO 6-Packs.
summary: The Salmon isn't like Pics, if u eat all items, it WILL FILL U UP, but...............................................

reviewText: This is delicious and priced right per quart. A great savings!***** Priced to sell and crystal light quality guarenteed! *****
I like this cereal a lot- tasty, good nutrition for a boxed cereal. I have to let it soak in the milk a while, because otherwise it is so crunchy it kind of hurts my teeth. I'll keep buying it.

I love green tea and I really like this one as it is not too bitter.  Most green teas are really bitter unless you get the tea leaves mix with another tea leaves.  I don't know what Keurig did to remove the bitterness but it is a full bodied green tea and I like it much better than the Bigalow green tea which has a horrible aftertaste.
can't say enough about this very amazing cake-----I [LOVE] it, you open the box, well the smell is completely out of this world, the taste IS amazing, and YESSSSSSSSS I [WILL] be back
summary: wicked jack's tavern red velvet rum cake

reviewText: These O's are just as the name describes. They are crunchy with peanut pieces in the actual O's and they are very sweet.  But the calorie count is reasonable (100 calories for 3/4 cup), and I like eating a handful or two as a midday snack or instead of a dessert. Given the peanuts, I'm surprised how little protein the cereal contains and wouldn't really make this my regular morning cereal.
summary: These Are Crunchy, Nutty and Very Sweet

reviewText: This is an attractive little slipcase-packaged sampler of chocolate bars.  There are 12 snack-size bars (slightly larger than 1" x 2", 15g each), with 2 of each type of 6 flavors: 3 milk chocolates and 3 dark chocolates.  Each mini bar is scored into 12 tiny pieces for easy sharing or portion control.  The actual quantity of chocolate in the whole package is probably equivalent to 2 standard gourmet bars.  It bills itself as organic and Fair Trade Certified, and the product is made in Poland.  The back of the package has nutrition facts for each of the 6 flavors, and each mini bar is either 90 or 80 calories with 40 to 60 of those from fat.  I got one slipcase of these from Vine to review, and I'd expect to pay $6 to $10 for a single slipcase in a store.Milk: 34% cocoa, 80 cal, 40 from fat; this flavor was a good balance of sweetness and creaminess without venturing into sickly sweet or slimy.  I'd classify it as a better than average, but not fantastic, basic milk chocolate.Toffee-Milk: 34% cocoa, 80 cal, 40 from fat; this bar has a good buttery toffee aroma, and you can feel and see some toffee chunks, but the toffee flavor is not very strong.Almond-Milk: 37% cocoa, 90 cal, 50 from fat; I got a subtle almond aroma, there are many good-sized chips of almond visible in the bar, and the flavor is subtle, but definitely almondy.Dark: 70% cocoa, 90 cal, 60 from fat; the flavor of this bar has a distinct cherry note, and it's a good balance of creamy and chalky for a dark chocolate, with the right amount of bitterness.Ginger-Dark: 60% cocoa, 80 cal, 40 from fat; there are visible chunks of shredded ginger and a subtle ginger aroma with short, sharp bursts of ginger flavor when you directly hit a piece, but it's balanced well with the chocolate flavor and not overwhelming, pleasing even this reviewer, who's not a huge ginger fan.Cherry-Dark: 60% cocoa, 80 cal, 45 from fat; plenty of chunks of chewy dried tart cherries, good cherry aroma, but the flavor is almost too tart - they could have upped the sugar a bit to compensate for the very tart cherries.Overall, the chocolate is good, but not spectacular.  It would certainly make a good occasional treat or small gift.
summary: Decent Gourmet Treat Perfect for Sharing

reviewText: I think my husband would have liked just a little bigger package but the 3 flavors offered were okay.  I am not sure if this is his favorite brand but trying to find a variety of snacks for him for work.

My twin boys love eating them as much as I love the convenience of the Happy Baby Organic "pouchy-puches" They allow for my boys (1 year old) to grab them and eat on their own without the mess while on the go. They get all the healty nutrients I give them at home with home-made meals but when we're on-the-go grabbing a few of these is convenient, fas, easy, healty and fun!
This product was purchased for my adult son; he really likes Swedish Fish and these did not disappoint. They were very frest and tasty.
Good deal. Way cheaper than byung them in the smaller packs at the store. And you get single servings so I don't eat the whole can.
summary: stopped me from eating the whole can.

reviewText: Have no fear, you CAN eat cereal that tastes just like those sweet cereals you ate as a kid without incurring the derision of spying neighbors. No more do you have to hide your Cinnamon Toast Crunch or Cookie Crisp in a Cheerios box, just buy these!(After finishing the box, I remember the cereal it tastes like: King Vitamin!)All kidding aside, this is a good (but not great) sweet cereal. Biggest plus is total lack of HFCS (high fructose corn syrup). This is sweetened with molasses and sugar. It is not too sweet and it is nicely crunchy. And like most fortified breakfast cereals it contains 25% of a lot of the vitamins you need daily.It's not a great source of protein or fiber. But on the flip side, it's not carb heavy or high in calories (for what it is). And to be honest, there's no great nut taste even if peanuts are the 4th ingredient. And I don't get honey from it either.So to wrap up: sweet crunch: yes. great nutrition: no. Probably not worth 7$+ a box, but it is probably cheaper at your grocery store. Worth a try, but it probably won't be your favorite.
summary: Miss the cereals of your youth?

reviewText: I admit from the start I am not a coffee expert.  I like this.  It is smooth and good tasting.  I use it in my keurig (using a reusable cannister).  I like the flavor.....  not too harsh.recommended!
Tasty, crunchy, what more could you ask? Thirteen more words thirteen more words thirteen more words thirteen. Now three more words.

As soon as I got this I opened it to taste it, very crunchy and sweet. I like to carry this kind of tid bit to nibble on while I am out and about.  I even gave a few to my dog, he liked it, but he'll eat anything.In the morning I tried it with milk, I am not a cereal person but this appealed to me because it seemed like it would have a Cheerios flavor, it does not.  The only problem, which is why I am not a cereal person is the sweetness, it is too sweet.  The longer it lingers in the milk the more sugar oozes out.  I had to pour out some milk and add fresh to cut the sugar.  I must say it stays crunchy in milk, after 6 minutes the crunch was still there.  So if  you like crunch this one is for you. The tiny nuts fall off and they are a treat at the end of the bowl. All in all it is not a bad product but I am afraid it did not do it for me.
highly addicting, because the jalapeno chips have a good combination of seasoning.and also a deal for 6 bags of chips
summary: Did I say these were addicting ?

reviewText: yummy

I just placed one of these packets in a 6 ounce glass of water, and it actually does taste like I just squeezed lime in the cup. The teacher taste much better than the artificial tasting lime juice that comes in a squeeze bottle or glass bottle.
summary: a great option if you hate drinking water and like the taste of lime juice

reviewText: First time I went with this brand because it was cheaper than the other ones I buy. Great popcorn. Great taste. Great price.

I was actually looking for 110% chocolate, but unfortunately with Amazon's limited selection I could only find 100% - This in spite of my mother telling me to give it a 110% effort to find it. I had a similar problem when I was amplifier shopping and tried to find a knob that went to 11. Aside from the relatively low percentage of cacao this is an excellent bar of chocolate.
summary: Not as good as the 110% bar...

reviewText: I love garbanzos in salads, and the Libby's garbanzos are pretty decent. Watch the pricing, however. In my experience, generic garbanzos are also pretty good, and I can often get the Budh's brand of garbanzos gor 99 cents. So unless the price for 12 cans is $12-13, these may not be the best buy around.Amazon Prime customers, of course, do get the benefit of having these delivered to our doorstep in two days or so. And it's nice to let someone else do the toting on these cans. So that alone may make paying something of a premium a good idea.
summary: Great for salads, but watch the pricing!

reviewText: for those of us who are gluten sensitive - -these are a joy.  i have issues with snack products that typically have more than 4 ingredients in its manufacture.  usually i find that when there are more than 4 ingredients, at least one of those extra ingredients is something that i am allergic to.  the beauty of this product is that i can eat them and i don't have to worry.  for some people they may taste bland, but i like the taste.

Crystal Light Moctails Mojito tastes like a light limeaide with a hint of mint. It is really refreshing and would be particularly great for hot summer days. One package is supposed to make a "pitcher" but my pitcher holds 16 cups of water, not 8. So, it took me two packages to make one pitcher. This makes it seem a little pricey since one container only makes 2.5 pitchers. At the current Amazon price ($22.40) that makes it $1.49 per pitcher. Not as cheap as Koolaid, but in my opinion it isn't a bad price for the unique (and adult) flavor that you can't get from any other sugar-free, non-alcoholic drink mix. Most of us would easily pay $1.49 for a 20oz sugary soda at a gas station.Speaking of alcohol, a little rum or even vodka goes great with this mix! I substituted some of the water out and tried it both ways. Yum!I think that most kids would like the taste of this Mojito Moctail mix also. It may be a great way to keep them from feeling left out when you are drinking real Mojito's (or you could spike yours and they would never know). Plus, it is much healthier for the kids than sugar filled juices or soda. I would recommend this for both kids and adults. It is a refreshing, great tasting drink.
I couldn't be more pleased.  This is the best quality vanilla extract I have ever tried.  This is a HUGE bottle so I cleaned and refilled the first, smaller bottle to make it easier to measure from.
I love extra bold coffee and got turned onto this by some friends from Europe. Yum! Delicious flavor and aroma - and the subscription makes it an even better value!
summary: Great coffee at a good price

reviewText: Knorr Rice Sides Creamy Chipotle flavor is actually rice and pasta with a cheesy sauce with a pronounced flavor of smoked peppers.  The flavor is good but not at all spicy and it needs some hot sauce to give  it a bit more kick.  Otherwise, it's a nice starchy dish.I think hikers will like it because it's cheesy enough that it can be made without the milk and butter, substituting olive oil and water or even just water and still have it taste good and have a nice texture.  Directions call for it to simmer for seven minutes after being brought to a boil and then left to mature for a couple of minutes and the rice and pasta definitely need some time to soak up the moisture and soften up.
summary: Cheesy rice and pasta with chipotle

reviewText: Based on reviews, I bought this "stuff", even my dogs won't eat it.Some one got me again, probably won't be the last time that I buy "STUFF". You know what I mean...right?But...the next time I see 5 reviews, 5 stars and no other reviews, I'll run like the wind.Should be labeled "STUFF"

Guys:Although the price recently went up, I received this 4-pack for $12 shipped (using Subscribe and Save and an Amazon clipless coupon).  Although it has a very high concentration of robusta beans (60 or 70%) instead of the market-favored arabica beans (40 or 30%),  it's the robusta beans which produce such an excellent creamy and rich crema, from both my stove-top espresso maker and my Nespresso machine (I fill my own home-made capsules with this brand...seeNe-Cap Nespresso Compatible Refill Capsules), and the espresso is absolutely perfect. No bitterness, just rich, dark and flavorful. Would buy again if it goes on sale (the Amazon price is still better than NYC supermarkets which sell one pack for $4.75),
summary: While I prefer the red Lavazza for a drip machine, this is perfect for my espresso needs.....

reviewText: I have one in the AM,Our son introduced me to this coffee.  It's my very favorite.  I don't ever want to run out.
I like snacks in portion control packs. These are great to throw in my lunch bag and keep me from over indulging.

I have to say I didn't care for this mix of caramel-cheddar-kettle popcorn.  I didn't think the cheese popcorn flavor went at all well with the caramel and kettle corn.  I would have liked them each individually but not blended together.

Looking at the shape of this snack you will think you are eating Cheetos. But rest easy there's no grease here. This is the perfect snack if you're trying to diet. There should be something fun if you're fighting the calories, and this was perfect! For 110 calories, you get 65 smart fries, and I actually felt full after eating a bag. They're light and crispy and very flavorful. Here's what I thought about the flavors:Honey Mustard and Onion: My fav by far! I can taste the honey dijon and the sweet onions. Delicious!Vinegar Splash: Lots of vinegar flavor!Honey BBQ: More subtle in flavor, but very tasty.Vintage Cheddar: Classic Cheese Curl flavor, light and salty.Sea Salt: allows the potato flavor to shine through. Yum!Jalapeno Trio: I liked this one the least, if I'm going to eat a flavor like this I would want something greasy with it, which would defeat the purpose of a healthy snack!

I still love a good bowl of Campbell's chicken noodle soup. I put sharp cheddar cheese in to melt and fresh ground black pepper to make it even better. I also use pimento cheese sandwiches to dip in soup and that is so good !!! I give this soup a big A+++++ !!!
summary: What can I say....this is my all time favorite soup growing up !!!!

reviewText: This coffee is a nice mild blend, and has a pleasant taste, Most people will love it.. I really like a stronger coffee. but purchased this to enjoy if I wanted more than my one mug.  No bad after taste either.. would recommend to people who like a nice mild coffee.. but with good flavor too..
I have tried all of the Nescafe Memento Coffee, and this one is every bit as good as the other two.  I'm just partial to the Caramel Latte. YuMmMMmY!

This product is much harder to use than described.  The receipes are easy to follow, but the rolling is very difficult, and the insructions were vague, I found myself having to turn to the internet to look up instructions and rolling techniques.  The ingredients were all very high quality, but all were available in my local supermarket. Would not recommend.

I quit drinking coffee last year, but still enjoy a hot morning drink.  So I switched to hot chocolate and have been on a search for the very best tasting.  So, when I read all the "rave" reviews, I thought I'd try this.  To be truthful I don't think it tastes much different than Swiss Miss.  Yes, it is good, but not spectacular.  Very good price.

I love these figs. My grandfather had a couple of fig trees in his backyard when I was growing up. These bring back memories. I could eat TONS of these dried figs, but they are high in fiber so I can't or I will suffer gastronomical consequences. I must limit myself to 3-4 a day. My seven year old son loves these as well. It is one way I can get fruit into him. Costco sells these in a 40 ounce bag which I frequently get. They are a lot cheaper there. I don't remember how much I pay, but it is around $10 or $15 for the bag. These are almost $27 for 42 ounces. This is one of those rare instances where it is cheaper to go to a brick and mortar store than buy on Amazon.

I decided to try this salad dressing mix more for the purpose of using it as a seasoning for meat than for salad dressing but I've tried it both ways. I'm always looking for new things to dress up my normal grilled chicken or fish dinners and this worked well. I used it as a dry rub and while it wasn't overly flavorful, it still added some pop to the meat. I will probably try it as a marinade next time, mixing with a little extra virgin olive oil or the like.I tried the vinaigrette recipe on the bottle and was pleasantly surprised. When blended with olive oil and vinegar (I used cider vinegar since that was what I had available) it has a strong herb flavor without being overpowering. The leftover salad dressing keeps pretty well for a few days and loses nothing in the flavor. In fact I think the flavor got a little stronger after sitting in the refrigerator a few days.This dressing mix is quite versatile and I can see myself testing it out in many ways. Perhaps a seasoning for cooked vegetables instead of he usual salt and pepper, Or maybe as a topping for a baked potato, or mixing into mashed potatoes. Pasta salad, spaghetti sauce, use your imagination and I think you'll enjoy this Herb Filled Salad Dressing Mix as much as I did. Now to try the other two flavors... Kelley A. Hartsell, July 2008. All rights reserved.
summary: Use your imagination and I think you'll enjoy this as much as I did

reviewText: These are a perfect size for my pre-school aged kids.  They just love them, and I love that it's good for them.
summary: Great for quick snacks or lunch boxes

reviewText: The first thing I noticed about Chock Full O’ Nuts Coffee K-Cups is that the bottom of the K-Cup is paper instead of plastic.  This was a disappointment as a quick glance showed this would not work in my Hamilton Beach coffee brewer (the K-Cup is about half an inch too short to work in the coffee brewer).  I ended up taking the K-Cup into work where it works fine in the Keurig brewer we have there where it worked fine but it is a bit disappointing to not be able to use this in my coffee maker at home.  Also, the design of the K-Cup makes it impossible for me to store it in my K-Cup holder - instead I have to store the bulky box or the bag containing K-cups in a cabinet in my kitchen taking up valuable space.K-Cup design issues aside, I like the Chock Full O’ Nuts Coffee coffee made from the K-Cups.  I don't like strong or flavored coffee and Chock Full O’ Nuts Coffee taste just the way I like it.  It is strong enough to get me going in the morning but not so strong that it curls my hair or upsets my stomach.  The taste is nice and pleasant and not too bitter (I do use milk and sugar in my coffee).  The only thing keeping me from buying this coffee is that it unfortunately does not work in my coffee maker.
summary: I like the coffee but not the K-Cup design

reviewText: I love Tim Hortons Hot Chocolate. I would not make in microwave. It comes out best by adding a little water at a time and stirring well

Homemade dressings has a hit with Italian Garden because it is so versatile.  The directions say use it for salad dressings many of which I have made successfully.  The spices give a nice punch to an otherwise humdrum vinegar and oil dressings.  Also it's easy to adjust the amount of spice in dressings, something  you can't do in a bottled dressing.  Lastly the spice mix is easy to use in a dressing and doesn't have all those ingredients you can't understand in bottled dressings.  It's a plus that it's 100% natural.Also this mix is good as a rub or just sprinkled on meats and vegetables.  It's great seasoning for food that you grill.  Because it is a mix of spices, there isn't one overpowering taste.  It's easy to pour, yet you don't have to use a huge amount to get good flavor.  I would buy this product again and pass it along to friends.  Give it a try.

We have a KEURIG coffee maker (the big regular one) and when this arrived I wondered (just for a second) if it would work since it was not in the regular Keurig plastic container as each of these are in a vacuum sealed bag and each is in a small cloth coffee bag. They worked perfectly in our Keurig. Excellent coffee. Now, I have to admit that I have not seen this on the shelves at my local grocery stores (why? I have no idea), but this is a really good coffee.

i  the product.  Quite frankly I believe that this brand is the best premium brand of popcorn that is avaiklable today.  I like the pop-up pacaging because I don't have to wash dishes.As an aside, I do find that it is best to open the package with scissors to avoid making a mess, maybe I'm just clumsy.I recommend the gourmet popcorn to anybody who likes good popcorn.  I continue to uy it .Gunner  January, 2014
summary: I recommend the gourmet popcorn to anybody who likes good popcorn.

reviewText: The taste-tester of this formula was my baby cousin Skylee, age one year. This is the third Enfagrow formula she tried. She wasn't a big fan of the soy version - I don't think she liked the taste. She seemed to enjoy this one, too. It was very gentle on her stomach; her mom and I didn't notice any tummy rumblings so far.

O-K, I was a little dubious at first.  A lot of prepared herb and spice mixes on the market seem to be full chemicals that I can't pronounce and they taste very dull, extremely salty and have a strange, artificial after-taste.  THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM!When my order arrived the first thing that I did (after smelling it) was to taste the mixture straight out of the jar.  I was surprised at how clean and fresh the taste was.  I picked up on the herbs (I'm thinking oregano, basil, parsley, rosemary and maybe some mint), the sea salt and then the sweetness of the bell pepper combined with a tartness of the lemon juice.  There was a slight bit of heat (the garlic?) and a nice, pure, food-like aftertaste.Next I mixed it with some fine olive oil and used it as a dip for some crusty Italian bread.  Wonderful!  Later in the week I used it, along with some Dijon Mustard, as a coating for a rack of lamb.  I ended up adding a little crushed black pepper to the mix and it was great.  My guests commented that I always seem to have a way with seasoning.  I thought about telling them that I was using a prepared mix but decided to simply agree with them.Finally I used it as a salad dressing along with aged balsamic vinegar, wine vinegar and extra virgin olive oil.  It took a few minutes to get the proportions right, and I did add a little chopped rosemary and some fresh minced garlic. It was much better than any prepared dressing that comes in a bottle. I've yet to use it as an ingredient in a marinade, but I think that it would make a quick, tasty addition to some of the liquids that I am now using to add flavor to chicken and beef.I am really impressed with the flavor and quality of this prepared mix, so much so that I ordered the other two varieties (French and Napa) on my own.  I plan on keeping them as a staple in my spice cabinet (just don't tell anyone!)
summary: Much More Versitle Than I Would Have Imagined

reviewText: This tea is just amazing. It has a very unique taste, and if you like cinnamon at all you will love this. It is a bit strong at the recommended 1 cup per tea bag, but I'm guessing 1 & a half will be perfect. It is not overly hot like the (only) bad review says, except for maybe the fact that you may be willing to scald your tongue to drink it, its that good!One thing to note is some of the actual tea bags aren't very secure on the top, and the tea will likely pour into your cup. Might want to staple it down a bit more.
summary: Possibly the best tea I've had yet.

reviewText: First, there's a date on the bag that makes no sense. Second, there's no stale date on it and thirdly it doesn't taste anywhere near as good, to us anyway, as the French Roast we get from Coffee Bean DirectFrench Roast, Whole Bean Coffee, 5-Pound Bag. The French Roast is a Subscribe & Save (old one so we get 15% off) for about 31 bucks for 5 lbs for about the same price as this item. That said, the French Roast is stronger and the beans are nice and dark. I see some have referenced Eight O'Clock in reviews and I can remember when that was A&P;'s store brand... for those from the East many years ago. At the current price of 13 bucks a pound it compares with the bulk coffees at the local food stores for about the same price. I went with 3 stars because I don't think it supports all those 5 star reviews and it's in the average range for flavor. My drip coffee maker has a robust setting and with that on this blend isn't near a great cup of Joe.Based on some comments from someone who won't accept that my coffee doesn't taste as good as theirs I'm adding a bit more to my review. I ordered on January 4, 2013 and the date on my bag was 120911 (September 11, 2012 using the YY/MM/DD format) and it was listed as "New" on Amazon. As you can see, it was past the date when it was sold. I'm not stating anything about freshness... just taste and that we don't think it's anywhere near a 5-Star bag of coffee. The date "made no sense" to me because I was unsure what it was (stale date, best by date or whatever) and I didn't think Horton's would want Amazon distributing their coffee past that date... but that does not seem to be the case. If you already like this coffee continue buying it. If you like to purchase coffee 4 months past the date on the bag then please do so. My review has nothing to do with what others think of this coffee so there's no need to be defensive. We have both been drinking coffee for over 50 years each so the rating is purely our impression of taste... and it wasn't good. Because of the recent comment I've lowered the rating to 2-Stars because it still tastes inferior to a 5-Star coffee, it was sold after the date on the bag and we will not brew it without mixing it with other blends to improve the taste. We do use a decent Melitta drip coffee maker with a stainless thermal carafe and no warmer plate to burn the coffee.This review is just our opinion of taste: not strength and not freshness... though it is bitter and that could be because it's not fresh... but I'm not making that claim. It just doesn't taste good and if it were stronger it still wouldn't taste good. If I add more grounds it doesn't taste any better... actually worse. It does not state in the description that this is a "medium blend" as mentioned by the commenter. If you can only get a medium blend from "100% Arabica beans" it doesn't matter because it still doesn't taste good... but Arabica beans should  deliver complex flavors and it's just not there in the bag we received 4 months after the date on it. We drink medium blends also and used the example we provided because it tastes better so I'll add another example of a coffee that tastes better because there's no shortage of examples. To prove our point... at least to ourselves... we purchased a container of Maxwell House French RoastMaxwell House French Roast (Medium Dark) Ground Coffee, 33-Ounce Jugs (Pack of 2)... a medium-dark with 100% Arabica beans... near the sell by date (on sale for under 7 bucks because of the date) and it tastes far superior to the Horton's. Also, the container is 33oz. so it comes out to under 4 bucks a pound. I'm not a fan of buying pre-packaged ground coffee at a food store but if I can do so and get something that tastes better than Horton's it really doesn't make much sense to buy the Horton's... in my opinion. I get that someone who has rated this coffee 4-stars likes it but others have reviewed it unfavorably and we still don't like it.
summary: I'm not quit as impressed as others... and it was outdated.

reviewText: Love love love. Can finally enjoy coconut milk without wasting half the carton. These are great for single and double uses. Very happy someone figured out good things can come in small packages!

Let me start by saying that these are still candy! - not a health food - but a lot better for you than Reeses. And the taste is much better.  To me, the peanut product in reeses is more of a dried out paste than "butter."  Don't get me wrong, I loved them as a kid and still eat them on occasion.  If you crave chocolate and peanut butter, this healthier version should fill it. Some reviewers feel it isn't sweet enough but it's just about perfect in my mind.  So many of our treats are over-loaded with sugar and fat (and all the substitutes) that I think we've become accustomed to cloyingly sweet candy, soda and even yogurt. Once I cut back on sugar laden products, I began to appreciate products like Unreal Peanut Butter Cups with true flavors and a lot less junk.  Honestly, they're delicious. Can't wait to try the "snickers" version. Happy Snacking.
summary: Feeling Better About Peanut Butter Cups

reviewText: This is one great coffee substitute!  Had not problem switching from coffee to this product.  Best of all we love to have Dandy Blend in the evening and it doesn't keep us awake.  Good stuff, good tasting and good for your health.

This 18-oz. jar of McCormick ground cinnamon is for serious cinnamon lovers or  commercial bakers only!  It's huge, compared to the 1- or 2-ounce jars or cans of McCormick cinnamon that you'll find in the spice aisle of your local grocery store.  However, it's the same high-quality McCormick cinnamon that you find in the small-size containers.  I use a lot of cinnamon--mostly in cinnamon/sugar topping for buttered toast, but also in apple pies and baked things--so I find this super-economy-size jar to be both convenient and bargain-priced.
summary: HUGE Jar of High-Quality McCormick Ground Cinnamon

reviewText: The grocery store prices are very high for these - five dollars for an ounce where I live. These are one fifth that price. The quality of these seeds is just as good.

I tried this and the couscous flavor. They were both good, but the couscous one tasted better. I would highly recommend either one, as they are both pretty healthy, instant, and tasty (also portable). I like to cut up some pieces of tofu or sausage and put it in there when I make them, makes it perfect and complete.

I like these because they don't spike my blood sugar.  I usually stock up when Rite Aid has them on sale (several times a year at $2.00 per bar).  They also sell the 72% ghirardelli which I like for the same reason.  Highly recommend.

This is one among many teas I have bought. I am a tea junkie! I used to be a fan of Teavana, but they're just too damn expensive! Thanks to Amazon and their selection of teas, I can afford to splurge. This red rooibos tea is gentle and soothing. I like it. I'm getting online now to buy some more Chai. Thanks Amazon.
I really enjoyed this peanut butter, especially since it does not contain hydronated oils. However, it really just tastes like super sugary peanut butter.

I recently tried illy issimo's Cappuccino (8.45 ounce can) and really enjoyed it. I decided to try their slightly smaller (6.8 ounce) Caffe coffee drink as well, and I came away largely disappointed.  Obviously, there is less here to enjoy.  After a few generous sips, I found the can nearly drained.  I appreciate the fact that the entire drink clocks in at only 45 calories, making it perhaps the healthiest of all the commercially available cold coffee drinks.  I was also pleased to see that it uses beet sugar as a natural sweetener as opposed to corn syrup, and of course, all illy issimo drinks uses 100% Arabica coffee.  So, there's no denying the quality.But in short, this was not nearly as tasty or as satisfying as the Cappuccino I previously tried.  The Caffe was intense, slightly creamy, and just about as sweet as I would want it.  But it left me with a bitter, unpleasant aftertaste that lingered far too long.  You should not feel the sudden urge to brush your teeth or drink cold water after enjoying espresso, but that is exactly how I felt after finishing this.  Therefore, despite the quality ingredients, the initial taste, and the impressive low-calorie count, I cannot recommend this.  I'd rather double up on the calories and enjoy a larger can of their superior Cappuccino.

If you like to eat raw garlic this is for you.  I prefer my garlic cooked or in garlic salt form.  I was really looking forward to this flavor but won't buy again.  Almost all the popcorn popped and was usual Orville's quality.
Apparently, this was developed by a Harvard guy in the 1800s.  I love the fact that it does not contain Aluminum and the powder works great!

This stuff is just lovely. While it's not the same as my Robert Harris Italian Roast, it's pretty good stuff. I don't have to use as much as with Starbucks, and I get a good "bite" without bitterness. Every shipment is welcomed happily
summary: I have this on regular shipments.

reviewText: Not what I expected.  Not bad, just not as good as I thought it would be.  Sweetness is a personal thing, I found the product a little shy in that area.  Which is funny really, because I usually find foods too sweet for my taste.
I love gummi bears, and Haribo is the BEST! These are nice and chewy, excellent fruit flavors. Convenient-sized packages and cheaper than in my grocery store. I'll be ordering these again!
Swanson has the best broths and stocks over any of the others.  I also love the convenience of the 32-ounce containers.

I bought several of these over the past few months but I think the flavor flavor changed and it is not as delicious as the first box I bought which was titled Bold Italian dark.I sent an email to starbucks but never received a response.I no longer see the title of Italian dark bold even in their countless stores.Even with this important complaint it is still the best instant coffee made.PLEASE STARBUCKS BRING BACK THE OTHER RECIEPE AS THAT INSTANT COFFEE WAS TO DIE FOR, EVEN MORE THAN THIS.
summary: NOT AS GOOD AS THE FIRST BOX THAT WAS LABELED BOLD ON THE FRONT

reviewText: These are a pretty good replacement if you're really into cocoa krispies, but they don't turn the milk as dark as the chemical concoction put out by Kellogg's. The flavor is relatively good, but it's not as chocolatey as some might be hoping. Overall, it makes a good snack, but it is not at all filling as far as a breakfast cereal goes. Seems to mix best with sweetened milks such as almond milk; regular milk and goat milk left it a little plainer tasting.Also worth noting that this cereal tastes pretty good dry, if not better than it tastes with milk.Note: it doesn't snap, crackle, or pop.
summary: Healthier but not tasier than Kellogg's Cocoa Krispies

reviewText: I love this tea. I love the smooth feel of the individually sealed envelopes, I love the red of the box, I love the fragrance as it steeps, and I REALLY love the taste. It is just amazingly good, definitely worth the stained teeth.Occasionally I will warm up some milk in my mug (filled about halfway, I'd say) and let the teabag steep while the water is getting hot. Once I take the teabag out I just add some sugar and am ready to go.If you love tea, if you love gently but wonderfully spiced foods - try this. I am very glad that I found it.

I would give the taste of this blend a full five stars; it lives up to it's claims of "sweet and salty."  The chocolate is decent quality as well.  However, as is often the case when mixing nuts into mixes with chocolate, the moisture in the bag seems to make them lose some of their crunch and flavor.  (Deducted on star for less-than-stellar, though good, flavor; deducted second star for texture disappointment.)
It's 100 % pure orange juice, so you can't go wrong there.  The bottles are handy.  It's also sold and delivered at a good price.

I lover this coffee and will keep buying it.  I never drink Decalf but since getting a Keurig I can have a cup when I get home without brewing a whole pot and just love this decalf as it has the flavor of a full roast coffee.

I've tried several brands of matcha tea in the U.S., and this is among those that come closest to the taste I enjoyed in Japan.  This matcha mixes well (as others have noted, a bamboo whisk is a necessity... honest!) and doesn't have a trace of bitterness in it; it's absolutely a pleasure to drink just straight with near-boiling water (no sweeteners or milk needed, IMHO).  And it's a wonderful start to the morning, and just 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of this in the morning is enough to keep me alert and energetic all day :).Yes, it's expensive, but it's still way cheaper than a largely-artificial Starbucks matcha, for instance, or probably even your typical (and probably much-less healthy) "energy shake" / "breakfast bar."Lastly, just a couple of key reminders on preparing matcha tea (including this one!) in the best way:- Error on the side of using less-hot water.  I've had great results getting water to a light boil, then letting it sit for a minute or so before pouring into the matcha bowl, swishing it around for a few seconds, then adding the matcha powder.  Remember -- if the water is too hot, you risk having overpowering-strong & potentially bitter matcha :\.  Worst case of not-hot-enough:  slightly weaker but still nicely smooth and sweet matcha- Don't store matcha in your refrigerator door, where the temperature isn't as cool as the inner part of the fridge.- Don't expect it to be super-fresh months out.Hope this helps, and enjoy your matcha :-)

This coffee tastes very good.  I heated mine in a mug but it would be good over ice too.  Because it is very sweet I would not want to start every day with it but as a treat it's great.  By my calculations there is about a tablespoon of sugar in each 6.8 ounce can.  Cans are aluminum which is appreciated since that is the only substance I can recycle here.
I am always looking for interesting items for lunch at work.  These are great with no mess while making them.  Easy to make and very tasty.

What caught my eye at first was the price: $29 for 80 k-cups.  I thought I would try it and see if this was too good to be true.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The Fogchaser proved to be a strong, dark roast with a robust flavor.  The filter bottom actually allows for one of the strongest flavors I have found in a k-cup.  Fogchaser is now my regular coffee in the morning.  Add to this that the cup is a filter with minimal plastic, I feel a little better about the environment.  I am all around pleased and will continue purchasing for personal use.
summary: Great price, great coffee, less plastic - good all around

reviewText: This is top notch cocoa at a great price, get it delivered every few months to keep it in stock in the house.

To me, the quality of the coffee flavor was good (what I would expect from Illy), with smoothness rather than bitterness. However, the amount of coffee flavor is a bit too weak, so that the flavor of the sugar and milk dominate more than they should. And I didn't even realize that there was any cocoa in it until I read the ingredients.It is much better than the bottled Starbucks Frappuccino, because the Frappuccino has way too much sugar compared to this one. So if you want a sweet milky coffee drink, this is the one to get.Small Print:  it was "produced for" and "distributed by" Coca-Cola, product of Denmark.
summary: move over Frappuccino (but could be even less sugared)

reviewText: I HAVENT USED THIS YET, AS I HAVE IT FOR USE IN AN EMERGENCY .....SO IT IS IN THE EMERGENCY FOOD STORAGE....BUT THIS CAN MAKE SOUPS AND SAUCES.

It is hard to say you love gravy but I really do like lots of gravy over my turkey and mashed potatoes and who knows what else. The Campbell's Turkey gravy tastes just right to us and it comes in a can. The can is important as it comes at a great price in a pack of 12 on Amazon's Subscribe and Save program. We purchase lots of products on this program and store some in our garage pantry. So canned product is much more suited for such storage. We occasionally give our dogs a special dinner by putting a light topping of gravy over their dog food especially on those rare occasions when they seem disinterested in their meal.

I love coffee and I'm a big fan of Starbucks regular brewed coffee which I buy a lot of in the stores. I don't drink much instant coffee but I've tried several other brands in the past and didn't think this Starbucks instant coffee could be much better. I was wrong. Starbucks Via instant coffee tastes as close as you can get to regular brewed coffee. I was shocked at how good it is. It's rich, bold, and flavorful. The only downside is the price - it's significantly more than other brands of instant coffees. I still drink mostly fresh brewed coffee but when I can't and need instant I drink Starbucks Via

I like this flavor of coffee a bit better than their Morning blend.  I have a cup or two every morning at work.  The pods are a bit strange, but you absolutely can't beat the price.  Family company, too!
I don't like this flavor at all.  I imagined taste along the lines of the fruits displayed on the box, but it doesn't taste anything like orange, pineapple or guava.  It's got a weird aftertaste.
This strawberry product does not taste very sweet and is not as candy like as traditional fruit roll ups.  It is a shorter all natural version of the Twizzler strawberry licorice straw.

I love dark chocolate anything and I've tried dark chocolate almonds before and have enjoyed them.  These, however, were not as tasty as others. The chocolate almost wasn't even there. It was like the almonds were coated in cocoa, not "dark chocolate."  I don't think I would order any more of these.

Although I would never confuse this bread with the real French Bread, it is by far, the best gluten free white bread that I have made - from mixes as well as from scratch.  The mix is milk free - wonderful for those of us who have to avoid milk products. The texture of the bread is very close to traditional white bread made from wheat and does not become "grainy" even after several days in the freezer.  I think it it's easy to make, whether by traditional oven method or in a bread machine.  One of the very few bread mixes I highly recommend.
summary: Best Gluten Free White Bread Mix

reviewText: I tried the Eat, Think, Smile crispy thins, and it was an interesting journey for my taste buds. I was expecting a primarily cocoa/chocolate taste from these thins, but the cocoa flavor was subtle and mixed with rice and sunflower seeds (cocoa is only the fifth ingredient behind brown rice flour, sunflower seed butter, cane syrup and rice flour).  I even tasted sesame seeds and yellow corn in these chips, and that is alot of different flavors for one snack crisp.  The product is all natural and relatively low in sugar (only 6 grams per serving).  I don't mind some combination of tastes (chocolate and peanut butter are great combinations) but cocoa, sesame, sunflower seeds, yellow corn and brown rice?  This product uses quality ingredients, but the wide variety of tastes mixed into one crispy thin was too odd for me. Then again, taste is subjective, so someone else may appreciate the wide variety of flavors in one crispy thin. Just know what you are getting yourself into before you buy.
summary: An interesting combination of flavors unlike anything I've ever tried

reviewText: I was a little disappointed in this product.  I do buy more and more dehydrated vegetables, finding them more flavorful than canned or freeze dried.  These tomatoes disappointed me.  If you cook them too long they lose their flavor.  But I have used sun dried tomatoes, several different brands, and I guess I expected their intense flavor. I plan to stick with sun dried from now on.
summary: Not as flavorful as sun dried tomatoes

reviewText: I am an avid tea drinker and so I was at a bit of a loss when I became pregnant.  I wanted to cut caffeinated tea out of my diet during the pregnancy but soon found that meant my choices were limited to herbals and a small handful of decaf black teas, which were mostly flavored.  One day I came across this one at the grocery store and decided to give it a try.I've long enjoyed Stash teas for their quality, which is pretty incomparable.  I generally prefer loose teas to bagged but Stash is one of those rare teas whose flavor isn't compromised by the bag.  I found this to be the case with this particular tea.  It's not a very complex flavor, which is why I wouldn't give it a full five stars.  However, it is very mild and has a nice, subtle nutty flavor.  It's definitely a good tea for those who are new to greens as when it's brewed appropriately it has none of the bitterness or strong grassy flavor that can sometimes come through in greens.  It's an easy drinking tea and I sip it throughout the day, to the point where I drink around three oversized mugs of it a day.  In light of this, I now order it by the 6-pack from Amazon in order to have a continuous supply.

I was eating these alone for awhile and liked them, but then I got a bag of dried fruit like cherries, blueberries, plums etc and started mixing those in with the granola and it's amazing together.  It has lots of protein and fiber and tastes great and really helps keep me full between meals while I'm at work.  I've tried a few different granola over the years and this is one of my favorites.
Their Earl Grey and English breakfast do not come close to the quality of Twining teas.Very disappointing. Poor quality. Lousy flavor.

Item: Broccoli Cheese SoupBrand: Campbell'sPurchase: Win-CoPrice: $1.25 in storeNumber Purchased: 4ReviewI was so up set by this product. I love Broccoli Cheddar soup, I eat it all the time. I usually get it pre-made at stores or delis. I thought that having it so cheap to make at home would be great. I followed the instructions for stove top and it turned out horrible. The soup was like thick nasty nice, it has a level of grease, and it tasted foul. I couldn't stand it. I attempted it a second time and it was the same thing. It was such a waste of money. I couldn't make it, I wasted the 3rd can trying to bake cheesy chicken with it like in the Campbell's cook book and that was a bust.I donated the last to the food bank, and I feel bad about it because it was the bad and some poor family is going to get it. (And I usually donated to the food bank each month simply to help people).Never again, never ever again. Don't waste you time, pick a pre-made frozen brand.

I like that these are coated in some sort of cocoa powder instead of being chocolate-covered, much neater to eat on the go. They do not pack quite the chocolate kick that I would have enjoyed, but for just ten more calories per ounce than regular, unsalted almonds, you take the bad with the good. If I was having a real chocolate jones, I would have half a serving of these with a fewGhirardelli Chocolate Baking Chips, 60% Cacao Bittersweet Chocolate, 11.5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)

Splenda, which is a brand name for sucralose, started out in powder form in packets to compete with other sweeteners such as aspartame and saccharine, primarily to be added to drinks. The granulated form extends sucralose's uses to encompass all those in which sugar can be used. I have baked with it a couple of times, with good results; and it is especially convenient that it is formulated to substitute for sugar cup for cup, teaspoon for teaspoon. This obviously means that you prefer sugar in a sugar bowl rather than packets, you can use this just as you would regular sugar.The sucralose molecule is rather similar to that of actual sugar, which may account for the similarity of taste; but unlike sugar it contains virtually zero calories (note that "zero calories" does not mean "no calories," but rather an amount less than 1 calorie per serving. It's not enough to worry about, and most diabetics can consume it safely in reasonable quantities.Sucralose is my favorite artificial sweetener, but it still falls a little short of the taste of real sugar. The only way I know to describe the difference is to say that it tastes a bit lightweight. I use it to sweeten iced tea and find that a small amount of honey adds substance to the sweetness. This product is a boon to calorie watchers and, in this form, to cooks as well. I would be remiss not to note, however, that at least one grocery chain sells its own version of granulated sucralose, which I have found indistinguishable from the Splenda product except for having a lower pricetag.

I have been trying different coffee brands over the last year since we received our Keurig coffee maker, and I believe the San Francisco brand has the best prices on K cups! The coffee is good quality, and I appreciate having it in the more eco-friendly sack type of container which biodegrades more easily.

I was disappointed in this purchase. Both my husband and I couldn't taste any difference between this and regular coffee. I expected it to have a tad more 'flavor' to it of spice. I won't purchase it again. It was, however ,packaged well and shipped promptly.

The sweets are so handy to add to my soups.  Grab a handful and drop in.  No more scraping the potatoes.  The size is quite small, more like diced potatoes than my chunks I usually do with fresh potatoes.  Te ease of use overpowers size any day.

reviewerName: Beth DeRoos "Beth DeRoos from the California ...
reviewText: Have been making our homemade yogurt for decades and the reason I use this starter is even though I remove 1/4 cup of the batch I have made for the next batch, after a few months its good to have a fresh culture starter.  So every 3-4 months after having made literally gallons of homemade yogurt I will open one of the sealed packets of starter culture and start a new fresh batch of yogurt.  But we make a gallon of yogurt per week, because we eat yogurt with a half teaspoon of cinnamon in the morning, and make yogurt cheese for both cheesecake and for mixing with herbs for our own yogurt cream cheese with crackers or on bagels.If you eat little yogurt you could simply buy a small cup of store bought plain yogurt and use that for starter, but you also have to make sure the store bought stuff has no milk from cows that have received hormones or antibiotics. Something we avoid by only using organic raw milk.
summary: Have used this brand for a dozen or more years..here is why

reviewText: The basic ingredients are reasonably healthy.  Like so many cereals, there is a strong emphasis on giving it a sweet taste, even to the point of adding agave syrup, a sweetener which some view with suspicion.  The sweetness tends to drown out the vanilla flavor, which is unfortunate.  It may be a way, however, to get a healthy cereal into kids.  The re-sealable envelope package is more convenient than the usual box with liner and should keep the cereal fresh for a long time even in a humid area.  Worth a try if you are looking to add variety to your breakfast menu.
I love these cookies!  They are so light and crispy!  So good!  My toddler likes them too.  These are a great price compared to locally.  Yum!
summary: Mom loves them baby likes them

reviewText: I just tried the Crown Prince Natural Kipper Snacks and not loving it. I usually get the MW Polar Kipper Snacks, 3.53 Ounce Units (Pack of 18) on Subscribe and Save but for 2 months now they have been Out of Stock so I decided to try the Crown Prince since they are wild caught and reviews have been favorable. Alas, having one now for lunch and had to stop eating to write this review. Had it been great, I would have kept eating and written the review afterward.First, the shipment I received the packaging looked good on the outside but as I opened each of the individually cartoned cans, the cans themselves were covered in a sticky golden oil. No smell or odor or puncture in the can, nor do the 18 boxes show any damage, so I figure this is a usual thing with the Crown Prince Kipper Snacks? I also buy the Crown Prince Sardines for my dogs (I prefer CENTO) and never experienced oily cans. However gross as it was at first, again no effect on the actual contents of the cans or the flavor and freshness of the kipper snacks. Just dirty cans hard to wash with water... wear gloves and hope none of it gets on the plate.Then, tasting the Low in Sodium variety, meh... Nothing to write home about, unlike the MW Polar brand I actually gift to my mom and dad, they are so good! And I have a little tickle in my throat. Maybe just psyching myself out, but if you are looking for robust flavor, meaty texture and consistent freshness and clean cans... go for the MW Polar Kipper Snacks, 3.53 Ounce Units (Pack of 18).On the plus side, these kipper snacks are made without additives, preservatives, vinegars or oils and is well-suited for anyone on the Candida Diet and/or dealing with systemic yeast overgrowth. Just wish it tasted and textured as well as the MW Polar Kipper Snacks, 3.53 Ounce Units (Pack of 18) http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000KHMWQS/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_78Will order only if the MV Polars are Out of Stock...
summary: Not a substitute for the stellar MW Polar Kipper Snacks, but it will do once in a while

reviewText: My family loves this oatmeal.  We do not need to eat gluten free, but out of all the oatmeal we have tried, this is the best!  It's creamy, filling and delicious.
I have been happy with the results when I use this product in soups and stews. Obviously not the same as fresh peppers, but for some things  this works better.
summary: Works great for soups and stews.

reviewText: I've always enjoyed these Slim Jims as an afternoon snack, but never ordered them in bulk before. Glad I did because now I can enjoy one whenever I want. Much better for me than sweets.I got the original Slim Jim, but wouldn't mind trying the other flavors of this popular meat stick: beef jerky, beef steak or the beef and cheese. I like cheese, so will probably opt for that for my next purchase.As with all food, one shouldn't over-do; the extra calories should be added to your daily intake.Enjoy!Reviewed by Betty Dravis, August 14, 2013Author of "The Toonies Invade Silicon Valley"
summary: A filling snack... Tasty and time-tested...

reviewText: I love honey (as someone who drinks tea a lot) and I love raw honey especially. This is a very thick, dense product with a strong taste and a sharp sweetness- reminds me of molasses. I actually have been getting over a cold and sinus infection over the last few weeks, and have been taking teaspoonfuls of this honey and it helps my throat tremendously (I talk all day at work).If you get some time, look up the benefits of Manuka honey, it's very interesting, and makes it worth the price in my opinion.
I love this time of year! This coffee is full and robust; you can taste a hint of spice and cinnamon.
summary: I love this time of year!

reviewText: I am a big fan of Starbucks Frappuccino, but I don't get to drink it too often since it's a bit on a heavy side for a casual coffee-based drink IMHO. illy issimo cappuccino is a much lighter alternative to Farappuccino: it has half the calories (100 vs. 200) and fat (1.5 g vs. 3 g), albeit in a slightly smaller serving size. The lightness, of course, comes at a price and illy issimo cappuccino tastes as light as you would have expected it. It is made of medium-brew coffee, which is not that bad, but I prefer more full flavored varieties. This is a fairly tasty coffee-based energy drink, but it's not as impressive as illy issimo's espresso drinks. Nonetheless, I've enjoyed drinking it and would recommend it to most coffee lovers in a search of a convenient and tasty energy drink.
really good herbs and butter are already included, great flavor//// just add water to the mix and either cook on stove top of microw, add any vegi, and meat you have a great meal........
summary: knorr/lipton rice sides herb and butter,

reviewText: I can't attest to the healing properties of this honey, but the company that markets this product claims it's one of the best types of honey available. Maybe: I have personally seen how honey, applied to an abrasion, repairs tissue very effectively...and that's just generic clover honey. So, Manuka Doctor Bio is probably at least as good, if not better.It's derived from bees that pollinate manuka flowers, which are native to New Zealand, and the flavor is distinctive.  At first, it was sort of off-putting because it isn't as sweet as out North American flower honeys, and there's kind of a citrus-y aftertaste. But after the second or third taste, I think it's pretty good.It's cloudy, not clear, but that's fine: it still "behaves" like honey, whether you use it on toast or in tea.It's also a bit on the pricey side. If you're a true honey afficianado, Manuka Doctor Bio is definitely worth a try. If you're someone like me who just likes a little taste of honey regularly, you might be just as happy with the store brands that come in the bear-shaped containers.

But, it doesn't have an unusual taste.  I like it but if you were expecting a REAL vanilla taste you will be disappointed.  It is a combination of a vanilla and almost a light cherry taste.  The price of this seems to vary depending on where you order it and its not available everywhere.  Enjoy.
Not even close to saltines!  Typical gluten free tasteless starch with salty overtones.  Sorry I ordered a 3-pack.  I would recommend trying a single box to see if you like it before buying in bulk.

Chances are if you are buying this you already know what hempseed tastes like. The price is good and the quality is good as well, but these seeds are really an acquired taste. I still give it a 4 because of the brand and the health benefits of them!

This is a GREAT strong cup of coffee.  While I like strong coffee very well -- most are too acidic and tend to upset my stomach.This is a very smooth blend -- in my opinion much better than the Starbucks Pike Place.I make sure I have this on my subscribe and save monthly -- hopefully they will keep the price down in my budget
summary: The best coffee -- Not acidic at all!!

reviewText: These berries are better then I had thought they might be. Wonderful with my breakfast cereal/oatmeal. Now part of my diet.

Illy Issimo Coffee Drink is really good. I especially like it iced in this hot weather. It gives me a nice caffine boost. During the low part of my day (early Afternoon) it is a nice pic me up! It also tastes pretty good.If you like a deep rich coffee you will love it.Try it iced.

I buy these using the subscribe and save feature. We regularly have 5 or more items delivered per month, so we get these at a 20% discount. Great deal at about .30/cup (even better than a warehouse club price). I don't have any problems with the design and they work well in my Keurig.
summary: Great Deal for a Tasty Coffee

reviewText: These peppers are excellent for soups and stews, they have a very good flavor, not real strong, but very flavorful
This is very good gum and the flavor lasts. I was hesitant to try it but now need to reorder! Husband likes it too!

Hormel Mary Kitchen Roast Beef Hash, 15 oz. (236g)For a change of pace, if you can find this next to the  Hormel Corned Beef Hash, give it a try. The can lists a serving size as 7   ounces, or half a can, but going by the 2  ounce or 1/3 of a can that I used for reviewing the Hormel Corned Beef Hash, you should be able to get six servings from a 15 ounce can. If you are camping, and the weather is bad, you can even sit in the tent and eat this Hormel Roast Beef Hash cold, straight from the can. Add a little Heinz Ketchup to make it taste more like a meal. At home, heat some up in a frying pan with an egg or two added.  Eggs are hard to cook in a microwave, as just before the yolk dries out, it may explode and makes a mess.  You need to keep the egg away from the corned beef, and cover the dinner cooking plate with plastic wrap to contain any egg explosions.The egg white will not cook if it is touching the hash, and will require more time added to the two minute (1:55 minutes?) cooking time in the microwave, and by that time the yolk is dried out. A frying pan on the stove is definitely a better and more manageable way to cook hash and eggs. Use a slice of butter and medium heat to keep the food from sticking to the pan, as even non-stick pans will eventually wear out and become ordinary pans.In comparing the Hormel Roast Beef Hash with the Hormel Corned Beef Hash, on a per serving basis, the Roast Beef Hash seems to be better for you:Serving Size 1 cup (236g), Servings Per Container about 2.Amount Per Serving: Hormel Roast Beef Hash----Hormel Corned Beef Hash.Calories.......................380................................380..Calories From Fat........220................................220Total Fat........................24g................................24g..Saturated Fat...............10g................................11g..Trans Fat......................1g..................................1gCholesterol....................70mg.............................80mgSodium.......................790mg............................990mgTotal Carbohydrate........22g.................................24g..Dietary Fiber................2g...................................2g..Sugars........................1g...................................1gProtein........................19g..................................16gPercent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet:..Vitamin A, Vitamin C.....0%..................................0%..Calcium.......................2%..................................2%..Iron..........................10%..................................8%Based on this chart, it would appear that the Roast Beef Hash is healthier, with less Cholesterol, less Sodium, less Carbohydrate, and more vegetable  Protein. It is still a little salty, but not anywhere near as salty as the Corned Beef Hash. Prepared foods in general contain far too much sugar and salt. The salt causes high blood pressure and water retention, while the sugar causes obesity and Adult Type 2 Diabetes.The Hormel Roast Beef Hash ingredients: BEEF, REHYDRATED POTATOES, WATER, TEXTURED VEGETABLE PROTEIN (SOY FLOUR, CARAMEL COLOR), CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF SALT, HYDROLYZED SOY, CORN , AND WHEAT PROTEIN, FLAVORING, SUGAR, SPICES.  The can also lists a recipe for a Puffed Hash Omelet.The Hormel Corned Beef Hash ingredients:  BEEF, REHYDRATED POTATOES, BEEF STOCK, CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF SALT, SUGAR, FLAVORING, SPICE, SODIUM NITRITE.  The can also lists a recipe for Cheesy Corned Beef on English muffins.Distributed by Hormel Foods Sales, LLC, 1 Hormel Place, Austin MN 55912  Hormel Foods, LLC.; web: hormel.com; Phone: 1.800.523.4635.
summary: Easy Meal Hot Or Cold, Whenever You Need It, No Cooking Or Refrigeration Required.

reviewText: Since I first discovered the Nutiva EVCO about 2.5 months ago, not only has my skin become more soft and supple, even in these winter months, but my labs and blood-work have benefited very much with the inclusion of the EFAs re-introduced back into my diet.  I see nothing but clear skies ahead, as regards my overall physical health and well-being.  Thanks, Nutiva!
This is a good product and is very tasty, as long as the box has not been tampered with. Some people tend to open the box and eat a few while in transit I suspect. They are just that good a snack.

I enjoy the flavor of this product very much. I almost never get any sort of flavored coffee from Starbucks, I'm typically a regular coffee guy.  I've seen the light and I'm enjoying my Dolche Gusto machine almost every night.This is probably my 3rd favorite flavor. Cappuccino and Choochino beat it out but this one tastes VERY similar to the Cappuccino so it's a tough call. Try one, you'll probably like it.  The downside is the expense, you're talking about $1 a drink, not to mention the price of the machine.  That's pretty steep for a homemade coffee drink IMO.
Una leche evaporada de cabra de gran calidad. Puede comprarla sin ninguna duda. Quede muy satisfecha con esta compra. Volvere a comprarla
This are shipped straight to you. Great tasting, and the turkey meatballs are fantastic. Well worth the investment. Especially for the moments when you need something fast.

I keep a few of these at the office for a nice break. The cherry and cocoa mix is a bit of a surprise. Based on the label, I was expecting more of a mixed berry flavor but it turns out the only fruit component is dried cherries which is slightly tart. The cocoa flavor is light and not as sweet as chocolate chips. But the great thing about this mix is that the bar ends up being a nice balance of the tart and sweet. The almond and oats add a nice chewy/nutty texture. All in all, I really like it. For less than $4 for 5 bars, it's not a bad deal. But, I'd probably wait for bigger discounts with a Subscribe & Save option.

This ginger arrived in small pieces, skin discolored, and not really all that fresh, soft spots.  It arrived in a thin paper envelope instead of a small box, so it got beat up in delivery.  It's 'OK' for use, but expected better.Order placed on the 3rd, arrived on the 22nd.  I got 11 oz, not 14.This seller is communicative and friendly, but should work on having product on hand and ready to ship out -- most people expect and are willing to pay priority mail prices for produce... this product could have shipped in a small flat rate box for not much more than the first class postage charged.I gave excellent seller feedback (which has mysteriously disappeared) even before the product arrived based on the friendly communication.  I may give them another chance if I can't find another source, but next time I would expect fast shipping, fresh product and the amount advertised.
summary: not really all that fresh, arrived late, and less than 14 oz

reviewText: for the amount of calories this soup is awesome.  comes in at only 240 cals for the entire can for creamy thick clam chowder!

Overall, I like the blend of flavors for this bar. The chocolate is more of a cocoa flavor than traditional chocolate, which works nicely with the tartness of the berries.  I would prefer if they were a little less sweet, and looking at the ingredients you can see there is some added sugar for a total of 10grams per bar.  Not overly high, but I would have liked it to be around 6grams of sugar per bar.  The bars are not overly chewy, which is a good thing, so you don't need to worry about any dental work - they taste more like a soft oatmeal cookie with a bit of bite.
summary: nice blend of flavors, a bit sweet for me

reviewText: I like this curry but I preferMae Ploy Thai Red Curry Paste - 14 ounce per jar,Mae Ploy Thai Green Curry Paste - 14 oz jarandMae Ploy Thai Yellow Curry Paste - 14 oz jar.I don't like the fact that you have to remove it from the can and find a way to store it after you open it.To me, the yellow curry didn't compare well to what I'm used to.

I like chewy granola bars.  In fact, theCascadian Farm Organic Chewy Granola Barare the best I've had in terms of flavor and texture.  Next up, theNature Valley Crunchy Granola Barshave a great flavor, but they're crunchy.  Good, but crunchy.These "Eat.  Think.  Smile." granola bars, texture-wise, could be considered the unfortunate offspring of the above chewy and crunchy goodness.  Mine were "mostly crunchy" (but not dry like those that are advertised as crunchy) but when a small enough piece was in my mouth, it softened up enough to not be crunch.  If you take the entire bar and fold it in half, it will break, not bend.So, kill one star for the "Chewy" not living up to its name here.And the other star goes away for a variety of reasons:  "mixed berry" is misleading, unless you consider juice a berry.  The only actual berry in here is cherry, and while it does provide a burst of sweetness, it doesn't taste much like a cherry.  And the cocoa powder they use seems to be more for health benefits (anti-oxidants) and coloring than for flavor, because these neither smell like nor taste any like cocoa/chocolate.All in all, I wouldn't really recommend these unless you're don't mind the texture, and can tolerate a granola bar not tasting like granola, chocolate or "berries" (cherries) that they're advertised as.

Campbell's makes a really good-tasting chicken broth that's good for low-salt diets. Unfortunately, it has disappeared from supermarket shelves. I was so happy to discover it on Amazon at a reasonable price with free delivery. We couldn't be happier!You don't need overwhelming salt to have flavor in your food. Good stuff!

This is a very mellow, smooth tea with less caffeine than black tea or green tea. I don't need any sweetener with this one as it seems to have its own sweetness. Good for sipping with cheese and crackers.

HAS A WEIRD AFTERTASTE. SINCE THE ORDER COMES WITH 3 PACKAGES, WE THOUGHT THE FIRST ONE WAS TAINTED BECAUSE OF THE STRONG CHEMICAL TASTE, BUT BY THE THIRD BOX, WE REALIZED IT'S JUST THE PRODUCT. I STOPPED EATING IT AFTER TRYING EACH PACKAGE. I'LL NEVER BUY THEIR STUFF AGAIN.

The family and I really enjoyed these gummies. We compared shapes and textures, each selecting our favorites. The favorite texture was white backed, then the traditional, and finally the jam-filled.  The favors were average none stood out above the others; they were all similar. We did like how soft the gummies were – the reclosable bag kept them fresh until final gummy was eaten.

I tried 3 flavors (Cherry Berry, Orchard Blend and Tropical Blend) and found the following to be true of all of them.1) Packaging is impressive with long, narrow, foil lined one-serving sized bags. However, the size of the bag is deceiving for the amount of product inside. Although they are easy to open by simply tearing off the top inch, they are not resealable - not that you would want to because the servings are so 'small'. The bag design also makes it near to impossible to reach in by hand for snacks. Even a child's hand is too large, resulting in having to eat this snack by pouring into hand or bowl.2) At the bottom of each bag is a layer of fine 'powder' residue from the dried fruits.
