It gets on everything and stains: esp. when wet from fingers, etc. It also makes it difficult to get the last of the snacks from the bag to your mouth, esp. if eating directly from the package,  because the powder from the bottom of the bag puffs out, up your nose and all over your mouth. Makes a mess.3) All 3 flavors that I tried had the same issue as someone mentioned in their comments before me: each flavor seems to have an over-abundance of one particular fruit. In the Cherry Berry, it is apples. In the tropical, I found it to be mangoes, and in the orchard, it was bananas, lots and lots of bananas.4) I also found some of the snack to be 'crunchy' while other pieces of fruit were sticky/mushy once in my mouth. Ex. banana slices. The combo of moosh and crunch (very little crunch) was disappointing when this is suppose to be a 'crunchy snack'. I found myself using it up in yogurt and oatmeal rather than as a snack.This is a natural snack so the first time around I didn't mind the expense. However, now that I know what to expect, I will not purchase again unless the packaging and fruit 'dust' issues could be addressed. Then it might be worth the money. Until then, I'll buy my own fresh bananas, mangoes and apples.I will admit, however, a few of these put together in a gift basket would make a nice presentation for someone who has never tried this product.

I absolutely love Enjoy Life products!! These cookies are a staple at our house!  You would never know they are allergy-free!  They have great flavor and a wonderful crunchy texture!  I am so thankful for this company and this product since we are an allergen free family!

I have been extremely impressed with the illy canned drink line and this was no exception.  It's a refreshing boost of caffeine which offers a great balance between the boldness of the coffee and its sweetness.  Perhaps the biggest selling point was the lack of a bitter aftertaste.I'd recommend this for those who enjoy straight up espresso drinks and for those looking for an afternoon pick-me up.  This is one of the better coffee drinks I've had.

Expensive but good for ya.....I always go for organic anything whenever possible. It is a better gamble than an insurance plan as far as my experience goes. Good food is the "insurance". I am sure things slip thru the organic system but I still think it is a better gamble. Nuts are no exception, gotta stay away from chemically grown & processed foods AMAP.  Watch out for those GMO's! Over continued use you will taste the difference.  Okay, since I got started...."You are what you eat".....if you feed your body good nutrition it can heal itself.

These are the best dried cherries we've ever eaten!!  We have ordered four boxes these last two years as we add them to our Trail Mix, salads and just for munching.  We hope this Company keeps up the high quality of their dried cherries as everyone who has tried them here has loved them too!!
summary: Traverse Bay Fruit Company Dried Cherries are Awesome!!!

reviewText: Plump beautiful vacuum sealed beans. Down here a shriveled bean in a glass jar costs over four dollars. These vanilla beans were well sealed, moist but not nasty, with a lovely vanilla smell and taste.

I like Kashi cereals alot so I had high expectations of Golean Cinnamon Crisp.  The cereal combines with milk well and it holds its crunch (probably due to the generous sugar coating).  It has a good cinnamon but sweet flavor.  I tried eating it dry but it was too dry and not to my liking.  It is much better with milk.  The nutrition numbers are good except for the sugar content which is high for a healthy cereal but not bad if the portion is kept modest.  The cereal is filling and a good start to my morning.
summary: Light, crispy and great taste but sweet.

reviewText: I enjoyed this product.  Although very bland, it has a pleasant hearty quality and the blandness can be fixed by doctoring it with your own favored spices.  It then makes great sloppy joe sandwiches.

I thought there would be at least a hint of caramel or, being Werthers, of toffee but all I get from these is run of the mill overly sweet milk chocolate.  Not better or worse than any milk chocolate from a drug store hollow Easter bunny to the coating on a Kit Kat bar.  All the same stuff and not bad tasting but certainly not remarkable.
summary: Not bad but not good either

reviewText: I love these mega chunks! I use them for all my chocolate needs. I have used them to make a variety of baked goods and candy.Very versatile.
Excellent product. Amazon's prices were very good a few months ago. However, now the price is more than the popcorn costs in the grocery store.

For me nothing says the holidays like peppermint lattes @ Starbucks. But who can pay $4+ for their smallest size? And if you are like me, you want to enjoy your coffee while sitting at your desk 1st thing in the morning when you get to work. Who has the time to wait in 15min morning rush lines at your local coffee house? I don't have $4 a day or an extra 15min even to rush over for some coffee so that is where Maxwell House Peppermint Mocha Latte comes in hand. Make your own holiday classic out of the convenience of your own home, at work, or even in your car on the way to work as long as your aren't driving. It's that simple, and you can adjust the flavor to meet your needs instead of having to wait an extra 10min to send your drink back for them to fix it for you. All you need to do is boil water, or heat milk, and then add 4-5 teaspoons of latte, stir and you are done! That's it who knew a latte would be so simple to make. I prefer to make mine with milk with about 6 teaspoons (I prefer a stronger peppermint taste, but overall I would rate the peppermint flavor mild with only 4 teaspoons and the mocha very slight.) and add a little bit of caramel drizzle to go along with it. Takes me only 1 min to get my latte ready in the morning and I am out of the door, and the best part about the whole thing is that it didn't cost me $4 for a single cup.Other than convenience, I love the fact that you get foam on the top of your latte. I know lattes are supposed to have foam, but I can't tell you how many times I have bought make-it-yourself-lattes and their excuse for foam has been this pasty layer at the top. Maxwell House lattes have had a generous amount of foam on the top, much more than you would expect from something that you are just stirring into a cup.If your just like me and love your holiday coffee but don't have time and don't want to pay your coffee house prices I highly suggest you try Maxwell House Peppermint Mocha Latte. And if you want an extra treat add a little bit of caramel to your drink, you can thank me later.
Fantastic product....great addition to vegan cookies.Delicious to eat right out of the bag for a quick pick me up.
The taste is good and spiced well, but it is really dry and hard.

My husband and I love the Raspberry Quince tea from Republic of Tea and we actually received this as a sample bag when we ordered the Raspberry Quince bottled tea from RoT. I tried it and have to say that it's really good. The hibiscus tea has a hint of berry and citrus, lending it a nice fruity flavor without being overpowering. The natural sweet flavor is a bonus as it means I can have it without adding any sugar or artificial sweetener. This tea can be steeped hot or as iced tea. The tea is also caffeine-free, and the main ingredients are hibiscus (flower), sweet blackberry (leaf), and stevia (leaf). Refreshing and wonderful!
summary: Yum! A perfect juicy, herbal blend!

reviewText: You can turn water into a pitcher of refreshing, really brewed-tasting iced tea in a few minutes. Just put the pitcher in the refrigerator and by the time you have lunch or dinner on the table your beverage is ready.Because it's unsweetened, you can add your own sweetener to taste. But, it's really so darn good that you might want to savor the tea's natural taste.Lipton Cold Brew Tea Bags are economical and GOOD!
summary: "Instant" iced tea without the powder-mix taste!

reviewText: First of all, this real maple syrup needs to be REFRIGERATED after opening, as there are no preservatives in it. Not so, with some faux brands of syrup like Mrs. Butterworth's or Hungryjack syrups. In fact, those syrups are not maple syrup at all, as they are nothing more than corn syrup with artificial maple flavoring. Corn syrup has the guilty reputation of raising blood sugar and being very high on the Glycemic Index scale.  However, real maple syrup is surprisingly low on the GI scale and very safe to eat for everyone, including diabetics.I love this syrup. It is dark, and not thick, as you would expect a faux syrup to be, which makes it easy to pour. It definitely does taste like maple, although not overwhelmingly so. As a personal treat to myself, I slice bananas in a bowl, pour Anderson's Maple Syrup over them, put a dollop of real whipped cream on top, then pour a slight smidgen more maple syrup on top of the whipped cream. This makes a wonderful sweet treat, healthy for everyone. I definitely recommend this syrup to all.
summary: The Difference Of Real Maple Syrup

reviewText: I really likeWerther's Original Hard Candy, Sugar Free, 2.75-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12), so I thought I'd try their new chocolate/caramel hybrid.The chocolates are individually wrapped in foil and have the consistency of pastilles likeDroste Pastille Milk, 3.5-Ounce Roll (Pack of 12).  The chocolate is surprisingly rich and melts in your mouth.  There is a subtle caramel flavor that permeates throughout the entire experience.Rich, tasty, and a great new product oeuvre from Werther's!
summary: Smooth, Luxurious Chocolate with Hint of Caramel

reviewText: Tone's has always been a good brand for spices and the garlic powder was no exception. It came quickly and was worth the money. I will buy from this company again.

This illy issimo coffee drink is a nice pick me up during the day. Has a delicious coffee taste with just the right amount of sweet added. Drink it straight out of the can or in a cup, cold or hot, convenient size.
Used these for Halloween and the kids seem to like them. Good taste and expected quality. My granddaughter is a fan.

I was initially attracted to the Rishi Tea because it is certified Organic - I choose organic whenever possible.  I am already a big fan of Earl Grey teas, and this one did not disappoint.  It is very full-flavored, with a lovely note of bergamot, as one would expect from the best Earl Grey blends.  Enjoy it hot or cold, and do try it without sugar or honey first - it really doesn't need it.  I recommend this product!

This is a great bag of Treats.  There is not much to review here because basically you get a bag of small snickers and peanut M&Ms.  The bag costs a little more, maybe because of the peanuts, but I think people enjoy them more.

I tried the MIO liquid peach tea in hopes of substituting it for an instant mix that I had been using. Unfortunately it does not even come close to peach tea. I was disappointed.When used as recommended (one squeeze per eight ounces of water) it has an extremely weak taste that does not resemble either peach or tea. It's difficult for me to understand why it is called an enhancer.I'll just stick with bottled water.
summary: For the price, I'd rather just drink water

reviewText: Just love the taste and crunchy texture of these cookies. The gingery taste, has a bit of a bite to it, that I just love.  I've not found a cookie over here, that compared to these, so will order again.

reviewerName: J. Nachison "long-time SF and history lover"
reviewText: So this is chocolate and fudge.  I tried it after a day at work, to 'relax'  and hold me over until i got home.  Close, but no cigar.Chocolate taste on the coating is minimal, though melts with finger heat just like the real thing.  Body is crumbly, heavy and bland.  I noticed a full, but backgroundish chemical taste (not oder).  There was little feel or taste for a chocolate fudge energy bar.Yes, it's edible.  Recommended?  I'll leave that to individual tastes in case you buy it.

Every bit as good as the Vermont maple syrups, in my opinion.  As you may know, Grade B maple syrup has a stronger flavor than Grade A and I prefer the grade B version.Looks like Amazon's out of stock as of this writing.  Hopefully they will get more soon because it's quite good and also was well-priced.

First whiff tells you this is freshly cut, real oregano. Unlike some others I won't mention there is nothing stale about this one. It came well packed in an air-tight bag. I like the fact that it's USDA organic, as all your herbs and spices purchases should be.Will be ordering this one again.

Unlike a lot of cheese flavored snacks that just taste salty and processed, these actually taste like cheese and garlic!  It probably not too surprising considering the first ingredient listed is parmesan cheese.These are made with whole grains, are really filling, and taste wonderful.  The crackers are nice and thick, and have a good crunch to them.  They are very sturdy and would be great for dipping, but they tasted so good I didn't even think of putting anything on them.  I will definitely buy this product again.
Very fresh and LOTS of them!  Compared to what they cost in the grocery store,  these are a must for those who use lots of Caraway in bread making!
dehydrated onion has become difficult to find in my area.  I have used Tone's products for many years and have always been pleased with them.  No problems here.
I am a vegan who insists on organic, and I love this brand of spices. They're fresh and tasty and very well-priced. I have many varieties and love them all.
This is absolutely delicious over ice with my favorite vanilla soymilk! Add your favorite syrup and you've got Starbucks for a fraction of the price! Yummy!
summary: No need to go to Starbucks anymore!

reviewText: This is some really nice tea.  Even brewed slightly weak, the flavor comes through.  The scent will fill your whole house and just make everything seem a little bit better.  If you like Earl Grey, this is definately a brand to give a try.

I was surprised at how good the Barilla Gluten Free Rotini pasta turned out! Barilla GF pastas have the best texture and taste of any GF pasta line I've tried. It is very close to that of wheat pasta. And, I've tried a lot of GF pastas.I like my pasta a bit al dente and this came out perfect. The combination of corn and rice seems just right. But then who knows pasta like Barilla?For exceeding my expectations Barilla GF Rotini Pasta earns 5 stars from me.Update:Jan 23, 2014In a recent dinner with friends the Barilla GF Rotini was very much appreciated. Even the non-GF eaters were impressed at how much it was like "normal" pasta. After years of not so nice GF pasta these Rotini are amazingly good.
summary: Very close to non-GF pasta: Updated

reviewText: This is a very nice, full flavored green tea. Also very convient in the K-Cup packaging. I have tasted some lose leaf premium green tea that is a little better, but much more expensive and not in K-Cup style.
this was just the right coffee for my family every morning,we all love the smell of it from the coffee maker.

I m a Ron Teeguarden fan... but... not in this tea... I like the taste of the straight Gynostemma tea w/o anything added and after-all that is what we are after.  I just do not like the taste of this nor the price.
summary: Sorry... It tastes bad to me...

reviewText: This is some seriously healthy stuff a great alternative to brown rice and CousCous. Like anything you cook seasoning is the key, I use Herb Ox Beef  and Herb OZ Chicken boullion cubes as well as Bragg's Liquid Aminos with finely diced onions, sweet and spicy peppers along some finely diced scallion and steam it in my Aroma Stainless Steel Rice Cooker, with great results!
This was definitely  not worth the money and won't order again. It's so forgettable  I forgot I had it.Linda

After mixing and remixing this, I finally found the correct ratio of product to liquid.  The peppermint flavor is bold while the chocolate is not quite rich enough, being masked by the initial mint burst.  However, when mixed with milk, the flavors come out a bit more evenly than with water, which tends to make this seem really watered down if there isn't enough flavor mix added.  I like it as a change from just chocolate or vanilla coffee flavor since the peppermint is refreshing without being overly powerful.  Just takes some fiddling to get the mixture right.  Overall, a good instant product.

I love granola bars, and I have often used them to satisfy a sweet craving to keep me away from something like a candy bar (even small ones).  This bar certainly looks great with a chocolate coated bottom, and some drizzled on the top.  Its on the small side, but that is happening more and more as we see more bars that are fewer calories and such.  This is a nice mix of protein and fiber, although, typically I personally either want a lot of fiber, or a lot of protein.  You will need to figure out if the mix of nutrients meets your needs.  I still seemed to be hungry after eating the bar.As far as taste, it has a sweet taste - I'm not sure how to describe it - maybe honey-like, but chocolate did not stand out, maybe because this was "dark chocolate".  I marked it down one star because even being dark chocolate, it just didn't even stand out at all.I recommend this bar as a light snack if you need something sweet, a little fiber, a little protein, and you aren't a big chocolate lover.

I ordered several Stevita products and this was one of them. I had read many reviews where people described stevia products as having a bitter or weird after taste.So when I got this product I added a litte bit at a time and tasted it as I went... I made a normal sized Kool-Aid or juice type decanter and added a full teaspoon (not heaping) of the powder. It has a very nice subtle sweet and fruity flavor. You could add more for a much more pronounced sweetness and flavor but I think thats what happens when people complain of a bitter after-taste... they add too much.The Stevita drink mixes were not meant to have the bold flavors and sweetness of say.. Kool-Aid or grape juice.These products are wonderful for those who are avoiding sugar, diabetics (check with your doctor first), low-carbing, artificial sweeteners and are tired of drinking water, water, water all the time ;)When you receive the container you will be surprised about the size... it is smaller than it looks online but remember a little goes a LONG WAY!

I LOVE this stuff. I have a glass of cherry Stevita with me almost at all times, it seems! The taste is good and thanks to Cherry Stevita (and Grape Stevita, Lime Stevita), I am almost off all sugar. I can feel the difference. The flavor is good and doesn't have an artificial sweetener taste.

These are the perfect substitute for low carbers as it is almost identical to peanuts in taste but with a low-carb friendly nutritional value. This is also a great way to get some fiber in your diet as you will head to the bathroom starting day 1.
A light tasting coffee.  Flavor is smooth with a hint of sweetness. Not a strong taste for those who don't like the bold coffee flavors.

Ok, the word 'gourmet' probably doesn't fit into the realm of popcorn, but this is the best commonly available.  For taste, hulls (those irritating kernel shells you find in every kernel), and price, Orville Redenbacher is the tops.I calculated the price and quality and found this to be the best value out there.  Other brands are good too, but consistently Orville Redenbacher is the best.

I like that these granola bars are packed with 4 gram of fiber and 4 grams of protein. At 110 calories per bar, it's a guilt free treat! The granola bars have a nice blend of chocolate and peanut butter, which helps curb cravings. The bars are made of  granola mixed with peanut butter chips, dipped in and drizzled with chocolate. However, the bars are just a tad dry and feel a bit gritty. Would definitely taste better with a tall glass of milk.
summary: Good by a bit of a gritty

reviewText: Comes individually packaged. Has a white candy powder coating and tastes like ginger. Love this product. I even have the tea form so have no complaints. Not sure why some people complained about the stickiness. I had no trouble taking it out of the wrapping or having it stuck to finger or anything. I think that was a bit of exageration from some commentors but whatever. It worked great for me and I love it and will continue to buy more. The bag is a bit small but has plenty to last a while.

This truly is the best granola I've ever tasted.  Unlike most granolas I have tried in the past, Bear Naked granola is not dry and hard. It is chunky, with a texture that lies somewhere between crunchy and chewy. It's just right and it tastes great. Peak Protein is the most nutritious of the variety and it is excellent with yogurt.

This popcorn tastes good and is a generous size for one. The bag claims that it is 30% larger and fluffier than the leading ready to eat savory popcorn, I'd agree with that and was thinking when I opened it that the kernels were in fact very big before I ever saw the print on the package about kernel size.The cheese taste is tangy and just the right amount. Since it is a white cheddar, there is no orange residue left on the fingers. The calorie count is 240 cal per bag, for the 1.5 oz bag, I thought that was pretty good since there is more than enough for 1 person. The popcorn tasted fresh, not stale and not overly processed. I would buy this snack again.

Many years ago, as a teenager, I LOVED these "international coffee" blends, expecially the "suisse mocha" flavor - it was my entree into the world of coffee.  This was long before Starbucks.  I haven't had it in ages but I'm a sucker for anything pumpkin so I decided to try this. Honestly, I liked it better than Starbucks "pumpkin spice latte."  It is tasty and soothing.HOWEVER - don't kid yourself that you are drinking "coffee" - instant coffee ranks a distant 3rd (or 4th?) after sugar and nondairy creamer.Also - the new "lock in fresh" packaging is a bit of a fiasco. I capped the container tightly but I'm still finding powder on the outside of the container, and the counter. Preferred older packaging.
summary: Tastes good ... but not much coffee...

reviewText: Great brand and product, however, granola companies that put whole almonds in granola should rethink their formula.To me, its just a lazy way to fill the bag.  almonds are great. i love them, eat them.  however, to try and process a whole almond in a cereal format...just DOES NOT WORK!
Great tasting granola. I like to add it to yogurt for breakfast, or pour milk over it like cereal. Recommended.

I have been using this product for over a year.  Before finding this I always had to remember to have fresh lemons on hand. Sometimes they would go bad before I used them.  Also, I no longer have to squeeze my own lemons and get to avoid that sometimes messy chore.  I still use real lemon slices for garnish at times.

The juice itself was ok, expired approximately six months after shipping date. However the packaging left some to be desired. Several cans were beat up and one had a small puncture allowing the other cans to be wet. Good to get if on sale and looking for a deal on V8.
summary: Juice was ok, packaging not so much

reviewText: I found these to be crunchy & the flavor to be very good which lasted the whole time I was chewing a cracker until I swallowed it. Seems to be a good healthy snack too although some people might want something to drink with these as they are a bit dry but that doesn't ruin my opinion of these crackers at all. Not something I would buy in the future yet I'll finish the bag anyway.

What a find this was!!  We love this.I was fearful of purchasing 12 boxes of this without knowing if we would like it, but thankfully, it's delicious and so easy.  Takes less than a minute to mix everything up and it's ready!We add a little bit more water than the directions call for and also add some olive oil.With Subscribe and Save, I figure I am saving 2 or 3 dollars over what I would pay at the store each time we make this tasty treat at home! AND I can make it anytime and it's ready in seconds!

I must confess to being completely taken by this juice.  I adore the packaging, the name, and even the story behind its birth.The taste is delightfully refreshing and different.  And while it does nothing in aiding the diet or lowering your sugar intake, it does make you feel better about drinking it since it is not a soft drink per say.My husband who hates all things that could potentially be healthy would allow me to put this into his lunch.  It was a huge deal that he liked these.  Again, it's better than the Mountain Dew he constantly drinks otherwise.Fun, fruity, and unique... we do buy this juice occasionally.  However, it too is hard to find and expensive when we do to carry it as a regular grocery staple.

Some people may put Shake N Bake anything in the same category as Ramen Noodles, but I don't really care about all that. This little pouch is a life saver, not to mention time saver. I have an 18 month old and sometimes attempting to cook anything is impossible. I need something quick and easy. Well, this is it. Literally, just shake and bake. Anybody can do this, it requires zero skill. And it actually is tasty. I leave mine in the oven a couple minutes longer than the suggested time, because I like my chicken somewhat on the crispy side. Pair it with anything you want, for you can't go wrong!

reviewerName: Lisa Shea "be the change you wish to see in t...
reviewText: Orville Sharp White Cheddar Popcorn is marketed as a 100% whole grain, healthy snack. Just how healthy is this ready-to-eat popcorn, and how does it compare with Smartfood?For a product promoting the Sharp White Cheddar aspect with glowing photos, there just isn't much of a cheddar flavor here. With the Smartfood popcorn, it tastes like real cheddar was layered over the popcorn, with that delicious, full flavor. Here it's as if some cheese-like flavoring was barely sprinkled on it. It barely tastes cheddary.It's not that it's bad, but more that it's "mostly harmless". When there is another option to choose from, it doesn't make sense to take this one instead, if cheddariness is your goal.So then, maybe this one is more nutritious?Unfortunately, no.With this Orville bag you get 1.5oz of popcorn. The Smartfood comes in a 1oz container. So the Smartfood is a better portion for portion control, and is still quite filling. That then also causes a significant skew in what you're ingesting. Here are the stats. In each pair the first number is the Orville number, and the second is the Smartfood number.Calories: 240 / 160Fat Calories: 140 / 90Total Fat: 16g / 10gSaturated Fat: 2g / 2gTrans Fat: 0g / 0gCholesterol: <5g / <5gSodium: 420mg / 290mgTotal Carbs: 21g / 14gFiber: 2g / 2gProtein: 3g / 3gSo you get just as much protein and fiber when eating the SmartFood popcorn. And you save yourself quite a lot on carbs, sodium, fat, and calories. In just about every way the SmartFood is the better choice.If the Orville Redenbacher was enormously tastier, then I might say it's worth the occasional splurge to have it instead. Just as I occasionally might eat a hot fudge sundae. But if the flavor isn't as good, *and* the health markers aren't as good, I'm not sure what my incentive would be to eat the Orville Redenbacher brand.All in all, I always recommend eating fresh foods vs packaged ones. So if you're going to "splurge" and have a treat for something like this, I'd say to make it worth it and go for the best tasting one you can get. In my opinion, that's the SmartFood choice.I was provided a sample of the Orville Redenbacher's Sharp White Cheddar popcorn from the Amazon Vine program, for the purpose of doing this review. That being said, we buy hundreds of food products for testing every year with our own money, and this comparison is one of many we've made in this product area.

This is one of my favorite products out there, I can get the richness of buttermilk in my baked goods but I don't have to always keep the liquid stuff that spoils on hand.  This stuff has a long shelf life, perfect for those of us who sometimes like to bake on a whim.... like I am right now, I am making some honey wheat bread.I found no problems with the packaging.  It I guess could be sturdier, but as I said I have not ever had any problems.  I like the resealable plastic lid especially well too.
summary: This is indispensable when making bread

reviewText: The flavor is good, not too much parmesan flavor though it is the first ingredient.  They are crunchy and taste much better paired with hummus.  These are like thin crisps made of flat bread similar to pitas.  They are a bit more nutritious than regular pita chips though.  They have a good amount of protein per serving which is something we like.  They come in a resalable bag so they keep fresh.  Good for a light lunch, nice snack, or appetizer.
My mother loves eating these little meals. She has dementia and is diabetic so we limit her carb intake. These are great on flavor, size and filling without being too much. Excellent when shipped.
summary: Excellent meal for the health conscious

reviewText: I bought this for pizza and other dishes that need a little hotness.  Well, it's hot.  Think less instead of more or your mouth will burn so much that you won't enjoy your food.Store the bottle in the refrigerator to keep it at maximum freshness.  I love it and I think this bottle is going to last a long long time.

These macadamia nuts are SO fresh and tasty straight out of the bag that my intention to soak them in lime and salt then roast with a bit of coconut oil hasn't happened. I *did* soak some in lime and salt, but then ate them raw.The bag contained a fairly equal measure of (GORGEOUS) whole and half nuts, and all I can do is shake my head re the reviews which state/imply that this is a bad thing. What kind of Princess & the Pea nonsense is that?! Those with such easily offended sensibilities need to get a grip. I mean, seriously. These macadamia nuts are fantastic.

On the whole I'm a big fan of the Orville Redenbacher products. They taste good, use a good amount of real ingredients, and healthier oils than a lot of competitors. They have a lot of microwave products that are winners, made with real butter and healthy oils. Compared to those this product does not look as good.Good news: The product contains something approximating real cheese rather than just artificial cheese flavor. The bad news: The oil is unhealthy sunflower and hydrogenated soybean oil (trans-fat). While the amount of trans-fat is low, it's still there. There are also "natural flavors" which is corporate-advertising-speak for "chemical flavoring". Again, it's low on the ingredients list, but given the kind of oils used, I'd rather buy a bag of microwave popcorn that uses palm or coconut oil (much better for you). The bag is also small, but given how the healthiness is mediocre that might be a good thing. I like the flavor and the popcorn itself is up to the usual standard.
summary: Not bad, but could be much better

reviewText: I was so excited when I saw Barilla had released a GF pasta. I've used Barilla products since when I was a student in France, and have been a fan.  I have gluten sensitivity as do some of my kids, and we've gradually transitioned many products.  For pasta, I've been usingAncient Harvest Quinoa Organic Pasta Gluten Free, Elbows, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)this, which we buy at Costco. It's expensive though.  The Barilla worked great...and nobody had any ill effects after.  I used it to make macarona béchamel, which is an Egyptian version of pastito.I'm adding this to my list of favorite GF products, along withBlanched Almond Meal Flour, 5 lb. (1 Pack),Betty Crocker Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), andBob's Red Mill Gluten Free Whole Grain, Rolled Oats, 32-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4).
summary: Happy I can find GF pasta in my local store

reviewText: Simply put, this drink is delicious, and I didn't reach this conclusion on my own. I introduced Izze's Sparkling Apple to more than three people, and everyone who tried it loved it. Even my dad, who's pretty picky about drinks, really liked it a lot. It's not too sweet, it's not too carbonated... it's like apple cider with a twist! It's great!It smells delightful, and I liked the packaging as well. I thought the cans were some of the most appealing I've seen in awhile.I definitely recommend Izze's All-Natural Sparkling Apple, and I'm sure you'll like it too!

I have a love affair with good chocolate. Especially Belgian chocolates. For a quick fix, a Dove bar is pretty good to me...it's smooth and velvety chocolate has a nice feel on the tongue and a good chocolate flavor.I was pleasantly happy with these Werther's Original Caramel Chocolates. The chocolate flavor was pretty good.. The Caramel flavor was almost lost though. When I compare it to the caramel blast that you get with a Rollo's, for instance, it can't be compared.Individually wrapped, my package contained 23 pieces.I was a little surprised to discover that a serving of these Caramel Chocolates, 4 pieces, contained 10mg of Cholesterol. I compared this to some Belgian dark chocolate bars I had in the house and they contained no cholesterol at all. I'm not sure quite what to make of that, but I'm inclined to avoid Cholesterol when I can so I'd probably avoid these and stick to my Belgian chocolate with no cholesterol.
summary: Enjoyable treat, but what's with the cholesterol?

reviewText: 3/1/14 update: I have now tried the Ronzoni gluten-free pasta and like it better than the Barilla, both when it's first cooked and as leftovers. It's worth trying both to see which you prefer.-------I am hypoglycemic and used to eat Dreamfield's low-carb pasta, which is incredibly tasty, but I was still bloating and decided to go gluten-free with my diet a few months ago to see if that helped (it did). I had been eating Ancient Harvest's quinoa pasta, and while it tastes good with butter and salt, the texture is grainy and I didn't like it with spaghetti sauce. The shaped pasta like rotini also falls apart when it's cooked. The brown rice pasta I tried, which was touted as "not mushy" was exactly that, and so disgusting I tossed it after two bites. When Barilla's GF pasta became available through Vine, I decided to give it a try.When I cooked the Barilla GF penne pasta this weekend, I was pleasantly surprised. Great taste, great texture, tasted quite a bit like regular pasta. I happily inhaled the bowl! Like the other GF pastas, it still has a lot of carbs, more than I normally consume and considerably more than Dreamfield's. But I definitely liked the taste and texture better than the other GF pastas I've tried. No bloating or gastric distress. It's also less expensive than the boutique brands, and local grocery stores are offering lots of coupons for the Barilla GF pastas.However, when I had leftovers, the texture wasn't as good as it was when it was fresh. It was a little grainy and not as palatable, and I did not particularly enjoy it. It lost some of its flavor. I'd still recommend the Barilla, but would suggest you only make as much as you're going to eat at that time rather than making enough for leftovers.I discovered at the grocery store the other day that Ronzoni is also now offering a GF pasta and I bought a box of that. I will update my review after I've tried it and see how it compares to the Barilla pasta. I'm glad to see the big brands getting into it, because GF products are expensive and not always as good as I'd like them to be!
summary: great when it's first made, not as good for leftovers

reviewText: While the overall rating of this product is very good, I was worried after reading some of the reviews.  Several people had commented on these chocolates being too sweet, leaving an after taste, and other issues.  I have to say that I completely disagree, this candy is very good.There is a perfect combo of caramel and chocolate.  They remind me of Hershey's Kisses with caramel centers.  You get a taste of the original Werthers candy with the right amount of chocolate.  The smoothness of the candy is great.  These are not a hard candy like Werthers Original, they are soft and really do melt in your mouth.  I just wish I had more of them.Others have also commented on the price and amount you get in a bag, but I will stick to the product.  This candy deserves at least four stars, if not five.  Excellent taste all around and absolutely no complaints here.  Recommended.

In the Beginning there was Fruit Juice, and there was Soda Pop, and never the twain should meet... unless you mixed them yourself.  But then somebody got the Great Idea -- when reconstituting fruit juice after Pasteurization, why not reconstitute it with carbonated water?  Thus was born...Soda Juice!And I tasted it, and it was Good!  Apple and Blackberry were both rather mild tasting; Clementine and Grapefruit a little stronger and more tart; and Pomegranate had the strongest taste.  I'd say Pomegranate and Grapefruit were my favorites, but I enjoyed all of them.In the cans you have 5 flavor choices:Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Apple, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24),Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Blackberry, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24),Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Clementine, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24),Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Grapefruit, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), andIzze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Pomegranate, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24).  The only difference between Izze in the cans and Izze in the bottles, other than the obvious of size and container, is that only Izze in the cans is fortified with vitamins: C, B6, and Niacin, plus the fact that currentlyIzze Sparkling Blueberry Soda (12 ounce)and Izze Sparkling Peach Soda (12 ounce) are only available in bottles.Since virtually nothing is added, the slight nutritional differences must be due to the characteristics of the different juices being used.  Apple, Blackberry, and Grapefruit have the highest calories, 90, Clementine and Pomegranate the lowest, 80.  Apple, Blackberry, and Clementine have the highest sodium, 15mg; Grapefruit and Pomegranate the lowest, 10mg.  Apple and Blackberry have the highest total carbohydrates, 21; Clementine, Grapefruit, and Pomegranate the lowest, 20.  Finally Apple has the highest sugars, 21g; Blackberry and Grapefruit are next, 20g; and Clementine and Pomegranate the lowest, 19g.Note: as other reviewers have already mentioned, all of these are fruit juice blends so those with fruit juice health concerns need to be aware of more than just the title juice.  All contain white grape, apple, and lemon juice.  In addition to their title juices Blackberry contains raspberry; Grapefruit contains orange; and Pomegranate contains clarified pineapple and cranberry juice.Compare and Contrast: a similar product is worth considering:essn Sparkling Blood Orange & Cranberry Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24),essn Sparkling Fuji Apple Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24),essn Sparkling Mango & Passion Fruit, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24),essn Sparkling Meyer Lemon Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), essn Sparkling Minneola Tangerine Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), and essn Sparkling Pomegranate & Montmorency Cherry Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24).  The difference?  The essn products lack the vitamin fortification, have a higher carbonated water to juice ratio, and have roughly twice the calories, total carbohydrates, and sugars of the Izze products, probably because they contain the fruit pulp, which the Izze products do not.

When I first tried this I thought it tasted bland, but on my second attempt I shook the bag prior to opening it, and it was much much better.  Now I eat it all the time.  Compared to the "Natural" flavor which is extremely salty, the Light Natural flavor has a great buttery taste (palm fruit oil) and just a hint of salt.  Perfect.Other customers recommend Bearitos No Salt No Oil brand, but for me that's like eating paper (or foam packing peanuts).  Redenbacher's Light Natural provides just enough flavor to make the popcorn palatable while still being very low in fat (2 grams versus 4.5 grams) and calories (110 versus 120).
I use pumpkin for my dogs to keep them regular and this is a great product.  I will definitely buy more of this product.
summary: I bought it for the dogs.

reviewText: The Wether's Original Caramel Milk Chocolates are thin discs of milk chocolate with a swirl of white chocolate going through it.  The white chocolate has been colored to a caramel color, and has been flavored to taste like caramel.  So, there's no chewy, dense caramel like there are in Rolos, nor is there any creamy goopy caramel like there is in Ghirardelli's Caramel Filled Milk Chocolate Squares.  I've put Ghirardelli's Caramel Filled Milk Chocolate Squares on a pedestal, so these Werther's do fall short in that regard.  I appreciate the texture of caramel in my caramel-filled chocolates, and Werther's doesn't have it.Otherwise, the caramel taste does taste like caramel but in a way that is throat-burningly sweet.  The first time I ate one, I popped one in my mouth and they sent me running for a glass of water to wash it down with.  It definitely kept me from eating more than one at a time.  This is coming from a girl that lives on sweets, so you know these are SWEET.I like the thin disc shape, though.  Don't ask me why, but I like chocolates more when they're thin, rather than a thick brick o' chocolate.  Thin is better for nibbling, especially with chocolate as sweet as this.So, three stars from me, I'm not likely to buy them because I do prefer Ghirardelli's, but my husband did like the Werther's despite being so sweet.  He's a Dove Dark Chocolate kind of guy so I thought the Werther's sweetness would make him gag, but he ate the rest of the Werther's over the next week.  He even kept them on a top shelf in the cupboards where I couldn't reach (or see) them.  That's his way of saying "This candy is MINE."  My husband has a strict policy of not eating candy/baked goods/any junk food if he doesn't absolutely love it....  if he's going to have something that isn't healthy, it has to be a food that he really enjoys.  So, I expected the Werther's to be taken to his work so his coworkers could finish them, but he didn't.  I think he'd give these 5 stars.  :)
summary: Verrrry sweet; no caramel in the traditional sense

reviewText: I bought this, took it home, and read the ingredients and saw SUCRALOSE, EWWWWWWWW! If I had read it at the store I wouldn't have bought it. Either way I popped some anyways. It's surprisingly good, it's not great though. It has more negatives than positives. The positives are that it has a sweet taste for sure, nothing chemical or weird though. That's about it for the positives. The negatives are that you need to eat a handful or the popcorn is bland, if you eat it in small handfuls THEN it tastes sugary and sweet. The popcorn is also cold, coming right out of the microwave, I think this is due to it not really having any coating like butter so it gets cold fast......I like warm popcorn. It's also really light and dry.......I like buttery popcorn. All in all this popcorn is good tasting and I am really picky about this stuff and artificial sweeteners, it doesn't taste fake or chemical to me. Have you ever had a popcorn ball? It tastes like a less sweet version. I happen to love popcorn balls, some people don't.UPDATE: I only ate 1 bag of this stuff. It's gross. I don't like it.
summary: Pretty good, even though it has SUCRALOSE!

reviewText: These actually hold there flavor better then the other natural gums on the market. And they stay soft even after chewing it for an hour or more. Highly recommended plus this flavor is great and clean feeling. Not sure if I fell the burst of energy like some people have mentioned but don't mind it have a little bit of vitamin B.
summary: The best there is for natural gum!

reviewText: Amazon sells a 700-ct for $15..why would i ever pay $35 for 1000-ct(plus shipping on 1000-ct)....seems crazy.  Look up the 700-ct and you'll be siked.
I am fond of peanut butter & honey together. I really like this stuff. I eat it 2-3 mornings a week on my toast. I will continue to get this. I get it at my local stores though.
I use Splenda in everything and love this huge box.  I have it in my work office to use with my Keurig when I make coffee or tea.  It lasts a very long time and is a great sweetner.

I love Larabars and I bought a box of these when they were on sale and I didn't like these as much.  They are a little too minty for me.  The funny thing is that I bought a box of these because I had bought one from the health food store and I loved it.  It was very delicious to me then but six months later I guess my taste buds had changed.  The flavors I do really like are cherry, apple, lemon, and chocolate coconut.

Both my wife and I like this pumpkin spice latte.  It has a more complex mix of flavors that is more than just one note.  Most notably is the latte aspect that seems quite milky or creamy which is nice.  The actual coffee aspect (like most mixes like this) is minimal, but it does contain instance coffee (according to the ingredient list).  It is not a caffeine jolt like a strong coffee and does not taste of strong coffee, but I wouldn't expect that.  Between the sugar, fat, and small amount of coffee it is maybe a gentle boost.  It is a creamy mix of flavors that surround a pumpkin pie spice.  However both my wife and I would say we "like", not "love" this.  Still very good and happy to have it on occasion.The biggest drawback to me is the fat content, with a 10% DV of saturated fat (although only 3% DV total fat).  The 4% DV carbs (8g sugars) is okay in my book.  It makes me think twice about having a cup, and think about what else I was going to have that same day, and certainly not daily or multiple in a day.  So within moderation, one cup of this now and then around the Halloween & Thanksgiving holidays seems a nice treat.  It isn't terribly bad for you, but in my book cannot be ignored.  Of course check what your alternative was going to be, if your next choice was something using a creamer with equal or more fat content, then this consideration is a moot point.  But this is just based on the 1 1/3 tbsp serving size and you are likely to use a bit more.Do use the 4 teaspoons (or more) recommended for 6-8oz.  For 6oz, I found 4 to be ideal to taste great.  They don't clarify what kind of teaspoons, level or heaping, so I assume level or slightly rounded.  4 slightly rounded seems to yield a very good drink.  But I think it adds up to more than the serving size of 1 1/3 tbsp.  But you cannot really cut down to stretch the mix or lower the %DV.  We have tried 3 rounded tsp in 6oz on three occasions and always find it to be too watery and always needs that extra tsp.  If you are going to have 3, you really need to put in the 4th to make it worthwhile.I have to compare to a another pumpkin spice coffee that we think is heavenly.  We absolutely love theGreen Mountain Coffee Pumpkin Spice (K-Cups)mixed with 1 or 2 tbs of International Delight, fat free, french vanilla, coffee creamer, found in your refrigerator section of grocery stores.  The fat free version has 0% fat and 2% carbs per tbs.  I always use 2 tbs, so compared to a serving size of this, they are both 4% carbs, but I save the fat.  The pumpkin spice K-cup with this is just heavenly, but much more of a single note flavor that is the pumpkin pie spice and creamy in a simpler way.
summary: Very Good, Complex, and Creamy Latte Quality

reviewText: I am not a fan of these lemon cookies.  I love other Pams' cookies, but these have a too strong lemon flavor and that's all I taste.  I still have most of the case and I may just throw them out.

Izze All Natural Sparkling Pomegranate Juice is a nice alternative to the normal breeds of soda such as Coca-Cola, Pepsi, and Dr. Pepper.  It doesn't compare, however, to sodas that it will probably have more direct competition from such as Sunkist, the numerous Fanta flavors and others.  Why?  Because when most folks want a soda, they want a sugar-laden treat that'll give them a little spark.  This is soda for folks who care a bit more about their health than the average joe.  It's also a good choice for people who may not be able to drink sugar-shockers like Cherry Coke.I'm not saying that Izze Sparkling Juice is bad.  In fact, it tastes pretty good.  It contains seventy percent fruit juice (and most of that is white grape and apple) and thirty percent sparkling water.  The sugars that are contained in this drink are all natural.  It's also got a few vitamins in there, which are a plus.The pomegranate juice has a bit of a tart bite to it, and in my opinion the lemon juice that's also contained in this drink stands out a bit.  The can is 8.4 ounces, so you won't be getting the usual twelve ounces from the average can of soda.  Be sure to drink it very cold, because much like Miller Lite, it's pretty rank when it's warm or just a tad cool.In closing, Izze's got a good thing going with their sparkling juices.  This item will probably fit best in the health niche market, and I don't see it hurting the sales of Sunkist any time soon.  Give it a shot if you are looking for a Coca-cola subsitute.
Wow. Amazing stuff! I cant believe how good the candy is and fresh, too!!! With Sees I dont think one can go wrong. Great flavors

I was very excited to be able to get these via subscribe and save! Well that excitement is gone because the AMAZON warehouse, as usual, packed the glass bottles with heavy cans and other heavy items. The package arrived to me with tiny glass shards EVERYWHERE. A total mess. I am very disappointed. Also, I am now afraid to purchase anymore for fear of another broken glass mess.

I'm hard pressed to write a review for a piece of candy.  I'm not a chocolate afficinado.  My wife is.  I didn't care for this candy.  I just didn't like the taste.  Don't know how to explain that in scientific terms so I won't attempt to. Their hard candies are much-much better.  My wife, the chocolate lover, loved these.

A poll of my family rated these chips from 3.5 to 5 stars. This flavor is among our overall PopChip favorites. It captures the kettle corn taste quite nicely. It is slightly sweet and slightly salty but neither flavor dominates nor is overwhelming. I let my children take a bag to school and it was a big hit with other children. I think there was even a little pushing and grabbing.Personally, I think this flavor works better than other PopChips because of the corn base. It seems especially well suited for popcorn. Of course, those who do not care for kettle corn will not like this flavor; those who do will likely enjoy it.
summary: +  *: We like it but tastes vary

reviewText: These pop-tarts taste the same and, in fact, are the same as those found in the stores.  These have been perfect for eating breakfast in my dorm room.  Good deal in bulk!

In the last few months, I've reviewed two books that touted the value of coconut oil and its many uses. When I searched for "coconut oil" in Amazon books, I got several thousand hits. It's definitely a hot topic these days, yet I can remember when the consumption of coconut oil was widely disparaged because of its saturated fat. Fast forward a few decades, and although some health authorities still don't like coconut oil, the tide has turned and the oil is being praised for its many benefits, both internal and external.The Viva Labs product is "extra virgin." Since it hasn't been refined or heavily processed, it has a very mild coconut taste and aroma, both of which were very pleasant to my palate and nose. The melting temperature is about 76 F, so at most room temperatures, the oil has a soft creamy texture. I tried a spoonful, and it's quite tasty. I then fried some breaded shrimp in the oil, and it was delicious. I'm looking forward to substituting coconut oil for olive or canola oil in some of the recipes my wife and I use.Healthwise, because much of the saturated fat of extra virgin coconut oil is in the form of lauric acid, coconut oil is considered to be a better alternative to partially hydrogenated vegetable oils when solid fats are required. In addition, virgin coconut oil is composed mainly of medium-chain triglycerides (aka "healthy fats"), which may not carry the same risks as other saturated fats. Recent findings indicate that daily consumption of coconut oil may boost brain performance and could even help to prevent Alzheimer's.The two books on coconut oil that I reviewed also mentioned the external uses of the product for improving skin moisture and appearance, and for aromatherapy and massage therapy. It can even be used as a restorative treatment on hair.Coconut oil is definitely a hot product today, and my experience with the Viva Labs Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil has been very positive.
summary: A healthy oil with a multitude of uses

reviewText: I've tried other Werther's products in the past and have been pleased, so I was eager to try these caramel milk chocolates.  Oval-shaped and wrapped individually in foil, the candy is absolutely delicious.  The combination of caramel with chocolate is one of those confectionary matches made in heaven, like peanut butter and chocolate.  Some chocolate is overly rich, some has a chalky consistency, but Werther's got it right with this product.  My only complaint is that the 5.2-ounce bag holds only 12 pieces of candy.  It would be nice to have a larger bag.
summary: Great Chociolate Melts in Your Mouth

reviewText: The Clementine (orange) flavor of Izze is my favorite among the three I have tried, the other two being apple and grapefruit. This is a very crisp, refreshing beverage that has just the right balance of fruit to carbonation, and a slight tartness that keeps it from being cloying or flabby. Some reviewers have commented and even complained about this sparkling juice having only the barest amount of carbonation.  Not so with the ones I have tried, so perhaps these other reviewers left the top open and allowed it to go flat or something. Believe me, this had lively carbonation, and a good, natural tasting tart orange flavor.  The size of the can is convenient, too - takes up hardly any space in the fridge or in the lunch sack.As part of the "Vine" program, I received and tasted three different flavors but Amazon will not allow me to publish a separate review of each flavor.  So I am combining them all into one.Apple flavor: like biting into a crisp, green apple and savoring the peel and the fruit/meat at the same time. It has nice, clean and refreshing flavors with an excellent balance of carbonation. Normally I am not a fan of apple juice or sparkling cider but this one I liked.  It is not cloying or flabby-tasting as I find most apple beverages to be, probably because this is green and not red apple-flavored.Grapefruit flavor: this was my least favorite of the bunch, but if you prefer a very tart flavor, this fits the bill nicely. Again, a good balance of carbonation, crisp, and refreshing, this had good pink grapefruit taste but I also detected a plastic-tasting element.  The aftertaste was pure grapefruit so I don't know where that plastic came from or where it went, but it did mar an otherwise nice drinking experience.Overall I rate these Izze beverages very high.  They taste good, they are refreshing, and come in convenient-sized cans that easily fit in the fridge or a lunch sack or back pack. Good products!

A sugar-free, no calorie vanilla syrup is a great additive for coffee.  And since my wife is a big fan of Splenda, she really enjoys this addition to her morning coffee.  It has a nice aroma and does sweeten the coffee, so I’d use it sparingly.  Would like to try it with other things, but have yet to do so.
My son eats so many of these organic squeeze packets.  He seems to love this flavor.  I have it on auto subscribe and love the savings!
I'm sure it's the fact that it's got blueberries in it, but my 9 month old & 2 year old both like this stuff!  The pouches are good sized.
We tried this the first time when we were at the Atlanta furniture market. We mail ordered it because it was so good.
The product is every bit as good as the vendor claims. Moreover, the health benefits of coconut (though not widely known) are legion, and easily researched via GOOGLE.

I like the flavor and texture of this product. Its also an extremely versatile item in the kitchen for meats and appetizers. I found that is was particularly good on pork chops, where the raspberry flavor really complemented the meat and brightened up the flavor. I thought it was even more fun to use it as an appetizer - spread over a thin layer of cream cheese on a dinner or serving plate (not too thick of a cream cheese layer) with a side of pretzels or wheat thins. I couldnt stop eating it. I think the price could be a tiny bit lower, but I do think its worth it. Quality product.

Like other reviewers I actually like Kashi products. Generally I find them flavorful within the allowance I make for healthier food. That means I don't expect a Snickers bar - but I do expect a good flavor. These had a taste that was bland but with a slightly bad aftertaste. The texture is fine and was not a problem. I didn't taste much of anything in it other than banana - but that flavor didn't even taste that good. No chocolate that I could determine. They are not the worst bar I've ever had but they are not something I would ever buy. I didn't hate them. If they were the last food and I was shopping for a hurricane or something I'd have to pick them up so I would not starve.Look it's 2012 - not 1990. Back in 1990 all my health food tasted, well, gross. But there wasn't much available so I dealt with it. Now in 2012 healthy food does not have to taste bland, unappealing, and cardboard like. Take a pass!
summary: The first bad Kashi - this bar is not appealing!

reviewText: This snack bar is soft and slightly chewy. It does taste like banana bread and the chips (crunchy banana and soft chocolate) provide a nice textural contrast. It is also surprisingly filling.My only complaint is that one of the sweeteners has a rather "sharp" sensation. I don't know any other way to describe it other than rather than blending in it makes itself known in the after taste. This will not keep me from buying more, because if you're having a sugar craving, this is a helpful option that will satisfy the urge without breaking the calorie bank.

reviewerName: Livin' La Vida Low-Carb Man "Jimmy Moore"
reviewText: My wife Christine LOVES her vanilla latte coffee made with heavy whipping cream. We eat a low-carb, high-fat diet, but that doesn't mean we're deprived of the little things in life that make it enjoyable. This Torani Sugar Free Vanilla Syrup is the perfect way to complement and mimic the Vanilla Latte from Starbuck's that she loves so much when we make it at home. This product shows you don't have to sacrifice taste when you give up the blood sugar-spiking sugar in your diet. ENJOY!
summary: All The Vanilla Flavor Without All The Sugar

reviewText: We finally tried this as a side or dipping sauce with roast pork and roast beef.  It was fabulous!  I'm sure it would be good with any meat or poultry.While it's distinctly raspberry, it's not overly sweet and has a nice spicy, smokey flavor from the chipotle in it.Some of the suggested uses included pouring it over cream cheese as a cracker dip or spread, use as a base for salad dressing and many others.A very delicious, versatile sauce.I will be buying this one.
...to see that Rice Chex are now Gluten Free!  This was my favorite cereal prior to being diagnosed with CD and I am very excited to see that it is back on my menu!

These are great for snacking for, say, a replacement for chips. However, they're too fragile for dipping. I bought them for using with hummus, peanut butter, or cream cheese dips, but they break every time, so I can't recommend them for that use. They do taste very good, though, plain!

reviewerName: david l. poremba "the past in review"
reviewText: I took a bite of my first bar and felt that it was dry and somewhat overcooked(?) I realize that this is suppposed to be a healthy bar but it proved to be heavy eating and definately not without a whole glass of milk.Very disappointing.

I used this recently and liked the flavors but did think it a wee bit on the salty side.  There was just enough of the mixture to do two large chicken breasts, coating them with a nice thick coating that was crunchy.  Cooking them right in the bag is fantastic.  No muss, no mess.  Just put the mixture in the bag with the chicken, shake to coat, clip the bag shut with the enclosed tie and bake.  It cooks it a bit faster than cooking them without a bag so you might want to keep a check on them so they don't dry out.  We ate one breast for dinner and the following day I cut up the other one and put it on salad.  Tasted wonderful both ways.
LIKE AND EAT THEM ALL VERY RAPIDLY!!  ALMONDS ARE A VERY HEALTHY NUT AND I EAT A LOT OF THEM!
summary: SUPER TASTE AND EASY PACKAGE TO OPEN

reviewText: They have a funny taste.  At first you get the taste of the ginger but inside you get a strange taste.  Sighs...The ingredients contain sulphur dioxide, don't know if that would cause such an odd taste or not.Update:  Today I stopped by the health food store and even though it was expensive bought some Frontier crystallized ginger from their bulk bins.  The taste was great compared to this brand.  There is definitely something wrong with this crystallized ginger from Sincerely Nuts.  Amazon was kind enough to refund my money and I trashed it.  You can get the same Frontier crystallized ginger here on Amazon...it's the organic one...Not cheap but tasty right out of the bag.
i bought originally to make my own face cream...but then tasted it...SO delicious...a little bit stirred intoa cup of cocoa is so yummy...great product:)
Love these and they are very appreciated by all that I gift them to. I probably have consumed by annual quota for now and won't order again until next fall and winter. :(

reviewerName: Stacy at Mom in Training blog
reviewText: I was very pleased with these because they had a nice full package. Sometimes when you order snack size items they don't hardly fill the bags. These on the other hand had a perfect portion size in each bag.

I'm quite a fan of the Pamela's Product product line.  This just isn't my favorite.  I bought these for my husband who doesn't tolerate milk chocolate very well.  After having one package he said that he was having a reaction within 5 minutes to something in there (which I can't figure out what ingredient it is) and refused to eat any more.  So I'm left with eating 50 bags by myself.  As with any shortbread cookie, you're going to get a broken cookie.  Only one package so far had both cookies looking perfect.

A good quality product that has its uses for skin and hair care as well as food.  Fragrant and mild-tasting.Ladies, here's an idea:  get your partner to give you a massage, using liberal amounts of this oil.  Then, invite your partner to lick off the excess.  Repeat as desired.  The procedure will benefit more than just your skin.(DISCLOSURE:  I was sent a free sample of the product to review, under no obligation).

.I am not allowed to eat much sugar.  My physicians insist that I should eat mostly  complex carbohydrates and protein.  So occasionally I treat myself to a small indulgence.  Recently I tried and reviewed  some chocolate candy and received a comment saying that Lindor Truffles are much better.  So, I had to try some.Lindt Lindor Truffles are marvelous.  I like the white chocolate, it melts in my mouth and leaves a darling after taste that lingers awhile.  The milk chocolate is divinely smooth and excites my tastebuds.  The peanut butter is very tasty.In general each of the five flavors is superior candy.  These chocolates are the best I have tried.  They are a spectacular treat that tickles the tastebuds and soothes the soul.I limit myself to only one truffle every few days.  That way they do not break my diet much while giving me incentive to continue my bland diet without complaint.I highly recommend this product..
My teenage daughter loves these cookies with morning tea.  They smell like coffee and the chocolate chunks taste  much better than those in a cheap chocolate chip cookie.  I will keep these on hand.

I am so impressed with this product.  It's a perfect balance of sweet and heat and works well with many types of meat. The two flavors work very well together.  I have been using it on Veal and Apple patties and it's the perfect accompaniment.Also, the bottle is a nice size and you get a lot for your money!

This herbal red tea is very soothing and is naturally sweet enough on its own that I often skip adding my raw honey to it.I'm not sure yet about the health benefits [personally] but here's what I found from a google search:Honeybush tea is probably the most underrated and least known health beverage I've come across. Grown in the high mountains of the Western and Eastern Cape regions of South Africa, this unique plant is not only delicious but it is extremely healthy for you.Honeybush tea is made from the leaves, stems and flowers of the honeybush shrub. It's been cultivated by the indigenous people of South Africa for hundreds of years. The Tea contains no caffeine, very little tannins, has many of the same health benefits as rooibos tea and makes a superb iced tea.Each cup contains healthy anti-oxidants, along with minerals such as: Calcium, Copper, Iron, Nitrogen, Phosphorus, Potassium, Magnesium, Manganese and Zinc. This herb is said to have positive effects in preventing breast, prostate, and uterine cancer; reducing the risk of osteoporosis; having anti-fungal and anti-viral properties; lowering cholesterol levels, and much more. Most important of all, Honeybush is a pleasant tasting beverage that can be consumed every day.

I wanted to switch from Trident to something without artificial sweeteners or other artificial ingredients. This fit the bill. I like it a lot, it tastes great and doesn't have any weird ingredients in it. I don't find that the flavor fades too quickly, which I noticed some reviewers have complained about.

I was actually a little bit disappointed with this tea, because it's cut up so fine that it doesn't work with our tea balls. I had to bust out the muslin bags for this one. Once brewed, the tea is grassy and sweet, and reminded my partner of "a hot milkhouse". We kinda wished we'd gone with another tea.Edit: we've come to really enjoy this tea, with some extras. We brew it strong and add a fat spoonful of honey. Yum!
summary: a nice mild tea to have on hand

reviewText: I use Viva coconut oil on my skin because I have very dry, rough skin. Coconut oil is the perfect emollient because it soaks in well and holds moisture in. I was offered a free jar of Viva's coconut oil, and am happy to offer my review. I'm impressed with the high quality of this coconut oil. It's organic and free of any chemicals that might irritate my skin. It has not been treated to remove the natural scent of coconut oil, like some other brands of coconut oil that I've purchased. It makes me smell like a Mounds bar! I use it at night before I go to bed, so I don't have to worry about the scent clashing with my perfume. I don't think I'd mind either way, because it smells so good. My skin feels very soft when I use it. I'll be glad to have this around this winter when my skin tends to dry out more. I'll buy this brand in the future.
summary: It makes my skin feel amazing! Smells pretty good, too

reviewText: PACKAGINGWhen I got this in the mail, some sort of seal had broken and it had leaked in the box. So if you're planning on keeping it loose in your pocket or purse, maybe keep it in a plastic baggie to make sure it doesn't leak all over the place. I do like that this one package makes approx 24 glasses - seems much easier than carrying around several packets to get you through a day if you like to add the little flavor thingies to your water. But if the package leaks...not good.TASTEThis stuff doesn't taste BAD, but it doesn't really taste GOOD, either. And definitely not like sweet tea. If I had to force it, it maaaaybe taste like a crappy version of canned Nestea-type tea. I put 2 squirts in a glass of ice water and had to add a third to make it string enough. If you get other, fruity flavors, you could probably use as much as you want (to get a hint of fruit flavor in your water) - but for tea, you really need it to be fairly strong or it just tastes like gross, watery tea. Also, I think fruit flavors would probably still taste OK at room temperature but the tea flavor didn't.

I bought this based on other reviews and the comparisions to Rooibos. Don't know if I got an old bag (possible), brewed it wrong (probably) or what but it was awful and went the way of the drain. Wish Davidson's had a sampler of their bulk tea's so one doesn't get stuck with a pound of something they don't like!

I've used this as a substitute for vegetable shortening (like Crisco) in baked goods. In particular I enjoy the added flavor and taste using this for biscuits. Like other shortening or fat products it can be heated to become an oil for cooking as well.Although this product has many uses outside of the kitchen, I have only used it for cooking, but highly recommend it as a high quality organic substitute for cooking oil and shortening.
summary: Use as a substitute for cooking oil or for shortening (Crisco)

reviewText: When I first saw a commercial for this product I was a bit skeptical whether or not it would live up to expectations.  Personally I found that the product lived up to, and maybe surpassed some of my expectations.  If you are like me, constantly looking for ways to spice up your drink without the extra sugar and calories, this is a great product for you.  Mio allows you to add as much extra flavor as you want, you can add a drop, or pour the entire bottle into your drink, the result is a sugar free drink that is specifically designed by you.I personally really enjoyed this product because it has no calories, and no sugar in it.  Drinking 8 glasses of water a day is a struggle, but this is one way to get your water intake and enjoy a flavored drink without any extra calories.  If you are looking to cut back on your sugary drink intake, this is a great product to pick up, because it will allow you to enjoy a flavored drink without the sugar.
I use these strawberries in yogurt, oatmeal and right out of the container! They are perfectly sweet and fun to eat! Love them!

reviewerName: Wandrwoman "Wise as Aphrodite, Beautiful as A...
reviewText: This is a very good quality product. 100% certified organic, extra virgin, cold pressed, 100% pure, food grade coconut oil. Extremely fragrant, this oil is a delight to use. I have been using coconut oil as a hair and skin moisturizer and am extremely pleased with this product by Viva Labs.A sample was provided by the manufacturer in return for an honest review.
I loved this tea.  You just cannot go wrong with Twinings.  Also, try Timothy's English Breakfast Tea.....both are excellent.

I have to admit trying these just out of simple curiosity. Yes, they are bright colored as the picture shows. The flavor is what has me hooked. As other reviewers have stated, each chip has its own and varied flavor. It turns a bag of traditional potato chips into boring by contrast. I am not much of a potato chip eater--but these are definitely a favorite. I love sharing them with friends, who are equally impressed with their unique textures and colors. Beisdes good eating, they are a great conversation piece. Not too salty. You truly savor each one. Enjoy.

I had purchased Zesty Ranch tortilla chips of Safeway's brand and really enjoyed them, so I ordered these from Amazon and while they did taste good, the flavor was not as zesty as Safeway's. Still, I had no trouble devouring the contents of the six bags I received and will order them again.
summary: Not Quite As Good As Safeway's, But Still Good

reviewText: I love this tea, and this is a great deal buying it in bulk.  This is the only way I buy it anymore, and will as long as the price is good.

Bigelow Green Tea is available everywhere in American supermarkets, but it's just not a very good green tea. It produces an amber-colored brew that lacks the crisp tannin flavors that should be in quality green tea. With the prominent drawing of Mount Fuji and distinctive Shinto torii (Itsukushima, a UNESCO world heritage site) on the box, you might think this is Japanese green tea. It is not. No information is listed on where it is grown, except that it is "packaged and blended in the USA".Green tea is very good for health because of the abundance of catechins and flavinoids (antioxidant compounds) and has half the caffeine of black tea. Good Japanese green tea produces tea that is clear pale yellow-green, or very dark green, depending on the tea grade. These helpful chemicals, however, get mostly destroyed during roasting. Catechins are also responsible for the bright aroma and astringent taste of green tea, which is lacking in this product. With its brown leaf particles (see my photo comparison in gallery) and resulting brown liquid, Bigelow is more like hojicha, a roasted green tea. The flavor is very thin and I have to use 2 bags per cup of tea.A much better quality tea isKirkland Signature Green Tea Matcha Blend, 100% Japanese Tea Leaves, which is surprisingly good for a tea sold in non-specialty supermarkets. It is made by Ito-En, one of Japan's biggest beverage makers. I first heard about it because it is the tea used by staff at the Japanese Embassy in DC.As for directions, the ideal temperature for green tea 70-80C, NOT boiling (100C) as the product description recommends. Sugar is seldom added to green tea, though it is frequently enjoyed cold.
summary: A very bland and uninteresting green tea

reviewText: We gave these away for Halloween and had many leftover to sample ourselves. They are really good. I like the assortment of flavors, though I'm not as into the half cream ones. I'm glad to find candy that I can share without feeling I'm poisoning the person I share it with.

I'll start with the disclaimer that I received this product for review and did not purchase it myself.  With that being said, this is a difficult product to review because there is a lot of highly subjective personal opinion that goes into a reviewing an item like this.Basically, if you enjoy bottled, flavored iced tea beverages, then you'll probably enjoy this.  If you already hate Arizona iced tea or Lipton's flavored teas, this Celsius Raspberry Acai beverage is going to be no different.The flavor is very much akin to Arizona or Lipton raspberry flavored iced teas.  This Celsius product is a green tea with raspberry acai.  It is not carbonated and is not sugar sweetened.  I find just like the other companies' raspberry iced teas, the Celsius Raspberry Acai flavor starts out cool and smooth, but finishes with a somewhat tart harshness.  Myself, I've never been a big fan of that unsweetened or lightly sweetened ice tea flavor that finishes with the harsh ending.  The Celsius Raspberry Acai is drinkable, but I don't find myself craving another can at any point.  However,  I can see where some people find it to be undrinkable, likely due to the finishing flavor.  Still, it's nothing you haven't tasted before if you've had those other products.So what's the big deal with this Celsius brand of canned teas versus any others?  Well, the can boasts that drinking a 12 oz serving (10 calories) boosts your metabolism to burn off 100 calories.  Obviously there is no way I can support or dispute this claim as I have no way to measure my resting metabolic rate after drinking this stuff.  What I can say, though, is that there is 200  mg of caffeine per can.  You can compare that to 12 oz of coffee which I think is usually somewhere around 120-150 mg of caffeine, depending on brand and type.  The last couple of days I've substituted my 11am cup of coffee with a Celsius can and I get the same level of pick-me-up as the coffee.  So, I can vouch for the added alertness and energy boost.  As far as burning 100 calories after drinking it? I honestly don't know.  That comes back to personal opinion and whether or not you believe all the acai diet hype with adding "meta-blends" of taurine and guarana and ginger extracts, etc.  I have to leave that up to you to decide as I'm not a nutritionist and have had little experience with similar products.Overall, I personally give it 3 stars because I find it to be drinkable (though I don't LOVE it) and it gives me a comparable lift as a cup of coffee, but I don't know if I personally believe all the energy burning claims.  If you enjoy other brands of iced, raspberry flavored teas and you're into the calorie burning claims of acai/herbal blends, then I would definitely recommend you try this stuff.  If you already know that you don't like green or raspberry flavored iced teas, you'll have a hard time swallowing a can of this.
summary: An alternative to a cup of coffee IF you like raspberry iced teas

reviewText: I was extremely disappointed with this purchase. Not only were my Biscotti broken, this batch were also stale. Very disappointed.

...and how you feel about that is how you'll feel about this cereal.  Me, and my kids, well, we loved it.  So much so that we devoured the box in a matter of days.  And there's one of the only real problems with Krave - the box is ridiculously small.  But aside from that, when it comes to sugar-laden cereal, this is among the kings.  Once it's drowned in milk, the flavor comes alive and truly tastes very close to chocolate cake batter.  It can be a bit overwhelming if, say, like me, you fill up a bowl with a bit too much cereal.  My kids, who had previously been addicted to Chocolate Mini Wheats, now can't get enough of this stuff.  I feel like we've traded off a little healthiness here with this one, as it's lower in fiber, etc. than the Chocolate Mini Wheats, but like most kids, they more than make up for it with plenty of healthy snacks elsewhere.  Going back to those Mini Wheats is pretty difficult after this incredibly indulgent breakfast snack - for that's what it truly feels like, a snack.
summary: Like chocolate cake batter in your breakfast bowl

reviewText: In the last few months, my daughter has been purchasing the single containers in the grocery store, she loves it! It's a lunch I like once in a while as a change of pace, and most important for both of us, it's very easy to make. Last month, I purchased the 4 pack in the grocery store, and we shared it. Neither one of us has had a problem with the shells being under or over-cooked, and we both have different microwaves. Each time we have made this, it only takes a few minutes, and it came out perfect.It's tasty, and filling. When we make this, we are satisfied & not hungry for several hours later. Our grocery stores do not sell the 8 pack, only single, or 4 pack.
