There are many days when our schedule is tight, and we are too tired after work and chores to cook, so this comes in very handy.The serving is plenty for us, and the cheese is tasty, and creamy. I'll be ordering this again, since we both enjoy it. Highly recommended!

I have no idea what the original formula had in it or how it tasted, but I know that this stuff is ridiculously good. I love the consistency and the taste. You can get your sweet/chocolate fix at night with one spoonful. So much better than Nutella and way better for you.

I am not sure if it is possible to have a more chocolate tasting cereal than Krave. There is a very light coating of chocolate inside the rectangles giving each piece a lot of extra chocolate taste. Krave tastes great both dry and in milk. If you like chocolate, I would definitely give this one a try.
summary: tastes great both dry and in milk

reviewText: I've always enjoyed Stash teas. With cinnamon, clove, orange, etc., the Christmas Eve blend seemed like a potent choice. But it's strangely bland. I've tried longer steeping and less water, yet the flavor is always lacking. Either the batch I received is stale, or the blend is much less intense that you'd think based on the ingredients. Still, the flavor isn't unpleasant. This would be a good choice for someone who loves wintry spice blends but can't handle them full-strength.
Only 150 calories, tastes good, 20 grams protein. Grab and go. Just wish they were a little cheaper than they are.

I usually drink non-caffeine herb tea and just plain mint is one of my favorites. I can't stomach chamomile, so I'm pleased this tea does not have that ingredient.  I'm not sure that I feel more "energized', but as it has caffeine, I'm sure I'm not sleepier. (-: According to the box it ha 77 mg of caffeine, which compares to 90 g in 8 oz of coffee. Overall, I like the taste and the smell. I have several other boxes of Yogi tea in the cupboard and as I usually drink tea at night, I'm more likely to reach for those at home. I think I'll leave this one at the office and we can have a cup when the coffee pot is empty, but we wish there was one more cup.One of my friends thought the first sip was a bit of a medicine-y taste shock, but she said it kind of grew on her. Also, she said it leaves a nice aftertaste. Another friend thought it was "softer" than regular black tea and it's not very bitter. Overall, we like it.

I am very pleasantly surprised with this drink.  In most cases the promise of calorie burning or energy drinks are high and delivery is questionable in what it does for you.  This drink is no different.  I can't really tell if this drink actually burns calories.  It may or it may not.  It claims it does and I see no reason to doubt the claim.  I do know the drink gives some level of energy as I have had a hard time sleeping both times I drank the beverage within a few hours of my rest period.  Also no crash after the effects wears off.The drink tastes really good!  That is probably the biggest surprise to me.  Most of the time I don't like supplement drinks because they taste, well, like supplement drinks.  I had the Peach Mango version and I would be happy to drink this just for the taste.Positives:1.  Great taste.2. Works well for energy.3. Low calories (10).4. No sugar, no food coloring and low sodium.5. Not carbonated which means no stomach issues and no deposit in Michigan.Cons:1.  None I can see unless it doesn't really burn calories.

I love Cider. All year round. I bought this back in the summer for cups of iced cider. I've found with other cider k-cups I had to add sugar just to make it sweet enough to drink. It seemed like the other brand I tried made an apple flavored tea not cider. I love this product. It has the right amount of sweetness, and I've recently made it with a splash of rum for yummy results.

Okay, first of all this apears to be marketed as a diet aid.  As such it has green tea, ginger, acai, artificial sweetener (which I can't stand) and a handful of other ingredients that other people have listed quite nicely.  The theory that this claims is that with the caffiene, diuretics and taurine included, along with the 0 calories, that you will burn more calories then you intake.I'm a bit leery about this claim, though I can see how it would work "technically."  It Celsius also has a heavy dose of caffiene in it, which I'm not sure that people who are dieting really want to add into their diet.I tried one - I REALLY didn't like the flavor, I've never been a green tea fan but I thought I'd give it a whirl.  I won't be drinking any others because I just can't stomach it.My husband tried a few and took them to work with him to hand out to his construction workers.  My husband also didn't care for the taste at all.The construction crew - not one asked where to get it, or for a second can.  Sadly I have yet to find anyone who likes these enough to want to drink a second can.  Even my energy drink junkie friends didn't like this stuff.  I think most of them disliked the taste of the green tea combined with the artificial sweeteners.

I think the packaging is not eye-catching by any stretch.  Probably should punch it up a little.  I am not a big fan of the cello packing for the actual treats and had to put them in a ziplock bag.  Those are minor inconveniences overall.  My dog is one of the pickiest when it comes to his treats.  However, when I handed Merlin one of the Cloud Star King Voltaire Natural Dog Treats, he actually at it within seconds.  Checking to see if it was just a fluke and that he might be hungry, I gave him a second one after he ate his regular meal.  I got the same results from him--the treat was wolfed down in seconds.  For any other dogs, this must be a very tasty thing. Another box is in Merlin's future.  Jim Fargiano, author of: [...]

Yummy! This gluten free cereal is absolutely delicious! I love that it is filled with blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries, but not too many. The cereal has a touch of sweetness, and the berries help add some sweetness too. Tangy strawberries and raspberries and sweet blueberries make this one of my favorite cereals. Try this today, I guarantee that you will like this cereal! :)
Other organic cranberries come sliced. These are whole, deep dark red color, and fresh tasting! I will buy these again very soon.
This is the most horrible thing I have every tasted. It has a sickening taste and odor to it. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY...HORRIBLE!

This was a great choice for me as I love herbal teas .  My only complaint is that I only received one box and not the 6 box count.The melange of flavors and a perfectly blended amount of vanilla make this a smooth and delicious drink both hot and cold.  Iced that is.I am adding this one to my list of favs
summary: WONDERFUL AND FULL BODIED HERBAL TEA

reviewText: My wife and I love red rooibos, and without a doubt, Davidson's Tea provides the single best purchase in red rooibos one can find.We read some information that made green rooibos something we wanted to try.  It has somewhat different health benefits than does red rooibos, in ways that white or green tea have other benefits than does black tea.  Since we expect to go through a lot, we decided to give this a try.For those without experience with green rooibos, the taste is rather like a cross between chamomile, green tea, and a hint of red rooibos, but with a slight scent of recently-cut hay.  You will generally find green rooibos combined with other flavors in the store--one popular one is green rooibos with honeybush.  This will likely be our preferred blend, too.  Davidson's Tea also has a very nicely-priced honeybush, so do consider this.  Also, Davidson's Tea has bulk hibiscus, which helps make a nice blend of theirs called "Spring."We will be buying more of this in the future.
summary: For green rooibos, a most excellent buy

reviewText: My husband and I like our coffee sweet and obviously flavored.  This coffee tasted like regular coffee, and any vanilla hazelnut flavor is very faint.
I make virtually everything from scratch, but I don't hesitate to use this delicious broth in my cooking. Tastes homemade and FRESH! I love it.
It is solid pack tuna and can be divided nicely and cleanly.  The flavor is good.  Somewhat pricey, but I think it is worth the extra cost.

The intense smell of the bacon bits while this was cooking made me run into the kitchen to see of the handle on the cooking pot was burning.Everything cooked up in the exact amount of time suggested on the back of the pouch. The salt content was ok, if you were going to serve at least two portions. The actual finished product tasted ok; the pasta was tasty, the sauce was good, but the taste of the smoky bacon bits were a bit overpowering. The pasta was creamy but I was not impressed by the bacon flavor. Perhaps adding some hot sauce might have spiced things up but I am not much into hot sauce. The next time I cook this I will add peas and maybe some chicken (as suggested on their Amazon page) at the very end - that should provide a good counterpart to the chewy bacon bits.The sodium content is about average. Two servings would be the best idea, so as not to consume so much sodium in one sitting.
summary: Tasted ok, but the cooking experience was novel

reviewText: But also very scorpion peppers.I like my sauces unbearably hot but with enough flavor to them that I get more then just a mouthful of pain, in my experiance there are several categories of hotsauces. If Dave's Naga Jolokia sauce is an intense creeper (takes time to register the heat and lasts a long time), then the scorpion pepper is a stinger, meaning the moment this stuff hits your mouth you get the full extent of it's burn.That said it is not as hot as several other of Dave's sauces...
This is some very tasty tea and I rank it as one of my top ten that I have tried from Stash.  I drink it every day.  It is very blue berry and I feel good about drinking it.

As soon as you open these up, you'll notice how fruity they smell. Very nice smell.The taste is pretty good too. and I enjoy them..but. They have a bit of an after taste. Just about all albanese gummies that i've tried do. For that they loose 1 point. Haribo's don't have an after taste. But you do get more gummies if you buy albanese. So you choose.

Each 2.5 oz of this product contains 50 calories, and provides a 1/4 cup of fruits and vegetables.  It claims to provide the same amount of caffeine as a cup of coffee.  I am a heavy coffee drinker so I did not get any immediate boost of energy from drinking this.  It also contains very little vitamin B6 (40%) and B12  (60%).  When you take an energy drink, they normally have a LOT more B vitamins in there.  Most of the energy comes from the B vitamins and caffeine.  It does contain a 100% vitamin C, so that is a plus.I did not like the taste very much, but it was tolerable.  You definitely want to shake this first before drinking it as it settles to the bottom.  It's very tiny so you can gulp this in a second.  If you are sensitive to caffeine, it might work for you.  It's a lot healthier compared to a Red Bull, and if you need a quick shot of caffeine and don't like coffee, this might be a good alternative for you.  For now, I am going to stick with coffee and my B vitamin supplements.

I ordered this coconut milk because it has no additives and the cans are BPA free plus most of the reviews are good. The product I received was not creamy and white like most reviews said. It was light gray in color and the consistency of paper pulp. I shook it, stirred it, even used an immersion blender to try to get it smooth and creamy, which did not work. It was almost hard in the can and didn't really pour but had to be dug out. I added water to it and used the first can in some smoothies but didn't feel comfortable with the color. I emailed Natural Value to ask if it was a normal color and consistency for this milk and received a prompt reply which did not answer my question at all.  They did send another case without charge.. Upon opening a can from the second case, I found the exact same product, gray and pulpy. Maybe I'm wrong but the gray color somehow says old coconut to me,I won't be ordering this again but commend the prompt reply to my email and the effort to replace the first purchase. Just wish my question had been answered.

Bought 12 of them based on fellow reviewers opinions. As an all purpose seasoning so far does a fair job. I have not noticed any greatness so far in this product. I have used it in many different types of food and it is okey. I use several herbs and some spices in cooking and thought this one would be above average but like I said it is average tasting. Hope I am not missing the point here but I did expect a fantastic all around seasoning. I guess the question to ask is: What makes it so special to those reviewers that gave it so many praises? Do not regret the purchase, still have plenty of time to decide if I would buy this product again. They said it worked great with steamed vegetables but I can not endorse that. I tried it on steamed vegetables and I still needed to add a little more to the plate which defeated the idea of just using Knorr Aromat All Purpose Seasoning. I thought I would forego the Mayonnaise but it was not so. 3 to 3.5 Stars at best!
Good flavor

I coninue to buy this chicken broth. With recent order I made a large pot of fish soup using half and half broth and water. I will continue to ordr and use it because I like the taste and if we are going to kill and eat chickens we can at least let them be range free. I will freeze the soup using the bph free Ball Plastic freezer containers that just arrived. 9/10/12Really like this chicken broth and the way it is packaged in individual 8oz boxes. I use it in making instant mashed potatoes and in other recipies instead or water or half water and half chicken broth.

So I am an adult that is crazy for gummies.  I have just always loved them and let's just say that I'm old enough people in the grocery store think I am buying them for my kids (which I do not have).  The only problem is that my hubby and I are those organic people, so I had to seriously cut back on my gummy consumption.  I found these at like a Whole Foods and have loved them ever since.  But the price here is so much better.  I bring lunch to work everyday and these are perfect for that -- they are the highlight. I don't care that there are only 3 flavors and they are a little chewy on the outside.  You get used to that.  These are a great product if you care about eating organic.

Don't buy anything else for popcorn, this is the ticket. Don't believe all those natural food product folks that say Palm Oil is bad for you, its a bunch of bunk. This oil plus coconut oils are good for you.
Not the greatest tea ever, but very drinkable. It's my mainstay tea these days - great if you drink a lot, and are looking for a cheaper but drinkable loose leaf.

this is expensive but worth the price. thank goodness for subscribe and save! in the supermarket it is very expensive, so I do not buy it very often. Now I can have it more often. The case is almost gone, and I only received it two weeks ago!!! I highly recommend this soup.
After our local grocery store stopped carrying organic sugar in favor of crap like Splenda, I needed a place to buy it.  Amazon to the rescue!  This is enough sugar to last us a year.
summary: So great to buy this in bulk

reviewText: Used this as one of the teas for a church fundraiser.  Fresh and very tasty.  Makes great hot tea.  Will use it as iced tea this summer. Big bag goes a very long way! [...]
summary: Davidson's Tea Bulk, Imperial Green Tea, 16-Ounce Bag

reviewText: I am a tea enthusiast and I find this tea to be rather pleasant. It has a nice flavor and a light yellow tint.

It's got the simple carbs available from rice flour to offer you, and nothing else. Still, as it's brown rice flour, there's probably a ghost of B-vitamins in there somewhere. IfThese cook very quickly, as do all rice noodles. Means that you don't have to plan for 10 minutes to heat the water to boiling and another 20 to cook the noodles. In addition, the package gives directions for quick-soak to use in a stir fry.I order three of these each month, because two people who can't digest wheat really do eat that much of them. They are very, very versatile.
summary: Really good, if nutrition-free; great for the pasta lover who is wheat- or gluten-intolerant

reviewText: This is ok; for me it can get a little sweat with the 'caramel'. I can only drink one then go to something else. However the one is good.

I love ranch dressing, but it can be really expensive.  So, you should check out the Wishbone ranch packets, they are so much cheaper and this is a great idea.  Make sure that you look into this product, you even get 12 packets with it.
summary: Wishbone Ranch Dressing and Salad Seasoning Mix, 2.1 Ounce (Pack of 12)

reviewText: a great flavor for decaf and I love it and will continue to use it regularly as I had to stop the caffeine in my diet.

This pasta is pretty good. The flavor is strong and VERY bacony, which we loved! The texture of the noodles is a little weird-I cooked them as directed and they still were a bit pasty and stuck together.  Overall, the flavor was good, so the texture didn't deter from the eating experience enough to say I wouldn't eat these again!

BELIEVE what the others are saying.  The contents of the box IS NOT 24 Chocolate Chip,20 Peanut Butter, and 16 Oatmeal Raisin.  There is NO OATMEAL RAISIN in the box.THE BOX CONTAINS - 30 Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip and 30 Chocolate Chip barsand it says that on the Front of the box...Also the bars are tiny - 3 1/2 inch long by 1 inch wide by 1/2 inch thick.
summary: FALSE ADVERTISING - WHAT YOU SEE IS NOT WHAT YOU GET

reviewText: As someone else said, this seemed a little light on the parmesan but was very good. I just added a shake of my own parmesan. I followed the directions on the package and felt that although good, it was a bit watery for my tastes. The directions call for one and half cups of water and half a cup of milk. I think the next time I buy this, and I will buy it again, I will use one cup of water and one cup of milk. Your tastes might be different. I just want it to be a little bit creamier and I think that would fix it.
summary: Good, but don't follow the directions on package

reviewText: When I read the directions for this Smokehouse Bacon Parmesan pasta, the liquid amount seemed rather high to me.  So I reduced the water and milk to 1 cup each.  I found the result creamy and good; not quite like homemade, but pretty nice for Monday night after a long day at work.  Upon visiting Amazon to review the product, I found that a previous reviewer, RDToo had already recommended the liquid reduction I used!  So, I hand credit for the idea to RDToo!I'm giving the product three stars because of the required amendment to the cooking instructions in order to make a side dish with good taste and texture.  If the original directions had called for 1 cup of water and milk each, I would have awarded the product 4 stars for flavor and texture.I usually eat whole grain pasta, but I intend to keep a few of these Knorr Pasta sides in the pantry for those nights when a quick and easy dinner is all I can muster.
summary: Good in a pinch with RDToo's directions!

reviewText: So, I am a big fan of Sci show and Crash course on youtube.  One of the Sci show creators is Hank Green.  He talked about a TimTam slam, so we wanted to get some TimTams and try the slam with coffee.  Oh, it was so good.  Get a cup of coffee and a TimTam, bite the ends off of the TimTam, then use the bar like a straw and draw the coffee into the candy bar.  The filling melts down and becomes gooey, the wafer of the bar softens, bon appetit!  My only regret is that these are not sold in my area and I must buy them from amazon.There are 11 cookies or biscuits in the package.  They are two wafers, kind of like chocolate crackers with a chocolate cream filling in between.  Like a sandwich.  They are then covered in chocolate.They are a little pricey, but these are not everyday treats.  I will buy more in the future.  Oh yes, I will.
summary: Thanks Hank Green for getting me hooked on TimTam

reviewText: I should have paid attention to the label a little better. The product is NON carbonated, but once I got over that realization, the water is actually very good. I'm glad I got it, and now that i know what I would be buying, I would probably buy it again. Get it really cold, and Yummm.

Loved all of the flavors---and the orange-mango is my favorite as it was when i had tasted it at a friend's home----but love the color of the lime and it is wonderful when i make a punch recipe with these drinks!

My family has been big fans of hidden valley ranch dressing that you make from a package. We decided to put this to the test and when we were all gathered together with a big salad, I made hidden valley and then this. I labeled the containers a and b.I made each according to directions, which are the same; 1 cup of milk and 1 cup of mayonnaise. To my surprise the wishbone turned out very runny as compared to the hidden valley. It also tasted a bit saltier. The hidden valley had more flavor.The final verdict was a unanimous vote for hidden valley and a no to the runny ranch of wishbone. The only way I could get my family to finish the wishbone was to mix the 2 together. I was very disappointed in the quality, especially from a company that makes such a great Italian salad dressing that is very flavorful. This was bland in addition to runny.

I have to agree with my son ~ these weren't as good as the plain old vanilla gluten free bunnies. At all. The chocolate bunnies were so chalky tasting. Ick. We picked out all the vanilla ones and ate those. Unfortunately, they had ended up tasting a little like the chocolate ones. Sorry Annie's!
summary: Not as good as the vanilla....

reviewText: We usually like Annie's products, but these just aren't up to par.  My daughter misses out on all the fun shaped snacks (Teddy Grahams, Goldfish, etc.) she sees her friends eating so she was so excited to find these.  But they are disappointing everyone in our family - very little flavor, and that gritty mouthfeel that is so familiar to gluten free.  Nobody ate them - they just sat on the shelf for months until I finally threw them out.  There are too many other good gluten free options available now.  Lesson learned.

The English Breakfast tea is the most popular tea in England. I was introduced to it when I went to visit my sister - and was surprised at how good adding milk and sugar to this particular tea worked! This blend is just made for it.The pyramid bags are a nice improvement on the paper and don't add a taste that I often found when I was using the paper bags instead of brewing it in a proper pot.A very nice addition to the Lipton line of tea.
summary: Are you ready to add milk and sugar?

reviewText: I love grape jelly but am thinking of changing to preserves only because I drop more of the jelly back into the jar thanI can get on my toast.  Honestly folks, it's becoming frustrating but I may have a solution.  Use a teaspoon to dig itout.  Honestly, it may be I'll just stay on this Welch's delicious jellies!!!!!!!  What say you?

reviewerName: Baron Von Cool "Do or do not, there is no try."
reviewText: This was not chocolaty enough and the texture was off, more cake-like than brownie-like, and not in a good way. They were edible, but not all that enjoyable. Didn't hate it, but definitely disappointed. Will never buy this product again. Vastly prefer Pamela's GF brownie mix for their flavor/texture.
summary: Not chocolaty enough, texture is off

reviewText: i like it. it was delivered to my front porch. it was packaged properly and arrived with no damage. it tastes very good and there are many, many wonderful recipes i can use it in. i love eating it on toast with butter. also peanut butter and grape jelly is really good together. the jars are plastic. i really like that idea because they are safer to use. i am happy with my purchase of this product.
summary: it is a good grape jelly

reviewText: I am trying to eat just a little something every 3 hours and this is perfect. Not to high in calories and tastes really good. I highly recommend this product.
summary: Great Tasting for an easy meal

reviewText: In the past, I have absolutely hated pop tarts. I just couldn't imagine why someone would actually eat them. However, my girlfriend loves them, and things were running a bit tight on the grocery expenses front. I certainly wasn't in a position to start buying Ben and Jerry's. These took the place of such expensive gourmet treats. I figured that $8.53 for 48 of these thingys made it a cheap way to stretch our dollars for a week.I think the Amazon description said assorted flavors. We received strawberry and brown cinnamon. Maybe different shipments have different flavors, but I wasn't going to argue given heir low cost. We received four boxes. Each box has six foil packets. Each packet has two tarts.OK, OK, I actually dug into these before my girlfriend. Properly toasted, they're pretty decent. The pastry shell (I guess I can call it that) was not overally doughy or pasty. The filling tasted the way the box said. A single pack of two is reasonably filling as a dessert.Kids and pop tart afionados would probably give these five stars. Given the fact hat I really had expected a one-star treat, I think the four I'm giving this is pretty good.
This brand of stevia was recommended by a number of posters online.  I had previously tried another brand but couldn't abide the bitter, minty aftertaste.  I did not find SweetLeaf to be any better.
summary: Not as good as I'd heard

reviewText: I'm a big fan of hot and sweet flavored sauces, and this one is presents with a slightly different and interesting variation.  Initially, the sauce is sweet, but then is followed by a very slow burning flavor with a ginger accent.I can't say that this is similar to any other well-known foods or sauces.  It goes well on sandwiches and meats, but you have to like ginger, because it ends with a very long-lasting ginger flavor and coupled with the slightly burning quality, it seems to persist in the palate far longer than the sweet flavor.
summary: Sweet initial flavor followed by a slight burning ginger flavor

reviewText: I bought this product to have a version of cream on hand for the ice cream I make.  Sometimes I'm out of fresh cream and we do love our ice cream.  It works perfectly for that purpose.  Normally I make my ice cream with Junket mix to which I add 1 2/3 cup 2% milk and 1/3 cup of heavy cream for my 1 quart ice cream maker.  If I don't have fresh cream on hand, I use 2 cups of milk and two tablespoons of this dry cream.  The results are the same--delicious.After buying the dry cream, I've been experimenting with it, using it to enhance creamy sauces and soups.  It's great for that.  I tried reconstituting it and whipping it too, but that didn't work.  When reconstituted, I get the dry milk taste even when chilled overnight, but in hot or cooked things you can't tell it from fresh cream.  When I started the ice cream I was worried that it would affect the taste, but it doesn't at all in the finished ice cream.All in all, I'm glad to have the product on hand for use when my fresh cream supply gives out.
Dark and rich flavor.  I'm tried many, but prefer Tully's French Roast over all the others. I'm now on automatic delivery.
These taste really good, but I was looking for truly sproutable raw almonds.  As these are pasteurized, they are not truly raw almonds for what I want and need.
summary: tastes good, but these are pasteurized

reviewText: Jammy Sammys are like minature ceral bars for small hands.  They can crumble and fall apart, so not a good car travel snack.  Kids love these things though.  So if you are looking for an organic option, that is small hand friendly, portable and fun - these fit the bill.
summary: Kids love'em, All be it a little messy.

reviewText: My husband loves dark roast coffee and he tells me that this one is especially good.  I wouldn't know since I don't drink it.

These are good, but I like my coffee sweet and creamy so I have to use two and sometimes even add a splenda packet. So I've switched to buying refrigerated creamers at the grocery store. Glad I tried them though.
summary: Nice taste, but too small for my sweet tooth.

reviewText: Good coffee, but now the price is just ridiculous. Costco has Tully's for a much better price. All of these K-Cups had a HUGE price increase in the past week. Yup, going to cancel my auto-ships too.

I purchased these on Amazon based on the nutrition information provided. It is a LIE. The packaging states 1 serving per package, 290 calories, 970 mg sodium. Thats a lot of sodium!!! The nutrition information on this website states 140 calories and 470 mg sodium for one serving. If that were the actual case, I might actually try the soup. Now I will never know if the soup actally TASTES good or not since it has proved to be A VERY UNHEALTHY CHOICE. Please provide ACCURATE AND ACTUAL information so your customers can make INFORMED decisions. Waste of my time and money. The ACTUAL NUTRITION FACTS from the side of the carton are: Calories 210, total fat 1.5g, Sodium 970mg, Total carbs 59g, dietary fiber 2g, sugars 4g, protien 11g. As you can see you are consuming about half a days sodium and depending on your diet, a lot of carbs with very little nutritional value. Had this information been available on Amazon, I would have purchased something else for my workday lunches.
summary: BEWARE - NUTRITION LIST IS A LIE!!!

reviewText: Wonderful Earl Grey Tea, and also very competitively priced.  Available for monthly subscribers, which is a good deal.  Highly Recommend.

This has got to be one of the worst coffee's yet. It smells nasty brewing, tastes burned and bitter, Very strong...This is like Emerils extra bold but maybe even worse. Have to put in twice the usual amount of cream and sugar just to get past the bitterness. Wish I had not wasted my money on this one...will have to re-sell as for me personally there is no way I can even force myself to drink this crap. K-Cups have gotten so rediculous in price as well as waste I am on my way back to a good old percolator....I am fed up with the whole Keurig experience.......
i received this product accidentally when I ordered a case of NatraTaste (not from amazon).  As it turns out, I like this product a lot better AND it's not as expensive as the NatraTaste brand.

In May, 2011 I purchased a 25 pound bag of Great River's Organic Wheat Bread Flour and wrote a review of that product, giving it one star.In December 2012, I purchased the 4 Pack Gift Set because I wanted to try Great River's Pastry Flour and Cornmeal. I figured that I could use the whole wheat and "white" bread flour in crackers if nothing else. I love the pastry flour. Great flavor, makes both fantastic pastry, but also works well in quick breads. The cornmeal also is excellent for our favorite zucchini/corn bread.I decided that I would try to make a loaf of bread from the "white" bread flour that I had perviously panned as essentially having no gluten. First loaf I used 10 ounces of Hodgson Mills Bread flour with 10 ounces of Great River bread flour. The loaf came out really well. So, I said to myself, "Go for it!" and made a loaf of white bread with 20 ounces of Great River bread flour. It worked! Great texture, really good flavor -- nothing like my previous experience with this flour.So, I'm wondering -- did I get 25 pounds of pastry flour the first time -- not bread flour?This could account for both my unhappy results with this product, as well as the poor results of others?I'm not sure if I'm up to buying another 25 pounds of bread flour -- just in case the problem is one of labelling, not product. But the four pack seems to contain what it says on the bag.Try this flour -- we are really happy with it.
summary: Great Flour, Perhaps Great River has a labelling problem?

reviewText: My husband is gluten sensitive, dairy sensitive, and diabetic, so it's hard to find things like mixes you can buy off the shelf that he can eat.  This mix is one of those things - thank goodness!  I use it whenever he needs a gravy and I don't have time to make it from scratch.  The taste is pretty good and it tastes like chicken gravy.  Normally, I use it on top of turkey meatloaf muffins to flavor it and he says that they taste like an open faced turkey sandwich (without the bread, of course).
summary: Good chicken gravy for someone with lots of eating sensitivities

reviewText: I have been a fan of Newman's Own Organic Extra Bold Fair Trade blend for quite a while now.  It has become my "go-to" coffee when using my Keurig B70 coffee maker.  However, I am always looking for something new and when Coffee People's Organic Extra Bold came out in Amazon's new frustration-free packaging I had to give it a try.The first thing that I noticed after brewing a cup was the aroma.  It smelled more like freshly ground and traditionally brewed coffee than any other K-cup that I have tried (and I have tried dozens) with a rich, heady aroma.  The taste was full with medium-high acidity and a pleasing amount of "bite", as one would expect from a dark-roasted blend.  A perfect cup for me when using the 7 1/4 oz. setting but I imagine that some will like the larger cup size as well.  I think that this coffee is strong enough to deliver a rich cup even with 9 oz. of water.  I also like the fact that it is a certified organic coffee.As for the packing, Diedrich (who makes coffee under the Coffee People, Gloria Jean and Diedrich name) has worked with Amazon to reduce the amount of packaging needed for their K-cups.  All 50 of the pods are in one, heavy-duty box with no additional packaging.  I just ripped the top off and stuck the entire thing on my shelf.  A nifty way to help reduce waste and a convenient way for me to buy my new go-to coffee!Newman's Own Extra-bold Special Blend K-cups, 80 Pk for Keurig Brewers
summary: Sorry Newman's Own Extra Bold blend but I have found a new favorite K-Cup!

reviewText: It's the little things. I have gone from wishing I could get stevia for my coffee every time I eat breakfast at a restaurant to carrying my own. Packets are not as convenient - one tiny little SteviaTab is as sweet as a packet, but the whole tin of 100 SteviaTabs is only as big as about 6 packets stacked. And SweetLeaf has no funky aftertaste like some stevia brands, but without maltodextrin like Truvia.  I keep one of these tins in my purse at all times now. Love, love, love this product!
summary: Cannot express how glad I am to have this!

reviewText: Although it has Habanero in the title, this is not a hot sauce.  It is a sweet sauce with a touch of spice.  Excellent as a condiment or a cooking sauce (seet and sour pork) or even on salads! It is excellent over fish and as a dipping sauce.  Highly recommended.
This stuff is great. I wasn't sure when I took my first drink as it was unlike anything I had ever drunk before. Very flavorful.
summary: I will never buy teabags again

reviewText: I love chai and I love green tea.  Together they are perfect.  Tastes pretty good for a kcup.  Got this in a bigelow tea sampler and immediately had to buy more after one cup!

I really don't like being so negative in a review, especially when it is about Tea. I purchased tea regularly and probably have about 6 or more cups of hot or cold variations of white, black, and green tea. this was my first attempt at trying this kind of tea. I was instantly reminded of growing up in New Jersey and falling in a pile of leaves on a rainy winter day. This tastes like a mixture of wet leaves and stale cinnamon. It could be the healthiest in the world, I don't know, but it doesn't taste good at all.
These cookies have a delightful  flavor. The texture is fabulous, with little bits of spicy ginger to sink my teeth into!

Lipton's series of triagular teas is solid and dependable without quite hitting the 'perfect' mark. While the Earl Grey flavor comes through here, you have to steep it a bit to get the full monty; on the other hand, it has good aroma and if you do steep it, the reward is a good-flavored version that satisfies. For excellence in this variety, I would probably go with a more venerated brand, but this was my tea of choice for breakfast as long as the box lasted - nothing like the smell of Earl Grey tea. It manages quite well for a mass-produced and easily-acquired brand.
ANNIE CHUNG PRODUCTS ARE HORRID.  GROSSLY STICKY, TOO SALTY, NOT AS PICTURED OR DESCRIBED, NO VEGETABLES.  I WOULDN'T EAT THIS CRAP IF I WERE STARVING
summary: NOT WORTH ONE STAR - GIVE IT A ZERO

reviewText: Did you know:Jethro Bodine (Max Baer, Jr.) from the Beverly Hillbillies is a partner in Fischer & Wieser Specialty Foods?Fischer & Wieser make The Original Roasted Raspberry Chipotle Sauce?Fischer & Wieser is the maker of over 50 varieties of jams, jellies, mustards and award winning gourmet condiments?So what does the stuff taste like? It is literally an even blend of mango, honey, apple cider and ginger with just enough Habanero pepper sauce spice to zap your taste buds. I like this more than the Raspberry Chipotle and I don't like mangos. I have used it barbequed over salmon and chicken. I've even put it on Ritz crackers, but too much can be too spicy. Its one of the few sauces that I've actually enjoyed with my food and I generally am a puritan when it comes to sauces or spices.
We used this sauce on grilled tilapia and chicken and it was delicious. Slightly sweet, slightly spicy with a kick from the ginger that gave it an Asian quality. Recommended!

This is a very smooth and tasty Coffee. The only issue is the somewhat high price that is inherent to any single cup brewing system. But you wouldn't own a Tassimo unless you were willing to pay a bit extra for convenience. :)When I have these on hand I tend to pop them into the brewer all too often just because it is so quick and easy. So, for me, it's a bit of a luxury item. But this is definitely one of the better tasting Tassimo coffees that I have ever had.

The Tassimo Hot Beverage System is a single-cup coffee maker, similar to the Keurig Brewing System. Just so you know, the Tassimo’s T-Discs are entirely different than the K-Cups and incompatible with them.This coffee is prepared by Loblaw Companies Limited, under their President’s Choice label. It makes a nice cup of coffee, with a strong aroma and a rich taste. It is a very nice coffee to get to go with your Tassimo brewer.(Review of President's Choice Tassimo Gourmet, Medium Roast)
summary: Makes a nice cup of coffee

reviewText: With the name "Crunchy Vanilla Sunrise" and touting various whole grains, I expected more of an "adult" cereal--wholesome and natural.  I was a little surprised to open it and see the air-puffed cereal.  If I can compare the cereal to other common ones, it's like a mix of Kix, Rice Krispies, and flakes all mixed together with vanilla flavor and a crunch. It does taste good, and I'm sure kids would like it.  In fact, it seems like their market should be for kids with health-conscious parents.I'm glad that Nature's Path is making a cereal using some less common grains (even though corn still is at the top of the list).  All the grains are organic and non-gmo.  This cereal is gluten-free, and I promise you won't miss the wheat.It has 7 grams of sugar per serving, which may be fine for some people, but it's too sweet for me.  It's sweetened with evaporated cane juice and molasses. I think they could cut some of the sugar and still have a delicious cereal because of its natural vanilla flavor.Try and see if you like it, but just don't expect a granola-like cereal.

Since receiving the Mango Ginger Habanero Sauce, I have tried it several different ways.  First, we marinated chicken in this stuff and then grilled the chicken.  We kept some sauce to the side for dipping.  Delicious!!  It gave just the right tang to the chicken after grilling and those who wanted to "kick it up a notch" dipped in the slightly spicy sauce.We also tried it on some reheated fried fish to jazz it up.  I thought it was especially good on the fish as the sauce has a tropical flavor.I even tried it on toasted bread as part of a chicken sandwich.  Again, it was able to liven up an otherwise mundane meal.Overall, it is sweet and tangy.  It has a touch of heat to it, but I tolerated it very well and I am very sensitive to spicy food.  Good product!

I don't know much about tea and have only begun to learn, but I make this tea in the For Life Brew-in-Mug Extra Fine Tea Infuser I just got from Amazon [a real little gem] and enjoy it so much.  What a difference in a good loose tea and what I used to get at the grocer.  I don't use cream or sugar, but this seems - to me at least - to have a kind of sweet after taste.  I have also served it to a friend who adores it.  Would definitely recommend, especially if one just wants a nice cup of tea without a lot of other tastes added.  I am not a fan of teas flavored with spices, fruits, etc.
THis and the Fiber One 80 calorie Chocolate squares are two of my favorite cereals.  They are both delicious and low calorie a great addition to a low calorie high fiber diet plan!

Ginger is one of my least favorite spices; and I have never cared much for ginger bread cookies or ginger snaps. I must say, however, that these from the Newman family are quite tasty little surprises. Supposedly these ginger snaps are made from real candied ginger, and it shows. The ginger flavor is quite strong. I may have to rethink my position on ginger. If I can hold off, I plan to put these cookies in the crust of a a pumpkin cheesecake for the holidays.This product is also dairy and egg free if case you care. I don't. I have been eating them with fat free milk. Everything in life is a tradeoff anyway.
I love Earl Grey! Has a citrus taste kind of orangish. Great natural ingredients! Great by itself without sweetener or milk.
Did not see any results from drinking the tea, hoping to get ride of acne problems.  Will not buy it again
These are my favorite Milanos.  Great with a latte or a tall glass of milk.there is never too much chocolate.

i was expecting something with more flavor, with more 'grit'. certainly not as it turned out to be...nothing but VERY bland MUSH. i found this not much better, if at all, from quaker fast cook oatmeal.for the price i had thought there would be a nutty flavor..not so; i would have thought that there would have been some texture..not so--it was as if charles dickens thought of this when he wrote of gruel in some dark dank children's orphanage.for a far less price quaker does as good a job. infact i feel qualker has a bit more taste, more flavoe, more texture.no huge loss though; the wife will make it do in baked goods, as bread, cookies...so the irish blarney stone is at work it seems in the ad-description of this questionable oatmeal mush.

Gringo Bandito's hot sauce just made its way into my ever growing collection of hot sauces!Unlike Tabasco, Gringo Bandito's hot sauce is not horribly vinegary or tangy which I really like.The heat is there but not too hot, enough that you can easily enjoy dumping more on every few bites. And the spices in the sauce, you can actually taste! Nothing is overwhelming and so the tastes blend perfectly.Being someone with a corn allergy I was pleased to read that not an ounce of corn was in this sauce. No cornstarch, corn oil, or even dextrose that are common in several hot sauces on the market today.The reason for the 1 star deduction is the price... just a little too expensive for a 5 ounce bottle.
This has a slightly tangy flavor with not too much sweet and just enough hot to make it savory.  Recommended even as a dipping sauce for fish.

This review is regarding the cookie, not the price set by this seller. The cookie.... is fantastic. What a perfect little treat. Three cookies are only 180 calories. Since I am trying to watch my weight, I eat one - only 60 calories!! It's perfect for those times you NEED something sugary or chocolately. You can eat one of these and not blow your entire day dieting.Yum. Yum.

Strong ginger flavor, with residual heat, which is normal for real ginger; I see they're made with candied ginger and ground ginger, plus some organic ingredients.  This batch seemed well done; I don't know if they're supposed to be that dark--and a trifle black on the bottom of some.  They're smaller and thicker than what I'm used to--and hard and crunchy.  You definitely need to soak them in milk longer, but yes, I really like them.  One family member thought some cookies were burned, but she loves them and plans to buy more.  We both noticed pieces of candied ginger, which we all love.  Another family member doesn't think they need to be dunked in milk.  The best thing about them is that they truly are ginger snaps.
My favorite tea on a rainy cold day.  It's really good for iced tea as well.It's great with a piece of pound cake
summary: My favorite chai hot or iced.

reviewText: I've always loved dates & eat them as a snack to satisfy my sweet tooth. These are moist & plump with the occasional dry or seeded one in the bag. They freeze well, too.

I discovered Stretch Island Fruit Leather in the grocery store while looking for an alternative to artificially flavored fruit rolls and was pleasantly surprised. They were sold individually, so I purchased one of each flavor available (strawberry, cherry, and raspberry) to sample. Raspberry and cherry turned out to be my two favorites.The strips are thick (think a thin strip of beef jerky) and if they've been sitting out in high temps, a thin sticky film will develop on them--I learned that the hard way--but if kept in the fridge or cool location, this can be avoided. There is some texture to the strips; I like to suck on them rather than bite and chew because it feels like a little tongue massage, but they are chewy. As for the flavor, it's tangy with a hint of sweetness.It reminds me of the fruit strips I used to make in my dehydrator, except with a bit more thickness and moisture. Basically, if you're searching for something ultra sweet or don't have a fondness for tangy/sour flavors, then this fruit leather may not be for you.
This tea had a mediocre taste. After I tried several times to adjust my brew to get a good flavor I gave up and tossed it in favor of something a bit more expensive but with better flavor.
summary: You get what you pay for.

reviewText: We are not trendy. We are not techno. We are home-body, boarder-line-good-old-boys (sorry to destroy your stereotype of the Gays). We don't have a Keurig (I just had to look up how to spell it), and we didn't even know a Tassimo machine existed. I got these because we have a Keurig machine at work and I thought I could use them (remember didn't know Tassimo existed). I thought Tassimo was the brand...SO that said, I discovered that you can slit the tops of these things and pour out the coffee and use it in a traditional coffee maker.And it's pretty good. It reminds me of the coffee that my parents used to drink (from a perk machine) at church on Sunday afternoons. So I will probably be looking for Presidents Choice regular coffee. And if you HAVE a Tassimo machine, these are great; get some.
summary: This is a review from an idiot.

reviewText: Coconut oil can seriously be used for everything and we do!  I use it for cooking and hair the most.  It is a very large container though and will last a long time.  If  you do use it for hair, your hair needs to be extra scrubbed with the shampoo or it will leave a greasy spot.

This Columbia Blend leans more to the medium side than the bold side of coffee.  However, there is a slight kick to it, so solid medium coffee drinkers may want to take a pass.The blend is also slightly bitter, but not so bitter that it would be considered a harsh taste.  The bitter can be toned down by milk, which would leave no significant aftertaste.I would put this kcup in the same category asCaribou Coffee, Caribou Blend, 24-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, although I would choose this Barista Prima Columbia blend over the Caribou Blend.This is an OK blend, but there are better coffee blends on the market.Disclosure: I received this kcup in a free sample pack mailed by Keurig to its customers.
summary: Advertised as Medium-Bold, but more Medium than Bold.  Slightly Bitter, but Not Harsh.

reviewText: I get a lot of company.  My Keurig gets a lot of attention.  I put the pot away.  There is no difference in the taste of the decaf from the regular.  They're both great.

I have eaten Barilla products for years.  My parents usually bring them to me whenever they visit from Maryville, Tennessee, outside Knoxville.  This is the first time I've ate the Barilla Penne Plus pasta, which the Amazon Vine Program graciously mailed to me.  I prepared it per the directions.  However, I added a couple of pinches of salt to keep the noodles from sticking together while they boiled for the maximum amount of eleven minutes.  I like my noodles tender.  Basically, Barilla Penne Plus is multigrain pasta that has more protein and more fiber than the traditional penne.  It also contains ALA Omega-3, which is a fatty acid that promotes heart health.Mainly, I was concerned with how the pasta tasted, which was wonderful.  I could have eaten these noodles by themselves.  Instead, I served them with Ragu Chunky Mushroom & Green Pepper Pasta Sauce (Ragu Chunky Mushroom & Green Pepper Pasta Sauce 26oz) that had been heated together with a pound of ground turkey meat fried in a skillet.  (I substitute ground turkey for ground beef when I cook a lot of meals.)  For a healthy side dish, I steamed some sliced green zucchini and yellow squash using my OXO Good Grips Silicone Steamer (OXO Good Grips Silicone Steamer, Green).  I had a delicious meal.  There were enough leftovers to carry to work the next morning for lunch.  In fact, I had enough leftovers for two more meals.Barilla Penne Plus pasta is highly recommended for those who are on a diet.  It would make a great foundation for any meal that requires cooked pasta.  On the back of the box, there is a wonderful recipe for "Barilla Plus Penne with Spring Vegetables," which looks like it would be easy to prepare.  Basically, you sauté a variety of garden vegetables in a skillet and add chicken broth and cooked pasta.  Simmer all ingredients until thoroughly cooked.  Other recipes can be found at Barilla's website, which is also provided on the back of the box, near the bottom.Joseph B. Hoyos
summary: Barilla Penne Plus Pasta Tastes Great When Smothered With Ragu Sauce and Ground Turkey Meat

reviewText: For decaf, this brand is the best we've found. It's really better, I think, than the caffeinated.But then, I'm getting used to decaf and know it's better for me, especially in the evening.

So as other reviews have noted, the nutritional values are pretty good for these bars. Only 120 calories, very low sodium (90mg), 9g of fiber and so on. Also, no artificial sweeteners which I like, since I dislike the aftertaste of those very much. The bar is a reasonable size (35g) and is clearly intended as a snack bar.  The chocolate and raspberry flavors are mild, but good. I thought these bars were quite tasty by comparison to many others I have tried.  The fair comparison is to other snack bars, I think. None of these bars are super great and most are very much in the "just OK" category.  However, I felt these were a bit tastier than most and I would definitely buy them now and then as a healthy snack alternative.Yes, if they had true dark chocolate and raspberry fruit bits they would be much better, but I'm sure those calories would go up as well. As it is, I found them satisfying with just enough raspberry flavor to get my approval.Currently they are not available and there is no price, but at around 50 cents per bar or so, I think they would be a good purchase.
Great product, low glycemic but found now at my local Walmart for much less. Tastes the same, but a different brand.

reviewerName: FOREVER student of Life:D "Always learning co...
reviewText: I use to eat M&M;'s! I've gone to 100% Chocolate now!!Ghirardelli Chocolate Baking Bar, 100% Cacao Unsweetened Chocolate, 4-Ounce Bars (Pack of 6)I use the containers to hold 1 roll of Quarters And another use to carry my Dry Mouth stuff! My Family & friends Love when I need new containers :000000 ENJOY This is a great way to carry M&M;'s

I love the convenience of the smaller packaging because it makes it easier to carry some crackers to work or elsewhere. I also like how it lessens the waste of having stale crackers because you can never seem to wrap up the larger packages enough to keep them fresh. I actually have a nice piece of tupperware which holds 4 of the larger saltine packs and keeps them fresh without a problem, except when someone in my family does not close it all the way. I have been buying the Ritz crackers in the Fresh Stacks for over a year and was not surprised to find the saltines being packaged this way now. Overall, the convenience and lessened waste is wonderful but the pricing simply is not. Manufacturers turn "convenience" into big bucks; sell 'em the same product in smaller packaging but do not sell 'em at the same price point. Of course, it takes a bit more packaging to create the smaller packages but we all know it does not cost but a few cents more per package. Nonetheless, I will buy these in the future for the convenience factor and utilize when needed but will continue buying the larger packages most often for the savings.
This is another exceptional iced tea product for the K-cups line for Keurig systems. Sweeter than the peach iced tea it is refreshing.
Amazing granola, with just the right amount of maple.  Not too sweet or overpowering.  Great price, and tasted fresh.  It's a little expensive, but certainly worth it.
summary: Great Granola at a Good Price

reviewText: We will not buy this mix.  We would rather go without.  The texture is terrible -- rubbery and full of bubbles -- and way too sweet.

I do not usually write reviews, BUT this coffee is too good, to keep it a secret. :-)  Not only is it the best tasting k-cup coffee I have had, but it is the best tasting cup of coffee, I have ever had. The flavor is rich, smooth & bold, without any bitterness at all.  And these k-cups work perfectly with my Keurig.  In addition to that, they don't use all that plastic, like most other k-cups.  So they are much better for the planet.  Can't beat the taste & better for the planet, enough said!

I have always loved Lipton tea as it's a great tea with a nice strong flavor and these do not disappoint.  I feel more energized after having my morning cup and have noticed a bit of difference between these and the regular Lipton Black Tea.  If you want a bit more caffine then why not.  I mix mine with some honey and cinnamon and it's just delicious.  I've been drinking Lipton tea for over 50 years and don't plan on stopping anytime soon.  Quality from a long known and trusted brand.
Tasty, but we could do without the dark chocolate.

I got a chance to try out a box of this tea on the Vine program, and so far, I'm a fan.One thing that surprised me, and probably only because I'm ignorant about "herbal" teas, is that this is 100% peppermint leaves.  I thought it would be tea leaves mixed with peppermint.  It worked out in my favor, though, because I like that this is caffeine free.The taste is a mild mint flavor.  I've chewed peppermint gum for many years, several pieces a day usually, and this is nothing like that or peppermint candy.  It's a much milder taste to me, but still quite enjoyable and refreshing.  I've had a few cups unsweetened, and some cups sweetened with various substances (including agave nectar and erythritol), and they've all been good.The pyramid bags are pretty cool and "classier" than normal bags.  Like another reviewer (Wandrwoman) mentioned, it would be nice if these were in a sealed container, but that reviewer also mentioned just using a zip lock bag (which is a great idea).I absolutely recommend giving this a try if you like peppermint, but like any food product, I also generally recommend that you see if a local store has these in a smaller pack if it's your first time trying it (versus buying six 18-count boxes all at once).  After all, 107 bags of tea is a lot to have left over if you don't like the first one.  :)
summary: Refreshingly light, caffeine free peppermint tea

reviewText: This is a great way to get a chocolate fix. The raspberry taste is not too overpowering and the soy crisps give these a nice contrast in texture of soft and crisp. I would like to leave in my car for when i get hungry on the road, but I fear a gooey mess. 120 calories per bar and a nice protein boost makes these bars a winner in my book!
Great stuff, and a great price.  Very tasty, and no wacky ingredients.  My two-year-old loves it.

Dry and break/crumble too easily. Taste is OK, if a bit bland. Would prefer more fruit in them. Nutritionally, they are nothing to write home about. 33 % of the calories come from fat. Fairly high. 3 cookies costs you 140 calories. There's tastier choices for this many calories.

I'm a big fan of most of Newman's products and I appreciate that these cookies are organic, not artificial and don't have any hydorgenated oils, or trans-fatty acids. I don't care that they are vegan however I know some people might be looking for that but I'm just looking for a good ginger snap that's relatively healthy and for that there are far better options. First of all, these cookies are dry and hard as a rock. I know ginger snaps are sometimes crisp but you could chip a tooth on these things. Also the flavor is not my favorite. The ginger flavor is a little strange and they have a very strong orange taste. Overall the flavor of these cookies is just too overpowering. I did not finish the bag and would not buy these again.

First impression, very firm, dense texture, almost "shred the roof of your mouth" sharp when you bite into it.The initial taste isn't horrible, it's when the very bitter aftertaste kicks in that you start feeling like you want to turn off your taste buds.I had hopes for this product, that it didn't even come close to filling.With a name like "Newman's" I was expecting a high quality, tasty, organic, product.It might be organic, but tasty and hiqh quality don't apply in this case.Even my grandson tried one (almost 4 years old) if you have ever been around toddlers or preschoolers, it would be rare to find one that would say "NO" to a second cookie. However, my grandson didn't care for the taste of the cookie either, and he actually really likes Ginger Snaps!When offered a second one of these cookies, he backed away from me and told me "NO".This has left me with most of the bag of cookies, and a new inside, family joke, "be good or I will give you a cookie", because nobody in my family would try more then one other than me, and that was purely for research purposes on my part, since I did not like the taste.
summary: Only cookie that I have ever used as a "Threat"

reviewText: I gave these to my 53 year old husband for Christmas.  He's always talking about how he ate them as a child, ahem.  Since he's still pretty much a kid, I wrapped these up.  He hid them so no one else could have any!
This is the go to cereal for my kids. They also like the cinnamon flavor but the maple is something a little different and everyone in our house loves it.
Great task.  Good value.  Wonderful to use with salads.  I like buying the value size pack and combining it with my discount subscription order

The packaging is great.  The crackers stay crisp longer.  They are also easy to take with you.  They have an appealing smooth side.  Perfect with soup or a bowl of chili but they are so good that I eat them all by themselves!  They aren't high in calories either.

Very fine salt - and the fact that it is Kosher gives me the confidence to put it in my food, without any concerns.  Really good.  Actually, I have been using Himalayan salt for a long while, and I will not use any other kind.  This one is really great.  Worth every penny, worth buying it.
summary: This is a product that I recommend.

reviewText: My first grade son LOVES these, as I don't give him gummy products and he loves the green color and sweet taste. His big sister (9) finds them too sweet, which is why I'm holding back a star. I have tried them and actually found them oddly delicious myself, and I love that all Plum Kids products have quality organic ingredients.

By weird I mean: here is a bottle that has this sugar replacement that cost a pretty penny and it measures in drops. Yes, two drops from this container equal one packet of splenda? And the container, supposedly, has 800 drops which is quite a statement that in true honesty I can not dispute because it would be really tedious to count every single little drop that pours out from the plastic dispenser. Okey, that aside let's go to the part in the title of my review where I also say: It works! I tried it in my regular daily coffee and must say the taste is very agreeable and I compare it mostly to Splenda (which has been the choice for the past year or more) and it certainly is as good, if not better. No weird taste that I been able to tell and with the added bonus that it has zero zero zero, I think it makes a strong case for consumption. Heard that Splenda does have carbs and calories compared with this EZ-Sweetz. So I like it and now I am trying to see how long will it last compared to the price it cost to buy it. And since it has no impact whatsoever in the glycemic index (don't I sound very informed?) that is a plus to be considered. Perhaps is not even expensive if it lasts for at least a month or more. I found the product by accident and intriguing from the gate go so I was running low on Splenda and instead of going back to Costco and purchasing another 1000 packets I bought this one. The only reason I gave it 4 Stars is for the value factor but in everything else that it is supposed to do, it does with shinning colors. Thankful to the fine, and I mean fine, reviewers in amazon which I have learned to value and trust their helpful opinions (most of the time, anywhoo) and who knew EZ-Sweetz (2oz - Liquid Sweetener 800 Servings/Bottle) existed in the free world? Not me, that's for sure and thanks to amazon and reviewers alike now I have one standing pretty in my kitchen ready for cereal, tea, coffee and why not? Maybe even for baking. 4 Stars but surely 5 if it last like 800 drops?
Great gum and can't tell the difference between it and other gums.  No asparthame which is a great thing!  A+

I love tuna. I loved this tuna. I've tried other brand Albacore tuna, none as good as this. Solid, flakey, & white. Even with some spring water on top of it, which easily drains off, it is superior for eating as is or in a sandwich. Very tasty, very high quality.
summary: The best albacore white tuna available.

reviewText: I love peppermint tea. It's simple and refreshing, especially in chilly weather. I really like Lipton's peppermint tea. It's very fresh and fragrant when you open the box. The pyramid bags allow the peppermint to get ample steeping and allow it to disperse well throughout the water. I prefer it unsweetened. The first sip doesn't taste that wonderful as soon as it hits the tongue, but it really blooms after it's swallowed. The kids also love this tea, even unsweetened. The quality is good and we all enjoyed it.
I love to eat organic, but it's so expensive in my local grocery stories.  Love that I can have these canned goods delivered right to my door.  Great quality and taste great.

This size is perfect for the kids, and also for the adults.  Although, sometimes I am caught eating more than one bag!  Great to put in the lunch box, or just for snacking.  Love the cute little miniature bears, and small packaging.  The plastic tub is great for keeping the little bags organized.  We do the subscribe and save on this product and couldn't be happier.
good enough flavor. But very hully.

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: My nuts came packaged well, but were smashed a bit. They were inside a very tight area. I took out my nuts and ate them.
Arrived in container safe and no problems.  The individual bags are perfect for lunch boxes or treat  Nothing but a small bag to open so there is no waste.
...are tasty. The kids love them. Don't expect quantity in these pouches to be filling, but they work great as part of a lunch meal.

This coconut product can be used so many ways--snacking,cooking,baking,in smoothies.  I want the benefits of coconut oil without swallowing straight oil.  The shreds are about 60% oil by weight BUT suspended in fiber which slows absorbtion and tastes much better.

I started buying whole grain and/or more complex pastas like this because of the health benefits, but have come to really prefer them. First, I like the fact that the pasta has more texture and a bit more flavor without any sauce. Second, after eating it I don't experience such a heavy feeling followed by low energy. I think this stuff has less of a spiking effect on my blood sugar, giving more consistent energy over time. One of my favorite ways to cook is with seafood, especially clams. Finally, it does take longer to cook, so keep that in mind.

I have tried a number of Kellogg's cereals, including their whole Special K range, and this in my opinion is by far the best one. It has plenty of fruits in there so each bite has plenty of flavor. It's not too sweet, not too bland, not too anything.
The flavor is cheesy while the corn flavor does not overpower it.  They are crunchy and fresh, just like you buy in the local grocery store.  Go for it!

Nature's Path Organic Love Crunch is a rolled-oat granola with little chunks of dark chocolate and bits of freeze-dried strawberries and raspberries.  The quality of the ingredients is very good so it does tastes fresh and it is quite crunchy.My primary criticism is that it is much too sweet to eat for breakfast:  it even turns the milk sweet and gives it a slight chocolate flavor.  This granola is much better eaten dry as a dessert.  It would also be good as a topping for apple crisp.The suggested serving size of 1/4 cup has 140 calories and I would think a normal serving would be much larger than that, possibly a full cup or 560 calories. About half the bag arrived in tiny pieces from shipping so even the suggested quarter cup would probably contain more calories and it is not low-fat, either.  3/4 cup has 27% of the suggested daily value for fat.Note:  "evaporated cane juice" is better known as "sugar".Ingredients:  Rolled oats, evaporated cane juice, soy oil, spelt, dark chocolate chunks (evaporated cane juice, chocolate liquor, cocoa butter, soy lecithin, vanilla), flax seed, dried coconut, cocoa, freeze dried berry blend (freeze-dried strawberries, freeze-dried raspberries), rice starch, sea salt, natural chocolate flavor, natural vanilla flavor, tocopherols (natural vitamin E).Nutrition Facts:Serving size 1/4 cup (30g)Servings per container:  about 10 (total in package is 11.5 oz or 325 g)Per serving:Calories - 140Calories from fat - 55Total fat - 6 gSaturated fat - 1gTrans fat - 0 gPolyunsaturated fat - 3 gMonounsaturated fat - 15 gCholesterol - 0 mgSodium - 55 mgPotassium - 105 mgTotal carbohydrates - 20 gDietary fiber - 2 gSugars - 6 gProtein - 2 gVitamin A - 0%Vitamin C - 2%Calcium - 0%Iron - 4%
summary: Good quality, tasty, but too sweet for breakfast

reviewText: This cookie tastes really good.  It is crispy and buttery.  It has simple sugar so the flavor tastes more natural.  I like the fact that it contains whole wheat and oats, it gives it a little nutty flavor but is not overpowering.  The first thing I noticed was the fragrant smell while opening the bag.  They smell fresh and almost homemade.  The only reason I give it 4 stars is because you can hardly taste the fig in it.  I like fig newtons a lot, so maybe I was expecting more fig in this cookie, but this is more cookie than fruit; still, it tastes really good.  Another comment that I have is the amount of calories.  It has 140 calories for only 3 cookies, and there is no way you'll be satisfied with only three cookies (well, not me hehe) but I didn't take this into consideration because it is not advertised as a healthy cookie. Overall, I like the flavor and texture.

If you like very weak coffee, than you might like this. I could only detect the very SLIGHTEST mocha taste and the coffee almost tasted like just hot water. I couldn't return because it was a food product, so I made VERY small cups and that worked a little better. But I would not buy again.
Tasty.  Good quality.  A bit expensive for the amount of snack packs.  I can get the same thing for much cheaper at a local warehouse store.

If you are looking for flaked dehydrated coconut, look no further. I can't say that I've tried all the brands out there - mainly because I had all but given up on American coconut flakes, that always tastes like cardboard. Similar Brazilian products tend to be less dry, you bite into a flake and taste the coconut natural oils. Well, this is as close to that as I've ever tasted. The flakes might be dry outside, but are still juicy & flavorful. I eat these as a snack and a treat, straight out of the bag!

I'm always on the lookout for good 100 calorie snacks, and I have always been a fan of Fig and Fruit Newtons, so when I saw this product I jumped at it. What these are is a thin oat cookie with dried cranberries baked in. Some additional "natural flavor" gives it a pleasant fruity taste.Now, these thins weigh in at 140 calories (45 calories from fat) for three cookies, and 22 grams of carbs. Eating two brings it much closer to 100 calories, though admittedly they do make a less than satisfying snack.That said, these are very tasty snacks that go along really good with tea, especially a nice Prince of Wales black tea.
Too weak for me

I'm not the world's biggest coffee fan, but I found this coffee (Hamilton Mills Toasted Cinnamon) to be absolutely delicious. The flavor isn't overpowering or too weak, it's just right. The cinnamon flavor adds a bit of spicy--a bit of kick. I would not only purchase this again, but I would love to try other products by this company, as everyone in my family really enjoyed it.

I liked these, and would have given them a 4/5, but my wife felt they taste like cardboard.They are cranberry and orange flavor. The cranberry is chopped up and is candied/chewy, and is integral to the cookie. The orange is like an orange extract. The cookie itself tastes like a oat cookie (e.g., a Walker oat cookie), but flatter, with bit of chewy cranberry.There are not a lot of cookies in a package. There are 2 trays/rows of cookies. The packaging says serves 10, but I found that I'd tend to eat 1/3 or 1/2 a row, which would be around 5 servings per package. A lot of cookie packaging is being downsized during our recession, but there's less to eat in here than a typical pack of fig newtons.And again, my wife said no.
summary: One out of two in my family like these

reviewText: I add a can of veggies as I please and this is such great tasting stuff. As a single senior it is the cat's meow. I have served it to guests and they love it too. My grandma "MiMi" (born 1888) made the best ever..but she's not here..is she?? Great taste and great Amazon Prime shipping delivers it to my door 2-day service no extra charge. Re-ordering 4 cans....sooo.yum yum yummy! Try this product.
summary: GREAT taste and EASY!!  - BETTER than my Grandma's

reviewText: I can't say I loved this product. It is good for you but the smell when you open the package is too much for me. It smells like dead fish. It goes away when you actually cook it mostly but hangs in the air a long time. Just not for me I guess...

I was pleasantly surprised at just how satisfying this small box of food was when I ate it.  The hummus was flavorful, the cranberries and almond roca were tantalizing, and the crackers were okay.  My husband was more impressed with the crackers more than I was, but I certainly had no complaint with them.  The one blah food was the edamame, which would have been significantly improved with a small amount of salt.  Overall, I really enjoyed the meal and would love to have it again!
My sister sent me these after I had a baby and they are great to grab as a snack.  I only wish there were more of them!

The first stumbling block for this is the directions.  They say, "Fill to fill line in cup."  I couldn't find one.The second is that, like a lot of things that one might cook in a microwave, this boils over in a higher wattage microwave if you cook it according to the directions. (Or, I went over the fill line, which I couldn't find.)It tastes like rice noodles, the sort that generally go with soy sauce.  It's a little jarring, as gluten-free entrees go.However, it's nice to have the equivalent of gluten-free cup-a-soup, so it's probably worth checking out if the most important thing is actually having portable food, not the best tasting gluten-free portable food.
summary: It's O.K.  Not Fantastic, But O.K.

reviewText: I'll be honest, I normally hate the taste of coffee.  I got this in a subscription box, though, so I tried it.  I've managed to almost finish the entire 11 oz. container.  I think the vanilla flavoring in it moderates the coffee taste.  It's actually a pretty pleasant combination.  (This review is for the cappuccino flavor.)This is relatively thick although it still flows freely (it's definitely a shake, not a smoothie).  It's vegan (contains soy milk) and has some thickeners like xanthan gum.  It contains four sweeteners (rice syrup solids, cane syrup, inulin, and stevia) but the sugar level is actually fairly low, considering that (6g of sugars which are going to be almost exclusively from the rice syrup solids and the cane syrup).  I don't normally drink sugary things, and I don't often like sugary drinks, but I thought it worked here.  The sugar mix is low glycemic, too, and the whole product is organic and gluten-free.This is very high in protein and in fiber and is supplemented with vitamins and minerals, including some like B12 and zinc that can be hard to get in a vegan or vegetarian diet.  At 180 calories, with all that protein and fiber, this would probably make a decent on-the-go breakfast, maybe with a piece of fruit.I drank this at the end of a long day where I was completely exhausted from not enough sleep and lots of physical activity.  I think I actually feel a little bit restored, which is great.  In the future, I'd probably go for the chocolate flavor, but if you're a coffee fan, you'll probably like the cappuccino flavor even more than I do.

Barilla Plus pasta is a multigrain pasta that's made with semolina, flax seed, oats, barley, lentils and chickpeas. Those grains give it 4 grams of fiber per serving, with a serving being 2 oz, dry. In case you're interested in the calories, it has 210 per serving which is about 10 higher than regular pasta. But this Barilla Plus has more protein and fiber than regular pasta. It contains egg whites, so it isn't a vegan pasta. I took off one star for that. Here's the ingredient list:Semolina, (Wheat), [Grains And Legumes (Lentils, Chickpeas, Flaxseed, Barley, Oats, Spelt), Egg Whites, Oat Fiber], Durum Flour, Niacin, Iron, (Ferrous Sulfate), Thiamine Mononitrate, Riboflavin, Folic Acid. Contains Wheat And Egg Ingredient.This pasta takes about 10 - 11 minutes to cook. We have been using other Barilla Whole Grain pastas, so it tastes pretty normal to us. It doesn't have as heavy of a taste as some whole wheat pastas. We've also tried some of the different shapes such as penne, elbows and rotini.  We've made this with olive oil, lots of garlic, broccoli and walnuts which is really good. We've also had it with tomato sauce, black and green sliced olives, garlic, onions and artichoke hearts. In the summer it's good with fresh basil pesto.Barilla seems to be the one pasta that comes out perfect every time and it's not easy to overcook it. It seems to hold it's shape and texture even if you leave it on the stove a little too long. It's the brand I usually look for.

Every shipment we get the cans are dented. We will only get organic corn and unfortunately this is our only choice since we live in the boonies. We are lucky to get half the cans in decent shape with each shipment.
